original: l'a ni 'od zer can ma'o //
analyzed: l'a ni 'od zer can ma'o //
translated: LA is Māmakī.

original: de bzhin du dbyug sngon dang 'od zer can ni zung ste phan tshun lus dang bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyug sngon dang 'od zer can ni zung ste phan tshun lus dang bsam pa'o //
translated: Similarly, Nīlāmbara and Māmakī are a pair, with mutual body and mind.

original: mi g-yo ba dang khro gnyer can ma'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang khro gnyer can ma'o //
translated: Acala and Aparājitā are a pair.

original: shin tu stobs dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'o //
analyzed: shin tu stobs dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'o //
translated: Mahābala and Vajrāṅkuśī are a pair.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang tsun d'a ni zung ste dkyil 'khor la ni bde ba dam pa'i don du'o zhes pa ni gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang tsun d'a ni zung ste dkyil 'khor la ni bde ba dam pa'i don du'o zhes pa ni gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pas so //
translated: Kāmarāja and Cundā are a pair. In the maṇḍala, bliss is the ultimate meaning. This is because of embracing the other’s family.

original: de bzhin du nus ma'i sa bon rnams te nus ma ni du ba la sogs pa mtshan ma'i rnal 'byor ma rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nus ma'i sa bon rnams te nus ma ni du ba la sogs pa mtshan ma'i rnal 'byor ma rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the seed syllables of the yoginīs are the yoginīs of the sign-gynmas, such as smoke, and so on.

original: de la aa yig dag dang aom dang rnam par bcad pa ni aa a'a aom aa:ste rim pa bzhin du nag mo 'bar ma dang ser mo 'bar ma dang dkar mo 'bar ma dang dmar mo 'bar ma'o //
analyzed: de la aa yig dag dang aom dang rnam par bcad pa ni aa a'a aom aa:ste rim pa bzhin du nag mo 'bar ma dang ser mo 'bar ma dang dkar mo 'bar ma dang dmar mo 'bar ma'o //
translated: There, the syllables A, O, and M are A, Ā, Aṃ, and Aḥ, respectively, and they are Kṛṣṇajvālā, Pīta-jvālā, Śukla-jvālā, and Lohi-ta-jvālā, respectively.

translated: Likewise, ham, haḥ, ha, haḥ, hoḥ, are the eight nāḍīs born from the eight syllables.🔽The vases are likewise divided by the vowels of wind, fire, water, and earth.🔽The eastern vases have hi hi, the southern vases have hri hri, the northern vases have hu hu,🔽and the western vases have hli hli, the divisions of wind and so on.🔽

original: da ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor la tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams gsungs te ha yig ni ts'a mund'a'o //
analyzed: da ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor la tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams gsungs te ha yig ni ts'a mund'a'o //
translated: Now the seed syllables of the speech mandala, such as Cāmuṇḍā, are taught. The syllable ha is Cāmuṇḍā.

original: hom ni dbang phyug chen mo dang ha:ni phag mo dang h'a ni dbang mo dang ksha ni khyab 'jug ma dang kshth'a ni tshangs ma dang kshom ni dpal chen mo dang ksha:ni gzhon nu ma ste gtso mo rnams kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: hom ni dbang phyug chen mo dang ha:ni phag mo dang h'a ni dbang mo dang ksha ni khyab 'jug ma dang kshth'a ni tshangs ma dang kshom ni dpal chen mo dang ksha:ni gzhon nu ma ste gtso mo rnams kyi sa bon no //
translated: Hoṃ is Maheśvarī, haḥ is Vārāhī, hā is Vaiṣṇavī, kṣa is Vāruṇī, kṣaṃ is Brahmāṇī, kṣaḥ is Kaumārī, and kṣaḥ is Vaiśvadevī. These are the seed syllables of the principal goddesses.

original: de bzhin du 'dab ma'i lha mo rnams kyi ni rim pa bzhin du shar la sogs pa phyogs brgyad kyi rgyab kyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la h'i hr'i h'u hl'i ksh'i kshr'i ksh'u kshl'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dab ma'i lha mo rnams kyi ni rim pa bzhin du shar la sogs pa phyogs brgyad kyi rgyab kyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la h'i hr'i h'u hl'i ksh'i kshr'i ksh'u kshl'i'o //
translated: Similarly, the seed syllables of the goddesses of the petals are, in order, on the back petals of the lotuses of the eight directions beginning with the east: ha, hi, hu, he, kṣi, kṣi, kṣu, kṣe, and kṣi.

original: thung ngu'i dbyangs rnams mdun du'o zhes pa 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la hi hri hu hli ksh'i kshri kshu kshli zhes pa ste shar gyi padma'i 'dab ma dag dang lho'i dag dang byang gi dag dang nub kyi dag dang me'i dag dang bden bral gyi dag dang
analyzed: thung ngu'i dbyangs rnams mdun du'o zhes pa 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la hi hri hu hli ksh'i kshri kshu kshli zhes pa ste shar gyi padma'i 'dab ma dag dang lho'i dag dang byang gi dag dang nub kyi dag dang me'i dag dang bden bral gyi dag dang
translated: They are on the petals of the eastern lotus, the southern lotus, the northern lotus, the western lotus, the southeast lotus, the southwest lotus,

original: dbang ldan gyi dag dang rlung gi dag la'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi dag dang rlung gi dag la'o //
translated: the northwest lotus, and the northeast lotus.🔽On the remaining six petals are the six long vowels beginning with ya.

original: lhag ma'i 'dab ma drug po rnams la ni 'dab ma drug la ya sogs dbyangs drug gis phye thung du ring po rnams ni rim par yongs bkod pa zhes pa ste phyogs dang phyogs bral gyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i 'dab ma drug po rnams la ni 'dab ma drug la ya sogs dbyangs drug gis phye thung du ring po rnams ni rim par yongs bkod pa zhes pa ste phyogs dang phyogs bral gyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la'o //
translated: The short and long vowels are respectively arranged on the petals of the lotuses of the directions and the intermediate directions.

original: de la ts'a mund'a padma'i 'dab ma la mdun du hi yig sngar bkod pa ste de nas g-yas skor gyis 'dab ma gnyis pa la ya dang gsum pa la yi dang bzhi pa la yri dang lnga pa la sngar bkod pa'i h'i dang drug pa la yu dang
analyzed: de la ts'a mund'a padma'i 'dab ma la mdun du hi yig sngar bkod pa ste de nas g-yas skor gyis 'dab ma gnyis pa la ya dang gsum pa la yi dang bzhi pa la yri dang lnga pa la sngar bkod pa'i h'i dang drug pa la yu dang
translated: In that, in the lotus of Cāmuṇḍā, the syllable hi is placed in front, and then, proceeding clockwise, ya is on the second petal, yi on the third, ṛi on the fourth, the previously placed hi on the fifth, and ū on the sixth.

original: bdun pa la yli dang brgyad pa la yom ngo //
analyzed: bdun pa la yli dang brgyad pa la yom ngo //
translated: On the seventh is ḷi, and on the eighth is oṃ.

original: de bzhin du khyab 'jug ma'i kshi y'a y'i yr'i ksh'i ksh'i y'u yl'i ye: 'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab 'jug ma'i kshi y'a y'i yr'i ksh'i ksh'i y'u yl'i ye: 'o //
translated: Likewise, in Viṣṇumātṛkā, kṣi, yā, yī, yṛī, kṣī, kṣī, yū, yḷī, and yē.

original: de bzhin du phag mo'i mdun gyi 'dab ma la hri ste de nas ra ri rri hr'i ru rli ram ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du phag mo'i mdun gyi 'dab ma la hri ste de nas ra ri rri hr'i ru rli ram ngo //
translated: Likewise, in Vārāhī, hri is on the petal in front, and then ra, ṛi, ḷī, ra, ru, ḷī, and la.

original: gzhon nu ma'i kshri r'a r'i rr'i kshr'i r'u rl'i ra: 'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i kshri r'a r'i rr'i kshr'i r'u rl'i ra: 'o //
translated: In Kumārī, kṣhri, rā, rī, rṛī, kṣhrī, rā, rū, rḷī, and rḥ.

original: drag mo'i hu wa wi wri hu wu wli wom ngo //
analyzed: drag mo'i hu wa wi wri hu wu wli wom ngo //
translated: In Rudrāṇī, hu, va, vī, vrī, hu, ū, vḷī, and voṃ.

original: de bzhin du dpal chen mo'i kshu w'a w'i wr'i ksh'u w'u wl'i wa: 'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal chen mo'i kshu w'a w'i wr'i ksh'u w'u wl'i wa: 'o //
translated: Likewise, in Śrīmahādevī, kṣhu, vā, vī, vrī, kṣhū, vū, vḷī, and vḥ.

original: dbang mo'i hli la li lri hl'i lu lli la ngo //
analyzed: dbang mo'i hli la li lri hl'i lu lli la ngo //
translated: In Indrāṇī, hli, li, lī, hḷī, lu, lḷī, and la.

original: tshangs ma'i kshli l'a l'i lr'i kshl'i l'u ll'i la:'o //
analyzed: tshangs ma'i kshli l'a l'i lr'i kshl'i l'u ll'i la:'o //
translated: In Brahmāṇī, kṣhli, lā, lī, lṛī, kṣhlī, lā, lū, lḷī, and lḥ.

original: de ltar hi kshi la sogs la mtha' thams cad nor ni gdengs can gyis bsgyur zhes pa brgyad la brgyad kyis bsgyur pa 'jigs ma @54a * //
analyzed: de ltar hi kshi la sogs la mtha' thams cad nor ni gdengs can gyis bsgyur zhes pa brgyad la brgyad kyis bsgyur pa 'jigs ma @54a * //
translated: Thus, in the case of HIKṢA and so on, the “eight” are the eight that are “transformed by the serpent” at the end of all the directions.

original: la sogs pa lha mo rnams kyi 'dab ma la go rims bzhin du'o zhes pa nges pa ste phyogs rnams su hi la sogs pa'o //🔽kshi la sogs pa ni phyogs bral gyi padma'i dang po rnams la'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa lha mo rnams kyi 'dab ma la go rims bzhin du'o zhes pa nges pa ste phyogs rnams su hi la sogs pa'o // kshi la sogs pa ni phyogs bral gyi padma'i dang po rnams la'o //
translated: The “eight” are transformed by the eight, and the goddesses beginning with BHAIRAVĪ are on the petals in order.🔽This is the rule. HIKṢA and so on are in the directions, and KṢA and so on are on the first lotuses of the intermediate directions.

original: 'dir rigs kyi dbang gis mngon phyogs ts'a mund'a la sogs pa'i thabs su 'gyur te sngags kyi dbye bas so zhes pa ni 'dir ts'a mund'a dang khyab 'jug ma ni 'du byed kyi rigs can ma'o //
analyzed: 'dir rigs kyi dbang gis mngon phyogs ts'a mund'a la sogs pa'i thabs su 'gyur te sngags kyi dbye bas so zhes pa ni 'dir ts'a mund'a dang khyab 'jug ma ni 'du byed kyi rigs can ma'o //
translated: Here, by the power of the family, the faces of CĀMUṆḌĀ and so on become the means, by the division of the mantras.🔽Here, CĀMUṆḌĀ and VAIŚNAVĪ have the family of form.

original: de dag la mngon du phyogs pa gzugs kyi rigs can ni thabs te sngags kyi dbye bas zhes pa li yig gi rigs can nyid do //
analyzed: de dag la mngon du phyogs pa gzugs kyi rigs can ni thabs te sngags kyi dbye bas zhes pa li yig gi rigs can nyid do //
translated: Their faces are the means, by the division of the mantras, that is, by the family of the letter LI.

original: phag mo dang gzhon nu ma ni tshor ba'i rigs can ma'o //
analyzed: phag mo dang gzhon nu ma ni tshor ba'i rigs can ma'o //
translated: VĀRĀHĪ and KUṆḌALĪ have the family of feeling.

original: de dag la mngon du phyogs pa 'du shes kyi rigs can ni thabs te au yig las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mngon du phyogs pa 'du shes kyi rigs can ni thabs te au yig las skyes pa'o //
translated: The means is the one who is inclined toward them, who is of the nature of perception, born from the syllable u.

original: dbang mo dang tshangs ma ni gzugs kyi rigs can ma'o //
analyzed: dbang mo dang tshangs ma ni gzugs kyi rigs can ma'o //
translated: Indra and Brahma are of the nature of form.

original: de dag la mngon du phyogs pa 'du byed kyi rigs can ni thabs te ai yig las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mngon du phyogs pa 'du byed kyi rigs can ni thabs te ai yig las skyes pa'o //
translated: The means is the one who is inclined toward them, who is of the nature of compositional factors, born from the syllable i.

original: drag mo dang dpal chen mo ni 'du shes kyi rigs can ma'o //
analyzed: drag mo dang dpal chen mo ni 'du shes kyi rigs can ma'o //
translated: Rudra and Mahadevi are of the nature of perception.

original: de dag la mngon du phyogs pa tshor ba'i rigs can ni thabs te ri yig las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mngon du phyogs pa tshor ba'i rigs can ni thabs te ri yig las skyes pa'o //
translated: The means is the one who is inclined toward them, who is of the nature of feeling, born from the syllable ri.

original: de ltar gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rigs bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rigs bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the mandala of speech, there is the presentation of the four families.

original: da ni sku'i dkyil 'khor la brgya byin la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te tom ni brgya byin dang na:ni tshangs pa dang pom ni rgya mtsho dang ma:ni tshogs kyi dbang po dang tom ni me dang na:ni gzhon nu dang tsom ni srin po'i dbang po
analyzed: da ni sku'i dkyil 'khor la brgya byin la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te tom ni brgya byin dang na:ni tshangs pa dang pom ni rgya mtsho dang ma:ni tshogs kyi dbang po dang tom ni me dang na:ni gzhon nu dang tsom ni srin po'i dbang po
translated: Now, in the mandala of body, the seed syllables of Indra and so on are stated: Tom is Indra, and Nam is Brahma; Pom is the ocean, and Mam is the lord of the assembly; Tom is fire, and Nam is Kumara; Chom is the lord of rakshasas, and Jom is the lord of the pretas.

original: dang nya:ni rlung dang kom ni khyab 'jug dang nga:ni gshin rje dang som ni drag po dang ka:ni gnod sbyin no //
analyzed: dang nya:ni rlung dang kom ni khyab 'jug dang nga:ni gshin rje dang som ni drag po dang ka:ni gnod sbyin no //
translated: And nya is Vayu, ka is Visnu, nga is Yama, ca is Rudra, and ka is Yaksa.

original: de ltar tsa la sogs pa sde pa drug po rnams ni thung du dang ring po'i dbye bas nag pa'i zla ba la sogs pa rnams kyi gnam stong gi sa bon te tsom nya:/
analyzed: de ltar tsa la sogs pa sde pa drug po rnams ni thung du dang ring po'i dbye bas nag pa'i zla ba la sogs pa rnams kyi gnam stong gi sa bon te tsom nya:/
translated: Thus, the six groups beginning with ca are the seed syllables of the lunar days of the dark fortnight, distinguished by the short and long [vowels], tsom nya, and so forth.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas nag pa zla ba'i gnam stong dang sa ga'i zla ba'i gnam stong la gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas nag pa zla ba'i gnam stong dang sa ga'i zla ba'i gnam stong la gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, tsom nya and so forth should be taken as the lunar day of the dark fortnight of Magha and the lunar day of the dark fortnight of Phalguna.

original: de bzhin du tsa la sogs sde pa dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams ni lha yi padma'i 'dab mar lha mo rnams kyir 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du tsa la sogs sde pa dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams ni lha yi padma'i 'dab mar lha mo rnams kyir 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, the groups beginning with ca together with the vowels become the lunar days of the goddesses in the lotus petals of the gods.

original: nag pa'i zla ba sogs kyi tshes rnams dus kyi nges pa'i dbang gis stong pa drug dang me yi grangs zhes pa sum brgya drug cu'i grangs te lo yi tshes rnams so //
analyzed: nag pa'i zla ba sogs kyi tshes rnams dus kyi nges pa'i dbang gis stong pa drug dang me yi grangs zhes pa sum brgya drug cu'i grangs te lo yi tshes rnams so //
translated: The lunar days of Magha and so forth, by the power of the determination of time, are the six zeros and the number of fire, that is, the number of three hundred and sixty, which are the lunar days of the year.

original: 'dir nag pa zla ba'i lha mo rnams ni dang po'i zlum skor @54b gyi 'dab ma bcu bzhi po rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'dir nag pa zla ba'i lha mo rnams ni dang po'i zlum skor @54b gyi 'dab ma bcu bzhi po rnams la'o //
translated: Here, the goddesses of the black month are on the fourteen petals of the first circle.

original: de la dang po'i 'dab ma la nya rdo rje ma dang gnyis pa la nyi rdo rje ma dang de bzhin du nyri rdo rje ma dang nyu rdo rje ma dang nyli rdo rje ma dang nyom rdo rje ma dang de bzhin du dzha rdo rje ma dang
analyzed: de la dang po'i 'dab ma la nya rdo rje ma dang gnyis pa la nyi rdo rje ma dang de bzhin du nyri rdo rje ma dang nyu rdo rje ma dang nyli rdo rje ma dang nyom rdo rje ma dang de bzhin du dzha rdo rje ma dang
translated: There, on the first petal is the Vajrī of the new moon, on the second the Vajrī of the full moon, and similarly the Vajrī of the moon, the Vajrī of the moon, the Vajrī of the moon, the Vajrī of the moon, and similarly the Vajrī of the moon,

original: dzhi rdo rje ma dang dzhri rdo rje ma dang dzhu rdo rje ma dang dzhom rdo rje ma dang dza rdo rje ma dang dzi rdo rje ma ste lha mo bcu bzhi po rnams ni bden bral gyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la'o //
analyzed: dzhi rdo rje ma dang dzhri rdo rje ma dang dzhu rdo rje ma dang dzhom rdo rje ma dang dza rdo rje ma dang dzi rdo rje ma ste lha mo bcu bzhi po rnams ni bden bral gyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la'o //
translated: the Vajrī of the moon, the Vajrī of the moon, the Vajrī of the moon, the Vajrī of the moon, the Vajrī of the moon, the Vajrī of the moon, and the Vajrī of the moon. These fourteen goddesses are on the lotus petals of the southwest.

original: dzri rdo rje ma ni mngon du phyogs pa'i shes rab ste nya'i chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dzri rdo rje ma ni mngon du phyogs pa'i shes rab ste nya'i chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The Vajrī of the moon is the wisdom of the manifest, because it has the nature of the new moon.

original: da ni de nyid la gnas ha yig ces pa la sogs pas klu'i rgyal po rnams kyi sa bon gsungs pa 'dir de nyid ni ya ra la wa ste de rnams la gnas pa ni de nyid la gnas pa'o //

translated: Now, the seed syllables of the nāga kings are stated, beginning with “the one abiding in that, the syllable ha.” Here, “that” is ya ra la va, and “abiding in them” is “the one abiding in that.”

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la stobs kyi rgyud dang padma dag gi hya hu'a'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la stobs kyi rgyud dang padma dag gi hya hu'a'o //
translated: On the wind maṇḍala, the syllables hyau are [the seed syllables] of Takṣaka and Padma.

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jog po dang padma chen po dag gi grangs bzhin du hla hla'o //
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jog po dang padma chen po dag gi grangs bzhin du hla hla'o //
translated: On the earth maṇḍala, the syllables hrau are [the seed syllables] of Vāsuki and Mahāpadma, respectively.

original: me'i dkyil @55a * //
analyzed: me'i dkyil @55a * //
translated: On the fire maṇḍala,

original: 'khor la nor rgyas kyi bu dang dung skyong dag gi hra hr'a'o //
analyzed: 'khor la nor rgyas kyi bu dang dung skyong dag gi hra hr'a'o //
translated: the syllables hṣrau are [the seed syllables] of Śaṅkhapāla and Karkkoṭa.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor la mtha' yas dang rigs ldan dag gi hwa hw'a'o //
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor la mtha' yas dang rigs ldan dag gi hwa hw'a'o //
translated: On the water maṇḍala, the syllables hrau are [the seed syllables] of Ananta and Kulika.

original: de ltar rlung me chu dang sa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la shar la sogs pa'i klu rnams kyi zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar rlung me chu dang sa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la shar la sogs pa'i klu rnams kyi zhes so //
translated: Thus, on the maṇḍalas of wind, fire, water, and earth, the syllables of the eastern nāgas and so on are stated.

original: da ni khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /
translated: Now, the seed syllables of Śvānavaktrā and so on are stated.

original: brtsegs pa zhes pa ni yi ge so sor yi ge lnga'i bdag nyid brtsegs pa'o //
analyzed: brtsegs pa zhes pa ni yi ge so sor yi ge lnga'i bdag nyid brtsegs pa'o //
translated: The “stacked” [syllable] is the individual syllable with the nature of five syllables stacked.

original: sde bdun brtsegs pa la gnas de rnams ksha ya ra wa lar ldan pa ni brgyad de dur khrod brgyad du lha min mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sde bdun brtsegs pa la gnas de rnams ksha ya ra wa lar ldan pa ni brgyad de dur khrod brgyad du lha min mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The seven classes stacked are the eight places endowed with kṣa, ya, ra, va, and la, which are the eight charnel grounds of the demonesses.

original: de la phyogs su shar gyi dur khrod la kkhgghda dang lho ra kshyrwla dang nub tu thkshshnypsa dang byang du hyrwla dang mtshams su mer nydzahtshtsa dang bden bral du ndhdthta dang rlung du ndhrthta dang dbang ldan dumbhbphpa'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs su shar gyi dur khrod la kkhgghda dang lho ra kshyrwla dang nub tu thkshshnypsa dang byang du hyrwla dang mtshams su mer nydzahtshtsa dang bden bral du ndhdthta dang rlung du ndhrthta dang dbang ldan dumbhbphpa'o //
translated: In the directions, the eastern charnel ground has ka, kha, ga, gha, ṅa; the southern, ra, la, va, śa, ṣa; the western, ta, tha, da, dha, na; the northern, pa, pha, ba, bha, ma; the southeast, ña, ña, ḍa, ḍha, ṇa; the southwest, ta, tha, da, dha, na; the northwest, ta, tha, da, dha, na; and the northeast, pa, pha, ba, bha, ma.

original: de ltar thams cad du shes rab thabs kyi lus dang bsam pas rigs kyi dbang las 'dir ni gang zhig dbus su mngon phyogs 'gyur te rnal 'byor pas gtso bo dang nye ba'i gtso bo'i dbye bas rtogs par bya'o zhes pa ni rgyud kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du shes rab thabs kyi lus dang bsam pas rigs kyi dbang las 'dir ni gang zhig dbus su mngon phyogs 'gyur te rnal 'byor pas gtso bo dang nye ba'i gtso bo'i dbye bas rtogs par bya'o zhes pa ni rgyud kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, everywhere, by the body of wisdom and method and the intention, one should understand that whichever [syllable] faces the center here is the principal one and the secondary one by the division of the yogin and the yoginī. This is the determination of the tantra.

original: da ni bskyed bya skyed byed la sogs pa'i 'brel pa dpal ldan rdo rje can dang kun bzang zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bcas pa'i dgu ni go sla ste sna tshogs yum gyi lhag ma'o zhes pa'i mthar thug pa rigs dang rigs
analyzed: da ni bskyed bya skyed byed la sogs pa'i 'brel pa dpal ldan rdo rje can dang kun bzang zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bcas pa'i dgu ni go sla ste sna tshogs yum gyi lhag ma'o zhes pa'i mthar thug pa rigs dang rigs
translated: Now, the relationship of what is produced and what produces, etc., is the nine and a half verses beginning with “the glorious one with the vajra” and “Samantabhadra,” etc., which are easy to understand, and are the remainder of the “various mothers.”

original: dang rigs can dag gi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: dang rigs can dag gi 'brel pa'o //
translated: The relationship of the families, the family members, and the family holders is up to the end of the verse “the family of the vajra holder.”

original: da ni sku bzhi rnam par dag pas dag pa gsungs pa lha mo zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir nang gi le'u las mngal nas skyes pa'i byis pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa bzhi'i dbye bas mngal dang phyi rol du sku bzhir gsungs pa ji lta ba de
analyzed: da ni sku bzhi rnam par dag pas dag pa gsungs pa lha mo zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir nang gi le'u las mngal nas skyes pa'i byis pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa bzhi'i dbye bas mngal dang phyi rol du sku bzhir gsungs pa ji lta ba de
translated: Now, the purity of the four bodies is taught by “the goddess,” etc. Here, in the inner chapter, the four bodies are taught as the womb and the external [world] by the division of the four states of the child born from the womb.

original: bzhin du lha bsgom pa la rnal 'byor pas rnam par sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du lha bsgom pa la rnal 'byor pas rnam par sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Just as that is, so the yogin should purify the meditation on the deity.

original: de la lha mo ni du ba ma dang smig rgyu ma dang mkha' snang ma dang mar me ma dang ser mo 'bar ma dang dkar mo 'bar ma dang dmar mo 'bar ma dang nag mo 'bar ma dang cha dang thig le'i gzugs can ma ste bde ba
analyzed: de la lha mo ni du ba ma dang smig rgyu ma dang mkha' snang ma dang mar me ma dang ser mo 'bar ma dang dkar mo 'bar ma dang dmar mo 'bar ma dang nag mo 'bar ma dang cha dang thig le'i gzugs can ma ste bde ba
translated: The goddesses are Dhūmā, Mārīcī, Ambarā, Dīptā, Pītavaśā, Sitavahā, Raktavaśā, Kṛṣṇavahā, and the one having the form of a part and a drop.

original: chen po'i 'khor lo'i bde ba chen po'i padma'i 'dab ma rnams la'o //
analyzed: chen po'i 'khor lo'i bde ba chen po'i padma'i 'dab ma rnams la'o //
translated: They are in the great-bliss wheel, in the great-bliss lotus petals.

original: 'phar ma gnyis pa la sangs rgyas rig ma zhes pa ste 'dir sangs rgyas ni don yod grub pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang rnam par snang @55b mdzad do //
analyzed: 'phar ma gnyis pa la sangs rgyas rig ma zhes pa ste 'dir sangs rgyas ni don yod grub pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang rnam par snang @55b mdzad do //
translated: On the second tier are the Buddhas and the Knowledge Goddesses. Here the Buddhas are Amoghasiddhi, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Vairocana.

original: rig ma ni sgrol ma dang gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i dang spyan ma'o //
analyzed: rig ma ni sgrol ma dang gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i dang spyan ma'o //
translated: The Knowledge Goddesses are Tārā, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Māmakī, and Locanā.

original: shing dang bcas shing bum pa dang bcas zhes pa la shing ni dpag bsam gyi shing ste de bzhin du yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang chos kyi gand'i dang chos kyi dung ngo //
analyzed: shing dang bcas shing bum pa dang bcas zhes pa la shing ni dpag bsam gyi shing ste de bzhin du yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang chos kyi gand'i dang chos kyi dung ngo //
translated: The trees and the vases. The trees are the wish-fulfilling tree, the wish-fulfilling gem, the wish-fulfilling banner, and the wish-fulfilling conch.

original: bum pa ni rdul dang khu ba dag gis sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi thig le'i dbye bas bshang ba dang gci ba dang khrag dang rkang gi bum pa brgyad do //
analyzed: bum pa ni rdul dang khu ba dag gis sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi thig le'i dbye bas bshang ba dang gci ba dang khrag dang rkang gi bum pa brgyad do //
translated: The vase is the eight vases of feces, urine, blood, and semen, by the division of the bindu of body, speech, mind, and gnosis by means of the semen and ovum.

original: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yin ni dag pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yin ni dag pa'i sku'o //
translated: The lord of the maṇḍala of the victors is the pure body.

original: de nas phyi rol gyi 'phar ma la thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rnams su khro bo'i dbang po ni bgegs mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dang gshin rje mthar byed dang gtsug tor ro //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi 'phar ma la thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rnams su khro bo'i dbang po ni bgegs mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dang gshin rje mthar byed dang gtsug tor ro //
translated: Next, the lords of wrath are in the doorways of the mind maṇḍala on the outer perimeter: Vijaya, Prajñāntaka, Padmāntaka, Yamāntaka, and Uṣṇīṣa.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni phyag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dang sa'i snying po dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang rnam par sel ba dang kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni phyag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dang sa'i snying po dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang rnam par sel ba dang kun du bzang po'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas are Vajrapāṇi, Ākāśagarbha, Kṣitigarbha, Lokeśvara, Nivāraṇaviṣkambhin, and Samantabhadra.

original: nges par ro yi rdo rje ma zhes pa ni sgra rdo rje ma dang reg bya rdo rje ma dang gzugs rdo rje ma dang ro rdo rje ma dang dri rdo rje ma dang chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ste 'di rnams ni chos kyi sku de
analyzed: nges par ro yi rdo rje ma zhes pa ni sgra rdo rje ma dang reg bya rdo rje ma dang gzugs rdo rje ma dang ro rdo rje ma dang dri rdo rje ma dang chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ste 'di rnams ni chos kyi sku de
translated: These are the very same as the Dharma Body.

original: nyid do // de nas gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rnal 'byor ma rnams longs spyod sku ste /
analyzed: nyid do // de nas gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rnal 'byor ma rnams longs spyod sku ste /
translated: Then, in the maṇḍala of speech, the yoginīs are the Enjoyment Body,

original: tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa 'dab ma'i lha mo dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa 'dab ma'i lha mo dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: together with the goddesses of the petals such as Caṇḍālī and so on.

original: de nas sku'i dkyil 'khor la rab mchog shing rta la gnas 'od zer can la sogs pa dang lha ni nyi mar rab grags pa bden bral la sogs pa bcu gnyis dang stobs kyi rgyu la sogs pa klu ni brgyad po rnams dang khyi gdong ma la sogs
analyzed: de nas sku'i dkyil 'khor la rab mchog shing rta la gnas 'od zer can la sogs pa dang lha ni nyi mar rab grags pa bden bral la sogs pa bcu gnyis dang stobs kyi rgyu la sogs pa klu ni brgyad po rnams dang khyi gdong ma la sogs
translated: Then, in the maṇḍala of body, the supreme ones are the goddesses of the spokes such as Māmakī and so on, the goddesses of the sun such as the twelve goddesses beginning with Raudrī, the eight nāgas such as Airāvata, and the goddesses such as Śvānavaktrā.

original: pa rab gtum ma rnams te lha la sogs pa 'di rnams 'khor dang bcas pa zhes pa padma'i 'dab ma'i lha dang bcas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: pa rab gtum ma rnams te lha la sogs pa 'di rnams 'khor dang bcas pa zhes pa padma'i 'dab ma'i lha dang bcas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The goddesses of the petals are the goddesses of the retinue of these deities and so forth. The emanation body of the Buddha is the deities of the lotus petals.

original: de bzhin slar yang rgyal pa'i sku ni dbye ba gnyis su 'gyur te phyi rol dag dang nas nang la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin slar yang rgyal pa'i sku ni dbye ba gnyis su 'gyur te phyi rol dag dang nas nang la yang /
translated: Again, the body of the Victor is twofold, external and internal.🔽Just as it is born from the womb, so it is definitely in the maṇḍala.

original: mngal nas skyes pa ji lta ba 'di de bzhin kho na dkyil 'khor la ni nges par rab tu 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir mngal du byis pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ye shes dang khu ba dang rdul mngal du dag pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba🔽de bzhin du ston pa bcom ldan 'das dang lha mo du ba ma la sogs pa dang sogs pa'i sgras chos kyi dung la sogs pa dang bum pa brgyad de 'di rnams ni dkyil @56a * //
analyzed: mngal nas skyes pa ji lta ba 'di de bzhin kho na dkyil 'khor la ni nges par rab tu 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir mngal du byis pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ye shes dang khu ba dang rdul mngal du dag pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ston pa bcom ldan 'das dang lha mo du ba ma la sogs pa dang sogs pa'i sgras chos kyi dung la sogs pa dang bum pa brgyad de 'di rnams ni dkyil @56a * //
translated: Here, the consciousness, gnosis, semen, and ovum of the child in the womb are the pure body.

original: 'khor gyi snying por lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi snying por lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
translated: Just so, the teacher Bhagavān, the goddesses Dhumā and so forth, and so forth, meaning the eight vases such as Dharmaśaṅkha, are the coemergent body in the heart of the maṇḍala.

original: de nas byis pa'i phung po dang khams 'byung ba chos kyi sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas byis pa'i phung po dang khams 'byung ba chos kyi sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, just as the child's aggregates, elements, and sense-fields are the Dharma Body, so in the mandala the Buddhas, etc.

original: de nas byis pa'i skye mched 'byung ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la yang nges par sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas byis pa'i skye mched 'byung ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la yang nges par sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, just as the child's sense-fields are the Complete Enjoyment Body, so in the mandala also are Sound-vajra, etc.

original: de nas byis pa'i lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa dang skra la sogs pa 'byung ba dang btsa' ba'i dus sprul pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo bzhi ste rigs kyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor
analyzed: de nas byis pa'i lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa dang skra la sogs pa 'byung ba dang btsa' ba'i dus sprul pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo bzhi ste rigs kyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor
translated: Then, just as the child's hands, feet, etc. and hair, etc. are the Emanation Body, so in the mandala also are the four wrathful ones, Yamantaka, etc. , by the power of the family.

original: gyi ni snying por yang dag gnas zhes pa thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la thugs kyi rigs kyi dbang gis te mngal du rnam pa bzhi'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: gyi ni snying por yang dag gnas zhes pa thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la thugs kyi rigs kyi dbang gis te mngal du rnam pa bzhi'i nges pa'o //
translated: The line abiding in the center of the mandala refers to the mind mandala, by the power of the mind family. This is the determination of the four aspects in the womb.

original: da ni phyi rol du rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa phyi rol zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni phyi rol du rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa phyi rol zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the four external aspects are stated, beginning with “external.🔽”

original: 'dir byis pa skyes pa'i lte ba nas srog 'byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du phyi rol du gsung gi dkyil 'khor la ts'a mund'a la sogs pa lha mo brgyad po 'khor dang bcas pa zhes pa lha mo drug cu🔽rtsa bzhi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir byis pa skyes pa'i lte ba nas srog 'byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du phyi rol du gsung gi dkyil 'khor la ts'a mund'a la sogs pa lha mo brgyad po 'khor dang bcas pa zhes pa lha mo drug cu rtsa bzhi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Here, just as the life force arises from the navel of a newborn child, which is the innate body, in the same way, externally, in the maṇḍala of speech, there are the eight goddesses, such as Caṇḍa, and so on, together with the retinue, that is, the sixty-four goddesses.

original: 'dir byis pa'i lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa bskum pa dang tshig mi gsal ba chos kyi sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha bcu gnyis te sogs pa'i sgras shing rta la gnas pa'i lha mo drug go //
analyzed: 'dir byis pa'i lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa bskum pa dang tshig mi gsal ba chos kyi sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha bcu gnyis te sogs pa'i sgras shing rta la gnas pa'i lha mo drug go //
translated: Here, just as the hands, feet, and so on of a child are contracted and the speech is unclear, which is the dharmakāya, in the same way, there are twelve deities, and so on refers to the six goddesses who are on the chariot.

original: 'dir byis pa'i so skyes pa dang tshig gsal bar gyur pa na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la mtha' dag gdengs can rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir byis pa'i so skyes pa dang tshig gsal bar gyur pa na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la mtha' dag gdengs can rigs so //
translated: Here, just as the teeth of a child are born and the speech becomes clear, which is the saṃbhogakāya, in the same way, in the maṇḍala, there are the complete nāgas.

original: 'dir byis pa'i so lhung ste slar yang skyes pa nas 'chi ba'i bar du sprul pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la gtum mo khyi gdong ma la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa ste 'byung po bye ba phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i
analyzed: 'dir byis pa'i so lhung ste slar yang skyes pa nas 'chi ba'i bar du sprul pa'i sku yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la gtum mo khyi gdong ma la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa ste 'byung po bye ba phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i
translated: Here, just as the one who has lost his baby teeth and has grown them again up to the time of death is the emanation body, in the same way, in the mandala, the emanation body is the one with the retinue of Caṇḍālī, Dog-faced, and so on, together with the fifty million spirits.

original: gsum dang bcas pa ni sprul pa'i skur 'gyur mi yi bdag po sems can kun gyi don gyi slad du'o zhes pa phyi rol du sku bzhi rnam par dag pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: gsum dang bcas pa ni sprul pa'i skur 'gyur mi yi bdag po sems can kun gyi don gyi slad du'o zhes pa phyi rol du sku bzhi rnam par dag pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The one with the three is the emanation body for the sake of all sentient beings, O Lord of Men.

original: da ni sku bzhi dang rdo rje bzhi phan tshun du sbyor ba gsungs pa sku pa yi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa'i gzugs rdzogs pa'i slad du lhan cig skyes pa'i sku dang @56b 'byung ba bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi sku yi rdo rje zung du
analyzed: da ni sku bzhi dang rdo rje bzhi phan tshun du sbyor ba gsungs pa sku pa yi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa'i gzugs rdzogs pa'i slad du lhan cig skyes pa'i sku dang @56b 'byung ba bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi sku yi rdo rje zung du
translated: Now, the mutual correspondence of the four bodies and the four vajras is stated with “the body vajra,” and so on. Here, just as the one who has completed the form of a child is the innate body and the body vajra, which is the nature of the four elements,

original: 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
translated: in the same way, in the mandala, the emanation body is the one with the retinue of Caṇḍālī, Dog-faced, and so on, together with the fifty million spirits.

original: de bzhin du byis pa'i brjod pa'i don du gsung rdo rje dang chos kyi sku zung du 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du chos ston pa'i don du dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa'i brjod pa'i don du gsung rdo rje dang chos kyi sku zung du 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du chos ston pa'i don du dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the union of the Dharma-circle is for the sake of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'dir byis pa'i byang chub sems dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sems can kun gyi don byed pa po zung yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir byis pa'i byang chub sems dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sems can kun gyi don byed pa po zung yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
translated: Here, the union of the childish bodhicitta and the Enjoyment-body is the agent for the sake of all sentient beings, and in the same way, the union of the Dharma-circle is also.

original: 'dir byis pa'i ye shes zhes pa ni 'pho ba'i dus su bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir byis pa'i ye shes zhes pa ni 'pho ba'i dus su bde ba'o //
translated: Here, the so-called childish intuition is the bliss at the time of the transference.

original: sprul pa'i sku zhes pa ni lo bcu drug gi mtshams su khams yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku zhes pa ni lo bcu drug gi mtshams su khams yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: The so-called Emanation-body is the complete perfection of the elements at the time of sixteen years.

original: zung du 'gyur te srog chags rnams la thar pa ster ba nyid do zhes pa la thar pa ni 'dir byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams 'pho ba'i skad cig ste de ster ba'i phyir thar pa ster ba'o //
analyzed: zung du 'gyur te srog chags rnams la thar pa ster ba nyid do zhes pa la thar pa ni 'dir byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams 'pho ba'i skad cig ste de ster ba'i phyir thar pa ster ba'o //
translated: The union is the bestowal of liberation to the creatures. Here, liberation is the moment of the transference of the drops of bodhicitta, and because it bestows that, it is the bestowal of liberation.

original: srog chags rnams kyi ye shes dang sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid zung yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du de'i chos mi mthun pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa ni thar pa ster ba'o zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi ye shes dang sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid zung yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du de'i chos mi mthun pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa ni thar pa ster ba'o zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Just as the characteristics of the wisdom and emanation bodies of all living beings are a pair, in the same way, by the opposite of that, the cessation of the twelve links of cause and effect is the bestowal of liberation.

original: slar yang sku bzhi dang rdo rje bzhi po rnams kyi shes rab thabs kyi lus dang bsam pa mnyam pa dang mi mnyam rigs zhes pa la mnyam pa'i rigs ni rdul las byung ba'i khams kyi rigs dang mi mnyam pa'i rigs ni khu ba las byung ba'i khams
analyzed: slar yang sku bzhi dang rdo rje bzhi po rnams kyi shes rab thabs kyi lus dang bsam pa mnyam pa dang mi mnyam rigs zhes pa la mnyam pa'i rigs ni rdul las byung ba'i khams kyi rigs dang mi mnyam pa'i rigs ni khu ba las byung ba'i khams
translated: Again, the body of method and wisdom of the four bodies and the four vajras is the same or different. The same is the type of the element that arises from the particle. The different is the type of the element that arises from the bindu.

original: kyi rigs te nyi zla ka sogs aa sogs dang rnam gsum srid pa la gnas ye shes kyi dbye ba dga' ba la sogs pa dang rnam shes kyi dbye ba skye mched bcu gnyis kyi dbye ba dag gis rnal 'byor pa yis mtha' dag rig par bya ste
analyzed: kyi rigs te nyi zla ka sogs aa sogs dang rnam gsum srid pa la gnas ye shes kyi dbye ba dga' ba la sogs pa dang rnam shes kyi dbye ba skye mched bcu gnyis kyi dbye ba dag gis rnal 'byor pa yis mtha' dag rig par bya ste
translated: The divisions of the three, the sun and moon, the vowels and consonants, and the three existences, the divisions of the wisdoms, joy and so on, and the divisions of the consciousnesses, the twelve sense bases, should be understood in their entirety by the yogi.

original: nang gi le'u las byis pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du lha'i sgrub thabs kyi skyed pa'i rim pa la'o //
analyzed: nang gi le'u las byis pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du lha'i sgrub thabs kyi skyed pa'i rim pa la'o //
translated: As in the case of a child, so in the case of the creation stage of deity yoga.

original: de ltar lha'i gzugs rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha'i gzugs rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the form of the deity is complete.

original: da ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa skyes pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems byin gyis brlab pa sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur
analyzed: da ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa skyes pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems byin gyis brlab pa sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur
translated: Now, the consecration of body, speech, and mind is stated with “vajra,” etc. Here, the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of a newborn child is characterized by the states of waking, dreaming, and deep sleep.

original: pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dpral ba dang mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba @57a * //
analyzed: pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dpral ba dang mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba @57a * //
translated: As in that case, so in this case, the consecration with OṀ, ĀḤ, and HŪṀ at the forehead, throat, heart, navel, secret place,

original: dang gtsug tor la aom a'a: h'um ho sv'a h'a ste 'di rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i yan lag ni byis pa mas 'khru bar byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag po'i lha mo rnams kyis zhes pa rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis
analyzed: dang gtsug tor la aom a'a: h'um ho sv'a h'a ste 'di rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i yan lag ni byis pa mas 'khru bar byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag po'i lha mo rnams kyis zhes pa rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis
translated: and crown of the head is the consecration by the supreme goddesses of the Victorious Ones, just as a mother bathes her child.

original: bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: bkru bar bya'o //
translated: One should wash.

original: 'dir byin gyis brlab pa ni dpral bar aa yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'dir byin gyis brlab pa ni dpral bar aa yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Here, the consecration is that on the forehead, the letter A becomes a moon disk.

original: de'i steng du aom yig yongs su gyur pa las 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du aom yig yongs su gyur pa las 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa'o //
translated: On that, the letter Om becomes an eight-spoked wheel.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las sku rdo rje kha dog dkar po zhal gsum pa rtsa ba dkar po g-yon dmar po g-yas nag po phyag drug pa g-yas pa na 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang padma 'dzin pa g-yon na ral gri dang dril bu dang nor bu
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las sku rdo rje kha dog dkar po zhal gsum pa rtsa ba dkar po g-yon dmar po g-yas nag po phyag drug pa g-yas pa na 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang padma 'dzin pa g-yon na ral gri dang dril bu dang nor bu
translated: That becomes white Body-vajra, with three faces, the principal face white, the left red, the right black, with six arms, holding a wheel, a vajra, and a lotus in the right hands, and a sword, a bell, and a jewel in the left hands.

original: 'dzin pa shes rab dang bcas pa rdzogs par bya ste de nas dpral ba las spros nas des nam mkha'i khams kun nas yongs su gang bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa shes rab dang bcas pa rdzogs par bya ste de nas dpral ba las spros nas des nam mkha'i khams kun nas yongs su gang bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should complete the figure with wisdom, and then emanate from the forehead, and meditate that it fills the whole realm of space.

original: sku rdo rjes gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams la chos bstan pa mdzad nas slar log ste bdag nyid kyi mdun du yang dag par bkod la sku'i rdo rje 'dzin pa bdag la dbang bskur du gsol zhes dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste de
analyzed: sku rdo rjes gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams la chos bstan pa mdzad nas slar log ste bdag nyid kyi mdun du yang dag par bkod la sku'i rdo rje 'dzin pa bdag la dbang bskur du gsol zhes dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste de
translated: Having taught the Dharma to the sentient beings to be trained by Body-vajra, he returns and is properly placed in front of oneself. One should request the empowerment, saying, “Please confer the empowerment on me, the holder of the Body-vajra.”

original: nas sku'i rigs kyi lha mo rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i bum pas mngon par dbang bskur bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nas sku'i rigs kyi lha mo rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i bum pas mngon par dbang bskur bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then one should visualize that the goddesses of the Body family confer the empowerment with vases of nectar.

original: de nas dbang bskur bar gyur pa la byin gyis brlab par bya ste dpral bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sku rdo rje rab tu bcug nas 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur bar gyur pa la byin gyis brlab par bya ste dpral bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sku rdo rje rab tu bcug nas 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then one should consecrate the one who has been empowered. Having inserted Body-vajra into the moon maṇḍala in the forehead, one should say this:

original: dpal ldan sku yi rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: dpal ldan sku yi rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: “Glorious holder of the vajra body,

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas ;🔽/ sku yi rdo rje can gyi ni //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas ; / sku yi rdo rje can gyi ni //
translated: having meditated on the indivisible three vajras,🔽please grant me now the consecration

original: byin brlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod //
analyzed: byin brlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod //
translated: of the one who possesses the vajra body.”

original: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: “All buddhas dwelling in the ten directions,

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //
translated: having meditated on the indivisible three vajras,

original: sku yi rdo rje can gyi ni //
analyzed: sku yi rdo rje can gyi ni //
translated: The one who has the vajra of body

original: byin brlabs gnas su dang bdag mdzod //
analyzed: byin brlabs gnas su dang bdag mdzod //
translated: should consecrate the places and the self.

original: ces pa ste sku byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ste sku byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: This is the consecration of the body.

original: de bzhin du mgrin par ra yig yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mgrin par ra yig yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the same way, on the throat, the letter ra transforms into a sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du a'a: yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du a'a: yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //
translated: On that, the letter āḥ transforms into a red eight-petaled lotus.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las gsung rdo rje shes rab dang bcas pa dmar po zhal dmar po dang dkar po dang nag @57b po g-yas na padma dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa g-yon na nor bu dang dril bu dang ral gri 'dzin pa spros te
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las gsung rdo rje shes rab dang bcas pa dmar po zhal dmar po dang dkar po dang nag @57b po g-yas na padma dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa g-yon na nor bu dang dril bu dang ral gri 'dzin pa spros te
translated: That transforms into red Vajra Speech together with Wisdom, with red, white, and black faces, holding a lotus, vajra, and wheel with the right hands, and a jewel, bell, and sword with the left hands.

original: / des nam mkha'i khams yongs su gang bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: / des nam mkha'i khams yongs su gang bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that they fill the realm of space.

original: gsung rdo rje gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams la chos bstan pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: gsung rdo rje gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams la chos bstan pa mdzad nas /
translated: Vajra Speech teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings who are to be trained.

original: slar yang bdag nyid kyi mdun du yang dag par bkod la gsung gi rdo rje can gyis bdag la dbang bskur la gsol zhes dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: slar yang bdag nyid kyi mdun du yang dag par bkod la gsung gi rdo rje can gyis bdag la dbang bskur la gsol zhes dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: Again, having arranged them in front of oneself, one should request the consecration of speech with the verse, “Consecrate me, O possessor of speech vajra,” and so forth.

original: de nas gsung gi rigs kyi lha mo rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i bum pas bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gsung gi rigs kyi lha mo rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i bum pas bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then one should meditate on the goddesses of the speech family consecrating oneself with the vase of nectar.

original: de nas gsung byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas gsung byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
translated: Then one should bless the speech.

original: gsung rdo rje nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la rnam par bkod nas 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la rnam par bkod nas 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having arranged it on the sun mandala of speech vajra, one should recite this:

original: dpal ldan gsung gi rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: dpal ldan gsung gi rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: “O glorious possessor of speech vajra,

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //🔽gsung gi rdo rje can gyi ni //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas // gsung gi rdo rje can gyi ni //
translated: having meditated on the indivisible three vajras,🔽please bring about now the consecration

original: byin brlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod //
analyzed: byin brlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod //
translated: of the possessor of speech vajra in my place.

original: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: O buddhas dwelling in the ten directions,

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //🔽gsung gi rdo rje can gyi ni //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas // gsung gi rdo rje can gyi ni //
translated: having meditated on the indivisible three vajras,🔽please bring about now the consecration

original: byin rlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod //
analyzed: byin rlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod //
translated: of the possessor of speech vajra in my place.”

original: ces pa ste gsung byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ste gsung byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Thus, the consecration of speech.

original: thugs byin gyis brlab pa ni snying gar thig le yongs su gyur pa las sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor kha dog mthon mthing rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thugs byin gyis brlab pa ni snying gar thig le yongs su gyur pa las sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor kha dog mthon mthing rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The consecration of mind is as follows: At the heart, one should visualize a moon disk, and on top of that, a syllable hūṃ, which is the nature of the mind of all buddhas.🔽That syllable hūṃ completely transforms into Rāhu, the color of a dark blue cloud.

original: de'i steng du h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje rtse lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje rtse lnga pa'o //
translated: On top of that, the syllable hūṃ completely transforms into a five-pronged vajra.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las thugs rdo rje shes rab dang bcas pa nag po zhal nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po g-yas na rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma 'dzin pa g-yon dril bu dang ral gri dang nor bu 'dzin pa spros te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las thugs rdo rje shes rab dang bcas pa nag po zhal nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po g-yas na rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma 'dzin pa g-yon dril bu dang ral gri dang nor bu 'dzin pa spros te /
translated: That completely transforms into Mind Vajra together with Wisdom, black in color, with a black, red, and white face, holding a vajra, wheel, and lotus in the right hands, and a bell, sword, and jewel in the left hands.

original: des nam mkha'i khams yongs su gang bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des nam mkha'i khams yongs su gang bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize that filling the realm of space.

original: thugs rdo rje gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams la chos bstan pa mdzad nas slar log ste bdag nyid kyi mdun du yang dag par bkod la thugs rdo rje can gyis bdag la dbang bskur du gsol zhes dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams la chos bstan pa mdzad nas slar log ste bdag nyid kyi mdun du yang dag par bkod la thugs rdo rje can gyis bdag la dbang bskur du gsol zhes dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: Having taught the doctrine to the sentient beings to be trained, he returns and is placed in front of oneself. One should request the empowerment, saying, “Empower me, O Vajra Mind.”

original: de nas thugs rdo rje'i rigs kyi lha mo rnams kyis bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bsgoms nas byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas thugs rdo rje'i rigs kyi lha mo rnams kyis bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bsgoms nas byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
translated: Then, having meditated on the goddesses of the Vajra Mind family empowering oneself, one should be consecrated.

original: thugs rdo rje sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la bkod nas @58a * //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la bkod nas @58a * //
translated: Having placed Vajra Mind Rāhu in the maṇḍala,

original: 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should recite this:

original: dpal ldan thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: dpal ldan thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: “O glorious Vajra Mind Holder,

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //🔽thugs kyi rdo rje can gyi ni //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas // thugs kyi rdo rje can gyi ni //
translated: having meditated on the indivisible three vajras,🔽please grant me today the consecration

original: byin brlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod //
analyzed: byin brlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod //
translated: of the one who possesses the vajra mind.

original: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: The buddhas dwelling in the ten directions,

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //
translated: having meditated on the indivisible three vajras,🔽please grant me today the consecration

original: thugs kyi rdo rje can gyi ni //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje can gyi ni //
translated: of the one who possesses the vajra mind.”

original: byin brlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod ces pa'o //
analyzed: byin brlabs gnas su deng bdag mdzod ces pa'o //
translated: Bless me in the place of consecration.

original: de ltar thugs byin gyis brlab pa byas te /
analyzed: de ltar thugs byin gyis brlab pa byas te /
translated: Thus, having done the consecration of the mind,

original: de nas gcig pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de nas gcig pa nyid kyis /
translated: then, by means of the one-ness,🔽the yogi should hold the pride, saying,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'a ka tsitta sv'a bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa'i nga rgyal rnal 'byor pas gzung bar bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'a ka tsitta sv'a bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa'i nga rgyal rnal 'byor pas gzung bar bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Om, I am the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi lte bar ho yig gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi lte bar ho yig gis so //
translated: Thus, in the navel of the wisdom consort, with the syllable Ho,

original: gsang bar sv'a yig gis so //
analyzed: gsang bar sv'a yig gis so //
translated: in the secret place with the syllable Sva,

original: gtsug tor ra la h'a yig gis so //
analyzed: gtsug tor ra la h'a yig gis so //
translated: in the crown of the head with the syllable Ra, and in the place of the jewel with the syllable Ha.

original: khu ba'i chos las thabs rigs gsum dang rdul dang khu ba'i chos las shes rab rigs drug go /
analyzed: khu ba'i chos las thabs rigs gsum dang rdul dang khu ba'i chos las shes rab rigs drug go /
translated: The three families of method arise from the quality of semen, and the six families of wisdom arise from the quality of the blood and semen.

original: gsol ba gdab pa gzhan ni dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa gzhan ni dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas bya'o //
translated: The other supplications should be done with the rite taught in the chapter on initiation.

original: der ma gsungs pa gang yin pa de thams cad cho ga 'dis bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: der ma gsungs pa gang yin pa de thams cad cho ga 'dis bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Whatever is not taught there, all of that should be done with this rite.

original: da ni stong pa la sogs pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnas rnams gsungs pa stod pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sems can thams cad shi ba'i mthar shi ba'i mtha'i phung po rnams stong pa nyid du 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa
analyzed: da ni stong pa la sogs pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnas rnams gsungs pa stod pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sems can thams cad shi ba'i mthar shi ba'i mtha'i phung po rnams stong pa nyid du 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa
translated: Here, just as all sentient beings, at the end of death, the aggregates at the end of death become emptiness, in the same way, for the sake of the yogi

original: rnams kyi mi'i phung po'i nga rgyal yongs su spang ba'i don dang lha'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du aom sh'un+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'a tma ko& ham zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi mi'i phung po'i nga rgyal yongs su spang ba'i don dang lha'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du aom sh'un+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'a tma ko& ham zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: s’ complete abandonment of the pride of the human aggregates and for the sake of the complete perfection of the divine aggregates, “Oṃ, I am the emptiness of knowledge vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.”

original: 'dir nye bar bskyed pa'i cha shas can gyi phung po lngas mngal du byis pa'i lus rdzogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la me long lta bu la sogs pa rnam pa lngas lha'i sku rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar bskyed pa'i cha shas can gyi phung po lngas mngal du byis pa'i lus rdzogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la me long lta bu la sogs pa rnam pa lngas lha'i sku rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Here, just as the body of a child in the womb is perfected by the five aggregates that are the parts that are generated, in the same way, the body of the deity is perfected by the five aspects, such as the mirror-like [wisdom], in the maṇḍala.

original: de la nga rgyal ni aom su bi shuddha dharmma dh'a tu sva bha ba a'a tma ko nya ham zhes pa nyes pa ste de ltar stong pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi dus dang rdo rje gsum gyi dus dang de bzhin du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i ye shes
analyzed: de la nga rgyal ni aom su bi shuddha dharmma dh'a tu sva bha ba a'a tma ko nya ham zhes pa nyes pa ste de ltar stong pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi dus dang rdo rje gsum gyi dus dang de bzhin du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i ye shes
translated: and the fault is that one is empty, and the time of the realm of phenomena and the time of the three vajras, and likewise the gnosis that will be explained.

original: mchod pa rjes su chags pa'i la ste 'dir byis pa'i rna ba 'bigs pa la sogs pas lo bcu drug gi mtshams su bag ma len pa na lag pa 'dzin pa dang ye shes mchod pa'i rjes @58b su chags pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mchod pa rjes su chags pa'i la ste 'dir byis pa'i rna ba 'bigs pa la sogs pas lo bcu drug gi mtshams su bag ma len pa na lag pa 'dzin pa dang ye shes mchod pa'i rjes @58b su chags pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Worship is the passion of the rite, just as in this world when a girl is married at the age of sixteen, having pierced her ears and so on, there is the passion of holding hands and the passion of worshipping gnosis.

original: de ltar de'i dus su tata sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod par bya ste 'dir skyed pa'i rim pa la bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i dus su tata sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod par bya ste 'dir skyed pa'i rim pa la bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, at that time one should say tattvasvabhāvātmako 'ham. Here, the generation stage is the definition of the Bhagavān.

original: da ni lha'i rnam par dag pas 'khor lo thams cad kyi rtsa rnams gsungs pa bum pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir bum pa rnams dang lhan cig du ba la sogs pa brgyad po rnams kyis snying ga'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa dag pa ste de
analyzed: da ni lha'i rnam par dag pas 'khor lo thams cad kyi rtsa rnams gsungs pa bum pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir bum pa rnams dang lhan cig du ba la sogs pa brgyad po rnams kyis snying ga'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa dag pa ste de
translated: The purities of the eight channels, such as the avadhūti, purify the eight-spoked heart chakra.

original: nyid chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: nyid chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: That is the dharma chakra.

original: rig ma spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi dang sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi ste brgyad po 'di rnams lus dang bsam pa'i dbye bas bcu drug po rnams kyis mgo bor 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug pa dag pa ste de nyid lhan cig skyes
analyzed: rig ma spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi dang sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi ste brgyad po 'di rnams lus dang bsam pa'i dbye bas bcu drug po rnams kyis mgo bor 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug pa dag pa ste de nyid lhan cig skyes
translated: The purities of the sixteen channels, the four knowledge consorts such as Buddhalocanā and the four buddhas such as Vairocana, purify the sixteen-spoked head chakra.

original: par rab tu grags so //
analyzed: par rab tu grags so //
translated: That is renowned as the connate chakra.

original: ma gsungs pa nyid las chos kyi dung dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang chos kyi gand'i dang dpag bsam gyi shing ste bzhi po rnams kyis gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo dag pa'o ;
analyzed: ma gsungs pa nyid las chos kyi dung dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang chos kyi gand'i dang dpag bsam gyi shing ste bzhi po rnams kyis gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo dag pa'o ;
translated: The purities of the four channels, the dharma conch, wish-fulfilling gem, dharma banner, and wish-fulfilling tree, purify the ushṇīsha chakra.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs zhes pa skye mched bcu gnyis dang khro bo bzhi ste bcu drug po rnams shes rab dang thabs kyi dbye bas sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs zhes pa skye mched bcu gnyis dang khro bo bzhi ste bcu drug po rnams shes rab dang thabs kyi dbye bas sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattvas and so forth are the twelve sense bases and the four wrathful ones, making sixteen. Divided into wisdom and means, they are thirty-two.

original: nyis 'gyur mi bdag ces pa sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis mgrin par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs sum cu rtsa gnyis pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyis 'gyur mi bdag ces pa sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis mgrin par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs sum cu rtsa gnyis pa dag pa'o //
translated: “The double of the lord” refers to the thirty-two spokes of the enjoyment cakra in the throat.

original: 'jigs ma la sogs nor la gdengs can gyis ni bsgyur pa zhes pa drug cu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyis lte bar sprul pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs drug cu rtsa bzhi pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs ma la sogs nor la gdengs can gyis ni bsgyur pa zhes pa drug cu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyis lte bar sprul pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs drug cu rtsa bzhi pa dag pa'o //
translated: “The nāgas transform the wealth of Māṇicūḍa and so on” refers to the sixty-four spokes of the emanation cakra in the navel.

original: de bzhin du ts'a mund'a la sogs pa brgyad dang sgeg mo la sogs pa brgyad kyis gsang ba'i 'khor lo dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ts'a mund'a la sogs pa brgyad dang sgeg mo la sogs pa brgyad kyis gsang ba'i 'khor lo dag pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the eight such as Cāmuṇḍā and the eight such as the goddess of charm purify the secret cakra.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs bcu gnyis po rnams la lha sum brgya drug cu po rnams kyis las kyi 'khor lo dag pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs bcu gnyis po rnams la lha sum brgya drug cu po rnams kyis las kyi 'khor lo dag pa'o //
translated: The one hundred and sixty-eight deities purify the action cakra in the twelve joints of the arms and legs.

original: klu dang gtum mo bcu drug po 'di rnams kyi lus dang bsam pa'i dbye bas sor mo'i tshigs kyi mtshams rnams la bya ba zhes bya ba'i 'khor lo dag pa ste 'khor lo dag pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: klu dang gtum mo bcu drug po 'di rnams kyi lus dang bsam pa'i dbye bas sor mo'i tshigs kyi mtshams rnams la bya ba zhes bya ba'i 'khor lo dag pa ste 'khor lo dag pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: These sixteen, nāgas and fierce ones, are the pure cakras called “joints” in the divisions of body and mind. This is the determination of the pure cakras.

original: da ni gtso bo la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gzhan gsungs pa dus kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gtso bo la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gzhan gsungs pa dus kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, another purification of the principal and so forth is stated, beginning with “time.”

original: 'dir phyi rol du dus dang nang du chu srin la sogs pa khyim gyi 'khor lo yan lag bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni rgyu dang @59a * //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du dus dang nang du chu srin la sogs pa khyim gyi 'khor lo yan lag bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni rgyu dang @59a * //
translated: Here, externally, time and internally, the zodiac wheel of the houses of Capricorn and so forth, which has the nature of twelve branches, is the nature of cause and effect.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid de de la lnga ni rgyu'i chos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid de de la lnga ni rgyu'i chos so //
translated: Among them, five are causal phenomena,

original: bdun ni 'bras bu'i chos so //
analyzed: bdun ni 'bras bu'i chos so //
translated: and seven are resultant phenomena.

original: rgyu'i chos ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Causal phenomena are the nature of afflictions and karma.

original: 'bras bu'i chos ni sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid de 'jig rten khams kyi le'ur gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos ni sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid de 'jig rten khams kyi le'ur gsungs so //
translated: Resultant phenomena are the nature of suffering, as stated in the chapter on the world systems.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i chos de rnams kyi dag pa ni dus kyi dag pa ste rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gags pa'i dag pas rdo rje can te dkyil 'khor gyi dbang po dus kyi 'khor lo rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i chos de rnams kyi dag pa ni dus kyi dag pa ste rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gags pa'i dag pas rdo rje can te dkyil 'khor gyi dbang po dus kyi 'khor lo rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of those dharmas, cause and effect, is the purity of time, the purity of the cessation of cause and effect. The possessor of the vajra, the lord of the mandala, the Wheel of Time, is pure.

original: lo dang zla ba la sogs dbye bas so zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lo dang zla ba la sogs dbye bas so zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: The division of years, months, and so on will be explained in the commentary.

original: sems kyi rnam pa ni rnam par dag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa ni rnam par dag pa'i sems so //
translated: The aspect of mind is the pure mind.

original: nyi ma ste 'khor ba'i sems kyi mtshan nyid srog la zhon pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma ste 'khor ba'i sems kyi mtshan nyid srog la zhon pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni ma yin no //
translated: The sun, the characteristic of the samsaric mind, is not the aggregate of consciousness mounted on life.

original: nyin zhag so so'i dbang gis sna tshogs yum shes rab ma rnam par dag pa ste 'dir lo la zla ba'i dbye bas dus sbyor bcu gnyis ji lta ba de bzhin du nyin zhag so so la 'char ba'i dbye bas dus sbyor bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: nyin zhag so so'i dbang gis sna tshogs yum shes rab ma rnam par dag pa ste 'dir lo la zla ba'i dbye bas dus sbyor bcu gnyis ji lta ba de bzhin du nyin zhag so so la 'char ba'i dbye bas dus sbyor bcu gnyis so //
translated: By the power of each day, the various mothers, the pure prajñās, are the twelve two-hour periods, just as they are divided into months in a year. In the same way, there are twelve two-hour periods divided by the rising of each day.

original: de bzhin du yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pas shes rab ma'ang dag pa'o //🔽'dir theg pa gsum la rgyas gdab pa ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi ye dharm'a:'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pas shes rab ma'ang dag pa'o // 'dir theg pa gsum la rgyas gdab pa ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi ye dharm'a:'o //
translated: Likewise, by the cessation of the twelve limbs, the mother of wisdom is purified.

original: lha rnams kyi rgyas gdab pa ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi rgyas gdab pa ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: Here, the seal of the three vehicles is the Dharma, the seal of the gods is the Buddha,

original: dge 'dun rnam pa bzhi'i rgyas gdab pa ni dge slong ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun rnam pa bzhi'i rgyas gdab pa ni dge slong ngo //
translated: the seal of the four types of Sangha is the monk,

original: de bzhin du dge slong sngon du 'gro ba ni dge 'dun no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong sngon du 'gro ba ni dge 'dun no //
translated: and likewise, the Sangha is preceded by the monk,

original: ye dharm'a: sngon du 'gro ba ni chos so //
analyzed: ye dharm'a: sngon du 'gro ba ni chos so //
translated: the Dharma is preceded by the Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas sngon du 'gro ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo dang lha'i tshogs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sngon du 'gro ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo dang lha'i tshogs so //
translated: and the assembly of wrathful deities and bodhisattvas is preceded by the Buddha.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la gtso bo ni bsam du med pa'i thugs rdo rje ste gtso mo ni stong pa nyid dang ye shes kyi chos can ma sna tshogs yum mo zhes pa rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la gtso bo ni bsam du med pa'i thugs rdo rje ste gtso mo ni stong pa nyid dang ye shes kyi chos can ma sna tshogs yum mo zhes pa rigs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, in the maṇḍala, the principal one is the inconceivable mind vajra, and the principal one is the mother of the nature of emptiness and wisdom, the diverse mother.

original: da ni du ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa rlung zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir snying ga'i padmar mnyam gnas la sogs pa'i rlung rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i rtsa brgyad de de rnams kyis du ba la sogs pa'i lha mo🔽nag mo 'bar ma'i mthar thug pa rnams dag pa'o //
analyzed: da ni du ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa rlung zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir snying ga'i padmar mnyam gnas la sogs pa'i rlung rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i rtsa brgyad de de rnams kyis du ba la sogs pa'i lha mo nag mo 'bar ma'i mthar thug pa rnams dag pa'o //
translated: Now, the purities of smoke and so forth are stated: “wind” and so forth. Here, the eight channels that are the supports of the winds of the equalizing wind and so forth in the heart lotus are the purities of the goddesses of smoke and so forth, ending with the Fierce Lady.🔽The purities of the parts and the bindu are the purities of the avadhūtī and the shankhinī, respectively.

original: aa ba dh'u t'i dang dung can ma dag gis cha dang thig le'i gzugs can ma dag ste rlung bcu 'gags pas dag pa'o //
analyzed: aa ba dh'u t'i dang dung can ma dag gis cha dang thig le'i gzugs can ma dag ste rlung bcu 'gags pas dag pa'o //
translated: The purities of the ten winds are the purities of the ten winds.

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi zad pas zhabs @59b g-yon pa'i 'og tu drag po dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi zad pas zhabs @59b g-yon pa'i 'og tu drag po dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of Rudra under the left foot is the purity of the four afflictions.

original: bdud kyi tshogs zad pas zhabs g-yas pa'i 'og tu bdud dag pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi tshogs zad pas zhabs g-yas pa'i 'og tu bdud dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of Māra under the right foot is the purity of the hosts of Māra.

original: lus kyi sgrib pa zad pas dung dag pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi sgrib pa zad pas dung dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the conch is the purity of the obscurations of the body.

original: ngag gi sgrib pa zad pas gand'i dag pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi sgrib pa zad pas gand'i dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the throat is the purity of the obscurations of speech.

original: sems kyi sgrib pa zad pas nor bu dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi sgrib pa zad pas nor bu dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the jewel is the purity of the obscurations of the mind.

original: ye shes kyi sgrib pa zad pas dpag bsam gyi shing dag pa ste sku'i rdo rje la sogs kyis so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgrib pa zad pas dpag bsam gyi shing dag pa ste sku'i rdo rje la sogs kyis so //
translated: The tree of pristine consciousness is pure because the obscurations of pristine consciousness are exhausted.

original: bum pa brgyad ni bdud rtsi'i yan lag gis zhes pa ni 'dir rkang 'gags pas bum pa gnyis dag pa ste g-yon dang g-yas kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: bum pa brgyad ni bdud rtsi'i yan lag gis zhes pa ni 'dir rkang 'gags pas bum pa gnyis dag pa ste g-yon dang g-yas kyi dbye bas so //
translated: The eight vases are pure by the branches of nectar. Here, the two vases are pure by the cessation of blood, by the division of left and right.

original: de ltar thams cad du g-yon dang g-yas kyi dbye bas rig par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du khrag 'gags pas bum pa gnyis dang de bzhin du gci ba mi 'dzag pas bum pa gnyis dang de bzhin du bshang ba mi 'dzag pas bum pa gnyis dang de bzhin du khu ba mi 'dzag pas rgyal ba'i bum pa dang rdul mi 'dzag pas
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du g-yon dang g-yas kyi dbye bas rig par bya'o // de bzhin du khrag 'gags pas bum pa gnyis dang de bzhin du gci ba mi 'dzag pas bum pa gnyis dang de bzhin du bshang ba mi 'dzag pas bum pa gnyis dang de bzhin du khu ba mi 'dzag pas rgyal ba'i bum pa dang rdul mi 'dzag pas
translated: Thus, everything should be understood by the division of left and right.🔽Similarly, the two vases are by the cessation of blood, and similarly, the two vases are by the non-emission of urine, and similarly, the two vases are by the non-emission of feces, and similarly, the vase of the victor is by the non-emission of semen, and the vase of total victory is by the non-emission of particles.

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa ste bum pa brgyad dang gnyis sam thod pa rnams dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa ste bum pa brgyad dang gnyis sam thod pa rnams dag pa'o //
translated: Thus, the eight vases are pure, or the skulls.

original: da ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi dag pa gsungs te 'dir kun rdzob kyi chos 'gags par gyur pa na 'du byed gzhan la sogs pa de rnams so //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi dag pa gsungs te 'dir kun rdzob kyi chos 'gags par gyur pa na 'du byed gzhan la sogs pa de rnams so //
translated: Now, the purities of the Buddhas are stated. Here, when the conventional phenomena are ceased, those formations and so forth.

original: des na rnam par dag pa'i 'du byed ni don yod grub pa ste 'du byed kyi sgrib pa zad pas so ;
analyzed: des na rnam par dag pa'i 'du byed ni don yod grub pa ste 'du byed kyi sgrib pa zad pas so ;
translated: Therefore, the pure formation is Amoghasiddhi, because the obscuration of formation is exhausted.

original: / tshor ba ni dri med nor bu'i phyag ces pa rin chen 'byung ldan te dang yig ni sdud pa'i don to //
analyzed: / tshor ba ni dri med nor bu'i phyag ces pa rin chen 'byung ldan te dang yig ni sdud pa'i don to //
translated: Feeling is called the “hand of the stainless jewel,” Ratnasaṃbhava, and the “and” has the sense of collecting.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: Similarly, perception is Amitābha.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni 'khor lo can zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni 'khor lo can zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The aggregate of form is called “the one with the wheel,” Vairocana.

original: slar yang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa 'di rnams ni ri bong can zhes pa khu ba dang stobs zhes pa bshad dang khrag dang gci ba dang bshad pa ste 'di rnams rnam par dag cing sgrib pa med pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung po
analyzed: slar yang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa 'di rnams ni ri bong can zhes pa khu ba dang stobs zhes pa bshad dang khrag dang gci ba dang bshad pa ste 'di rnams rnam par dag cing sgrib pa med pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung po
translated: Again, these Akṣobhya and so forth are the “semen and strength,” the “urine and feces,” the “rabbit,” and so forth, which are pure and free of obscuration, and therefore the aggregates of consciousness and so forth

original: lnga rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lnga rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: become pure.

original: de bzhin du lha mo drug ces pa sna tshogs yum dang rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang sgrol ma dang gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i dang spyan ma ste khams rnams kyis zhes pa ye shes dang nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu dang
analyzed: de bzhin du lha mo drug ces pa sna tshogs yum dang rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang sgrol ma dang gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i dang spyan ma ste khams rnams kyis zhes pa ye shes dang nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu dang
