translated: The six elements are the elements of space, air, fire, water, earth, and gnosis.

original: sa'i khams rnams 'gags pas khams gzhan de rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i khams rnams 'gags pas khams gzhan de rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By blocking the elements, the other elements become purified.

original: yul dang yul can rnams kyis zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa yul drug dang @60a * //🔽mig la sogs pa yul can rnam par dag pa rnams kyis gzugs gzhan la sogs pa de rnams dang mig gzhan la sogs pa de rnams rnam par dag pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams dang lhan cig tu sa yi snying po la sogs pa
analyzed: yul dang yul can rnams kyis zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa yul drug dang @60a * // mig la sogs pa yul can rnam par dag pa rnams kyis gzugs gzhan la sogs pa de rnams dang mig gzhan la sogs pa de rnams rnam par dag pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams dang lhan cig tu sa yi snying po la sogs pa
translated: The six objects and subjects are the six objects such as form and the six subjects such as the eye.🔽The purification of the objects and subjects is the purification of the other forms and so forth and the other eyes and so forth.

original: ste byang chub sems dpa' phyag rgyar bcas pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: ste byang chub sems dpa' phyag rgyar bcas pa dag pa'o //
translated: The forms such as Vajra Body and the eyes such as Vajra Eye are the purification of the bodhisattvas together with their consorts.

original: khro bo lnga ni stobs rnams kyis zhes pa dad pa'i stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang dran pa'i stobs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang shes rab kyi stobs te dad pa med pa dang brtson 'grus med pa dang dran pa med pa dang ting nge 'dzin🔽med pa dang shes rab med pa'i sgrib pa zad pas dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khro bo lnga ni stobs rnams kyis zhes pa dad pa'i stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang dran pa'i stobs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang shes rab kyi stobs te dad pa med pa dang brtson 'grus med pa dang dran pa med pa dang ting nge 'dzin med pa dang shes rab med pa'i sgrib pa zad pas dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The five wrathful ones are the powers. The power of faith, the power of perseverance, the power of mindfulness, the power of samadhi, and the power of wisdom.🔽Since they exhaust the obscurations of the absence of faith, the absence of perseverance, the absence of mindfulness, the absence of samadhi, and the absence of wisdom, they become the powers of faith and so on.

original: stobs de rnams rnam par dag pa ni gtsug tor dang bgegs mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dang gshin rje mthar byed de khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dag pa'o //
analyzed: stobs de rnams rnam par dag pa ni gtsug tor dang bgegs mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dang gshin rje mthar byed de khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dag pa'o //
translated: The purification of those powers is the uṣṇīṣa, Vighnāntaka, Prajñāntaka, Padmāntaka, and Yamāntaka.

original: des par slar yang gzhan pa zhes pa gnod mdzes rgyal po dang dbyug pa sngon po dang 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang mi g-yo ba dang stobs po che ni bha ga dang ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang bshang lam gyi las kyi dbang po lnga po
analyzed: des par slar yang gzhan pa zhes pa gnod mdzes rgyal po dang dbyug pa sngon po dang 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang mi g-yo ba dang stobs po che ni bha ga dang ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang bshang lam gyi las kyi dbang po lnga po
translated: The “other” ones, namely, Sumbha King, Nīladaṇḍa, Kāmarāja, Acalā, and Mahābala, are the five action faculties of the vagina, speech, hands, feet, and anus.

original: rnams kyis te las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams kyis drag spyan ma la sogs pa dang lhan cig yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnams kyis te las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams kyis drag spyan ma la sogs pa dang lhan cig yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: They are purified together with Caṇḍī and so on by the actions of the action faculties.

original: ts'a mund'a sogs thun brgyad kyis te padma'i 'dab mar gnas pa 'jigs ma la sogs pa rnams nyi ma'i dus sbyor chu tshod drug cu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ts'a mund'a sogs thun brgyad kyis te padma'i 'dab mar gnas pa 'jigs ma la sogs pa rnams nyi ma'i dus sbyor chu tshod drug cu rnams kyis so //
translated: Caṇḍī and so on are located on the lotus petals by the eight periods, such as the first period, by the sixty solar periods.

original: bzhi ni stong pa'i 'dab ma rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: bzhi ni stong pa'i 'dab ma rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The four are purified by the purity of the empty petals.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i sgrib pa zad pas tsartsi k'a gzhan la sogs pa dang 'jigs ma gzhan la sogs pa'o zhes pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i sgrib pa zad pas tsartsi k'a gzhan la sogs pa dang 'jigs ma gzhan la sogs pa'o zhes pa dag pa'o //
translated: By the exhaustion of the obscurations of the emanation chakra, Caṇḍālī and so on are purified, and Bhairavī and so on are purified.

original: lha min la sogs zhes pa bden bral dang rlung dang me dang gdong drug dang rgya mtsho dang tshogs kyi dbang po dang brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang drag po dang gnod sbyin dang khyab 'jug dang gshin rje rnams ni nag pa'i zla ba dang sa ga'i zla
analyzed: lha min la sogs zhes pa bden bral dang rlung dang me dang gdong drug dang rgya mtsho dang tshogs kyi dbang po dang brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang drag po dang gnod sbyin dang khyab 'jug dang gshin rje rnams ni nag pa'i zla ba dang sa ga'i zla
translated: Rahu, Vāyu, Agni, Śakra, Brahmā, Rudra, Yakṣa, Viṣṇu, and Yama.🔽The twelve months are the months of

original: ba dang snon gyi zla ba dang chu stod kyi zla ba dang gro bzhin gyi zla ba dang khrums stod kyi zla ba dang tha skar gyi zla ba dang smin drug gi zla ba dang mgo'i zla ba dang rgyal gyi zla ba dang mchu'i zla ba dang po
analyzed: ba dang snon gyi zla ba dang chu stod kyi zla ba dang gro bzhin gyi zla ba dang khrums stod kyi zla ba dang tha skar gyi zla ba dang smin drug gi zla ba dang mgo'i zla ba dang rgyal gyi zla ba dang mchu'i zla ba dang po
translated: Kṛṣṇa, Bhādrapada, Āśvina, Kārttika, Mārgaśīrṣa, Pauṣa, Māgha, Phālguna, Caitra, Vaiśākha, Jyeṣṭha, and Āṣāḍha.

original: zla ba ste bcu gnyis por nams kyis grib pa zad pas dag pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba ste bcu gnyis por nams kyis grib pa zad pas dag pa'o //
translated: Since the shadow is exhausted in these months, they are pure.

original: de rnams kyi padma'i 'dab mar gnas rnams sgeg mo la sogs pa dang ldan pa sum brgya drug cu ni chu tshogs dbugs kyi grangs kyi nyin zhag rnams kyis te nyin zhag sum brgya drug @60b cu'i sgrib pa zad pas dag pa lha gzhan de rnams dang 'dab
analyzed: de rnams kyi padma'i 'dab mar gnas rnams sgeg mo la sogs pa dang ldan pa sum brgya drug cu ni chu tshogs dbugs kyi grangs kyi nyin zhag rnams kyis te nyin zhag sum brgya drug @60b cu'i sgrib pa zad pas dag pa lha gzhan de rnams dang 'dab
translated: The three hundred and sixty goddesses who reside on the petals of those lotuses are the purities of the days and nights, which are the number of breaths.

original: ma'i lha mo gzhan de rnams so zhes pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i lha mo gzhan de rnams so zhes pa dag pa'o //
translated: The other goddesses on the petals are the purities of the other deities.

original: gsang bar mi bdag nyis 'gyur rtsa rnams kyis kyang klu rnams dang ni gtum mo rnams kyang rnam par dag /
analyzed: gsang bar mi bdag nyis 'gyur rtsa rnams kyis kyang klu rnams dang ni gtum mo rnams kyang rnam par dag /
translated: In the secret place, the nāgas and caṇḍālīs are pure by the channels, which are double the lords of humans.

original: ces pa shes rab dang thabs kyi dbye bas nyis 'gyur nyid do //
analyzed: ces pa shes rab dang thabs kyi dbye bas nyis 'gyur nyid do //
translated: The double is by the division of wisdom and method.

original: de bzhin 'dod ma la sogs zhes pa ni 'dir 'dod ma sum cu rtsa drug dang phyir 'dod ma sum cu rtsa drug sngar gsungs pa rnams rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis lus kyi bya bas rnam par dag ste lus kyi bya ba'i sgrib pa zad pas 'dod
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod ma la sogs zhes pa ni 'dir 'dod ma sum cu rtsa drug dang phyir 'dod ma sum cu rtsa drug sngar gsungs pa rnams rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis lus kyi bya bas rnam par dag ste lus kyi bya ba'i sgrib pa zad pas 'dod
translated: Similarly, the purities of the thirty-six desire goddesses and the thirty-six reverse desire goddesses, which were previously mentioned, are pure by the actions of the body, due to the power of the qualities of the nature.

original: ma gzhan la sogs pa de rnams dag pa'o //
analyzed: ma gzhan la sogs pa de rnams dag pa'o //
translated: Those others, etc. are pure.

original: skra rnams kyis ni grub pa mtha' dag go ;
analyzed: skra rnams kyis ni grub pa mtha' dag go ;
translated: The hairs are all the accomplishments.

original: / sgrib pa med pa'i ba spu bye ba phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i gsum po rnams kyis dur khrod du 'byung po'i tshogs rnam par dag pa ste de ltar grub pa gzhan de rnams dang 'byung po gzhan de rnams so zhes pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: / sgrib pa med pa'i ba spu bye ba phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i gsum po rnams kyis dur khrod du 'byung po'i tshogs rnam par dag pa ste de ltar grub pa gzhan de rnams dang 'byung po gzhan de rnams so zhes pa dag pa'o //
translated: The three, together with the half-hundred of the pores without obscuration, are the pure assembly of the ghosts in the charnel grounds. Thus, those other accomplishments and those other ghosts are pure.

original: de nyid nyi shu rtsa bzhi sgrib pa med pa rnams kyis gtso bo'i mtshon cha rdo rje la sogs pa rnams dag pa ste rang bzhin med pa'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid nyi shu rtsa bzhi sgrib pa med pa rnams kyis gtso bo'i mtshon cha rdo rje la sogs pa rnams dag pa ste rang bzhin med pa'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i phyir ro //
translated: Those very twenty-four without obscuration are the pure weapons of the principal, the vajra, etc., because of the twenty-four aspects of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zhes pa la rang bzhin ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zhes pa la rang bzhin ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi tshogs so //
translated: By the power of the intrinsic qualities, etc. The intrinsic nature is the collection of the elements such as earth.

original: de rnams kyi yon tan ni yul drug ste de rnams kyi sgrib pa zad pa las dri gzhan la sogs pa'i khams rnams kyis phyi yi phyag rgya drug rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yon tan ni yul drug ste de rnams kyi sgrib pa zad pa las dri gzhan la sogs pa'i khams rnams kyis phyi yi phyag rgya drug rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The qualities of those are the six objects, and the purification of the six outer consorts is from the exhaustion of the obscurations of those, the elements of smell and so forth.

original: rdo rjes zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rdo rje ste sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa rnams kyis sgrib pa med pa'i phyir nang gi phyag rgya rnams dag pa ste
analyzed: rdo rjes zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rdo rje ste sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa rnams kyis sgrib pa med pa'i phyir nang gi phyag rgya rnams dag pa ste
translated: The inner consorts are purified by the vajras, the vajras of body, speech, mind, and gnosis, the purities of the characteristics of the four states of waking, dreaming, deep sleep, and the fourth, because of the absence of obscurations.

original: gzhan sku'i phyag rgya bzhi po de rnams rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan sku'i phyag rgya bzhi po de rnams rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The other four consorts of body are purified.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i thugs kar zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i thugs kar zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: At the heart of the vajra holder, on the moon at the heart of the principal of the mandala, is the syllable hūṃ.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje can ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje can ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: The glorious vajra holder is the innate joy, which is unchanging supreme.

original: sna tshogs yum ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dus gsum gzigs pa ste 'pho ba'i bde ba dang brtags pa'i sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa dag pa'o //🔽rnam gsum srid gnas zhes pa ni thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe phung po la sogs pa thams cad rnam par dag pa ste sgrib pa thams @61a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs yum ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dus gsum gzigs pa ste 'pho ba'i bde ba dang brtags pa'i sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa dag pa'o // rnam gsum srid gnas zhes pa ni thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe phung po la sogs pa thams cad rnam par dag pa ste sgrib pa thams @61a * //
translated: The mother of variety is the wisdom of the emptiness of all aspects, the vision of the three times, because of the exhaustion of the bliss of transmigration and the obscurations of imputation.

original: cad zad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: cad zad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The three abodes of existence are the complete purification of all aggregates and so forth, everywhere and at all times, because of the exhaustion of all obscurations. This is the definition of the Bhagavān.

original: de ltar srid pa yongs su shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar srid pa yongs su shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, the complete knowledge of existence is called nirvāṇa.

original: 'dir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba ste dus gsum gyi srid pa gsum ji lta bar gyur pa gzigs pa ni yongs su shes pa ste de nyid srid pa gsum sgrib pa zad pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gags pas rdzogs pa'i sangs
analyzed: 'dir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba ste dus gsum gyi srid pa gsum ji lta bar gyur pa gzigs pa ni yongs su shes pa ste de nyid srid pa gsum sgrib pa zad pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gags pas rdzogs pa'i sangs
translated: Here, the vision of the three abodes of existence of the three times, past, future, and present, is complete knowledge. That itself is the complete Buddhahood of the three abodes of existence, the exhaustion of obscurations, and the cessation of cause and effect.

original: rgyas rnams la cig car du 'gyur te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid kyi stobs kyis so ;
analyzed: rgyas rnams la cig car du 'gyur te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid kyi stobs kyis so ;
translated: For the buddhas, it is simultaneous, by the power of the knowledge of all modes, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dus gsum gyi srid pa gsum ji lta bar gyur pa cig car yongs su shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dus gsum gyi srid pa gsum ji lta bar gyur pa cig car yongs su shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: For the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas, the three existences of the three times do not become completely known simultaneously,

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi phyir dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sgrib pa cung zad tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi phyir dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sgrib pa cung zad tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the realm of nirvāṇa with remainder, and likewise, because of the bodhisattvas’ slight obscuration.

original: de bzhin du khro bo'i dbang po rnams kyang sa bcu'i dbang phyug nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du khro bo'i dbang po rnams kyang sa bcu'i dbang phyug nyid du grub bo //
translated: In the same way, the lords of wrath are also established as the lords of the ten stages.

original: da ni dag pa las chos kyi sku la sogs pa 'byung ba gsungs pa dpal ldan dag pa las zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni dag pa las chos kyi sku la sogs pa 'byung ba gsungs pa dpal ldan dag pa las zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the arising of the dharmakāya and so on from the pure is stated: from the glorious pure, and so on.

original: 'dir kun rdzob kyi bden pa la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos skad cig ma rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can te srid pa yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir kun rdzob kyi bden pa la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos skad cig ma rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can te srid pa yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the dharmas of dependent origination in the relative truth are characterized by arising and ceasing, because existence is not fully understood.

original: 'khor ba pa rnams kyi ma rig pa'i bag chags las bzhi pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhir 'gyur te de rnams las sku yi rab tu dbye bas yid ni rnam pa bzhi ru gnas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa rnams kyi ma rig pa'i bag chags las bzhi pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhir 'gyur te de rnams las sku yi rab tu dbye bas yid ni rnam pa bzhi ru gnas so //
translated: From the latent tendencies of ignorance of those in cyclic existence, there are four states, such as the fourth state. From those, the mind is present as four aspects due to the division of the body.

original: srog chags rnams kyi lus la rnam pa bzhi ni 'dir skye ba 'dzin pa'i dus su mngal du 'jug pa na khu ba 'pho ba'i gnas skabs na bzhi pa ste de yang kun rdzob tu bde ba chen po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi lus la rnam pa bzhi ni 'dir skye ba 'dzin pa'i dus su mngal du 'jug pa na khu ba 'pho ba'i gnas skabs na bzhi pa ste de yang kun rdzob tu bde ba chen po zhes brjod do //
translated: Here, the four aspects of the bodies of living beings are the fourth state at the time of entering the womb, when the body is first conceived, when the semen is emitted. That is also called “great bliss” in the relative.

original: de nyid ni shr'i yig las gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid ni shr'i yig las gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the nondual gnosis from the syllable śrī.

original: kun rdzob tu dag pa'i sku ste lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu dag pa'i sku ste lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the relative pure body, the meaning of the “coemergent body.”

original: de las chos kyi sku shin tu gnyid log pa'i mtshan nyid dang de las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rmi lam gyi mtshan nyid dang de las sprul pa'i sku sad pa'i mtshan nyid dang lus rdzogs te srog @61b 'byung ba'i dus nas phyi rol du slar yang rnam
analyzed: de las chos kyi sku shin tu gnyid log pa'i mtshan nyid dang de las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rmi lam gyi mtshan nyid dang de las sprul pa'i sku sad pa'i mtshan nyid dang lus rdzogs te srog @61b 'byung ba'i dus nas phyi rol du slar yang rnam
translated: From that, the dharmakāya is the characteristic of deep sleep, from that, the sambhogakāya is the characteristic of dreams, and from that, the nirmāṇakāya is the characteristic of waking up.

original: pa bzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: pa bzhir gsungs so //
translated: From the time the body is complete and the life force emerges, it is said that externally, again, there are four aspects.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la rgyal ba'i bdag po'i sems can kun don byed pa po sku yi dbye bar 'gyur te kun rdzob kyi sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la rgyal ba'i bdag po'i sems can kun don byed pa po sku yi dbye bar 'gyur te kun rdzob kyi sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, in the maṇḍala, the mind of the lord of the victors is the agent that acts for the benefit of all sentient beings. It becomes the division of the kāya because the obscurations of the relative are exhausted.

original: khams gsum pa gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs bzhugs te srid pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs bzhugs te srid pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind of others in the three realms and the recollection of past existences abide in the mind of the buddhas because existence is completely understood.

original: da ni sku bzhi'i bya ba gsungs pa sprul par zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sprul par zhes bsad pa'i gnas skabs su yid ni longs spyod byed pa por rab tu 'gyur te lus dang ngag dang dbang pos yul rnams byed par🔽gyur pas so //
analyzed: da ni sku bzhi'i bya ba gsungs pa sprul par zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sprul par zhes bsad pa'i gnas skabs su yid ni longs spyod byed pa por rab tu 'gyur te lus dang ngag dang dbang pos yul rnams byed par gyur pas so //
translated: Here, in the state of killing, the mind becomes the enjoyer of emanations of samsara, because the body, speech, and sense organs act as objects.

original: longs spyod rdzogs la zhes par mi lam gyi gnas skabs su ma mthong ba'i yul bems po ma yin pa rnams la sems par 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis zhes pa yul gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs la zhes par mi lam gyi gnas skabs su ma mthong ba'i yul bems po ma yin pa rnams la sems par 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis zhes pa yul gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: In the state of the path, the mind becomes the enjoyer of the enjoyment body, because it is not an inanimate object that is not seen.

original: chos kyi sku la zhes pa shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su gnyid du 'gyur te yid ni dbang po med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la zhes pa shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su gnyid du 'gyur te yid ni dbang po med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In the state of deep sleep, the mind becomes the enjoyer of the dharmakāya, because the mind becomes without sense organs.

original: dag pa la ni zhes pa bzhi ba'i gnas skabs su bde bar rab tu 'gyur te 'dir ni nyin mo'i dus sam mtshan mo'i dus su ste dus ni dus tshod do //
analyzed: dag pa la ni zhes pa bzhi ba'i gnas skabs su bde bar rab tu 'gyur te 'dir ni nyin mo'i dus sam mtshan mo'i dus su ste dus ni dus tshod do //
translated: In the state of the fourth, the mind becomes the enjoyer of bliss, because here, in the daytime or nighttime, the time is the occasion.

original: de'i dus su 'khrig pa byas pa ni thig le grol ba gsum gyi mthar lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig gi dus gcig na bde ba chen por rab tu 'gyur ro zhes pa kun rdzob kyi de nyid gang yin pa de'i phyir de ni nyin mtshan dus su
analyzed: de'i dus su 'khrig pa byas pa ni thig le grol ba gsum gyi mthar lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig gi dus gcig na bde ba chen por rab tu 'gyur ro zhes pa kun rdzob kyi de nyid gang yin pa de'i phyir de ni nyin mtshan dus su
translated: At that time, the performance of sexual union is the moment of the innate, at the end of the three releases of bindu, when it becomes the great bliss.

original: rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: That is the reality of the relative. Therefore, that should be cultivated by the yogi/nī day and night.

original: 'gyur med don du'o zhes pa mi 'pho pa'i skad cig gi don du ste 'chad par 'gyur pa'i yan lag drug gis so zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur med don du'o zhes pa mi 'pho pa'i skad cig gi don du ste 'chad par 'gyur pa'i yan lag drug gis so zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: For the sake of the unchanging, for the sake of the moment of non-emission, by means of the six branches that will be explained.

original: de ltar sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'gags na sgrib pa med pa'i chos su 'gyur te skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'o zhes pa rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'gags na sgrib pa med pa'i chos su 'gyur te skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'o zhes pa rigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, when the phenomenon with obscuration ceases, the phenomenon without obscuration occurs, free from arising and destruction.

original: da ni g-yon brkyang gi stabs la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe 'khor ba pa rnams kyi g-yon gyi rtsa la srog rab tu rgyu bar gyur pa de'i tshe g-yas la skum par 'gyur te srog
analyzed: da ni g-yon brkyang gi stabs la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe 'khor ba pa rnams kyi g-yon gyi rtsa la srog rab tu rgyu bar gyur pa de'i tshe g-yas la skum par 'gyur te srog
translated: Now, the purities of the postures of left-extended and so forth are stated: left, etc. Here, when the life-force of transmigrators flows in the left channel, at that time it is contracted in the right.

original: kyang sngags kyi lha'o //
analyzed: kyang sngags kyi lha'o //
translated: The mantra deity is also the life-force.🔽Therefore, when the life-force flows in the left due to the left extended and the right contracted, then that is the left-extended posture.

original: des na g-yon brkyang ba dang g-yas bskum pas g-yon la srog rab tu rgyu ba gang yin pa der 'gyur te de bzhin du sngags kyi lha'i g-yas bskum pa gang yin bde ni g-yon brkyang gi stabs su brjod @62a * //
analyzed: des na g-yon brkyang ba dang g-yas bskum pas g-yon la srog rab tu rgyu ba gang yin pa der 'gyur te de bzhin du sngags kyi lha'i g-yas bskum pa gang yin bde ni g-yon brkyang gi stabs su brjod @62a * //
translated: Similarly, when the right is contracted for the mantra deity, that is said to be the right-extended posture.

original: do ; / mnyam pa'i stabs dang gzhan pa g-yas brkyang gi stabs ni grangs bzhin du ste me'i rgyu ba las zhes pa cig car rtsa gnyis la dbu mar rgyu bas mnyam pa'i stabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: do ; / mnyam pa'i stabs dang gzhan pa g-yas brkyang gi stabs ni grangs bzhin du ste me'i rgyu ba las zhes pa cig car rtsa gnyis la dbu mar rgyu bas mnyam pa'i stabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The equal posture and the other right-extended posture are respectively due to the movement of fire, i.e., simultaneously flowing in both channels in the central channel, there is the equal posture.

original: nyi ma'i rgyu ba las zhes pa g-yas la rgyu ba dang g-yon bskum pa las g-yas brkyang gi stabs su 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: nyi ma'i rgyu ba las zhes pa g-yas la rgyu ba dang g-yon bskum pa las g-yas brkyang gi stabs su 'gyur ro ;
translated: From the movement of the sun means that from the movement in the right nostril and the contraction in the left, the right leg is extended.

original: / de bzhin dus ga'i stabs dang zlum po dang rol ba'i stabs dang padma'i 'dug stangs dang rdo rje'i 'dug stangs gang yin pa de rnams rim pa bzhin du g-yon gyi rtsa'am g-yas kyi rtsal nam mkha' sogs la zhes pa ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la srog rab
analyzed: / de bzhin dus ga'i stabs dang zlum po dang rol ba'i stabs dang padma'i 'dug stangs dang rdo rje'i 'dug stangs gang yin pa de rnams rim pa bzhin du g-yon gyi rtsa'am g-yas kyi rtsal nam mkha' sogs la zhes pa ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la srog rab
translated: Similarly, the gait of Aries, the round gait, the gait of play, the lotus posture, and the vajra posture are, respectively, the movement of the life force in the left or right nāḍī, in space, and so on.

original: tu rgyu ba ni sa ga'i stabs dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la rab tu rgyu ba ni zlum po'i stabs dang me'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu rgyu ba ni rol pa'i stabs dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu rgyu ba ni padma'i 'dug stangs dang sa'i dkyil 'khor
analyzed: tu rgyu ba ni sa ga'i stabs dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la rab tu rgyu ba ni zlum po'i stabs dang me'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu rgyu ba ni rol pa'i stabs dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu rgyu ba ni padma'i 'dug stangs dang sa'i dkyil 'khor
translated: The movement in the maṇḍala of space is the gait of Aries. The movement in the maṇḍala of air is the round gait. The movement in the maṇḍala of fire is the gait of play. The movement in the maṇḍala of water is the lotus posture.

original: la rab tu rgyu ba ni rdo rje'i 'dug stangs te /
analyzed: la rab tu rgyu ba ni rdo rje'i 'dug stangs te /
translated: The movement in the maṇḍala of earth is the vajra posture.

original: de ltar mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa dag la srog rlung rab tu rgyu ba gang yin pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa dag la srog rlung rab tu rgyu ba gang yin pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Thus, the five types are the movement of the life-force wind in the equal and unequal [channels] in that way.

original: rnam par dag pa des lha rnams kyi stabs dang 'dug stangs rnam par dag par 'gyur te g-yo ba med pa las so zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa des lha rnams kyi stabs dang 'dug stangs rnam par dag par 'gyur te g-yo ba med pa las so zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: By that purification, the gait and posture of the gods are purified, because they are free of movement.

original: de bzhin du skyes pa'i ngag rdzogs pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes pa'i ngag rdzogs pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the speech of the male is complete.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las srog dang lha skyed pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las srog dang lha skyed pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the great summary of the chapter on the life-force and the creation of the deity from the Stainless Light, the commentary on the Kālacakra Tantra, the king of tantras, which is an engagement with the root tantra in twelve thousand parts.

original: // / bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang //
analyzed: // / bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang //
translated: The one who holds the half-moon of the sixteen moments,

original: 'pho med bde la rab btud nas //
analyzed: 'pho med bde la rab btud nas //
translated: having bowed to unchanging bliss,

original: gang de'i thabs ni yang dag pa //
analyzed: gang de'i thabs ni yang dag pa //
translated: the method of that

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor rab brjod bya //
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor rab brjod bya //
translated: will be fully explained as the yoga of the vital drops.

original: gtum mo zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gtum mo zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: As it is said, “caṇḍālī” and so on.

original: 'dir skyed pa'i rim pa thams cad la sku rdzogs pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog go //
analyzed: 'dir skyed pa'i rim pa thams cad la sku rdzogs pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog go //
translated: Here, the completion of the body is the sovereign of the mandala in all the stages of creation.

original: gsung rdzogs pa ni las rgyal mchog ste las kyi dbang po bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung rdzogs pa ni las rgyal mchog ste las kyi dbang po bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The completion of speech is the sovereign of action, because the faculty of action is engaged in activity.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rdzogs pa ni thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rdzogs pa ni thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The completion of the drop of the spirit of enlightenment is the yoga of the drop.

original: khu ba 'pho ba las bde ba la dmigs pa ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor te de yang mi rnams kyi lo bcu drug gi mtshams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu ba 'pho ba las bde ba la dmigs pa ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor te de yang mi rnams kyi lo bcu drug gi mtshams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The observation of bliss from the emission of semen is the subtle yoga, and that occurs at the age of sixteen for human beings.

original: des na deng nye bar longs spyod pa'i slad du bag ma lan pa dang lag pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dang slob ma @62b la slob dpon gyis shes rab ma gtod par byed do //
analyzed: des na deng nye bar longs spyod pa'i slad du bag ma lan pa dang lag pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dang slob ma @62b la slob dpon gyis shes rab ma gtod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, in order to enjoy that now, the master bestows the wisdom woman on the disciple, with the rites of the bride and groom, holding hands, and so on.

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams la las kyi phyag rgya des bde ba de sgrub par byed par gsungs so //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams la las kyi phyag rgya des bde ba de sgrub par byed par gsungs so //

original: 'bring po rnams la ye shes kyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: 'bring po rnams la ye shes kyi phyag rgyas so //

original: mchog gi rnal 'byor pa rnams la phyag rgya chen mos so //
analyzed: mchog gi rnal 'byor pa rnams la phyag rgya chen mos so //

translated: That is also explained to be prāṇāyāma.

original: khams gsum po ni ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: khams gsum po ni ma lus pa'i //
translated: The life-force is the cessation of the three realms.

original: srid pa gsum ni yongs shes pa //
analyzed: srid pa gsum ni yongs shes pa //
translated: The three existences are totally understood.

original: @63a * // srog 'gag pa ni yungs kar te //
analyzed: @63a * // srog 'gag pa ni yungs kar te //
translated: The life-force is the cessation of the mustard-seed.

original: de yang rgyu bcas rgyu med du'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyu bcas rgyu med du'o //
translated: That is also with and without a cause.

original: so sor sdud pa phyag rgya che //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa phyag rgya che //
translated: The great seal is the withdrawal of the mind.

original: nam mkha' stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the empty sky.

original: sna de yi ni phyogs su yang //
analyzed: sna de yi ni phyogs su yang //
translated: In the direction of that nose,

original: gang zhig kho nar yid bkod pa //
analyzed: gang zhig kho nar yid bkod pa //
translated: the mind is placed right there.

original: mtshan ma'i mthar ni re kh'a gang //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i mthar ni re kh'a gang //
translated: The line at the end of the sign

original: de la sna tshogs rgyu mi rgyu //
analyzed: de la sna tshogs rgyu mi rgyu //
translated: is the various causes and noncauses.

original: ma lus bsgom par byed la //
analyzed: ma lus bsgom par byed la //
translated: One should meditate on all of them.

original: rnal 'byor bsam gtan sogs de yang //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsam gtan sogs de yang //
translated: That yoga is concentration, and so on.

original: zhes pa rtsa ba'i rgyud las nges pa ste mdor bsdus nas gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa rtsa ba'i rgyud las nges pa ste mdor bsdus nas gsungs so //
translated: This is the definitive summary taught in the Root Tantra.

original: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood by following the Root Tantra. This is the definitive meaning of the Bhagavat Manjusri.

original: gtum mo lte ba'i 'khor lo dgu yis bsnun pa'i lag 'gro zhes pa ni 'dir lte ba la rtsa'i 'khor lo dgu yis bsnun pa'i lag 'gro ste rtsa bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni khyim bcu gnyis kyi rtsa'i bdag nyid dang dkyil 'khor drug cu'i rtsa'i🔽bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gtum mo lte ba'i 'khor lo dgu yis bsnun pa'i lag 'gro zhes pa ni 'dir lte ba la rtsa'i 'khor lo dgu yis bsnun pa'i lag 'gro ste rtsa bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni khyim bcu gnyis kyi rtsa'i bdag nyid dang dkyil 'khor drug cu'i rtsa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The “demon struck by the nine navel cakras” is here the demon struck by the nine channel cakras at the navel, which is the nature of the seventy-two channels, the nature of the channels of the twelve houses, and the nature of the channels of the sixty maṇḍalas.

original: dgu yis bsnun pa'i lag 'gro tsartsi k'a sogs lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa ho yig ye shes snying po ste ye shes rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa de la dri med glog dang mtshungs pa gtum mo'i ye shes me ni rab rgyas pa zhes pa kun rdzob
analyzed: dgu yis bsnun pa'i lag 'gro tsartsi k'a sogs lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa ho yig ye shes snying po ste ye shes rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa de la dri med glog dang mtshungs pa gtum mo'i ye shes me ni rab rgyas pa zhes pa kun rdzob
translated: The “demon struck by the nine” is Carcika and so forth, the special deities, the syllable ho, the essence of wisdom, blessed by the vajra of wisdom. The “flaming wisdom fire, like a stainless lightning bolt, fully expanded” is the conventional

original: kyi ye shes 'dod pa ste de'i me ni 'dod pa'i me'o //
analyzed: kyi ye shes 'dod pa ste de'i me ni 'dod pa'i me'o //
translated: The fire of passion is the fire of passion.

original: 'dod pa'i me des rab tu rgyas bar gyur pa na lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa g-yon la dkyil 'khor lngar gyur pa dang g-yas la spyan ma la sogs pa rnams sreg cing mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang gzugs
analyzed: 'dod pa'i me des rab tu rgyas bar gyur pa na lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa g-yon la dkyil 'khor lngar gyur pa dang g-yas la spyan ma la sogs pa rnams sreg cing mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang gzugs
translated: When that fire of passion is fully developed, it burns the five mandalas in the navel emanation wheel, Vairochana and so forth on the left, and Lochana and so forth on the right, and it burns the sense organs such as the eyes and the objects such as form.

original: la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang sreg ste yid ni chos kyi dbyings 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang sreg ste yid ni chos kyi dbyings 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is burned because it apprehends the dharmadhatu.

original: thams cad mi 'jug pa'i phyir bsregs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi 'jug pa'i phyir bsregs pa'o //
translated: Since all are burned, they do not function.

original: de ltar thams cad bsregs nas mgo bor zla ba bzang las zhes pa skye ba dang / byang chub kyis bon ham yig las thig le'i gzugs khu ba glo bur ba 'dzag pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje can te byang chub kyi sems so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad bsregs nas mgo bor zla ba bzang las zhes pa skye ba dang / byang chub kyis bon ham yig las thig le'i gzugs khu ba glo bur ba 'dzag pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje can te byang chub kyi sems so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, when all are burned, the moon in the head melts, and the bodhichitta element that is the essence of the bodhichitta bindu, which is the seed of enlightenment, drips suddenly. That is the vajra holder, which is the bodhichitta.

original: mgo bo nas mgrin pa dang mgrin pa nas snying ga dang / snying ga nas lte ba dang lte ba nas gsang ba'i padmar ro //
analyzed: mgo bo nas mgrin pa dang mgrin pa nas snying ga dang / snying ga nas lte ba dang lte ba nas gsang ba'i padmar ro //
translated: From the head to the throat, from the throat to the heart, from the heart to the navel, and from the navel to the secret lotus.

original: padma de nyid ni shes rab kyi chos 'byung du gsungs shing de bzhin du lte ba dang snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang @63b dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi padma rnams shes rab kyi chos 'byung du gsungs so //
analyzed: padma de nyid ni shes rab kyi chos 'byung du gsungs shing de bzhin du lte ba dang snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang @63b dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi padma rnams shes rab kyi chos 'byung du gsungs so //
translated: That lotus is said to be the source of wisdom, and likewise the navel, heart, throat, forehead, and crown lotuses are said to be the source of wisdom.

original: de ltar zhu bar gyur pa na gsang bar sku'i thig le dang lte bar gsung gi thig le dang snying gar thugs kyi thig le dang mgrin par ye shes kyi thig le'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhu bar gyur pa na gsang bar sku'i thig le dang lte bar gsung gi thig le dang snying gar thugs kyi thig le dang mgrin par ye shes kyi thig le'o //
translated: When it has melted in that way, the body drop in the secret place, the speech drop in the navel, the mind drop in the heart, and the gnosis drop in the throat.

original: de ltar shes rab chos 'byung dag la gnas pa byang chub kyi sems ni slar yang zhes pa ji ltar byon pa de bzhin gshegs pa ste spro ba byas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab chos 'byung dag la gnas pa byang chub kyi sems ni slar yang zhes pa ji ltar byon pa de bzhin gshegs pa ste spro ba byas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the bodhicitta that abides in the sources of wisdom is again, as it came, the transcendent state, which is said to be the emanation.

original: ji ltar dpral ba nas dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'am rnam pa sna tshogs la sogs pa'i dbye bas byon pa dang zla ba'i cha bco lnga yongs su gang ba de bzhin du rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas steng du dpral bar gshegs te dri
analyzed: ji ltar dpral ba nas dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'am rnam pa sna tshogs la sogs pa'i dbye bas byon pa dang zla ba'i cha bco lnga yongs su gang ba de bzhin du rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas steng du dpral bar gshegs te dri
translated: Just as the moon moves to the forehead from the brow and fills the fifteen parts of the moon, in the same way, it moves to the forehead above through the aspect of the cause, and so on.🔽

original: ma med pa spro ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma med pa spro ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the moon, having arisen from the forehead with the divisions of joy and so on, or the divisions of the various aspects, fills the fifteen parts of the moon, in the same way, through the divisions of natural outflow and so on, it goes above to the forehead, and the stainless bindu is generated.

original: des na dri ma med pa'i thig le sna tshogs rgyan dang ldan zhing me long dag la gnas pa lta bu zhes pa pra phab pa dang mtshungs pa dus gsum du gnas pa'i ye shes 'khor lo rang byung ba zhes pa ni thig le'i rnal 'byor las phra
analyzed: des na dri ma med pa'i thig le sna tshogs rgyan dang ldan zhing me long dag la gnas pa lta bu zhes pa pra phab pa dang mtshungs pa dus gsum du gnas pa'i ye shes 'khor lo rang byung ba zhes pa ni thig le'i rnal 'byor las phra
translated: Therefore, the stainless bindu, endowed with various ornaments, like a reflection in a clear mirror, similar to a mirror divination, is the self-originated wheel of pristine consciousness abiding in the three times.

original: mo'i rnal 'byor du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mo'i rnal 'byor du gyur pa'o //
translated: The subtle yoga becomes the yoga of the bindu.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa dang ni gzugs dang gzugs med srid pa rnam pa gsum po rnams kyang rim pas zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi thig le skyed pa'i rim pas sbyangs byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa dang ni gzugs dang gzugs med srid pa rnam pa gsum po rnams kyang rim pas zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi thig le skyed pa'i rim pas sbyangs byas te /
translated: In the same way, the three types of existence—desire, form, and formless—are purified through the stages of the generation stage of the bindu of body, speech, and mind.

original: phyi nas ye shes me lce dag gis zhes pa mi 'pho ba'i bde ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag ste khams gsum po dus gcig tu ni dgug par bya zhes pa cig car dus gsum shes pa ste lha'i rnal 'byor dkyil 'khor gyi
analyzed: phyi nas ye shes me lce dag gis zhes pa mi 'pho ba'i bde ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag ste khams gsum po dus gcig tu ni dgug par bya zhes pa cig car dus gsum shes pa ste lha'i rnal 'byor dkyil 'khor gyi
translated: Then, by the flames of wisdom means that the light rays of unchanging bliss summon the entire triple world, the three realms, at once, meaning simultaneously, knowing the three times, the deity yoga of the mandala circle.

original: 'khor lo'i rnam pa spro ba dang 'khor ba pa rnams kyi bu dang bu mo spro ba ni byang chub kyi sems las so //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rnam pa spro ba dang 'khor ba pa rnams kyi bu dang bu mo spro ba ni byang chub kyi sems las so //
translated: The emanation of sons and daughters of the worldly beings is from the bodhicitta.

original: de ltar lo bcu drug gi mtshams su mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes rdzogs pa ste lha rnams kyi ni sgom pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar lo bcu drug gi mtshams su mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes rdzogs pa ste lha rnams kyi ni sgom pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: Thus, up to the age of sixteen, the body, speech, mind, and wisdom of those born from a womb are complete, and for the deities, it is by the power of meditation.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rnam par thar pa bzhi'i stobs kyis so zhes pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rnam par thar pa bzhi'i stobs kyis so zhes pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pas so //
translated: For the buddhas, it is by the power of the four types of liberation, that is, by the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: da ni zla ba zhes pa la sogs pas nang du sngags kyi bzlas pa la sogs pa gsungs te 'dir lus la zla ba zhes pa ni g-yon gyi rtsa dang nyi ma zhes pa ni g-yas kyi rtsa'o //🔽aa sogs @64a * //🔽zhes pa ni aa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi tshogs te g-yon du srog yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: da ni zla ba zhes pa la sogs pas nang du sngags kyi bzlas pa la sogs pa gsungs te 'dir lus la zla ba zhes pa ni g-yon gyi rtsa dang nyi ma zhes pa ni g-yas kyi rtsa'o // aa sogs @64a * // zhes pa ni aa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi tshogs te g-yon du srog yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
translated: Now, the inner mantra recitation and so forth are taught by “moon” and so forth. Here, “moon” is the left channel and “sun” is the right channel.🔽“A and so forth” is the collection of vowels, which is the life-force moving to the left.

original: ka sogs zhes pa ni gsal byed kyi tshogs te g-yas su srog yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: ka sogs zhes pa ni gsal byed kyi tshogs te g-yas su srog yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
translated: “Ka and so forth” is the collection of consonants, which is the life-force moving to the right.

original: rnam gsum bgrod gnas zhes pa g-yon gyi bgrod pa la gnas pa'i srog ni sku rdo rje'i bzlas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam gsum bgrod gnas zhes pa g-yon gyi bgrod pa la gnas pa'i srog ni sku rdo rje'i bzlas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: “The three paths and the abiding” is the life-force abiding in the left path, which is called the “vajra body recitation.”

original: g-yas kyi bgrod pa la gnas pa'i srog ni gsung gi bzlas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: g-yas kyi bgrod pa la gnas pa'i srog ni gsung gi bzlas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The life-force abiding in the right path is called the “vajra speech recitation.”🔽The life-force abiding in the central path is called the “vajra mind recitation.”

original: dbu ma'i bgrod pa la gnas pa'i srog ni thugs kyi bzlas pa zhes brjod de 'di rnams 'gags pa las gzhom du med pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbu ma'i bgrod pa la gnas pa'i srog ni thugs kyi bzlas pa zhes brjod de 'di rnams 'gags pa las gzhom du med pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung du 'gyur ro //
translated: From stopping these, the indestructible omniscient speech arises.

original: des na so sor sdud pa la sogs pa drug gis sbyor ba yan lag drug po 'di bsgom par bya ste so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // de bzhin srog rtsol 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: des na so sor sdud pa la sogs pa drug gis sbyor ba yan lag drug po 'di bsgom par bya ste so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // de bzhin srog rtsol 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting nge 'dzin //
translated: Likewise, vitality control, retention,🔽Recollection, and meditative concentration.🔽These six branches of yoga are asserted.

original: sbyor ba yan lag drug tu 'dod ces pa ste 'chad par 'gyur pa 'di rnams goms pas gseng bzang padma la ni zhes pa lte ba'i padma la sku gsung thugs kyi rnal 'byor te zhes pa ni rnam gsum bgrod pa la gnas pa'i srog 'gog pa'o zhes pa'i
analyzed: sbyor ba yan lag drug tu 'dod ces pa ste 'chad par 'gyur pa 'di rnams goms pas gseng bzang padma la ni zhes pa lte ba'i padma la sku gsung thugs kyi rnal 'byor te zhes pa ni rnam gsum bgrod pa la gnas pa'i srog 'gog pa'o zhes pa'i
translated: By cultivating these, “in the good lotus” means in the navel lotus, “the yoga of body, speech, and mind,” which means the three yogas, “is the stopping of the life force abiding in the three movements.”🔽The meaning is that.

original: don to // 'gog pa de nas dga' ba la sogs rnams kyis zhes pa dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang khyad par dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rnams kyis rdo rje chu skyes dag la ro mnyam gyur pas mi 'pho ba nyid kyi phyir sgom pa 'di ni
analyzed: don to // 'gog pa de nas dga' ba la sogs rnams kyis zhes pa dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang khyad par dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rnams kyis rdo rje chu skyes dag la ro mnyam gyur pas mi 'pho ba nyid kyi phyir sgom pa 'di ni
translated: “After that stopping, by the ecstasies and so on,” means that by the ecstasies, supreme ecstasy, special ecstasy, and innate ecstasy, “the vajra and lotus become of equal taste,” and because of that, “this meditation is nonemission.”

original: rdo rje gsum ste khu ba dang bshang pa dang gci ba 'gog pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ste khu ba dang bshang pa dang gci ba 'gog pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The three vajras are semen, feces, and urine.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las //
translated: Similarly, the Root Tantra says:

original: dbu ma mchog gi dbugs dang ni //
analyzed: dbu ma mchog gi dbugs dang ni //
translated: With the supreme central channel

original: dri dang chu dang ldan pas kyang //
analyzed: dri dang chu dang ldan pas kyang //
translated: and with smell and water,

original: rtag tu rigs ldan ma mchod bya //
analyzed: rtag tu rigs ldan ma mchod bya //
translated: always worship the lady of the clan.

original: khyad par dus la po nya mo zhes so //
analyzed: khyad par dus la po nya mo zhes so //
translated: In particular, the time is the female fish.🔽Then, in the lotus of wisdom, in the secret lotus, the drop of mind becomes stable.

original: de nas shes rab padmar zhes pa gsang ba'i padmar sems kyi thig le gnas bar gyur pa dag la lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang gis zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i dbang gis bsgom pa ni gzhom du med par 'gyur te steng du khu ba'o //
analyzed: de nas shes rab padmar zhes pa gsang ba'i padmar sems kyi thig le gnas bar gyur pa dag la lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang gis zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i dbang gis bsgom pa ni gzhom du med par 'gyur te steng du khu ba'o //
translated: By the empowerment of the innate, by the empowerment of unchanging bliss, meditation becomes invincible, the semen above.🔽Now, the approximation and so forth are stated: nectar, etc.🔽Here, a beginner first performs the approximation of the collection of the means of achievement, the approximation with the five nectars, etc.

original: da ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa gsungs pa bdud rtsi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir las dang po pas dang por sgrub thabs kyi tshogs bsnyen pa bya ste bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas bsnyen pa zhes pa la phyi rol du bdud rtsi lnga ni bshad
analyzed: da ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa gsungs pa bdud rtsi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir las dang po pas dang por sgrub thabs kyi tshogs bsnyen pa bya ste bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas bsnyen pa zhes pa la phyi rol du bdud rtsi lnga ni bshad
translated: The five nectars are explained externally.

original: pa la sogs pa dang sogs pa'i sgras go ku la sogs pa ste lha mnyes pa'i don du de @64b rnams zos pas bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa dang sogs pa'i sgras go ku la sogs pa ste lha mnyes pa'i don du de @64b rnams zos pas bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The etc. refers to the cow, and so on, and the etc. refers to the bull, and so on.

original: nang du bdud rtsi lnga ni phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: nang du bdud rtsi lnga ni phung po lnga ste /
translated: The inner is the five nectars, which are the five aggregates.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dbang po lnga po sgron ma lnga'o //🔽de rnams la ltos pa med pa ni bsnyen pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dbang po lnga po sgron ma lnga'o // de rnams la ltos pa med pa ni bsnyen pa ste /
translated: The etc. refers to the five sense organs, which are the five lamps.

original: lus dang rdzas la sred pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang rdzas la sred pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: The non-reliance on those is the approach, which is the complete abandonment of craving for the body and wealth.

original: bsnyen pa des lha rnams mchog ster bar 'gyur gyi bshad pa la sogs pa zos pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen pa des lha rnams mchog ster bar 'gyur gyi bshad pa la sogs pa zos pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The deities will grant the supreme through that approach, but not through eating the explanations, and so on.🔽 The ocean, vajra, and so on, refers to non-reliance on the enjoyments of the body, non-reliance on the enjoyments of speech, non-reliance on the enjoyments of the mind, and non-reliance on the bliss of transference.

original: chu gter rdo rje rnams dang zhes pa ni lus kyi longs spyod la ltos pa med pa dang / ngag gi longs spyod la ltos ba med pa dang / sems kyi longs spyod la ltos pa med pa dang / 'pho ba'i bde ba la ltos pa med pa ni bsnyen pa ste lus dang /
analyzed: chu gter rdo rje rnams dang zhes pa ni lus kyi longs spyod la ltos pa med pa dang / ngag gi longs spyod la ltos ba med pa dang / sems kyi longs spyod la ltos pa med pa dang / 'pho ba'i bde ba la ltos pa med pa ni bsnyen pa ste lus dang /
translated: The etc. refers to non-reliance on the enjoyments of the eyes, and so on.

original: ngag dang / sems dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i sdom pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ngag dang / sems dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i sdom pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Speech, mind, and the vow of pure conduct.

original: 'dis lha rnams mchog ster bar 'gyur gyi srid pa'i longs spyod la zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis lha rnams mchog ster bar 'gyur gyi srid pa'i longs spyod la zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: By this, the gods will grant the supreme, not by attachment to the enjoyments of existence.

original: sngags kyi bzlas pa sogs kyis zhes pa la 'dir sngags kyi bzlas pa zhes pa ni srog sdom pa ste sogs pa'i sgras dbyung ba dang dga' ba dang bum pa can gyi sbyor ba ni rtag tu bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi bzlas pa sogs kyis zhes pa la 'dir sngags kyi bzlas pa zhes pa ni srog sdom pa ste sogs pa'i sgras dbyung ba dang dga' ba dang bum pa can gyi sbyor ba ni rtag tu bsnyen pa'o //
translated: By the recitation of mantra, etc. Here, the recitation of mantra is the control of the vital energy. The term etc. includes the practices of exhalation, inhalation, and the vase-shaped breath, which are always to be cultivated.

original: des lha rnams mchog ster bar 'gyur gyi srog ma bsdams par ngag tu brjod pas ni ma yin no zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: des lha rnams mchog ster bar 'gyur gyi srog ma bsdams par ngag tu brjod pas ni ma yin no zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
translated: By this, the gods will grant the supreme, not by verbal recitation without controlling the vital energy. This is the definitive meaning.

original: drang ba'i don gyis ni thun mong gi dngos grub kyi don du bgrang phreng ba la sogs pas bzlas pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyis ni thun mong gi dngos grub kyi don du bgrang phreng ba la sogs pas bzlas pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: According to the provisional meaning, for the sake of the common accomplishments, one should perform the recitations using a rosary, and so on.

original: da ni nye ba'i sgrub pa gsungs pa so sor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir so sor sdud pa zhes pa la 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sdud pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: da ni nye ba'i sgrub pa gsungs pa so sor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir so sor sdud pa zhes pa la 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sdud pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Now, the proximate means of achievement is stated beginning with “individually,” and so on. Here, “individually withdrawing” means that the withdrawal of transmigrators is the apprehension of objects such as form by the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: de yongs su spong ba ni so sor sdud pa zhes brjod de stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la gzhan sha la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams kyis gzhan gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa ni nye ba'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su spong ba ni so sor sdud pa zhes brjod de stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la gzhan sha la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams kyis gzhan gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa ni nye ba'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The complete abandonment of that is called “individually withdrawing,” and the apprehension of other objects such as form by other eyes such as fleshly eyes and so on with respect to the form of emptiness is the proximate means of achievement.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang srog rtsol dang 'dzin pa ste rdo rje padma las skyes bdud rtsi 'pho ba med pa yis ni nye ba'i sgrub pa ste nges pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang srog rtsol dang 'dzin pa ste rdo rje padma las skyes bdud rtsi 'pho ba med pa yis ni nye ba'i sgrub pa ste nges pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Similarly, the proximate means of achievement is by means of the meditative stabilization, the life-force, and retention, the nectar born from the vajra and lotus, which is not transferred, in terms of the definitive meaning.

original: drang ba'i don gyis ni phyi rol du lha spros pas so zhes pa nye ba'i sgrub pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyis ni phyi rol du lha spros pas so zhes pa nye ba'i sgrub pa grub pa'o //
translated: In terms of the interpretable meaning, it is by means of the external emanation of deities, and so on. This is the proximate means of achievement.

original: da ni sgrub pa gsungs pa dga' ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa gsungs pa dga' ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the means of achievement is stated beginning with “joy,” and so on.

original: 'dir dga' ba la sogs rnams kyis rdo rje gsum zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi thig @65a * //
analyzed: 'dir dga' ba la sogs rnams kyis rdo rje gsum zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi thig @65a * //
translated: Here, the “three vajras” are the bindu of body, speech, and mind.

original: le rnams dang chu skyes ro mnyam gyur pa sgom pa sgrub par 'gyur te snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang bar thig le rnams gnas pa'o zhes pa'i don te de ltar na sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: le rnams dang chu skyes ro mnyam gyur pa sgom pa sgrub par 'gyur te snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang bar thig le rnams gnas pa'o zhes pa'i don te de ltar na sgrub pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the equality of the taste of the lotus is the practice, which means that the bindus are located at the heart, navel, and secret place.🔽Then, the great practice is when the bindu is applied to the wisdom [consort], and when there is the bliss of the non-emission of the bindu, then it is definitely the great practice.

original: de nas sgrub pa chen po ni shes rab sbyar la gang gi tshe 'pho ba med pa'i bde bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe nges par sgrub pa chen po ste phra mo'i rnal 'byor dag las zhes pa nges pa'i don gyis shin tu yid bzang ma'i rtsa'i steng du
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa chen po ni shes rab sbyar la gang gi tshe 'pho ba med pa'i bde bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe nges par sgrub pa chen po ste phra mo'i rnal 'byor dag las zhes pa nges pa'i don gyis shin tu yid bzang ma'i rtsa'i steng du
translated: From among the subtle yogas, the great practice is said to be from the union of the bindu above the excellent mind channel.

original: khu ba yang dag par sbyor ba las sgrub pa chen por gsungs te /
analyzed: khu ba yang dag par sbyor ba las sgrub pa chen por gsungs te /
translated: In the definitive meaning, it is from the union of the bindu above the excellent mind channel.

original: drang pa'i don du ni shes rab kyi chos 'byung gi sna'i rtse mor yungs kar la sogs pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: drang pa'i don du ni shes rab kyi chos 'byung gi sna'i rtse mor yungs kar la sogs pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: In the provisional meaning, it is from the union of the bindu at the tip of the nose of the dharma chakra of the wisdom [consort], such as mustard seeds, and so on.

original: de tar sgrub pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tar sgrub pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: That is the great accomplishment.

original: da ni dman pa dang mchog gi dbye bas bsnyen pa la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dman pa dang mchog gi dbye bas bsnyen pa la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, having explained the four branches of familiarization, he explains the familiarization, etc. in terms of the division into inferior and excellent.

original: dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir skyed pa'i rim pa la dang por stong nyid byang chub ces pa ni srog chags rnams shi ba'i mthar phung po yongs su dor nas skye ba'i cha shas can gyi phung po 'dzin pa las bar gang yin pa stong
analyzed: dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir skyed pa'i rim pa la dang por stong nyid byang chub ces pa ni srog chags rnams shi ba'i mthar phung po yongs su dor nas skye ba'i cha shas can gyi phung po 'dzin pa las bar gang yin pa stong
translated: First, emptiness, enlightenment, is the moment of the extinction of the life of a living being, at the end of which the aggregates are completely abandoned. The moment of emptiness, which is the interval between the abandonment of the aggregates of the previous life and the taking up of the aggregates that are the part of the birth, is the moment of emptiness.

original: pa nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig po srid pa gsum mthong ba ni stong pa zhes gsungs te nges par ni gdon mi za bar ro //
analyzed: pa nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig po srid pa gsum mthong ba ni stong pa zhes gsungs te nges par ni gdon mi za bar ro //
translated: The seeing of the three existences is said to be emptiness.

original: skad cig de'i phyi nas zla ba thig le dag ni yang dag 'dzin zhes pa 'dir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas ma'i mngal du khu ba'i thig le rnams 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig de'i phyi nas zla ba thig le dag ni yang dag 'dzin zhes pa 'dir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas ma'i mngal du khu ba'i thig le rnams 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag 'dzin pa'o //
translated: After that moment, the moon and the drop are perfectly taken up. Here, the consciousness of the ground of all takes up the drops of semen in the mother's womb. That is the perfect taking up.

original: de'i 'og tu khu ba la sogs pa bzung ba de nas gzugs ni bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba bdun gyis mngal rdzogs pa ste lus rdzogs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khu ba la sogs pa bzung ba de nas gzugs ni bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba bdun gyis mngal rdzogs pa ste lus rdzogs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, after the retention of semen and so on, “form is generated” means that the womb is completed in seven months, which is to say, the body is completed.

original: de nas rab mchog ro yi rigs rnams dag gis zhes pa phung po drug po rnams kyis mig la sogs pa rnams kyi yi ge dgod pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rab mchog ro yi rigs rnams dag gis zhes pa phung po drug po rnams kyis mig la sogs pa rnams kyi yi ge dgod pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Then, “with the supreme tastes,” the six aggregates, the letters of the eyes and so on, are placed, which is to say, one engages the objects of form and so on.

original: de bzhin du lha'i sgrub thabs la yang las dang po pas brtags pa'i bdag nyid bsgom bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i sgrub thabs la yang las dang po pas brtags pa'i bdag nyid bsgom bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the sādhana of the deity, the beginner should meditate on the imagined nature.

original: chu yi gter gyi rdo rje 'di ni spyi yi bsnyen par 'gyur te zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rdo rje rdzogs pa rnams kyis sgrub pa dag ni dbu ma yang ste srog rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu yi gter gyi rdo rje 'di ni spyi yi bsnyen par 'gyur te zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rdo rje rdzogs pa rnams kyis sgrub pa dag ni dbu ma yang ste srog rdzogs pa'o //
translated: This vajra of the ocean is the general approach, which is to say, the completion of the vajra of body, speech, mind, and gnosis, the accomplishment of the central channel, the completion of the life [energy].

original: 'di la thabs ni rnam bzhir 'gyur te zhes pa ni bsnyen pa'i yan lag dang nye bar sgrub @65b pa'i yan lag la dman pa dang brtan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la thabs ni rnam bzhir 'gyur te zhes pa ni bsnyen pa'i yan lag dang nye bar sgrub @65b pa'i yan lag la dman pa dang brtan pa'o //
translated: Here, the means are fourfold. The limbs of approach and the limbs of near-accomplishment are inferior and stable.

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag dag la de bzhin nyid de lo bcu drug gi mtshams su zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag dag la de bzhin nyid de lo bcu drug gi mtshams su zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The limbs of accomplishment are just so, at the juncture of sixteen years. This is the determination.

original: 'dir dman pa ni skyes pa'i byis ba dang so skyes nas 'bring po'i byis ba dang so lhung nas gzhon nu'o //
analyzed: 'dir dman pa ni skyes pa'i byis ba dang so skyes nas 'bring po'i byis ba dang so lhung nas gzhon nu'o //
translated: Here, the inferior is the child of a man, the child of a woman, and the youth whose teeth have fallen out.

original: slar so skyes shing lo bcu drug gi rjes la dar ma ste bu dang bu mo skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: slar so skyes shing lo bcu drug gi rjes la dar ma ste bu dang bu mo skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Again, the child of a woman, after sixteen years, is the adult, because of the very production of sons and daughters.

original: de bzhin du lha thams cad yan lag rnam pa bzhir rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bden pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha thams cad yan lag rnam pa bzhir rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bden pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the yogī should meditate on all the gods with four limbs. This is the determination of worldly truth.

original: da ni don dam pa'i bden pas sangs rgyas kyi sku rdzogs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni don dam pa'i bden pas sangs rgyas kyi sku rdzogs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the perfect buddha body by means of ultimate truth should be stated.

original: 'dir dang por stong nyid byang chub ces pa ni mun pa la cung zad kyang bsam bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang por stong nyid byang chub ces pa ni mun pa la cung zad kyang bsam bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: Here, first, “emptiness enlightenment” means not thinking about darkness at all.

original: de nas zla ba'i thig le dag ni yang dag 'dzin zhes pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thig le'i mthar thug pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i thig le dag ni yang dag 'dzin zhes pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thig le'i mthar thug pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Then, “the pure lunar drop is fully grasped” means grasping the sign of smoke, etc., up to the final drop.

original: de nas gzugs dag bskyed cing zhes pa ni thig le de nas sna tshogs mthong ba ni gzugs bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gzugs dag bskyed cing zhes pa ni thig le de nas sna tshogs mthong ba ni gzugs bskyed pa'o //
translated: Then, “forms are generated” means that after that drop, seeing the variety is the generation of forms.

original: rab mchog ro yi rigs rnams dag gis zhes pa sgrib pa med pa'i phung po drug rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rab mchog ro yi rigs rnams dag gis zhes pa sgrib pa med pa'i phung po drug rnams kyis so //
translated: “By the supreme tastes and families” means by the six unobstructed aggregates.

original: yi ge dgod pa zhes pa ni nyi tshe ba'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams 'gog pa'o ;
analyzed: yi ge dgod pa zhes pa ni nyi tshe ba'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams 'gog pa'o ;
translated: “The syllables are placed” means the cessation of the limited aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on.

original: / de'i phyir sa thob pas dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye bar 'gyur te ji srid pa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug tu ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: / de'i phyir sa thob pas dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye bar 'gyur te ji srid pa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug tu ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: Therefore, the classification of the inferior and so on is due to attaining the stage, and so on, up to becoming the lord of the twelve stages.🔽Therefore:

original: de'i phyir / bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
translated: The meaning of truth has twelve aspects.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa //
translated: He is aware of the sixteen aspects, and enlightened by the twenty aspects.

original: rnam par sangs rgyas kun rig mchog / ces pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par sangs rgyas kun rig mchog / ces pa nges pa'o //
translated: He is the supreme knower of all the aspects of perfect buddhahood.

original: da ni sbyor ba yan lag drug gsungs pa so sor sdud pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni sbyor ba yan lag drug gsungs pa so sor sdud pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the six-branched yoga is taught, beginning with “withdrawal,” and so on.

original: 'dir dang po'i las la so sor sdud pa ni rgyal ba'i dbang po zhes pa ye shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i las la so sor sdud pa ni rgyal ba'i dbang po zhes pa ye shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: Here, for a beginner, withdrawal is the aggregate of gnosis, called “the lord of victors.”

original: de yang mtshan ma'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu ste du ba dang smig rgyu dang me khyer dang mar me dang 'bar ba dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan dang cha shas dang thig le mthong ba'i dbye bas ma brtags pa ye shes kyi phung po'o
analyzed: de yang mtshan ma'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu ste du ba dang smig rgyu dang me khyer dang mar me dang 'bar ba dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan dang cha shas dang thig le mthong ba'i dbye bas ma brtags pa ye shes kyi phung po'o
translated: That is divided into sixteen aspects: seeing smoke, a mirage, fireflies, a butter lamp, a flame, the moon, the sun, Rāhu, a part, and a drop.

original: // bsam gtan mi bskyod pa nyid do zhes pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste rnam pa bcu ni yul dang yul @66a * //
analyzed: // bsam gtan mi bskyod pa nyid do zhes pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste rnam pa bcu ni yul dang yul @66a * //
translated: The unanalyzed aggregate of gnosis is the aggregate of consciousness, called “meditative concentration.”

original: can bcu po rnams gcig nyid du sna tshogs gzugs la bsam gtan pa'o //
analyzed: can bcu po rnams gcig nyid du sna tshogs gzugs la bsam gtan pa'o //
translated: The ten aspects are the ten objects and subjects, which are meditated on as a single thing in various forms.

original: srog rtsol dag kyang ral gri can no zhes pa 'du byed kyi phung po ste rnam pa bcu ni g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor bcu po gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srog rtsol dag kyang ral gri can no zhes pa 'du byed kyi phung po ste rnam pa bcu ni g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor bcu po gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The ten aspects of the aggregate of formation are the ten mandalas of the left and right, which are mixed into one.🔽The ten aspects of the aggregate of sensation are the ten aspects of retention, which are the ten aspects of the retention of life, which moves through the lotuses of the navel, heart, throat, forehead, and crown, in terms of the distinctions of going and coming.🔽The ten aspects of the aggregate of consciousness are the ten aspects of recollection, which are on the central channel of the rasanā.

original: sngar yang rnam pa bcu ste 'dzin pa phyag na rin chen no zhes pa ni tshor ba'i phung po ste srog gi 'dzin pa lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi padma la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa🔽bcu'o // g-yung mo la ni rjes su dran pa padma 'dzin par 'gyur zhes pa 'du /🔽shes kyi phung po ste g-yung mo dbu ma'i rtsa la rjes su dran pa de yang rnam pa bcu ste 'dod pa'i gnas skabs bcu'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: sngar yang rnam pa bcu ste 'dzin pa phyag na rin chen no zhes pa ni tshor ba'i phung po ste srog gi 'dzin pa lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi padma la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa🔽bcu'o // g-yung mo la ni rjes su dran pa padma 'dzin par 'gyur zhes pa 'du /🔽shes kyi phung po ste g-yung mo dbu ma'i rtsa la rjes su dran pa de yang rnam pa bcu ste 'dod pa'i gnas skabs bcu'i dbye ba las so //
