original: dpal ldan 'dzin 'khor lo can zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad de ting 'dzin rnam pa bcu ni rlung bcu po rnams 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal ldan 'dzin 'khor lo can zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad de ting 'dzin rnam pa bcu ni rlung bcu po rnams 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The glorious Cakrin is Vairocana, and the ten kinds of samādhi are the ten winds.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ni rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste rlung rnams mi 'bab pa gang gi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ni rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste rlung rnams mi 'bab pa gang gi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus the Blessed One is in a nirvāṇa that is not a state of rest, because the winds do not flow.

original: re re dbye ba lnga rnams kyis te zhes pa ni 'dir sbyor ba re re ni dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: re re dbye ba lnga rnams kyis te zhes pa ni 'dir sbyor ba re re ni dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa'o //
translated: Each division is fivefold means that here each application is the flow of the five maṇḍalas.

original: aa sogs ka sogs rnams kyis zhes pa ni dbyangs dang gsal byed g-yon dang g-yas kyi srog yang dag par rgyu ba 'gog pas so //
analyzed: aa sogs ka sogs rnams kyis zhes pa ni dbyangs dang gsal byed g-yon dang g-yas kyi srog yang dag par rgyu ba 'gog pas so //
translated: By the vowels and consonants means by stopping the correct flow of the left and right life-force winds.

original: da ni so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa so sor zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa so sor zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now the characteristics of withdrawal, and so on, are stated:🔽Withdrawal is the stopping of the winds.

original: 'dir so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba ni lus la yul dang yul can bcu po rnams kyi 'brel pas rnam par shes pa rab tu 'jug pa med pa ste stong pa'i gzugs kyi yul rnams la mig gzhan la sogs pa rnam pa lnga po rnams kyis rab🔽tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba ni lus la yul dang yul can bcu po rnams kyi 'brel pas rnam par shes pa rab tu 'jug pa med pa ste stong pa'i gzugs kyi yul rnams la mig gzhan la sogs pa rnam pa lnga po rnams kyis rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Here, “withdrawal” is the non-engagement of consciousness due to the connection of the ten objects and subjects in the body, and the engagement of the five kinds of eyes and so on in the empty forms that are objects.

original: de bzhin du gzugs de nyid la shes rab ces pa ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs de nyid la shes rab ces pa ni lta ba'o //
translated: Similarly, “wisdom” in regard to that form is seeing.🔽“

original: rtog pa zhes pa ni dngos po 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes pa ni dngos po 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Conception” is apprehending things.🔽“

original: dpyod pa zhes pa ni de'i don nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa zhes pa ni de'i don nges par byed pa'o //
translated: Investigation” is ascertaining their meaning.🔽“

original: dga' ba zhes ba ni gzugs la chags pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes ba ni gzugs la chags pa'o //
translated: Joy” is attachment to form.🔽“

original: g-yo med bde ba zhes pa ni gzugs dang lhan cig sems gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo med bde ba zhes pa ni gzugs dang lhan cig sems gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: Unwavering bliss” is the mind becoming one with form.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bas bsam gtan rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bas bsam gtan rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Thus, there are ten kinds of meditative concentration, differentiated in terms of object and subject.

original: 'dir srog rtsol dag kyang lam ni gnyis po zhes @66b pa g-yon dang g-yas pa'i lam bsgyel ba ste 'gog cing dbu ma'i lam du rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir srog rtsol dag kyang lam ni gnyis po zhes @66b pa g-yon dang g-yas pa'i lam bsgyel ba ste 'gog cing dbu ma'i lam du rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: Here, the prāṇa and āyāma are also the two paths, the left and right paths, which are overturned, that is, blocked, and well entered into the path of the central nāḍī.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor bcu 'gog pa las rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor bcu 'gog pa las rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Moreover, there are ten aspects from blocking the ten cakras.

original: 'dir thig ler zhes pa dpral bar srog ni rab tu zhugs shing gnyis ka'i bgrod pa bcom pa zhes pa 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral ba ni rtse gcig sems pa zhes bya ba dpral bar srog 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir thig ler zhes pa dpral bar srog ni rab tu zhugs shing gnyis ka'i bgrod pa bcom pa zhes pa 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral ba ni rtse gcig sems pa zhes bya ba dpral bar srog 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Here, the “bindu” is the prāṇa that enters the forehead, and “the two paths are destroyed” means that it is free from coming and going. “The mind is one-pointed” means that the prāṇa is held at the forehead.

original: gtum mo'i snang ba gang zhig srid pa gsum gyi nam mkha' la gyur pa de ni rjes su dran pa ste rnam pa bcur sngar gsungs so //
analyzed: gtum mo'i snang ba gang zhig srid pa gsum gyi nam mkha' la gyur pa de ni rjes su dran pa ste rnam pa bcur sngar gsungs so //
translated: The “appearance of caṇḍālī” is the memory of the space of the three existences, which was previously explained as having ten aspects.

original: shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni zhes pa shes bya dang shes pa gcig tu 'dres par gyur pas te 'gyur med bde ba'i dbang gis ye shes gzugs la ting 'dzin no //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni zhes pa shes bya dang shes pa gcig tu 'dres par gyur pas te 'gyur med bde ba'i dbang gis ye shes gzugs la ting 'dzin no //
translated: “By means of the nature of method and wisdom” means that the object of knowledge and the consciousness are mixed into one, and the samādhi of the form of gnosis is the power of unchanging bliss.

original: de yang srog la sogs pa rnams med pa las rnam pa bcu'o //🔽de ltar sbyor ba yan lag drug gi sgrub thabs so //
analyzed: de yang srog la sogs pa rnams med pa las rnam pa bcu'o // de ltar sbyor ba yan lag drug gi sgrub thabs so //
translated: Moreover, there are ten aspects from the absence of life and so forth.

original: 'di rnams dman pa la sogs dbye ba rnams kyis sna tshogs gtso bo dus kyi 'khor lo'i sgrub thabs rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di rnams dman pa la sogs dbye ba rnams kyis sna tshogs gtso bo dus kyi 'khor lo'i sgrub thabs rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: Thus, there are three types of means of achievement of the principal Kālacakra, which are various by way of the divisions of inferior and so forth.

original: phyag rgya gsum dang gnas skabs gsum zhes pa ni rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis zhes pa ste 'dir byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa'i bgrod pa ni dman pa'i gnas skabs dang g-yo ba'i bgrod pa ni 'bring po'i gnas skabs dang mi g-yo ba'i bgrod pa ni mchog🔽gi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: phyag rgya gsum dang gnas skabs gsum zhes pa ni rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis zhes pa ste 'dir byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa'i bgrod pa ni dman pa'i gnas skabs dang g-yo ba'i bgrod pa ni 'bring po'i gnas skabs dang mi g-yo ba'i bgrod pa ni mchog gi gnas skabs so //
translated: The three mudras and three occasions are by way of the three paths, that is, here the path of emission of bodhicitta is the occasion of the inferior, the path of movement of bodhicitta is the occasion of the middling, and the path of nonmovement of bodhicitta is the occasion of the superior.

original: 'di rnams las las kyi phyag rgya ni 'dzag pa'i bde ba sbyin pa mo dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya ni g-yo ba'i bde ba sbyin pa mo dang phyag rgya chen mo ni mi g-yo ba'i bde ba sbyin pa mo'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams las las kyi phyag rgya ni 'dzag pa'i bde ba sbyin pa mo dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya ni g-yo ba'i bde ba sbyin pa mo dang phyag rgya chen mo ni mi g-yo ba'i bde ba sbyin pa mo'o //
translated: From among these, the karmamudra bestows the bliss of emission, the jñānamudrā bestows the bliss of movement, and the mahāmudrā bestows the bliss of nonmovement.

original: de ltar sbyor ba yan lag drug la phyag rgya gsum bsgom par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du sbyor ba yan lag drug bsgom par bya'o //🔽da ni so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa so sor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe so sor sdud pas gzugs brtan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnam par dag par gyur pa de'i tshe sngags rnams kun gyis byin gyis
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba yan lag drug la phyag rgya gsum bsgom par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du sbyor ba yan lag drug bsgom par bya'o // da ni so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa so sor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe so sor sdud pas gzugs brtan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnam par dag par gyur pa de'i tshe sngags rnams kun gyis byin gyis
translated: Thus, because the Bhagavān has taught that the three mudrās are cultivated in the six-branched yoga, the yogī should cultivate the six-branched yoga for the sake of buddhahood.

original: rlob par 'gyur te tshig gi mchog sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlob par 'gyur te tshig gi mchog sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the result of prāṇāyāma, etc., is stated: prāṇāyāma, etc., are the cause of the five superknowledges, and the yogī who has attained the five superknowledges is blessed by all mantras, and the best of words, etc., are given.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga ni thob par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bsam gtan sbyor @67a * //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga ni thob par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bsam gtan sbyor @67a * //
translated: The five superknowledges are attained, and the lord of men is purified by the yoga of meditative concentration.

original: bas dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'dir gang gi tshe mig mi 'dzums par gyur pa de'i tshe lha'i mig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bas dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'dir gang gi tshe mig mi 'dzums par gyur pa de'i tshe lha'i mig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the eyes become unblinking, at that time the divine eye is attained.

original: de bzhin du lha'i rna ba la sogs pa ste bsam gtan gyis dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i rna ba la sogs pa ste bsam gtan gyis dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the divine ear and so forth are purified by meditative concentration.

original: srog rtsol gyis dag pa zhes pa ni 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba nyi ma dang ri bong can gyi lam dang bral te rtag tu dbu mar 'bab par gyur pa de'i tshe srog rtsol gyis dag par gyur pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mchod
analyzed: srog rtsol gyis dag pa zhes pa ni 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba nyi ma dang ri bong can gyi lam dang bral te rtag tu dbu mar 'bab par gyur pa de'i tshe srog rtsol gyis dag par gyur pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mchod
translated: The meaning of purified by prāṇāyāma is that when the yogi is free from the path of the sun and moon and always flows in the central channel, at that time, since he is purified by prāṇāyāma, the bodhisattvas🔽praise and extol him.

original: de bsngags par byed do zhas pa'i don to //🔽bdud dang nyon mongs la sogs nyams shing stobs bcu la ni 'jug par 'gyur te zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi gzugs bzung ba'i sems la 'jug par 'gyur te 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis so zhes pa ni srog 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zad pas gcig tu 'dres

original: rjes su dran pa legs par dag pa zhes pa la 'dir rjes su dran pa ni gzugs la 'khyud pa'i sems rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa legs par dag pa zhes pa la 'dir rjes su dran pa ni gzugs la 'khyud pa'i sems rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase the recollection is well purified means that the recollection here is the mind embracing form, free from all discursive thought.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe dag par gyur pa de'i tshe dri med 'od kyi dkyil 'khor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe dag par gyur pa de'i tshe dri med 'od kyi dkyil 'khor du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when it becomes purified, at that time it becomes the stainless orb of light.

original: kyang gi sgra las ba spu'i khud bu nas 'od zer lnga 'phro zhing nges par rgyu'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra las ba spu'i khud bu nas 'od zer lnga 'phro zhing nges par rgyu'o //
translated: The word also indicates that five rays of light radiate from the pores of the body and definitely move.

original: ye shes gzugs las so zhes pa stong pa'i gzugs las so //
analyzed: ye shes gzugs las so zhes pa stong pa'i gzugs las so //
translated: From the form of gnosis means from the form of emptiness.

original: de nas ting nge 'dzin gyis dag pa zhes pa ni 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sems dag gcig pa nyid kyis gang zhig 'gyur pa med pa'i bde bar gyur pa'i bde pa de ni ting nge 'dzin du gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas ting nge 'dzin gyis dag pa zhes pa ni 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sems dag gcig pa nyid kyis gang zhig 'gyur pa med pa'i bde bar gyur pa'i bde pa de ni ting nge 'dzin du gsungs so //
translated: Then, the phrase purification by means of concentration means that here, since the mind of grasped and grasper is the same, whatever becomes unchanging bliss, that is said to be concentration.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyis dag pa dri ma med par gyur pa ni nyin zhag 'ga' zhig rnams kyis te lo gsum dang phyogs gsum gyi nyin zhag rnams kyis ye shes sku ni 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa dbang bcu la sogs pa thob pa'i byang chub sems🔽dpar 'gyur te so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyis dag pa dri ma med par gyur pa ni nyin zhag 'ga' zhig rnams kyis te lo gsum dang phyogs gsum gyi nyin zhag rnams kyis ye shes sku ni 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa dbang bcu la sogs pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpar 'gyur te so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: body that has become stainless through samādhi.🔽Now, the yoga of the forceful method is explained.🔽Here, when the form is seen through withdrawal and so on, if the unchanging

original: da ni btsan thabs kyi rnal 'byor gsungs te 'dir gang gi tshe so sor sdud pa la sogs pas gzugs mthong bar gyur pa la srog ma bcings pa nyid kyis 'gyur pa med pa'i skad cig ma ma skyes na de'i tshe n'a da goms pa 'chad par 'gyur
analyzed: da ni btsan thabs kyi rnal 'byor gsungs te 'dir gang gi tshe so sor sdud pa la sogs pas gzugs mthong bar gyur pa la srog ma bcings pa nyid kyis 'gyur pa med pa'i skad cig ma ma skyes na de'i tshe n'a da goms pa 'chad par 'gyur
translated: moment is not generated due to the life-force not being bound, then at that🔽time, the familiarization will be interrupted.

original: pas btsan thabs su dbu mar 'bab par byas nas shes rab kyi chu skyes su gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rdo rje @67b nor bur bkag nas mi g-yo bas 'gyur pa med pa'i skad cig bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni btsan thabs kyi rnal
analyzed: pas btsan thabs su dbu mar 'bab par byas nas shes rab kyi chu skyes su gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rdo rje @67b nor bur bkag nas mi g-yo bas 'gyur pa med pa'i skad cig bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni btsan thabs kyi rnal
translated: Having brought it down into the central channel by force, one should accomplish the unchanging moment by the immobility of the drop of bodhicitta located in the lotus of wisdom, blocked in the vajra jewel.🔽This is the forceful yoga.

original: 'byor ro // da ni stong ba nyid kyi gzugs bsgrub pa'i slad du lta stangs gsungs pa bsnyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byor ro // da ni stong ba nyid kyi gzugs bsgrub pa'i slad du lta stangs gsungs pa bsnyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to accomplish the form of emptiness, [the Bhagavān] declares the gazes, beginning with “approaching.”

original: 'dir bsnyen pa zhes pa ni dang por du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma sgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsnyen pa zhes pa ni dang por du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma sgom pa'o //
translated: Here, “approaching” is the meditation on the sign of smoke, etc., at the beginning.

original: bsnyen pa de las dang po'i rnal 'byor ni sems kyis du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa de las dang po'i rnal 'byor ni sems kyis du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: From that approaching, the yoga of the first is the mind’s apprehension of the sign of smoke, etc.

original: de yang du ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig yid ches par 'gyur pa rnam pa bcu ste des na de yang rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de yang du ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig yid ches par 'gyur pa rnam pa bcu ste des na de yang rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Moreover, that is tenfold, together with smoke, etc., and the ten aspects of conviction.

original: 'khor lo can gyi zhes pa gtsug tor gyi khro bo'i lta bas zhes pa mig mi 'dzums par steng du lta bas mtshan mar 'gyur te mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam pa bzhi dang nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam pa drug ste de nas gzugs so //
analyzed: 'khor lo can gyi zhes pa gtsug tor gyi khro bo'i lta bas zhes pa mig mi 'dzums par steng du lta bas mtshan mar 'gyur te mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam pa bzhi dang nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam pa drug ste de nas gzugs so //
translated: The wheel-holder is the wrathful one of the uṣṇīṣa. The view is the upward gaze with unclosed eyes. The signs are the four aspects of the yoga of night and the six aspects of the yoga of day. Then there is form.

original: de ltar gzugs kyi mthar thug par so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyis bsnyen pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi mthar thug par so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyis bsnyen pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the conclusion of form is the branch of service with the withdrawal and concentration.

original: bgegs mthar byed pa'i lta ba zhes pa la bgegs mthar byed ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs mthar byed pa'i lta ba zhes pa la bgegs mthar byed ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o //
translated: The view of Vighnāntaka is Vighnāntaka, who is Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: de'i lta ba ni bdud rtsi'i gnas su son pa ste dpral bar son pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lta ba ni bdud rtsi'i gnas su son pa ste dpral bar son pa'o //
translated: The view is the arrival at the place of nectar, which is the arrival at the forehead.

original: bgegs mthar byed de'i lta ba ni bdud rtsi'i lam du son pa yang yan lag drug gi nye bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs mthar byed de'i lta ba ni bdud rtsi'i lam du son pa yang yan lag drug gi nye bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: The view of Vighnāntaka is the arrival at the path of nectar, which is the near accomplishment of the six branches.

original: kyang yig gis srog rtsol dang 'dzin pa bya ste srog gzugs mthong nas so zhes pa nye ba'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: kyang yig gis srog rtsol dang 'dzin pa bya ste srog gzugs mthong nas so zhes pa nye ba'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: Also, one should perform prāṇāyāma and retention, seeing the form of the prāṇa, which is the accomplishment.

original: shes rab la spros zla ba thig le zhes pa la 'dir shes rab la chags pas spros pa 'di zla ba thig le yin pa ni la spros zla ba thig le ste /
analyzed: shes rab la spros zla ba thig le zhes pa la 'dir shes rab la chags pas spros pa 'di zla ba thig le yin pa ni la spros zla ba thig le ste /
translated: The “moon drop” of the proliferation of wisdom is the moon drop of the proliferation of wisdom through attachment to wisdom.🔽The moon drop of bodhicitta that proliferates in wisdom also abides in the vajra jewel.

original: shes rab la spros pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le yang rdo rje nor bur gnas pa de'i gsang ba dang lte ba dang snying gar 'gyur med gsum du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sgrub pa la zhes pa gsum pa sgrub pa'i yan lag la
analyzed: shes rab la spros pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le yang rdo rje nor bur gnas pa de'i gsang ba dang lte ba dang snying gar 'gyur med gsum du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sgrub pa la zhes pa gsum pa sgrub pa'i yan lag la
translated: The three immutable states in the secret place, the navel, and the heart are the third branch, “accomplishment.”

original: 'gyur ro // de ltar sgrub pa'i yan lag bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de ltar sgrub pa'i yan lag bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should perform the branch of accomplishment.🔽“The sole peace of unimpaired bliss” is the sole moment of unimpaired bodhicitta, which is called “peace.”

original: bde ba ma nyams gcig pu zhi ba zhes pa la 'dir bde ba ma nyams pa'i byang chub kyi sems skad cig gcig bu gang yin pa de ni zhi ba zhes gsungs te lhan skyes ye shes rnal 'byor 'dir ni sgrub pa chen po la zhes pa ni
analyzed: bde ba ma nyams gcig pu zhi ba zhes pa la 'dir bde ba ma nyams pa'i byang chub kyi sems skad cig gcig bu gang yin pa de ni zhi ba zhes gsungs te lhan skyes ye shes rnal 'byor 'dir ni sgrub pa chen po la zhes pa ni
translated: The “great accomplishment” in this yoga of connate gnosis is the fourth branch, “great accomplishment.”

original: sems 'gyur pa med pa'i bde ba dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid do zhes pa sgrub pa chen po'i @68a * //
analyzed: sems 'gyur pa med pa'i bde ba dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid do zhes pa sgrub pa chen po'i @68a * //
translated: The great accomplishment is the unity with the bliss of the unchanging mind.

original: yan lag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth branch.

original: de ltar ye shes kyi sgrub thabs la yan lag bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes kyi sgrub thabs la yan lag bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, the means of attaining knowledge has four branches.

original: lha'i sgrub thabs la skyed pa'i rim pas sngar gsungs te 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i sgrub thabs la skyed pa'i rim pas sngar gsungs te 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The means of attaining the deity has been taught previously by the creation stage, which is mundane.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni de kho na nyid kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni de kho na nyid kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The supramundane is by the means of attaining reality, the perfection stage.

original: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
translated: The Dharma taught by the Buddhas

original: bden pa gnyis la yang dag rten //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag rten //
translated: is well based on the two truths:🔽the mundane conventional truth

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
translated: and the truth of ultimate meaning.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the Blessed One.🔽And again:

original: slar yang / rdo rje can bdag bstan pa ni //
analyzed: slar yang / rdo rje can bdag bstan pa ni //
translated: The teaching of the Vajra Holder

original: rim pa gnyis la yang dag rten //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis la yang dag rten //
translated: is well based on the two stages:

original: gcig ni skyed pa'i rim pa ste //
analyzed: gcig ni skyed pa'i rim pa ste //
translated: one is the creation stage

original: gzhan ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: and the other is the perfection stage.

original: zhes so // de ltar lha'i sgrub pa la rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa dang de kho na nyid kyi sgrub pa la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba yan lag bzhi po rnams kyis so zhes pa rigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar lha'i sgrub pa la rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa dang de kho na nyid kyi sgrub pa la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba yan lag bzhi po rnams kyis so zhes pa rigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, by means of the four branches—the conceptual meditation on the deity, and the non-conceptual practice of reality—this is the reasoning.

original: da ni srog rtsol gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa srog ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir stong pa nyid kyi gzugs mthong bar gyur pa na rnal 'byor pas srog rtsol bya ba gang yin pa de ni ji srid mgo yi bar du zhes pa mgo bo na bar
analyzed: da ni srog rtsol gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa srog ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir stong pa nyid kyi gzugs mthong bar gyur pa na rnal 'byor pas srog rtsol bya ba gang yin pa de ni ji srid mgo yi bar du zhes pa mgo bo na bar
translated: Now, the definition of prāṇāyāma is stated: prāṇa, etc. Here, when the yogi sees the form of emptiness, whatever prāṇāyāma he does, that is, as long as there is no headache,

original: mi byed kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mi byed kyi bar du'o //
translated: he should not do it.

original: de yang bde mnyam 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bde mnyam 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And that bestows the fruit of the bliss of equality.

original: de las steng du zhes pa ni mgo bo na ba'i mtha' las 'dod pa min pa 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed par 'gyur ta phung po rnam par nyams pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las steng du zhes pa ni mgo bo na ba'i mtha' las 'dod pa min pa 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed par 'gyur ta phung po rnam par nyams pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Above that, i.e., beyond the headache, it will not be desired, it will bring the fear of death, it will be the cause of the destruction of the aggregates.

original: ci ste rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis gtsug tor phug nas srog 'gro na rnal 'byor pas mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang dag la zhes pa stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la nges par sbyar bar bya ste nges par ni mtha' gcig tu'o //
analyzed: ci ste rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis gtsug tor phug nas srog 'gro na rnal 'byor pas mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang dag la zhes pa stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la nges par sbyar bar bya ste nges par ni mtha' gcig tu'o //
translated: If, on the other hand, the life force goes out through the fontanelle due to the power of yoga, then the yogi should definitely join it to the form of emptiness, to the state of supreme bliss.

original: de ltar phung po med kyang rnal 'byor ba ni bde mnyam zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi gzug sla 'jug ste rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi sems 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar phung po med kyang rnal 'byor ba ni bde mnyam zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi gzug sla 'jug ste rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi sems 'gro ba'o //
translated: Thus, although there is no aggregate, the yogi enters the form of the Buddha, the state of bliss. The yogi is the mind of yoga going.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten du ni grags pa min pa rnal 'byor pa 'di shi'o zhes pa ste srog rtsol gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten du ni grags pa min pa rnal 'byor pa 'di shi'o zhes pa ste srog rtsol gyi nges pa'o //
translated: However, this yogi is not known in the world as dead.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The other verse is easy to understand.

original: da ni lha gshegs su gsol ba gsungs pa gtsug gtor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang las rgyal mchog dang thig le'i rnal @68b 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms nas mchod pa dang mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud ces pa🔽la sogs pas bstod pa byas te /
analyzed: da ni lha gshegs su gsol ba gsungs pa gtsug gtor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang las rgyal mchog dang thig le'i rnal @68b 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms nas mchod pa dang mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud ces pa la sogs pas bstod pa byas te /
translated: Now, the request for the deities to depart is stated, beginning with “the uṣṇīṣa,” and so on. Here, having meditated on the supreme royal maṇḍala, the supreme royal activity, the yoga of the bindu, and the yoga of the subtle, one should make offerings and praise with “I bow to you, supreme Vajra, bestower of the supreme,” and so on.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams gshegs su gsol pa'i slad du gtsug tor du ni rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams gshegs su gsol pa'i slad du gtsug tor du ni rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to request the maṇḍala deities to depart, one should meditate on the five-pointed vajra in the uṣṇīṣa.

original: de'i lte ba la bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de'i lte ba la bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: One should request the departure of the great-bliss cakra in its center.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi rtse mo dag ni nyis 'gyur zhes pa rtse mo brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi rtse mo dag ni nyis 'gyur zhes pa rtse mo brgyad pa ste /
translated: The outer points are doubled, that is, there are eight points.

original: dbus kyi rtse mo dang lhan cig rtse mo dgu pa'i rdo rje chos kyi 'khor lor zhes pa snying gar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbus kyi rtse mo dang lhan cig rtse mo dgu pa'i rdo rje chos kyi 'khor lor zhes pa snying gar 'gyur te /
translated: Together with the central point, there is a nine-pointed vajra in the dharmacakra at the heart.

original: de'i lte bar du ba ma la sogs pa gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de'i lte bar du ba ma la sogs pa gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: One should request the departure of the navel cakra, and so on, in its center.

original: nyis 'gyur gzhan ma zhes pa /
analyzed: nyis 'gyur gzhan ma zhes pa /
translated: The other two are the same.🔽

original: rtse mo bcu drug pa dbus kyi rtse mo dang bcu bdun pa ste lhan skyes zhes pa dpral bar ro //
analyzed: rtse mo bcu drug pa dbus kyi rtse mo dang bcu bdun pa ste lhan skyes zhes pa dpral bar ro //
translated: The other one, which is double, is the sixteenth summit, together with the central one, which is the seventeenth. The innate one is in the forehead.

original: de'i lte bar phung po dang khams kyi lha gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de'i lte bar phung po dang khams kyi lha gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: In its center, one should request the departure of the deities of the aggregates and constituents.

original: de yi nyis 'gyur dag kyang gzhan zhes pa rtse mo sum cu rtsa gnyis pa dbus ma'i rtse mo dang lhan cig rtse mo sum cu rtsa gsum pa ste longs spyod rdzogs zhes pa mgrin par ro //
analyzed: de yi nyis 'gyur dag kyang gzhan zhes pa rtse mo sum cu rtsa gnyis pa dbus ma'i rtse mo dang lhan cig rtse mo sum cu rtsa gsum pa ste longs spyod rdzogs zhes pa mgrin par ro //
translated: The other one, which is double, is the thirty-second summit, together with the central one, which is the thirty-third. The enjoyment body is in the throat.

original: de'i lte bar skye mched bcu gnyis dang khro bo gzhi'i lha gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de'i lte bar skye mched bcu gnyis dang khro bo gzhi'i lha gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: In its center, one should request the departure of the deities of the twelve sense-spheres and the wrathful ground deities.

original: de yi yang ni nyis 'gyur gzhan zhes pa rtse mo drug cu rtsa bzhi pa dbus ma'i rtse mo dang lhan cig rtse mo drug cu rtsa lnga pa'i rdo rje ste sprul pa zhes pa lte ba'i 'khor lor ro //
analyzed: de yi yang ni nyis 'gyur gzhan zhes pa rtse mo drug cu rtsa bzhi pa dbus ma'i rtse mo dang lhan cig rtse mo drug cu rtsa lnga pa'i rdo rje ste sprul pa zhes pa lte ba'i 'khor lor ro //
translated: The other one, which is double, is the sixty-fourth summit, together with the central one, which is the sixty-fifth. The vajra emanation is in the navel chakra.

original: de'i lte bar rtsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa dang 'jigs ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor drug cu 'bab pa rnams te bzhi ni stong pa nyid kyi rigs can ma'o //
analyzed: de'i lte bar rtsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa dang 'jigs ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor drug cu 'bab pa rnams te bzhi ni stong pa nyid kyi rigs can ma'o //
translated: In its center are the sixty maṇḍalas of the nāḍīs such as Rasana, Lalana, and so on, and the four such as Jñānavāhinī, which are the families of emptiness.

original: de ltar bdun cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de ltar bdun cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: Thus, those seventy-two are requested to depart.

original: de yi snying po rtse mo gcig pa zhes pa ni de rnams kyi snying por sngar gsungs pa'i rtse mo gcig pa ste bde mnyam 'bras ster gsang ba'i padma'i khongs su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de yi snying po rtse mo gcig pa zhes pa ni de rnams kyi snying por sngar gsungs pa'i rtse mo gcig pa ste bde mnyam 'bras ster gsang ba'i padma'i khongs su gnas pa'o //
translated: “The one-pointed essence” is the one-pointedness previously explained as the essence of those [nāḍīs], which is the result of the bliss of the secret lotus.

original: de la yang rtse mo sum cu rtsa gnyis te 'dab ma'i grangs so //
analyzed: de la yang rtse mo sum cu rtsa gnyis te 'dab ma'i grangs so //
translated: There are thirty-two “tips” there, which is the number of petals.

original: de'i lte bar 'od zer can la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de'i lte bar 'od zer can la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: Those that are in the center of that, such as Māmakī, are requested to depart.

original: de bzhin du lha bcu gnyis po 'khor dang bcas pa rnams ni las kyi 'khor lo rnams rdo rjes byas nas de rnams kyi lte bar de rnams gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha bcu gnyis po 'khor dang bcas pa rnams ni las kyi 'khor lo rnams rdo rjes byas nas de rnams kyi lte bar de rnams gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: Similarly, the twelve gods with retinues are requested to depart from the centers of the action cakras, which are made of vajras.

original: klu rnams dang khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams ni @69a * //
analyzed: klu rnams dang khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams ni @69a * //
translated: The nagas, the dog-faced ones, and so forth,🔽

original: bya ba'i 'khor lo rnams pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i 'khor lo rnams pa'o //
translated: The nāgas, the dog-faced ones, and so forth are the retinue of the action wheel.

original: de ltar gshegs su gsol ba byas te de nas thun mtshams gsum la sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gshegs su gsol ba byas te de nas thun mtshams gsum la sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having invited [the deities] in this way, then at the three periods one should offer the bali according to the previously described rite.

original: sngar gyi cho gas bdud rtsi lnga sbyang ba byas nas des bdag nyid tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi cho gas bdud rtsi lnga sbyang ba byas nas des bdag nyid tshim par bya'o //
translated: Having purified the five nectars according to the previous rite, one should satisfy oneself with it.

original: de ltar skyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pas dus kyi 'khor lo'i sgrub thabs bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar skyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pas dus kyi 'khor lo'i sgrub thabs bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the method of accomplishing Kālacakra by means of the creation stage and the perfection stage was taught by the Bhagavat Mañjuśrī.

original: da ni rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa gsungs pa rnal 'byor pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni phyi'i dad gnyis pa ni nang gi'o //
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa gsungs pa rnal 'byor pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni phyi'i dad gnyis pa ni nang gi'o //
translated: Now, the conduct of the yogin is taught, beginning with “the yogin,” and so forth. Here, the yogins are of two types: one is the outer, and the other is the inner.

original: de la phyi'i gang yin pa de 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu dang nang gi gang yin pa de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyur rnal 'byor pas bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyi'i gang yin pa de 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu dang nang gi gang yin pa de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyur rnal 'byor pas bya'o //
translated: The external is the cause of mundane results, and the internal is the cause of supramundane results.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor pa yis nyin dang mtshan mor srog gcod pa dag bya ba de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i slad du rang gi lus la srog nyams pa la gsungs kyi phyi rol du srog gcod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pa yis nyin dang mtshan mor srog gcod pa dag bya ba de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i slad du rang gi lus la srog nyams pa la gsungs kyi phyi rol du srog gcod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the yogi/nī should kill living beings day and night in order to attain the result of omniscience, but not in the external world.

original: 'dir phyi rol du gdul dka' 'dul ba'i slad du srog gcod par gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de rnams kyi srog rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis bskug pa slar yang lus de nyid la rnal 'byor pas gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du gdul dka' 'dul ba'i slad du srog gcod par gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de rnams kyi srog rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis bskug pa slar yang lus de nyid la rnal 'byor pas gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Here, the killing of those difficult to tame in the external world is said to be the summoning of their life-force by the power of yoga and its re-introduction into that very body by the yogi/nī.

original: de ltar na gdul dka' 'dul ba por 'gyur te gdul dka' mthar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na gdul dka' 'dul ba por 'gyur te gdul dka' mthar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes grub bo //
translated: Thus, one becomes the tamer of the difficult to tame, but not the terminator of the difficult to tame. This is established.

original: sgra ni gang zhig zhal gyis dman pa dag ces pa ni 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung thams cad kyi skad sems can thams cad kyi snying la rang rang gi skad gzhan gyis 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid ni rab tu mi gnas pa ste sems can
analyzed: sgra ni gang zhig zhal gyis dman pa dag ces pa ni 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung thams cad kyi skad sems can thams cad kyi snying la rang rang gi skad gzhan gyis 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid ni rab tu mi gnas pa ste sems can
translated: Sound is that which is inferior to the face.🔽Here, the voice of omniscience is the individual language of all sentient beings in the heart of each sentient being.🔽

original: thams cad kyi skad yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi skad yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Sound is that which is inferior to the face. Here, the voice of the Omniscient One is the language of all sentient beings, which is the individual language of each and every sentient being. That very [language] is not well-established, because it is the language of all sentient beings.

original: rab tu mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir brdzun du smra bar gsungs so //
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir brdzun du smra bar gsungs so //
translated: Because it is not well-established, it is said to be false speech.

original: phyi rol du yang sems can gyi don gyi slad du sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang sems can gyi don gyi slad du sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //
translated: Also externally, for the sake of sentient beings, the speech of the Great Illusion, the Great Fierce One,

original: 'byung dang sdud par byed pa mo zhes pa la sogs pa'i gsung ni gdul bya'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'byung dang sdud par byed pa mo zhes pa la sogs pa'i gsung ni gdul bya'i don du'o //
translated: the one who creates and withdraws, and so forth, is for the sake of those to be tamed.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: dbang po gnyis skyes bde de nyid //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis skyes bde de nyid //
translated: that bliss of the two organs

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster //
translated: gives the fruit of buddhahood.

original: skyes pa rdo rje 'dzin rnam pa //
analyzed: skyes pa rdo rje 'dzin rnam pa //
translated: The one who holds the vajra of the male

original: bud med rdo rje btsun @69b mo'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i gsung ni brdzun du smra ba ste sems can rnams slu ba'i slad du sangs rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis slu ba can gyi tshig ni ma yin no zhes grub bo //
analyzed: bud med rdo rje btsun @69b mo'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i gsung ni brdzun du smra ba ste sems can rnams slu ba'i slad du sangs rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis slu ba can gyi tshig ni ma yin no zhes grub bo //
translated: The statement “the woman is the Vajra Queen” and so on is lying, because it is for the purpose of deceiving sentient beings. It is not the case that the yogis of the Buddha’s teaching speak deceptively.

original: 'dir lus sgrib pa med par skyes par gyur pa na gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa bcu gnyis po rnams 'dzin pa de ni rnal 'byor pa yis brkus te 'dzin par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir lus sgrib pa med par skyes par gyur pa na gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa bcu gnyis po rnams 'dzin pa de ni rnal 'byor pa yis brkus te 'dzin par gsungs so //
translated: Here, when one is born with an unobstructed body, one who takes up the twelve stages of the omniscient one is said to be “taken up by the yogi.”

original: phyi rol du yang sems can la phan pa'i slad du gter la sogs pa dbyung bar bya ste gter srung ba po rnams ngan 'gro las grol bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang sems can la phan pa'i slad du gter la sogs pa dbyung bar bya ste gter srung ba po rnams ngan 'gro las grol bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Also, externally, for the sake of benefiting sentient beings, one should extract treasure and so on, for the purpose of liberating the guardians of treasure from the lower realms.

original: khu ba'i thig le ma lhung ba las bde bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de gzhan gyi bud med bsten pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba'i thig le ma lhung ba las bde bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de gzhan gyi bud med bsten pa'o //
translated: The bliss that comes from the nonemission of the seminal drop is “reliance on another’s wife.”

original: gzhan gyi bud med ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ste 'khor ba'i pha rol tu son ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ste 'khor ba'i pha rol tu son ma'o //
translated: The woman of another is Prajñāpāramitā, who has gone to the other shore of saṃsāra.

original: gzhan ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste 'khor ba'i pha rol du son pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste 'khor ba'i pha rol du son pa'o //
translated: Another is Vajrasattva, who has gone to the other shore of saṃsāra.

original: de yi bud med ni gzhan gyi bud med de rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi chags bral min pa las zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba las de bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de yi bud med ni gzhan gyi bud med de rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi chags bral min pa las zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba las de bsten pa'o //
translated: Her woman is the woman of another, who is not without passion for the yogis, who is the unchanging bliss, and who is served.

original: phyi rol du yang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i dus su sbyin pa pos rang gi chud ma la sogs pa byin pa gang yin pa de bsten pa ni gzhan gyi bud med bsten pa ste chags bral min pa las zhes pa ni ji ltar dam tshig can
analyzed: phyi rol du yang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i dus su sbyin pa pos rang gi chud ma la sogs pa byin pa gang yin pa de bsten pa ni gzhan gyi bud med bsten pa ste chags bral min pa las zhes pa ni ji ltar dam tshig can
translated: Also externally, at the time of the consecration, etc., the donor gives his own wife, etc., and serving that is serving the woman of another. Not without passion means that, just as the vow-holders do not break their vow by being without passion,

original: rnams bdag nyid chags pa dang bral bas dam tshig dral bar mi 'gyur pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnams bdag nyid chags pa dang bral bas dam tshig dral bar mi 'gyur pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: so also the yogis do not break their vow by being without passion.

original: srog rtsol ba'i me yis zhes pa ni 'dir srog 'gog pas gtum mo 'bar ba gang yin pa de srog rtsol ba'i me zhes gsungs te /🔽srog rtsol ba'i me de yis ri bong can ni zhu ba dag kyang zhes pa byang chub kyi sems zhu ba thig le'i gzug rdo rje'i kha steng du btung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba skyed pa gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi chang
analyzed: srog rtsol ba'i me yis zhes pa ni 'dir srog 'gog pas gtum mo 'bar ba gang yin pa de srog rtsol ba'i me zhes gsungs te / srog rtsol ba'i me de yis ri bong can ni zhu ba dag kyang zhes pa byang chub kyi sems zhu ba thig le'i gzug rdo rje'i kha steng du btung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba skyed pa gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi chang
translated: The fire of prāṇāyāma is the blazing of caṇḍālī by stopping the prāṇa.

original: btung bar gsungs so //
analyzed: btung bar gsungs so //
translated: That fire of prāṇāyāma melts the rabbit, that is, the bodhicitta, and the form of the bindu is drunk at the opening of the vajra, which generates the connate joy. That is said to be the beer drunk by yogins.

original: phyi rol du yang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i dus su phyi'i lha rnams kyi gtor ma'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i dus su phyi'i lha rnams kyi gtor ma'i don du gsungs so //
translated: Also, externally, it is said to be for the purpose of the bali offering of the external deities at the time of the empowerment, and so on.

original: mthe bo'i tshigs nas gtsug tor dag tu zhes pa ni 'dir 'dod pa'i bstan bcos las thos te /
analyzed: mthe bo'i tshigs nas gtsug tor dag tu zhes pa ni 'dir 'dod pa'i bstan bcos las thos te /
translated: From the knuckle to the uṣṇīṣa: here it is heard in the treatise of desire.

original: dkar po'i phyogs la rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe bo nas tshes gcig la sogs pa 'phel ba dang zla ba'i cha 'phel bas nya'i mthar gtsug tor du rang @70a * //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs la rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe bo nas tshes gcig la sogs pa 'phel ba dang zla ba'i cha 'phel bas nya'i mthar gtsug tor du rang @70a * //
translated: On the positive side, the moon waxes from the first day of the lunar month and so on, increasing from the big toe of the left foot to the crown.🔽

original: sems zhes pa byang chub kyi sems 'gro ste tshes kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: sems zhes pa byang chub kyi sems 'gro ste tshes kyi dbang gis so //
translated: On the bright side, from the big toe of the left foot, the first day of the month and so on increase, and the part of the moon increases. At the end of the fifteenth day, the bodhicitta moves to the crown,🔽by the power of the days of the month.

original: slar yang gtsug tor nas ni rkang pa g-yas pa'i sor mo rnams su slar yang 'di ni 'gro ste nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes kyi dbang gis ji srid nag po'i phyogs kyi mtha' ru zhes ba gnam stong gi mthar ro //
analyzed: slar yang gtsug tor nas ni rkang pa g-yas pa'i sor mo rnams su slar yang 'di ni 'gro ste nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes kyi dbang gis ji srid nag po'i phyogs kyi mtha' ru zhes ba gnam stong gi mthar ro //
translated: Again, from the crown, to the toes of the right foot, it moves again, by the power of the days of the dark side, until the end of the dark side, the thirtieth day.

original: de ltar nag po'i phyogs kyi mthar ni byang chub kyi sems rkang pa'i mthe bo la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nag po'i phyogs kyi mthar ni byang chub kyi sems rkang pa'i mthe bo la rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, at the end of the dark side, the bodhicitta should be known to be at the big toe.

original: slar yang zla ba gzhan gyi dkar po'i phyogs la g-yon gyi mthe bo la sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: slar yang zla ba gzhan gyi dkar po'i phyogs la g-yon gyi mthe bo la sngar bzhin no //
translated: Again, on the bright side of another month, it is in the big toe of the left foot, as before.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, it is said:

original: tshes dang po la ni sor mo'i tshigs dang por ro ;
analyzed: tshes dang po la ni sor mo'i tshigs dang por ro ;
translated: On the first day, it is in the first joint of the toe.

original: / gnyis pa la ni gnyis par ro //
analyzed: / gnyis pa la ni gnyis par ro //
translated: On the second day, it is in the second joint.

original: gsum pa la ni gsum par ro //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gsum par ro //
translated: In the third, in the third.

original: bzhi pa la ni g-yon gyi long bu'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni g-yon gyi long bu'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the fourth, in the ankle on the left.

original: lnga pa la ni pus mo'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni pus mo'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the fifth, in the knee.

original: drug pa la ni bral dang dpyi'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: drug pa la ni bral dang dpyi'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the sixth, in the groin.

original: bdun pa la ni g-yon gyi lag pa'i sor mo'i tshigs dang po'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la ni g-yon gyi lag pa'i sor mo'i tshigs dang po'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the seventh, in the first joint of the finger on the left.

original: brgyad pa la ni bar ma'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni bar ma'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the eighth, in the middle.

original: dgu pa la ni gsum pa'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: dgu pa la ni gsum pa'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the ninth, in the third.

original: bcu pa la ni mkhrig ma'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: bcu pa la ni mkhrig ma'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the tenth, in the wrist.

original: bcu gcig pa la ni gru mo'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa la ni gru mo'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the eleventh, in the elbow.

original: bcu gnyis pa la ni phrag pa dang dpung pa'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la ni phrag pa dang dpung pa'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the twelfth, in the shoulder and arm.

original: bcu gsum pa la ni snying khar ro //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa la ni snying khar ro //
translated: In the thirteenth, in the heart.

original: bcu bzhi pa la ni mgrin par ro //🔽nya la ni dpral bar ngo //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa la ni mgrin par ro // nya la ni dpral bar ngo //
translated: In the fourteenth, in the throat.🔽In the fifteenth, in the forehead.

original: nya'i mthar ni khu ba gtsug tor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nya'i mthar ni khu ba gtsug tor du 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end of the fifteenth, the semen is in the uṣṇīṣa.

original: slar yang nag po'i tshes dang po la ni dpral bar ro //
analyzed: slar yang nag po'i tshes dang po la ni dpral bar ro //
translated: Again, on the first day of the dark half, it is in the forehead.

original: gnyis pa la ni mgrin par ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni mgrin par ro //
translated: On the second, in the throat.

original: gsum pa la ni snying khar ro //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni snying khar ro //
translated: In the third, in the heart.

original: bzhi pa la ni g-yas pa'i phrag pa'i phrag pa dang dpung pa'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni g-yas pa'i phrag pa'i phrag pa dang dpung pa'i mtshams su'o //
translated: In the fourth, in the right shoulder, between the shoulder and the arm.

original: lhag ma ni g-yon pa bzhi lugs las bzlog pa ste rkang pa g-yas pa'i sor mo'i sen mo'i mtha' la gnam stong gi mtha' ji srid par byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni g-yon pa bzhi lugs las bzlog pa ste rkang pa g-yas pa'i sor mo'i sen mo'i mtha' la gnam stong gi mtha' ji srid par byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The rest, the four on the left, are in the reverse order: the tip of the right toe, as far as the tip of the right nail, is the end of the month of the bodhicitta.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams spyod pa gang de nyin zhag so so'i dus su 'dod pa'i dngos grub rab ster ba zhes pa ni 'dir g-yon dang g-yas kyi rtsa la rab tu 'bab pa'i dbang gis g-yon dang g-yas su bgrod pa'i byang chub kyi sems dus thams cad du
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams spyod pa gang de nyin zhag so so'i dus su 'dod pa'i dngos grub rab ster ba zhes pa ni 'dir g-yon dang g-yas kyi rtsa la rab tu 'bab pa'i dbang gis g-yon dang g-yas su bgrod pa'i byang chub kyi sems dus thams cad du
translated: The conduct of the yogis, which grants the desired power at each moment of the day, is the bodhicitta that moves to the left and to the right by the force of the flow in the left and right channels.

original: dbu mar rab tu 'bab pas gsang ba la sogs pa'i padma @70b drug po rnams su 'og tu 'gro ba las steng du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i spyod pa de ni 'dod pa'i dngos grub ces pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ste de rab tu ster ba
analyzed: dbu mar rab tu 'bab pas gsang ba la sogs pa'i padma @70b drug po rnams su 'og tu 'gro ba las steng du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i spyod pa de ni 'dod pa'i dngos grub ces pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ste de rab tu ster ba
translated: Since it descends into the central channel, the conduct called “descending from above” in the six lotuses of the secret and so on grants the “desired power,” that is, the power of the great seal.🔽Also, externally, the conduct of women is the retention of women who are of the family of the five transcendent ones.

original: po'o // phyi rol du yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs can gyi bud med rnams 'dzin pa ni bud med kyi spyod pa ste bud med kyi spyod pa de rnams la srub pa ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: po'o // phyi rol du yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs can gyi bud med rnams 'dzin pa ni bud med kyi spyod pa ste bud med kyi spyod pa de rnams la srub pa ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: The churning of those conducts of women is celibacy.

original: de bzhin du zhal ni rnal 'byor pas bya'o zhes zhes dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems kyi 'thab mo ni rtsa'i kun du spyod pa zhes pa steng du khu ba 'gro bar bya'o zhes pa rtsa pa'i rgyud las nges pa ste rtsa ba'i spyod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhal ni rnal 'byor pas bya'o zhes zhes dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems kyi 'thab mo ni rtsa'i kun du spyod pa zhes pa steng du khu ba 'gro bar bya'o zhes pa rtsa pa'i rgyud las nges pa ste rtsa ba'i spyod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The face should be done by the yogī, and likewise, the battle of bodhicitta is the conduct of the nāḍīs, which is ascertained from the Nāḍītantra, “The semen should be brought upward.”

original: 'dir nyi shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya'i rjes la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'dir nyi shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya'i rjes la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ni go sla'o //
translated: Here, the four verses after the one hundred twenty-fifth are easy to understand.🔽Now, the meditation on the deity for the sake of pacification, etc., is stated: white, etc.

original: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du lha bsgom pa gsungs pa dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa lta 'dir bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig pa'am shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dam lnga'i bdag nyid la sogs par gsungs pa ni
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du lha bsgom pa gsungs pa dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa lta 'dir bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig pa'am shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dam lnga'i bdag nyid la sogs par gsungs pa ni
translated: Here, the Blessed One, Kālacakra, is said to be of one hero, or of the nature of wisdom and means, or of five natures, etc.

original: zhal la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnams kyis zhi ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhal la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnams kyis zhi ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes pacifying, etc., by the divisions of faces, etc.

original: gang gi tshe zhi ba byed pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pas sku'i zhal gtso bor byas nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la kha dog dkar po dpral bar gnas pa bsgom par bya ste dkar po yis ni zhi dang rgyas pa byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhi ba byed pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pas sku'i zhal gtso bor byas nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la kha dog dkar po dpral bar gnas pa bsgom par bya ste dkar po yis ni zhi dang rgyas pa byed do //
translated: When one is performing pacification, then the yogi, having made the face of the body the principal [face], should meditate on a white moon-disk located in the forehead, for with the white [face] one performs pacification and enrichment.

original: gsung gi zhal gtso bo nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la mgrin par gnas pa yid la bsgoms par gyur na dmar po yis ni dgug pa dang dbang du bya ba byed do //
analyzed: gsung gi zhal gtso bo nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la mgrin par gnas pa yid la bsgoms par gyur na dmar po yis ni dgug pa dang dbang du bya ba byed do //
translated: If one meditates on the face of speech, which is the principal one, located in the throat, on the mandala of the sun, with a red color, one will attract and enthrall.

original: ye shes kyi zhal gtso bo dus me'i dkyil 'khor la lte bar gnas pa bsgoms pa ser pos rengs pa dang rmongs pa byed do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi zhal gtso bo dus me'i dkyil 'khor la lte bar gnas pa bsgoms pa ser pos rengs pa dang rmongs pa byed do //
translated: If one meditates on the face of gnosis, which is the principal one, located at the navel, on the mandala of the fire of time, with a yellow color, one will paralyze and stupefy.

original: snying khar sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la thugs kyi zhal gtso bo ste nag pos bsad dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba yang byed do //
analyzed: snying khar sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la thugs kyi zhal gtso bo ste nag pos bsad dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba yang byed do //
translated: If one meditates on the face of mind, which is the principal one, located at the heart, on the mandala of Rāhu, with a black color, one will kill, expel, and separate.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas lha min lag 'gro'i rigs 'di bsgo mas ba yis ni bsgrub par bya zhes pa la lha min dang lag 'gro rnams kyi rigs rnam pa brgyad de rigs de nyid bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas lha min lag 'gro'i rigs 'di bsgo mas ba yis ni bsgrub par bya zhes pa la lha min dang lag 'gro rnams kyi rigs rnam pa brgyad de rigs de nyid bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should accomplish the eight types of the families of the asuras and the nāgas, who are located on the mandalas of the elements.

original: mkha' lding du 'chad par 'gyur pa ni 'dir rgyas par ma byas so //
analyzed: mkha' lding du 'chad par 'gyur pa ni 'dir rgyas par ma byas so //
translated: The garuḍas, which will be explained, are not elaborated here.

original: sgom dang bzlas pa de bzhin nyid du rang gi yid la byed ces pa ni zhal gcig phyag gnyis @71a * //
analyzed: sgom dang bzlas pa de bzhin nyid du rang gi yid la byed ces pa ni zhal gcig phyag gnyis @71a * //
translated: One should attend to the meditation and recitation in this way with one's mind.🔽🔽

original: pa'i lha'i sku la sogs pa'i kha dog gi dbye bas bsgoms pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas zhi ba la sogs pa byed do //
analyzed: pa'i lha'i sku la sogs pa'i kha dog gi dbye bas bsgoms pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas zhi ba la sogs pa byed do //
translated: One should attend to the meditation and repetition in just this way with one's mind means that one should meditate on the deity's body with one face and two arms, etc., by way of the divisions of color, and one should perform pacification, etc., by the procedure to be explained.

original: de ltar 'byung ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas zhes pa chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje bzhi srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bsgrub par bya ste las kyi dbye ba du ma rnams kyis zhes pa cho ga sna tshogs pa rnams kyis
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas zhes pa chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje bzhi srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bsgrub par bya ste las kyi dbye ba du ma rnams kyis zhes pa cho ga sna tshogs pa rnams kyis
translated: Thus, abiding in the maṇḍala of the elements means that one should accomplish the four vajras abiding in the maṇḍalas of water, etc., as the abode of the three existences, by means of the many divisions of rites, that is, by means of the various rituals.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: da ni gdul dka' 'dul bar byed pa'i slad du glang po che'i pags pa rlon pa'i gos 'dzin par bsgom pa gsungs ba phyogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gdul dka' 'dul bar byed pa'i slad du glang po che'i pags pa rlon pa'i gos 'dzin par bsgom pa gsungs ba phyogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to subdue those difficult to subdue, one should meditate on wearing the wet elephant skin.

original: 'dir dus rnam par dag pas lo'i phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyis phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir dus rnam par dag pas lo'i phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyis phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa ste /
translated: Here, with the pure twenty-four parts of the year, there are twenty-four hands.

original: rdo rje phreng thogs dpal dang ldan zhes pa grub po //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng thogs dpal dang ldan zhes pa grub po //
translated: The glorious one holding a vajra garland is complete.

original: glang po che'i pags pa rlon pa'i gos 'dzin pa 'di ni lhag pa'i zla ba dang bcas pa ste lo gang zhig zla ba bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: glang po che'i pags pa rlon pa'i gos 'dzin pa 'di ni lhag pa'i zla ba dang bcas pa ste lo gang zhig zla ba bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Holding the garment of fresh elephant hide, this is the extra month, the year which is the nature of thirteen months.

original: de'i phyogs nyi shu rtsa drug rnams kyis phyag rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs nyi shu rtsa drug rnams kyis phyag rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: With its twenty-six parts, there are pure hands.

original: de'i phyir phyogs lhag pa las phyung ba ni phyag gnyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs lhag pa las phyung ba ni phyag gnyis so //
translated: Therefore, the two hands are extracted from the extra part.

original: phyag de dag bong pa dang ni gser dang mtshungs pa zhes pa nag po dang ser po g-yas dang cig shos dag gis ni phung po'i bdud nyid glang chen zhes pa phung po'i bdud ni glang po che ste de zad pa las cha tsam nyid ni pags pa'o
analyzed: phyag de dag bong pa dang ni gser dang mtshungs pa zhes pa nag po dang ser po g-yas dang cig shos dag gis ni phung po'i bdud nyid glang chen zhes pa phung po'i bdud ni glang po che ste de zad pa las cha tsam nyid ni pags pa'o
translated: Those hands are like ivory and gold means that with the black and yellow, the right and left, the elephant of the demon of the aggregates is the demon of the aggregates, an elephant. From its exhaustion, just a part is the hide.

original: // de nyid rab tu 'byin pa ni phung po'i bdud nyid glang chen ma lus bshus nas rkang pa zung zhig dag nas 'dzin cing rkang ba zung zhig 'phyang ba glang chen pags pa'i gos zhes pa 'dzin pa ste g-yas su mgo bo dang g-yon gyi char mjug ma'o
analyzed: // de nyid rab tu 'byin pa ni phung po'i bdud nyid glang chen ma lus bshus nas rkang pa zung zhig dag nas 'dzin cing rkang ba zung zhig 'phyang ba glang chen pags pa'i gos zhes pa 'dzin pa ste g-yas su mgo bo dang g-yon gyi char mjug ma'o
translated: The elephant hide is the hide of the elephant of the demon of the aggregates, which is held by the two hands, with the head to the right and the tail to the left.

original: // lha min dbang po zhes pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud de de'i ma rig pa 'jug pa ni khrag go //
analyzed: // lha min dbang po zhes pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud de de'i ma rig pa 'jug pa ni khrag go //
translated: The lord of the demigods is the demon of the sons of the gods, and his ignorance is blood.

original: de zad pa las cha tsam ni thod pa'i khrag ste khrag gi thod pa de gang gi rab mchog phyag gi mthil na yod pa de ni lha min dbang po'i khrag gi thod pa phyag mthil na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de zad pa las cha tsam ni thod pa'i khrag ste khrag gi thod pa de gang gi rab mchog phyag gi mthil na yod pa de ni lha min dbang po'i khrag gi thod pa phyag mthil na zhes pa'o //
translated: The skull cup of the blood of the lord of the demigods is the skull cup of blood that is the best part of the elephant of the demon of the sons of the gods, which is held in the palm of the hand.

original: 'chi bdag bdud kyi gdong gi phyag ces pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud zad pa las cha tsam gyi sgrib pa mgo bo gang gi phyag na yod pa de ni 'chi bdag bdud kyi gdong gi phyag go //
analyzed: 'chi bdag bdud kyi gdong gi phyag ces pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud zad pa las cha tsam gyi sgrib pa mgo bo gang gi phyag na yod pa de ni 'chi bdag bdud kyi gdong gi phyag go //
translated: The hand of the face of the demon of death is the hand that holds the head, which is the best part of the elephant of the demon of death.

original: nyon mongs bdud ni zhabs kyis bsgyel zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i @71b bdud zad pa las cha tsam gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nges par ma bsregs pa gang yin pa de ni yi dags te gang gi zhabs kya 'og tu bsgyel ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs bdud ni zhabs kyis bsgyel zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i @71b bdud zad pa las cha tsam gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nges par ma bsregs pa gang yin pa de ni yi dags te gang gi zhabs kya 'og tu bsgyel ba'o //
translated: The demon of the afflictions is kicked with the foot. From the exhaustion of the demon of the afflictions, whatever part of the obscuration of the afflictions is not definitely burned is a ghost, which is kicked under the foot.

original: des na nyon mongs bdud ni zhabs kyis bsgyel ba ste de ltar cha tsam gyi sgrib pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: des na nyon mongs bdud ni zhabs kyis bsgyel ba ste de ltar cha tsam gyi sgrib pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Therefore, the demon of the afflictions is kicked with the foot. In that way, by the parts of the obscurations.

original: gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ces pa phyag nyi shu rtsa drug pa ste lhag ma'i phyag la ni mtshon cha dus kyi 'khor lo bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ces pa phyag nyi shu rtsa drug pa ste lhag ma'i phyag la ni mtshon cha dus kyi 'khor lo bzhin no //
translated: The Victor's hands, more than two, are twenty-six hands, and the remaining hands hold weapons like the wheel of time.

original: mgo bo dang thod pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pa stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can rus pa'i phyag rgya dang klu'i dbang pos brgyan pa ste gzhan gyi don du bsgom par bya zhes pa ni gdul dka' ba'i gdul bya'i don du'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bo dang thod pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pa stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can rus pa'i phyag rgya dang klu'i dbang pos brgyan pa ste gzhan gyi don du bsgom par bya zhes pa ni gdul dka' ba'i gdul bya'i don du'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Holding a garland of heads and skulls, with a tiger-skin skirt, bone ornaments, and adorned with the lords of the nagas, one should meditate for the sake of others. This is for the sake of the difficult-to-tame disciples. This is the definite conclusion.

original: da ni de'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa de la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni de'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa de la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the characteristic of its wisdom is stated in “there” and so forth.

original: 'dir lus kyi dbye bas nyi ma ni shes rab ste zla ba ni thabs so //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi dbye bas nyi ma ni shes rab ste zla ba ni thabs so //
translated: Here, the division of the body is the sun, which is wisdom, and the moon, which is means.

original: zla ba des nyi ma las bcu gnyis lhag pa'i gcig gi rgyu ba ji srid par rgyu ste zla ba so sor khyim bcu gsum rgyu zhing nyi mas khyim gcig rgyu'o //
analyzed: zla ba des nyi ma las bcu gnyis lhag pa'i gcig gi rgyu ba ji srid par rgyu ste zla ba so sor khyim bcu gsum rgyu zhing nyi mas khyim gcig rgyu'o //
translated: The moon moves for as long as the sun moves for twelve plus one. The moon moves through the thirteen houses individually, and the sun moves through one house.

original: des na nyi ma'i rgyu ba'i dbang gis de la yum ni zhal gcig ma ste zla bdag pas so //
analyzed: des na nyi ma'i rgyu ba'i dbang gis de la yum ni zhal gcig ma ste zla bdag pas so //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the movement of the sun, the mother has one face, because of the moon.

original: zung gi phyag gi padma ni gnyis gnyis te phyag gi padma g-yas dang g-yas min de dag la gri gug dang dpal ldan zhes pa mi'i thod pa'o ;
analyzed: zung gi phyag gi padma ni gnyis gnyis te phyag gi padma g-yas dang g-yas min de dag la gri gug dang dpal ldan zhes pa mi'i thod pa'o ;
translated: The pair of hands have two lotuses, that is, the right and left hands have a flaying knife and a glorious skull.

original: / de phyir lus kyi rab tu dbye bas zhes pa zla ba'i khyim gyi phyogs kyi dbye ba nyi shu rtsa drug gis rgyal ba'i bdag po phyag nyi shu rtsa drug par 'gyur te sna tshogs yum ni de bzhin nyid du lus kyi dbye bas nyi ma'i khyim
analyzed: / de phyir lus kyi rab tu dbye bas zhes pa zla ba'i khyim gyi phyogs kyi dbye ba nyi shu rtsa drug gis rgyal ba'i bdag po phyag nyi shu rtsa drug par 'gyur te sna tshogs yum ni de bzhin nyid du lus kyi dbye bas nyi ma'i khyim
translated: Therefore, by the divisions of the body, the twenty-six divisions of the lunar mansions become the twenty-six arms of the lord of victors. The various mothers are the twenty-seven mansions of the sun.🔽

original: gcig ste phyogs kyi dbye bas sna tshogs yum phyag gnyis ma'o //
analyzed: gcig ste phyogs kyi dbye bas sna tshogs yum phyag gnyis ma'o //
translated: Therefore, by the division of the body, the Lord of Victors has twenty-six hands by the division of the twenty-six directions of the lunar mansion. The mother of diversity is one lunar mansion by the division of the directions, the mother of diversity is two-handed.

original: gcer bu skra grol ma ste lhag ma ni bcom ldan 'das bzhin du rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: gcer bu skra grol ma ste lhag ma ni bcom ldan 'das bzhin du rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: Naked, with loose hair, the rest is adorned with ornaments like the Bhagavān.

original: shes rab thabs kyi lus dang bsam pa bde mnyam 'bras ster zhes pa de ltar gsungs pa rnams kyis mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i 'bras bu ster ba ste zla ba nyi ma'i rab tu rgyu ba dbugs 'jug pa dang 'byung ba 'gog pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi lus dang bsam pa bde mnyam 'bras ster zhes pa de ltar gsungs pa rnams kyis mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i 'bras bu ster ba ste zla ba nyi ma'i rab tu rgyu ba dbugs 'jug pa dang 'byung ba 'gog pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa
translated: The body of wisdom and method, the intention of which bestows the result of supreme bliss, by such statements, the result of unchanging bliss is bestowed. The movement of the moon and sun should be meditated upon by stopping the inhalation and exhalation of breath.

original: ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.

translated: Now, the meditation on the various forms is stated: “Now, the one with one face, etc.” Here, the one with one face, etc. means the one with two faces, four faces, five faces, infinite faces, many hands and feet,

analyzed: phyag dang zhabs du ma can mtshon cha du ma 'dzin pa du ma'i kha dog dang du ma'i dbyibs te /

original: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang /
analyzed: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang /
translated: The king holds various magical displays.

original: che ba sangs rgyas rig sngags 'dzin pa ste stong pa nyid dang mi 'gyur pa 'dzin pa'i bcom ldan 'das shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: che ba sangs rgyas rig sngags 'dzin pa ste stong pa nyid dang mi 'gyur pa 'dzin pa'i bcom ldan 'das shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The great one is the Buddha, the holder of awareness mantras, the Bhagavān who holds emptiness and immutability, the embodiment of wisdom and method.

original: mun pa dag gi mthar zhes pa ni mtshan mo'i dus su mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor dang nyin mo'i dus su nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor lta ba gang yin pa de ni mtshan mo nam mkha' la lta zhing
analyzed: mun pa dag gi mthar zhes pa ni mtshan mo'i dus su mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor dang nyin mo'i dus su nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor lta ba gang yin pa de ni mtshan mo nam mkha' la lta zhing
translated: The phrase at the end of the darkness refers to the yoga of the night at the time of night and the yoga of the day at the time of day. The yoga of the perfection of wisdom is the view. That is the view of the sky at night and

original: nyin mo bla gab med pa la blta ba'o //
analyzed: nyin mo bla gab med pa la blta ba'o //
translated: the view of the open sky during the day.🔽Thus, having meditated on the culmination of form, the channel, from the cessation of the moon and sun, that is, from the cessation of the life

original: de ltar gzugs kyi mthar thug par bsgoms te rtsa ni zla ba nyi ma 'gog pa las zhes pa g-yon dang g-yas kyi srog 'gog pa las bde mnyam ster te zhes pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba ster ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi mthar thug par bsgoms te rtsa ni zla ba nyi ma 'gog pa las zhes pa g-yon dang g-yas kyi srog 'gog pa las bde mnyam ster te zhes pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba ster ro //
translated: force in the left and right, bestows the bliss of equality, that is, bestows the supreme, unchanging bliss.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams ni zhes pa sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams ni zhes pa sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams so //
translated: The phrase the elements such as earth refers to the elements such as earth.

original: 'bigs byed dri med nor bu dang mtshungs zhes pa ni ji ltar dri med nor bu chen po reg pa tsam gyis rdo la sogs pa'i khams rin po cher byed de'i 'bigs par byed ces pa 'dzoms par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bigs byed dri med nor bu dang mtshungs zhes pa ni ji ltar dri med nor bu chen po reg pa tsam gyis rdo la sogs pa'i khams rin po cher byed de'i 'bigs par byed ces pa 'dzoms par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase like a stainless gem in the Vindhya means that just as a great stainless gem, by merely being touched, turns the elements of stone, etc., into jewels, so too, the stainless gem of emptiness, by merely being touched, turns the elements of the body, such as earth, into the nature of the vajra.🔽It pierces them, that is, it makes them whole, not fragmented.

original: de bzhin du stong pa gcig pu dri ma dang bral ba ni sa la sogs pa'i lus kyi khams rnams kun nas 'bigs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa gcig pu dri ma dang bral ba ni sa la sogs pa'i lus kyi khams rnams kun nas 'bigs par byed do //
translated: In the same way, the sole emptiness, free from stains, completely pierces the elements of the body, such as earth.

original: stong pa nyid kyi gzugs can de ni thog ma med cing mtha' med dbus kyang med la yul med yul zhes pa ni yul rnams med par yul du snang ba sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang pra phab pa lta bu bsgrubs pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo ste
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi gzugs can de ni thog ma med cing mtha' med dbus kyang med la yul med yul zhes pa ni yul rnams med par yul du snang ba sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang pra phab pa lta bu bsgrubs pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo ste
translated: That form of emptiness is beginningless, endless, and also centerless, and it is without object, that is, it appears as an object without objects, like an illusion, a dream, or a divination. The accomplishment is the wheel of time.

original: bde mnyam ster ba'o //
analyzed: bde mnyam ster ba'o //
translated: It bestows the bliss of equality.

original: zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: de ltar dpal ldan dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pas gsungs pa ste 'di'i rgyas pa ni ye shes kyi le'u las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dpal ldan dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pas gsungs pa ste 'di'i rgyas pa ni ye shes kyi le'u las brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection stage is taught in the sadhana of the glorious primordial buddha. Its extensive version will be described in the chapter on wisdom.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las skyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub thabs kyi mdor bsdus chen po ste bzhi ba'o /

translated: This concludes the fourth chapter, the great summary of the sadhana of the creation and perfection stages from the Stainless Light, a commentary on the Wheel of Time, the king of all tantras, that follows the root tantra in twelve thousand sections.

original: // / rje bo sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: // / rje bo sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: Homage to the lord, the holder of the vajra of diversity,

original: khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyi gtso //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyi gtso //
translated: the chief of the kings of wrathful ones,

original: rdo rje shugs la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: rdo rje shugs la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: having bowed to the one with vajra speed,

original: sgrub thabs sna @72b tshogs bshad par bya /
analyzed: sgrub thabs sna @72b tshogs bshad par bya /

original: khro bo'i dbang po zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: khro bo'i dbang po zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: With the words “the lord of wrathful ones” and so forth.

original: 'dir khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs ni sngar gsungs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi cho gas h'um yig dang rdo rje las rdzogs pa ste gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ces pa phyag nyi shu rtsa drug pa glang po che'i pags pa'i gos 'dzin pa rig byed zhal zhes
analyzed: 'dir khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs ni sngar gsungs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi cho gas h'um yig dang rdo rje las rdzogs pa ste gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ces pa phyag nyi shu rtsa drug pa glang po che'i pags pa'i gos 'dzin pa rig byed zhal zhes
translated: Here, the lord of wrath Vajrasena is perfected from the syllable hūṃ and a vajra by the rite of the previously explained sādhana. He has two more hands than the twenty-four hands of the conqueror, that is, twenty-six hands, and he holds an elephant-skin garment. He is called “the Veda-faced one”🔽because he has four faces. He has two legs, and his eyes and hair are orange. He is called “the crown of the lord of conquerors”

original: pa zhal bzhi pa zhabs gnyis pa dmar ser spyan dang dbu skra dmar ser rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan zhes pa mi bskyod pa'i cod pan can mche ba rnon po gtsigs pa sprul gyi rgyan dang zhes pa sbrul gyis brgyan par ba mchog stag gi pags pa'i
analyzed: pa zhal bzhi pa zhabs gnyis pa dmar ser spyan dang dbu skra dmar ser rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan zhes pa mi bskyod pa'i cod pan can mche ba rnon po gtsigs pa sprul gyi rgyan dang zhes pa sbrul gyis brgyan par ba mchog stag gi pags pa'i
translated: because he has a crown of Akṣobhya. He bares his sharp fangs. He is “adorned with snakes,” that is, adorned with snakes. He wears an

analyzed: sham thabs can gtso bo'i bzhin du mtshon cha'i phyag ste dus kyi 'khor lo lta bu dang spyi bor mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs rnam par dag pa'i thod pa kha dog lnga rnams dag gis phreng ba nges par bcings pa'o //
translated: excellent tiger-skin skirt. His hands hold weapons, like those of Kālacakra. On his head is a garland of five-colored skulls of the pure lineage of all conquerors.

original: de ltar gyur pa dri med 'phro ba ste dang ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa sna tshogs mdog la dbus su sna tshogs chu skyes dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dpa' bo gcig pa ste sgo bzhi rnams su rdo rje lcags khyu dang rdo rje
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dri med 'phro ba ste dang ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa sna tshogs mdog la dbus su sna tshogs chu skyes dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dpa' bo gcig pa ste sgo bzhi rnams su rdo rje lcags khyu dang rdo rje
