translated: The two feet of the lord of the bhūtas, the lord of the pretas, Acala, are pressed down with the weight of the hero, standing with his right leg straight.

analyzed: po la sogs pa rnams skrag par byed pa'i glang po che'i pags pa 'dzin pa lag pa'i sdigs mdzub dag gis lha min gdengs can lha rnams skrag par byed pa ste dza:h'um bam ho:sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis ye shes sems dpa' dang / gcig tu gyur pa rnal 'byor pas bsgoms na zla ba gcig nyid kho nas dur khrod sa la gnas pa zhes pa dur khrod kyi sar gnas pa'i 'byung ba'i tshogs na bsgrub par bya zhes pa 'byung po la sogs pa rnams kyi gtso bo gang yin pa de

analyzed: gzugs des zhabs kyi 'og tu bsgyel bar gyur pa na 'khor dang bcas pa 'grub par 'gyur te /

original: yi dags sam srin po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi dags sam srin po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The retinue is the pretas, rakshasas, and so on.

original: 'byung po la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the means of accomplishing the bhutas and so on.

original: da ni sprin gyi char dbang pa'i don du klu'i rgyal po'i @73a * //
analyzed: da ni sprin gyi char dbang pa'i don du klu'i rgyal po'i @73a * //
translated: Now, for the sake of controlling the rain clouds, the king of the nagas is to be accomplished.

original: sgrub thabs gsungs pa klu rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub thabs gsungs pa klu rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The sādhana is stated by “the nāgas” and so forth.

original: 'dir khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs de nyid bsgoms par gyur pas nyin zhag nyung zad rnams kyis zhes pa zla ba'i nyin zhag rnams kyis sprin gyi tshogs ni bsgrub par bya ste de ltar zhes pa cho ga 'dis so //🔽klu rnams chu skyes 'dab brgyad la ste zhes pa ni chu skyes kyi shar gyi 'dab ma la stobs kyi rgyu dang / mer padma dang / lhor nor rgyas kyi bu dang / bden bral du dung skyong dang / byang du mtha' yas dang / dbang ldan du rigs ldan dang /
analyzed: 'dir khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs de nyid bsgoms par gyur pas nyin zhag nyung zad rnams kyis zhes pa zla ba'i nyin zhag rnams kyis sprin gyi tshogs ni bsgrub par bya ste de ltar zhes pa cho ga 'dis so // klu rnams chu skyes 'dab brgyad la ste zhes pa ni chu skyes kyi shar gyi 'dab ma la stobs kyi rgyu dang / mer padma dang / lhor nor rgyas kyi bu dang / bden bral du dung skyong dang / byang du mtha' yas dang / dbang ldan du rigs ldan dang /
translated: Here, by meditating on that Lord of Wrath Vajrāveśa, in a few days, that is, in lunar days, one should accomplish the mass of clouds, that is, the rain, in that way, by this rite.

original: nub tu 'jog po dang / rlung du padma chen po ste /
analyzed: nub tu 'jog po dang / rlung du padma chen po ste /
translated: The nāgas are on the eight-petaled lotus, that is, on the east petal of the lotus, Balāhaka; on the south, Vāsuki; on the west, Takṣaka; on the north, Kulika; on the southeast, Padma; on the southwest, Śaṅkhapāla; on the northwest, Ananta; and on the northeast, Mahāpadma.

original: shar dang mer nag po dag dang / lho dang bden bral du dmar po dag dang / byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po dag dag /
analyzed: shar dang mer nag po dag dang / lho dang bden bral du dmar po dag dang / byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po dag dag /
translated: They are black in the east and south, red in the south and southwest, white in the north and northeast,

original: nub dang rlung du ser po dag go //
analyzed: nub dang rlung du ser po dag go //
translated: and yellow in the west and northwest.

original: klu'i rgyal po rgyal dang rnam rgyal ljang khu dang sngon po dag ni nyi ma'i steng du bsgyel byas nas zhes pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i zhabs kyi 'og tu lte ba yan chad skyes bu'i rnam pa man chad sbrul gyi rnam pa
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po rgyal dang rnam rgyal ljang khu dang sngon po dag ni nyi ma'i steng du bsgyel byas nas zhes pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i zhabs kyi 'og tu lte ba yan chad skyes bu'i rnam pa man chad sbrul gyi rnam pa
translated: Their bellies are above the sun mandala, and their feet are below it.🔽The upper parts of their bodies are human, and the lower parts are snakes.

original: mgo'i steng na gdengs ka bdun gyi khor yug can nor bu chen po 'phro ba dag gan rkyal du bsgyel cing /
analyzed: mgo'i steng na gdengs ka bdun gyi khor yug can nor bu chen po 'phro ba dag gan rkyal du bsgyel cing /
translated: They are supine with seven hoods above their heads, and they radiate great jewels.

original: klu'i rgyal po gzhan rnams bsgyel nas ;
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po gzhan rnams bsgyel nas ;
translated: The other kings of the nagas are supine.

original: de rnams kyi mjug ma'i rtse mo ni so sor rgyal ba'i steng du shar dang byang gi rnams dang rnam par rgyal pa'i steng du lho dang nub kyi rnams kyi mjug ma'i rtse mo thams cad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mjug ma'i rtse mo ni so sor rgyal ba'i steng du shar dang byang gi rnams dang rnam par rgyal pa'i steng du lho dang nub kyi rnams kyi mjug ma'i rtse mo thams cad do //
translated: The tips of their tails are in the east and north, above Jaya, and in the south and west, above Vijaya.

original: de ltar zhabs dag gis ni gdengs can bdag po zur dang padma'i 'dab mar gnas pa rnams kyi mjug ma'i rtse mo thams cad mnan nas zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar zhabs dag gis ni gdengs can bdag po zur dang padma'i 'dab mar gnas pa rnams kyi mjug ma'i rtse mo thams cad mnan nas zhes so //
translated: Thus, with his feet, he presses down on all the tips of the tails of the lords of the nagas, who are in the corners and on the lotus petals.

original: de ltar klu'i rgyal po brgyad ni gdengs ka lnga dang ldan pa sprin gyi rigs te sprin tshogs lto bdag nas nges par kun du spro byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar klu'i rgyal po brgyad ni gdengs ka lnga dang ldan pa sprin gyi rigs te sprin tshogs lto bdag nas nges par kun du spro byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the eight nāga kings are endowed with five hoods, and are of the cloud family, and the cloud-mass is definitely emitted from the belly.

original: de ltar dur khrod kyi sar khro bo'i dbang po bsgoms pas zla ba'i nyin zhag rnams kyis sprin gyi tshogs ni bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dur khrod kyi sar khro bo'i dbang po bsgoms pas zla ba'i nyin zhag rnams kyis sprin gyi tshogs ni bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Thus, by meditating on the Lord of Wrath in the charnel ground, the cloud-mass is accomplished by the lunar days.

original: de nas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dus su char 'bebs par byed cing gshegs su gsol bas zlog par byed do //
analyzed: de nas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dus su char 'bebs par byed cing gshegs su gsol bas zlog par byed do //
translated: Then, at the desired time, it rains, and by requesting it, it is stopped.

original: klu'i rgyal po'i sgrub thabs kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po'i sgrub thabs kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the method of achieving the nāga kings.

original: da ni las kyi dbye ba rnams kyis lha'i sgrub thabs gsungs pa zhes pa la @73b sogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni las kyi dbye ba rnams kyis lha'i sgrub thabs gsungs pa zhes pa la @73b sogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the method of achieving the gods is stated by the divisions of the rites.

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa la sogs pa dang mi yi bdag po gzhan lha dang lha mo rnams kyi sgrub thabs so so ru dkyil 'khor 'dir ni dpa' bo gcig pa rnams kyis 'gyur te rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis ni rnam par snang mdzad
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa la sogs pa dang mi yi bdag po gzhan lha dang lha mo rnams kyi sgrub thabs so so ru dkyil 'khor 'dir ni dpa' bo gcig pa rnams kyis 'gyur te rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis ni rnam par snang mdzad
translated: Here, in this mandala, the methods of achieving the lords of men and the other gods and goddesses are transformed into the methods of achieving the heroes, by the power of one's own victorious lineage.

original: la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbang gis las kyi dbye ba mtha' dag rnams kyi sgrub thabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbang gis las kyi dbye ba mtha' dag rnams kyi sgrub thabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of the lineage of Vairochana, etc., they become the methods of achieving all the varieties of ritual action.

original: rengs dang zhi ba dag dang dbang dang gzhan nor 'phrog dang gsad pa dang ni bskrad pa la sogs pa dag la yang sum cu rtsa drug rnal 'byor ma rnams dang gzhan dur khrod kyi mthar thug pa rnams kyi 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sgrub thabs su 'gyur te
analyzed: rengs dang zhi ba dag dang dbang dang gzhan nor 'phrog dang gsad pa dang ni bskrad pa la sogs pa dag la yang sum cu rtsa drug rnal 'byor ma rnams dang gzhan dur khrod kyi mthar thug pa rnams kyi 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sgrub thabs su 'gyur te
translated: In the case of paralysis, pacification, subjugation, stealing the wealth of others, killing, banishing, etc., the methods of achieving the thirty-six yoginis and the other [heroes] up to the end of the charnel grounds will be explained.

original: / slar yang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg ni rang rang gi sngags kyi sa bon rnams kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / slar yang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg ni rang rang gi sngags kyi sa bon rnams kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, the recitation and the homa are [performed] with the seed syllables of their respective mantras.

original: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i bsams gtan gsungs pa zhi ba la ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i bsams gtan gsungs pa zhi ba la ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the meditative stabilities of pacification and so forth are taught:

original: 'dir zhi ba la bsam gtan zhi ba dang ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar ba'i lha zhi ba'i gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhi ba la bsam gtan zhi ba dang ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar ba'i lha zhi ba'i gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Pacification is meditative stability, and the deity is white like a rabbit's fur.

original: drag po gsad pa la sogs pa la bsam gtan drag po dang lha kha dog nag po'o //
analyzed: drag po gsad pa la sogs pa la bsam gtan drag po dang lha kha dog nag po'o //
translated: Agitation is meditative stability, and the deity is black.

original: dbang la bsam gtan chags pa dang bcas pa dang lha kha dog dmar po chags pa'i gzugs so ;
analyzed: dbang la bsam gtan chags pa dang bcas pa dang lha kha dog dmar po chags pa'i gzugs so ;
translated: Power is meditative stability, and the deity is red.

original: / rengs pa la bsam gtan rmongs pa dang lha kha dog ser po rengs pa'i gzugs so //🔽zhi ba la ji lta ba de bzhin du rgyas pa dang rims nye bar zhi ba dang dug gzhil ba la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / rengs pa la bsam gtan rmongs pa dang lha kha dog ser po rengs pa'i gzugs so // zhi ba la ji lta ba de bzhin du rgyas pa dang rims nye bar zhi ba dang dug gzhil ba la 'gyur ro //
translated: Paralysis is meditative stability, and the deity is yellow.🔽Just as with pacification, so it is with enrichment, the pacification of contagious diseases, and the neutralization of poison.

original: gsad pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du bskrad pa dang dbye ba dang rims gzhug pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gsad pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du bskrad pa dang dbye ba dang rims gzhug pa la yang ngo //
translated: Just as with killing, so it is with banishing, separating, and inducing contagious disease.

original: dbang la ji lta bde bzhin du dgug pa dang bskyod pa dang rims bskyed pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: dbang la ji lta bde bzhin du dgug pa dang bskyod pa dang rims bskyed pa la yang ngo //
translated: As with the empowerment, so also with summoning, shaking, and generating fever.

original: rengs pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du rmongs pa dang phur bus gdab pa la yang ngo zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rengs pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du rmongs pa dang phur bus gdab pa la yang ngo zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: As with immobilization, so also with confusion and nailing down.

original: da ni tshogs kyi rigs rnams kyis zhi ba la sogs pa 'grub par gsungs pa zhi dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni tshogs kyi rigs rnams kyis zhi ba la sogs pa 'grub par gsungs pa zhi dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the families of the hosts are said to accomplish pacification, etc.🔽Here, pacification and prosperity are the family of the Victor and his sons.

original: 'dir zhi dang rgyas pa dag kyang sras bcas rgyal ba'i rigs dang zhes pa ni 'dir gzugs dang / tsher ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed de bzhi po 'di rnams ni rgyal ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir zhi dang rgyas pa dag kyang sras bcas rgyal ba'i rigs dang zhes pa ni 'dir gzugs dang / tsher ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed de bzhi po 'di rnams ni rgyal ba'i rigs so //
translated: Here, these four—form, feeling, perception, and mental formations—are the family of the Victor.

original: sras bcas zhes pa ni rnam par sel ba dang / @74a * //
analyzed: sras bcas zhes pa ni rnam par sel ba dang / @74a * //
translated: “And his sons” refers to the bodhisattvas.

original: sa'i snying po dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / nam mkha'i snying po ste 'di rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs so //
analyzed: sa'i snying po dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / nam mkha'i snying po ste 'di rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs so //
translated: Kṣitigarbha, Lokêśvara, and Ākāśagarbha are the family of the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du spyan ma dang gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i dang sgrol ma rnams ni rgyal ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyan ma dang gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i dang sgrol ma rnams ni rgyal ba'i rigs so //
translated: Likewise, Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Tārā are the victors’ clan.🔽Gandhe-vajrā, Rasavajrā, Rūpa-vajrā, and Sparśa-vajrā are the bodhisattva clan.

original: dri rdo rje ma dang / ro rdo rje ma dang ; gzugs rdo rje ma dang / reg bya rdo rje ma rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs te rigs 'di rnams kha dog dkar po dpral bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la padma'i 'dug stangs kyis gnas pa thabs rnams padma dkar po dang mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya dang shes rab rnams autpala dkar po🔽dang mi 'jigs pa'i phyag can du bsgoms pa so sor re res zhi dang rgyas pa dag kyang 'grub par 'gyur te rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: dri rdo rje ma dang / ro rdo rje ma dang ; gzugs rdo rje ma dang / reg bya rdo rje ma rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs te rigs 'di rnams kha dog dkar po dpral bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la padma'i 'dug stangs kyis gnas pa thabs rnams padma dkar po dang mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya dang shes rab rnams autpala dkar po dang mi 'jigs pa'i phyag can du bsgoms pa so sor re res zhi dang rgyas pa dag kyang 'grub par 'gyur te rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: These clans are white in color, standing on moon disks in their foreheads in the lotus posture. The methods are white lotuses and the boon-granting gesture. The insights are white utpalas and the boon-granting gesture.🔽Each of them individually accomplishes pacification and increase.

original: kyang yig gis dug med pa nyid dang rims nye bar zhi ba yang ngo //
analyzed: kyang yig gis dug med pa nyid dang rims nye bar zhi ba yang ngo //
translated: The word “also” indicates that they also accomplish the removal of poison and the pacification of fevers.

original: dbye ba dang bskrad pa dag dang kyang yig gis gsad ba dang dug gzhug pa dag kyang rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zhes pa khro bo'i rang bzhin gyis dbang gis 'khor bo las skyes rnams kyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbye ba dang bskrad pa dag dang kyang yig gis gsad ba dang dug gzhug pa dag kyang rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zhes pa khro bo'i rang bzhin gyis dbang gis 'khor bo las skyes rnams kyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by the nature of the wrathful ones, those born from the wheel and so on accomplish the divisions, the expulsion, the killing by the syllable kham, and the insertion of poison.

original: khro bo las skyes ni h'um yig dang rdo rje las skyes pa khro bo bcu po rnams dang phrem yig dang gri gug las skyes pa khro bo bcu'i btsun mo rnams te /
analyzed: khro bo las skyes ni h'um yig dang rdo rje las skyes pa khro bo bcu po rnams dang phrem yig dang gri gug las skyes pa khro bo bcu'i btsun mo rnams te /
translated: Those born from the wrathful ones are the ten wrathful ones born from the syllable hum and the vajra, and the ten wrathful queens born from the syllable tram and the flaying knife.

original: snying khar sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la khro bo g-yas brkyang gi stabs phyag na rdo rje dang zhags pa can rnams kyis gsad pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying khar sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la khro bo g-yas brkyang gi stabs phyag na rdo rje dang zhags pa can rnams kyis gsad pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those born from the wheel accomplish the killing by the wrathful ones standing with right leg extended, with a vajra and noose in their hands, on the mandala of Rahu in the heart.

original: phyag na ral gri dang lcags sgrog sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa rnams kyis dbye ba la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur te kha dog nag po drag po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phyag na ral gri dang lcags sgrog sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa rnams kyis dbye ba la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur te kha dog nag po drag po rnams kyis so //
translated: Those with a sword, iron chain, and threatening forefinger in their hands accomplish the divisions and so on, with a fierce black color.

original: lha mo g-yon brkyang ba phyag na gri gug dang thod pa can rnams dang phyag na ral gri dang zhags pa can rnams kyis so //
analyzed: lha mo g-yon brkyang ba phyag na gri gug dang thod pa can rnams dang phyag na ral gri dang zhags pa can rnams kyis so //
translated: The goddesses with hooked knife and skull bowl, and those with sword and noose, are in the left and right extended-bow postures.

original: dbang sogs 'byung skyes rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'dir rtsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad po mgrin par nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las ga'i stabs kha dog dmar po phyag na mda' gzhu can rnams kyis dbang du bya ba 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang sogs 'byung skyes rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'dir rtsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad po mgrin par nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las ga'i stabs kha dog dmar po phyag na mda' gzhu can rnams kyis dbang du bya ba 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: “Those born from the elements, such as subjugation,” and so on, refers to the eight goddesses such as Rākṣasi, who are in the throat, on sun maṇḍalas, in the ālīḍha posture, red in color, and holding bows and arrows.

original: phyag na zhags pa dang lcags kyu can rnams kyis dgug pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na zhags pa dang lcags kyu can rnams kyis dgug pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: They accomplish subjugation. Those with nooses and hooks accomplish summoning and so on.

original: rab gsal lha @74b min rigs la phur bus gdab pa 'ang lha min mo rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'dir khyi gdong ma la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad po lte bar dus me'i dkyil 'khor ser po la zlum po'i stabs phyag na 'khor lo dang ri bo can
analyzed: rab gsal lha @74b min rigs la phur bus gdab pa 'ang lha min mo rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'dir khyi gdong ma la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad po lte bar dus me'i dkyil 'khor ser po la zlum po'i stabs phyag na 'khor lo dang ri bo can
translated: “The stake of the very clear asura family is also the asura women,” and so on, refers to the eight goddesses such as Śvānavaktrā, who are in the navel, on yellow kālāgni maṇḍalas, in the ālīḍha posture, holding wheels and mountains,

original: rnams kyis rengs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnams kyis rengs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: and accomplish immobilization.

original: phyag na thab  dang phur bu can rnams kyis phur bus gdab pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na thab  dang phur bu can rnams kyis phur bus gdab pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who hold a hearth and dagger in their hands will accomplish the stabbing.🔽Those who hold a trident and a snake will accomplish the bewildering.🔽Those who hold a lotus and a wheel will accomplish the pacifying.

original: phyag na rtse gsum dang sprul rnams kyis rmongs pa 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na rtse gsum dang sprul rnams kyis rmongs pa 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who hold a hook and a noose will accomplish the summoning.🔽Those who hold a sword and a shield will accomplish the slaying.🔽Those who hold a pestle and a club will accomplish the paralyzing.🔽Those who hold a banner and a flag will accomplish the enthralling.🔽Those who hold a vase and a jewel will accomplish the enriching.🔽Those who hold a lotus and a sword will accomplish the liberating.🔽Those who hold a wheel and a lotus will accomplish the pacifying.

original: yum dag gis ni zhes pa rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'am shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin mas gsung ba'i padma la las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /🔽chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbye bas dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang sngar brjod pa'i mtshan ma dang 'dug stangs so sor re res so //
analyzed: yum dag gis ni zhes pa rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'am shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin mas gsung ba'i padma la las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te / chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbye bas dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang sngar brjod pa'i mtshan ma dang 'dug stangs so sor re res so //
translated: Those who hold a hook and a noose will accomplish the summoning.🔽Those who hold a sword and a shield will accomplish the slaying.

original: gsad pa dang gso ba yang 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsad pa dang gso ba yang 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who hold a pestle and a club will accomplish the paralyzing.🔽Those who hold a banner and a flag will accomplish the enthralling.🔽Those who hold a vase and a jewel will accomplish the enriching.🔽Those who hold a lotus and a sword will accomplish the liberating.🔽Those who hold a wheel and a lotus will accomplish the pacifying.

original: rdo rje'i 'dug stangs kyis thig le'i dbus su dga' ba dang bcas pa'i lha mos gso bar byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'dug stangs kyis thig le'i dbus su dga' ba dang bcas pa'i lha mos gso bar byed do //
translated: Those who hold a hook and a noose will accomplish the summoning.🔽Those who hold a sword and a shield will accomplish the slaying.🔽Those who hold a pestle and a club will accomplish the paralyzing.🔽Those who hold a banner and a flag will accomplish the enthralling.🔽Those who hold a vase and a jewel will accomplish the enriching.🔽Those who hold a lotus and a sword will accomplish the liberating.🔽Those who hold a wheel and a lotus will accomplish the pacifying.🔽Those who hold a hook and a noose will accomplish the summoning.🔽Those who hold a sword and a shield will accomplish the slaying.🔽Those who hold a pestle and a club will accomplish the paralyzing.🔽Those who hold a banner and a flag will accomplish the enthralling.🔽Those who hold a vase and a jewel will accomplish the enriching.🔽Those who hold a lotus and a sword will accomplish the liberating.🔽Those who hold a wheel and a lotus will accomplish the pacifying.🔽Those who hold a hook and a noose will accomplish the summoning.🔽Those who hold a sword and a shield will accomplish the slaying.

original: rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis srog bkug ste thig le 'phos pas ni chags pa dang bral bas 'chi bar byed de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis srog bkug ste thig le 'phos pas ni chags pa dang bral bas 'chi bar byed de /
translated: Those who hold a pestle and a club will accomplish the paralyzing.🔽Those who hold a banner

original: slar yang bsgrub bya rab tu 'tsho ba med do //
analyzed: slar yang bsgrub bya rab tu 'tsho ba med do //
translated: Again, the object of the rite is not alive.

original: des na de ni sangs rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgrub par mi bya ste /
analyzed: des na de ni sangs rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgrub par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that is not to be accomplished by the Buddhist yogin.

original: gang du bsgrub bya'i srog bkug pa na khu ba phyir 'byung bar 'gyur pa'o zhes pa ste las thams cad la nges pa'o //
analyzed: gang du bsgrub bya'i srog bkug pa na khu ba phyir 'byung bar 'gyur pa'o zhes pa ste las thams cad la nges pa'o //
translated: Where the life of the object of the rite is drawn out, the semen is emitted.

original: da ni las thams cad kyi sgrub thams rnams kyi dang po'i rgyu gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni las thams cad kyi sgrub thams rnams kyi dang po'i rgyu gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the cause of the first of all the accomplishments of all rites is stated beginning with “firstly,” and so forth.

original: 'dir dang por rnal 'byor bas 'bad pa yis ni bla ma'i man ngag las bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dang por rnal 'byor bas 'bad pa yis ni bla ma'i man ngag las bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Here, firstly, the yogin should strive to accomplish by the guru’s instruction.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes pa ni srog gi rlung ste rtag tu dbu mar rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes pa ni srog gi rlung ste rtag tu dbu mar rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The “wheel of time” is the life-force wind, which should always be inserted into the central channel.

original: srid gsum skyed ma zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi gzugs te gzugs dang srog gnyis po de dag 'bad pa yis ni bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: srid gsum skyed ma zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi gzugs te gzugs dang srog gnyis po de dag 'bad pa yis ni bsgrub par bya /
translated: The “mother of the three worlds” is the form of emptiness. Those two, form and life, should be accomplished with effort.

original: phyi nas sa gzhi'i gnas dag tu ni gang zhig gsungs bzhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams thams cad bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nas sa gzhi'i gnas dag tu ni gang zhig gsungs bzhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams thams cad bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in the places of the earth, one should accomplish all the rites, such as the fourth rite, and so on.

original: 'dir dpe ni pha dang ma yis rnam par dman pa'i bu ni yod pa min par dus kun du ni 'jig rten grags /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni pha dang ma yis rnam par dman pa'i bu ni yod pa min par dus kun du ni 'jig rten grags /
translated: Here, the example: a son who is deficient in father and mother is not existent, and is known in the world at all times.

original: de phyir bde mnyam @75a * //
analyzed: de phyir bde mnyam @75a * //
translated: Therefore, the result of the bliss of equality

original: 'bras ster gzugs dang srog gnyis po bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras ster gzugs dang srog gnyis po bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: is the attainment of the two, form and life.

original: rnam pa gzhan du gzugs dang srog ma bsgrubs pas las ni 'grub pa yod pa min no zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du gzugs dang srog ma bsgrubs pas las ni 'grub pa yod pa min no zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, without the attainment of form and life, the rite is not existent, is the determination.

original: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i slad du dang po'i bsgom pa gsungs pa gtso bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i slad du dang po'i bsgom pa gsungs pa gtso bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to accomplish pacification and so on, the meditation of the first is stated: the principal, etc.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas aa ba dh'u t'i la srog gnas pa gzugs rnam par gsal ba mthong ba de'i tshe gzugs de ji ltar rnam par brtags pa de ltar gzugs de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas aa ba dh'u t'i la srog gnas pa gzugs rnam par gsal ba mthong ba de'i tshe gzugs de ji ltar rnam par brtags pa de ltar gzugs de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the yogin sees the life abiding in the avadhūtī, the clear form, at that time, that form is seen just as it is imagined.

original: gtso bo zhes pa ni sngar gsungs pa'i dus kyi 'khor lo rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes pa ni sngar gsungs pa'i dus kyi 'khor lo rdzogs par byas te /
translated: The principal one is the previously mentioned Kālacakra, who is complete.

original: de nas de'i thugs khar padma'i dbus kyi lte ba la ri bong can dang nyi ma me zhes pa zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan te gsum gyi bdag nyid sbyor ba'i gza'i dkyil 'khor dang nang du la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa ba🔽dh'u t'i gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa snying ga'i padma ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i thugs khar padma'i dbus kyi lte ba la ri bong can dang nyi ma me zhes pa zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan te gsum gyi bdag nyid sbyor ba'i gza'i dkyil 'khor dang nang du la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa ba dh'u t'i gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa snying ga'i padma ste /
translated: Then, in his heart, in the center of a lotus, in the middle of the navel, the moon, sun, and Rāhu, which are the nature of the three planets, the orb of the sun, and internally, the lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūti, which are united into one, are the heart lotus.

original: de'i steng du rdo rje ni hum yig yongs su gyur pa las byung ba 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa zhes pa kha dog nag po rtse mo lnga pa 'od zer dang bcas zhes pa 'od zer lnga 'phro ba dgo dar bya'o //🔽de yi dbus su zhes pa ni rdo rje de'i dbus te lte bar dza ;
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo rje ni hum yig yongs su gyur pa las byung ba 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa zhes pa kha dog nag po rtse mo lnga pa 'od zer dang bcas zhes pa 'od zer lnga 'phro ba dgo dar bya'o // de yi dbus su zhes pa ni rdo rje de'i dbus te lte bar dza ;
translated: Above that, the vajra is the letter hūṃ, which arises from the transformation of that, which is like a cloud at the time of destruction, which is black in color, with five points, and with light rays, which is the emission of five light rays.

original: yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje lcags kyu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje lcags kyu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In its center is the letter ja, which is in the middle of that vajra, in the center, which is the transformation of the letter ja, one should meditate on the vajra hook.

original: de nas dza: yi lcags kyu de'i 'od zer rdo rje lcags kyu'i rnam pa rnams kyis srid pa gsum po zhes pa khams gsum po mtha' dag bkad byas nas /
analyzed: de nas dza: yi lcags kyu de'i 'od zer rdo rje lcags kyu'i rnam pa rnams kyis srid pa gsum po zhes pa khams gsum po mtha' dag bkad byas nas /
translated: Then, by the light rays of the hook of JAḤ, in the form of vajra hooks, having pervaded the three existences, all three realms,

original: rdo rje lcags kyu de rnams kyis srid pa gsum gyi rnam ba can dang ba khyab byed nyid kyis rnam gsum srid par gnas pa'i ye shes 'khor lo gang yin pa de thams cad bkug nas aa ba dh'u t'i'i sgo nas gtsug tor dang dpral ba dang mgrin
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu de rnams kyis srid pa gsum gyi rnam ba can dang ba khyab byed nyid kyis rnam gsum srid par gnas pa'i ye shes 'khor lo gang yin pa de thams cad bkug nas aa ba dh'u t'i'i sgo nas gtsug tor dang dpral ba dang mgrin
translated: those vajra hooks, having summoned all the wheels of exalted wisdom abiding in the three existences, which have the aspect of the three existences, and having pervaded the space of the three existences,

original: pa dang snying kha dang lte ba dang gsang ba'i lam du rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang snying kha dang lte ba dang gsang ba'i lam du rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should cause them to enter through the door of the central channel, the crown, the forehead, the throat, the heart, the navel, and the secret place.

original: rnam pa thams cad ba zla ba zhu ba dang mtshungs zhes pa byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de rang gi rdo rje'i kha nas yum gyi padmar spro bar bya zhes pa ni skyes bus rang gi rdo rje'i sgo nas bud med kyi padmar
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ba zla ba zhu ba dang mtshungs zhes pa byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de rang gi rdo rje'i kha nas yum gyi padmar spro bar bya zhes pa ni skyes bus rang gi rdo rje'i sgo nas bud med kyi padmar
translated: All aspects, similar to the melting of the moon, the characteristic of the exalted wisdom of the bodhicitta, should be emanated from one’s vajra mouth into the mother’s lotus.

original: byang chub kyi sems dga' ba dang ldan par spro bar byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha'i @75b rnal 'byor gyis lha mo'i padmar spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dga' ba dang ldan par spro bar byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha'i @75b rnal 'byor gyis lha mo'i padmar spro bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the bodhicitta is emitted with joy, so too it is emitted into the lotus of the goddess through the yoga of the deity.

original: yum zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams kyi skyed mdzad ma ste mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: yum zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams kyi skyed mdzad ma ste mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The mother is the producer of those to be explained, just as she is the one who gives birth from the womb.🔽There, the bodhicitta that has entered the sun is the bodhicitta that has entered the blood in the womb of the woman, which becomes of one taste with the blood.

original: der ni nyi mar rab tu zhugs pa zhes pa 'dir bud med kyi skye gnas su khrag la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub kyi sems khrag dang lhan cig ro mnyam par 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du yum gyi padmar nyi ma'i dbus su rab tu🔽zhugs pa'i zla ba ni ro mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der ni nyi mar rab tu zhugs pa zhes pa 'dir bud med kyi skye gnas su khrag la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub kyi sems khrag dang lhan cig ro mnyam par 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du yum gyi padmar nyi ma'i dbus su rab tu zhugs pa'i zla ba ni ro mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the moon that has entered the center of the sun in the lotus of the mother becomes of one taste.

original: aa sogs dang ldan pa zla ba zhu ba dang / ka sogs dang ldan pa nyi ma rdul te srog dang thur sel dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: aa sogs dang ldan pa zla ba zhu ba dang / ka sogs dang ldan pa nyi ma rdul te srog dang thur sel dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: The moon that is endowed with the vowels is the melted moon, and the sun that is endowed with the consonants is the dust of the sun, endowed with the life-force and downward-voiding winds.

original: / de yi dbus su ste srog dang thur sel gyi dbus su ye shes sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de yi dbus su ste srog dang thur sel gyi dbus su ye shes sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In the middle of that, in the middle of the life and downward winds, the seed of wisdom becomes the characteristic of the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: rigs kyi dbang gis so zhe sa ni phung po lnga'i bag chags kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes par 'gyur pa de bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi ye shes kyi sa bon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbang gis so zhe sa ni phung po lnga'i bag chags kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes par 'gyur pa de bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi ye shes kyi sa bon du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of the family, just as the consciousness of sentient beings becomes the seed of the wisdom of the karma of pacification and so on by the power of the traces of the five aggregates,

original: sa bon de yis rdzogs pa'i gzhon nu ma 'am /
analyzed: sa bon de yis rdzogs pa'i gzhon nu ma 'am /
translated: that seed gives the result of a perfect maiden or youth,🔽at the end of twelve years or at the end of sixteen years.

original: gzhon nu lo bcu gnyis kyi mtha' dang lo bcu drug gi mthar 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha mo'am thabs kyi lha rnal 'byor pas bsgoms pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu lo bcu gnyis kyi mtha' dang lo bcu drug gi mthar 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha mo'am thabs kyi lha rnal 'byor pas bsgoms pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Just so, the yogin of the method, the deity, meditates on the goddess.

original: de'i phyir lo bcu gnyis rnams su lha mo bsgoms pas mchog ster bar 'gyur zhing lha ni lo bcu drug rnams kyis mchog ster bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lo bcu gnyis rnams su lha mo bsgoms pas mchog ster bar 'gyur zhing lha ni lo bcu drug rnams kyis mchog ster bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the goddess gives the supreme result in twelve years, and the deity gives the supreme result in sixteen years.

original: de nas las thams cad dang dngos grub thams cad dang bde ba thams cad rnal 'byor pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas las thams cad dang dngos grub thams cad dang bde ba thams cad rnal 'byor pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, all actions, all powers, and all bliss are accomplished by the yogin.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig ste rgyud gzhan thams cad las dus nges pa ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa nyin dang mtshan mor bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi yin gyi gzhan rnams kyi ni lo brgya'i mthar yang ma yin no zhes pa
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig ste rgyud gzhan thams cad las dus nges pa ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa nyin dang mtshan mor bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi yin gyi gzhan rnams kyi ni lo brgya'i mthar yang ma yin no zhes pa
translated: Otherwise, only the afflictions are certain, and all other tantras are not for those who are diligent and meditate day and night, but not for others even after a hundred years.

original: dngos grub nges pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of powers.

original: da ni mtshan ma bskyed pa'i slad du ye shes kyi sa bon rnams gsungs pa dza:zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dza:h'um bam ho:rim pas zhes pa ni dza:yig las rdo rje lcags kyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni mtshan ma bskyed pa'i slad du ye shes kyi sa bon rnams gsungs pa dza:zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dza:h'um bam ho:rim pas zhes pa ni dza:yig las rdo rje lcags kyur 'gyur te /
translated: Now, in order to generate the signs, the seed syllables of gnosis are stated: Jaḥ and so on. Here, Jaḥ, hūṃ, vaṃ, hoḥ, in sequence, means that from the syllable Jaḥ, a vajra hook arises.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las lha 'am lha mo @76a * //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las lha 'am lha mo @76a * //
translated: That completely transforms into a god or goddess.

original: phyag na rdo rje lcags kyu can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje lcags kyu can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The hook is in the hand of Vajrapāṇi.

original: de bzhin du h'um yig las rdo rje ste de las phyag na rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du h'um yig las rdo rje ste de las phyag na rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, from the syllable HŪM, a vajra, and from that, Vajrapāṇi.

original: bam yig las zhags pa ste de las phyag na zhags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bam yig las zhags pa ste de las phyag na zhags par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the syllable VAṂ, a noose, and from that, Paśa in the hand.

original: ho: yig las dril bu ste de las phyag na dril bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ho: yig las dril bu ste de las phyag na dril bur 'gyur ro //
translated: From the syllable HOḤ, a bell, and from that, Ghanta in the hand.

original: aom a'a: hum ho de bzhin du gsungs zhes pa la de bzhin du zhes pa ni sngar bzhin du rim pas te /
analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho de bzhin du gsungs zhes pa la de bzhin du zhes pa ni sngar bzhin du rim pas te /
translated: OṂ, AḤ, HŪṂ, HOḤ, likewise, it is said. Likewise means in order, as before.

original: aom yig las zla ba zhes pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / a'a: yig las nyi ma zhes pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang / hum yig las rdo rje zhes pa sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor dang / ho yig las de bzhin nyid du 'gyur med ces pa dus me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: aom yig las zla ba zhes pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / a'a: yig las nyi ma zhes pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang / hum yig las rdo rje zhes pa sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor dang / ho yig las de bzhin nyid du 'gyur med ces pa dus me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: From the syllable OṂ, a moon, that is, a moon maṇḍala; from the syllable AḤ, a sun, that is, a sun maṇḍala; from the syllable HŪṂ, a vajra, that is, a Rāhu maṇḍala; and from the syllable HOḤ, suchness, that is, a Kālāgni maṇḍala.

original: a'i r'i a'u l'i de bzhin nyid du zhes pa ste /
analyzed: a'i r'i a'u l'i de bzhin nyid du zhes pa ste /
translated: A, Ī, U, Ū, likewise, it is said.

original: rim pa bzhin du a'i yig yongs su gyur pa las ral gri ste /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du a'i yig yongs su gyur pa las ral gri ste /
translated: In order, from the syllable A, a sword;

original: de yongs su gyur pa las lha'am lha mo phyag na ral grir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las lha'am lha mo phyag na ral grir 'gyur ro //
translated: That completely transforms into a god or goddess holding a sword.

original: de bzhin du r'i yig las nor bu'am mda' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du r'i yig las nor bu'am mda' ste /
translated: Similarly, the letter ra becomes a jewel or an arrow.

original: de las me'i lha phyag na nor bu'am phyag na mda'o //
analyzed: de las me'i lha phyag na nor bu'am phyag na mda'o //
translated: From that, the fire god holds a jewel or an arrow in his hand.

original: a'u yig las padma ste /
analyzed: a'u yig las padma ste /
translated: The letter au becomes a lotus.

original: de las chu'i lha phyag na padma dang phyag na autpala'o //
analyzed: de las chu'i lha phyag na padma dang phyag na autpala'o //
translated: From that, the water god holds a lotus or an utpala in his hand.

original: l'i yig las 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: l'i yig las 'khor lo ste /
translated: The letter la becomes a wheel.

original: de la ga sa'i lha phyag na 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de la ga sa'i lha phyag na 'khor lo'o //
translated: From that, the earth god holds a wheel in his hand.

original: de bzhin du ya ra wa la rnams kyang rim pa bzhin du rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ya ra wa la rnams kyang rim pa bzhin du rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i lha rnams so //
translated: Similarly, ya, ra, wa, and la are the wind, fire, water, and earth gods, respectively.

original: de bzhin du ha: zhes pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ha: zhes pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Similarly, haḥ is the sun maṇḍala.

original: hum zhes pa ni nyi ma'i steng du gtso bo'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: hum zhes pa ni nyi ma'i steng du gtso bo'i rdo rje'o //
translated: Huṃ is the principal’s vajra on the sun.

original: ham zhes pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ham zhes pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Haṃ is the moon maṇḍala.

original: phrem zhes pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gtso mo'i gri gug go //
analyzed: phrem zhes pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gtso mo'i gri gug go //
translated: Phaṭ is the principal lady’s flaying knife on the moon maṇḍala.

original: mtshan ma'i nges pa ste de bzhin gsungs zhes so //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i nges pa ste de bzhin gsungs zhes so //
translated: This is the definition of the signs, as it is said.

original: da ni lha bsgrubs pa'i rjes la zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bya ba'i slad du lha'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa zla ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni lha bsgrubs pa'i rjes la zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bya ba'i slad du lha'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa zla ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to perform the rites of pacification and so forth after having accomplished the deity, the deity's samadhi is taught, beginning with moon.

original: 'dir sngar brjod pa'i yum gyi gsang ba'i padmar zla ba nyi ma'i dbus su aa sogs ka sogs dang bcas par chu yi sa bon bdag nyid chu skyes te zhes pa ni wam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dkar po'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngar brjod pa'i yum gyi gsang ba'i padmar zla ba nyi ma'i dbus su aa sogs ka sogs dang bcas par chu yi sa bon bdag nyid chu skyes te zhes pa ni wam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dkar po'o //
translated: Here, in the secret lotus of the mother previously mentioned, in the center of the moon and sun, the water seed of the self-nature of the water-born, along with the vowels and consonants, is the syllable vam, which transforms into a white lotus.🔽From that, the perfect goddess, the color of the moon, with one face and two arms, riding a white elephant, holds a white lotus in her hand.

original: de las rdzogs pa'i lha mo zla ba'i mdog can zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma @76b glang chen dkar po la zhon zhes pas srungs la zhon pa phyag na chu skyes dkar dang zhes pa ni lha phyag na padma dkar po dang lha mo phyag na autpala dkar po
analyzed: de las rdzogs pa'i lha mo zla ba'i mdog can zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma @76b glang chen dkar po la zhon zhes pas srungs la zhon pa phyag na chu skyes dkar dang zhes pa ni lha phyag na padma dkar po dang lha mo phyag na autpala dkar po
translated: The deity holds a white lotus, and the goddess holds a white utpala.

original: ste / mi 'jigs pa ni g-yas pa mi 'jigs pa'i phyag go //
analyzed: ste / mi 'jigs pa ni g-yas pa mi 'jigs pa'i phyag go //
translated: The fearless one is the fearless hand on the right.

original: gos ni dkar po dang dkar po'i rgyan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gos ni dkar po dang dkar po'i rgyan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The garment is white, and she is adorned with white ornaments.

original: mu tig gi 'bras bus brgyan pa rab tu bzhad pa'i zhal ni bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: mu tig gi 'bras bus brgyan pa rab tu bzhad pa'i zhal ni bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on the face of the one with a laughing face, adorned with pearl fruits.

original: de yang bsgrub bya'i khyim du bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bsgrub bya'i khyim du bskul bar bya'o //
translated: And that is to be invoked in the house of the one to be accomplished.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gnyis kyis gsungs pa ni go sla ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gnyis kyis gsungs pa ni go sla ste /
translated: The two other verses beginning with “Then” are easy to understand.

original: de ltar bsgrub bya yi ni mchog gi bde ba byed pa thams cad rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya zhes pa'i mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub bya yi ni mchog gi bde ba byed pa thams cad rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya zhes pa'i mthar thug par ro //
translated: Thus, all the activities of the supreme bliss of the one to be accomplished are to be meditated upon by the yogī.

original: de bzhin du zla ba nyi ma'i dbus su hr'i: ste zhes pa la sogs pa nas de bzhin zhags pa lcags kyu dag gis khams gsum po nas dgug pa'i las ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur zhes pa'i mthar thug pa dbang dang dgug pa'i tshigs su bcad pa
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba nyi ma'i dbus su hr'i: ste zhes pa la sogs pa nas de bzhin zhags pa lcags kyu dag gis khams gsum po nas dgug pa'i las ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur zhes pa'i mthar thug pa dbang dang dgug pa'i tshigs su bcad pa
translated: Similarly, “In the middle of the moon and sun, hṛīḥ, etc.,” up to “Thus, the activity of summoning from the three realms with the noose and hook will be of many kinds.”

original: gsum ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gsum ni go sla'o //
translated: The three verses on subjugation and summoning are easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du dbye ba dang bskrad pa la nyi ma zla ba'i dbus su sprin nag dang mtshungs h'um yig ring po las skyes ral gri bsgoms byas nas zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o ;🔽/ nyi zla'i dbus su la: zhes bya ba yongs gyur 'khor lo bzang po kha dog ser po bsgoms byas nas zhes pa la sogs pa rengs pa dang phur bus gdab pa dang rmongs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbye ba dang bskrad pa la nyi ma zla ba'i dbus su sprin nag dang mtshungs h'um yig ring po las skyes ral gri bsgoms byas nas zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o ; / nyi zla'i dbus su la: zhes bya ba yongs gyur 'khor lo bzang po kha dog ser po bsgoms byas nas zhes pa la sogs pa rengs pa dang phur bus gdab pa dang rmongs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
translated: Likewise, in the case of the divisions and the expulsion, one should meditate on a long hūṃ-syllable arisen from a long sword in the middle of the sun and moon, and so forth. The two verses are easy to understand.🔽In the middle of the sun and moon, one should meditate on a yellow excellent wheel arisen from a laṃ, and so forth. The two verses on immobilization, impalement, and confusion are easy to understand.

original: slar yang gsad pa la nyi ma zla ba'i dbus su dri med glog dang mtshungs pa'i gri gug phrem gi rang bzhin bsgoms byas nas zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
analyzed: slar yang gsad pa la nyi ma zla ba'i dbus su dri med glog dang mtshungs pa'i gri gug phrem gi rang bzhin bsgoms byas nas zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
translated: Again, in the case of killing, one should meditate on a knife arisen from a laṃ in the middle of the sun and moon, the nature of a pure lightning flash, and so forth. The two verses are easy to understand.

original: de ltar dbang la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dgu ni go sla ste des na ma bris so //
analyzed: de ltar dbang la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dgu ni go sla ste des na ma bris so //
translated: Thus, the nine verses on subjugation and so forth are easy to understand, and so I will not write about them.

original: da ni zhi ba la bsam gtan gzhan gsungs pa zhi dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la bsam gtan gzhan gsungs pa zhi dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the other contemplations are stated for pacification, beginning with “pacification” and so forth.

original: dang por re zhig dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig pa'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste zhi ba la sogs pa dang dbang la sogs pa'i las la phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa dang / gsad pa la sogs pa dang rengs pa la sogs pa'i las la @77a * //
analyzed: dang por re zhig dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig pa'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste zhi ba la sogs pa dang dbang la sogs pa'i las la phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa dang / gsad pa la sogs pa dang rengs pa la sogs pa'i las la @77a * //
translated: First, one should meditate on the identity of the hero of the Wheel of Time, with twenty-four prostrations for pacification and so forth and power and so forth, and

original: phyag nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o //
analyzed: phyag nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o //
translated: with twenty-six prostrations for killing and so forth and paralyzing and so forth.

original: de nas skad cig gi rnam pas zhi dang rgyas pa la zhes pa ni 'dir dus kyi 'khor lo'i thugs kar chu'i dkyil 'khor la chu'i sa bon gyis bskyed pa'i lha chu'i bdag nyid can dkar po ste /
analyzed: de nas skad cig gi rnam pas zhi dang rgyas pa la zhes pa ni 'dir dus kyi 'khor lo'i thugs kar chu'i dkyil 'khor la chu'i sa bon gyis bskyed pa'i lha chu'i bdag nyid can dkar po ste /
translated: Then, by the method of the instant, for pacification and increase, here, at the heart of the Wheel of Time, on a water maṇḍala generated from the water seed, is the deity, white, with the identity of water.

original: rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa au yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis chu'i sa bon las ni zhi dang rgyas pa la yang de'i bsam gtan ni bsam gtan dkar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa au yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis chu'i sa bon las ni zhi dang rgyas pa la yang de'i bsam gtan ni bsam gtan dkar por 'gyur ro //
translated: “ By the power of the family” means that by the power of the family of the syllable u, from the water seed, the contemplation of that is the white contemplation for pacification and increase.

original: de bzhin du dbang dang dgug pa la yang dmar po lus ni sreg par byed pa me yi sa bon bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang dang dgug pa la yang dmar po lus ni sreg par byed pa me yi sa bon bdag nyid de /
translated: Likewise, for the rites of empowerment and summoning, the color is red, the nature is that of the seed of fire, the body burns.

original: mgrin par me'i dkyil 'khor la ri yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: mgrin par me'i dkyil 'khor la ri yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: At the throat, by the power of the seed of the family, the letter ri, there is a fire mandala.

original: dbye ba dang ni bskrad pa la yang nag po rlung gi sa bon gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dbye ba dang ni bskrad pa la yang nag po rlung gi sa bon gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: For the rites of separation and banishment, the color is black, the nature is that of the seed of wind.

original: dpral bar rlung gi dkyil 'khor la srog gi ai yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: dpral bar rlung gi dkyil 'khor la srog gi ai yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: At the forehead, by the power of the seed of the family, the letter i of life, there is a wind mandala.

original: rengs pa dang phur bus gdab pa la sogs pa la ser po sa yi sa bon gyi bdag nyid de lte bar sa'i dkyil 'khor la li yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: rengs pa dang phur bus gdab pa la sogs pa la ser po sa yi sa bon gyi bdag nyid de lte bar sa'i dkyil 'khor la li yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: For the rites of paralysis, impalement, and so forth, the color is yellow, the nature is that of the seed of earth. At the navel, by the power of the seed of the family, the letter li, there is an earth mandala.

original: gsad pa la stong pa'i sa bon las sngon po'i mdog ste /
analyzed: gsad pa la stong pa'i sa bon las sngon po'i mdog ste /
translated: For the rite of killing, the color is blue, the nature is that of the seed of space.

original: gsang bar ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la aam yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: gsang bar ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la aam yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: At the secret place, by the power of the seed of the family, the letter aṃ, there is a gnosis mandala.

original: gso ba la ljang gu ste gtsug tor du stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la aa yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: gso ba la ljang gu ste gtsug tor du stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la aa yig gi rigs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: For the rite of healing, the color is green, the nature is that of the seed of space. At the crown, by the power of the seed of the family, the letter a, there is a space mandala.

original: de ltar gnas drug po rnams su rigs drug gi dbang gis srog yang dag par sdom pa las 'grub par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar gnas drug po rnams su rigs drug gi dbang gis srog yang dag par sdom pa las 'grub par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the Blessed Lord has taught that the accomplishment of the life-force is by the power of the six clans in the six places.

original: da ni sa la sogs pa'i zad par bsgom pa gsungs pa sa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni sa la sogs pa'i zad par bsgom pa gsungs pa sa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the meditation on the totality of earth, etc. is stated by earth, etc.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis lha grub par gyur pa de'i tshe lte ba'i sa'i dkyil 'khor las sa yi zad par rgya mtsho'i steng du zam stegs brtsigs pa bzhin du spros nas bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis lha grub par gyur pa de'i tshe lte ba'i sa'i dkyil 'khor las sa yi zad par rgya mtsho'i steng du zam stegs brtsigs pa bzhin du spros nas bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Here, when the yogis have accomplished the deity, then, from the earth mandala of the navel, having emanated the totality of earth like a bridge over the ocean, one should meditate.

original: chu yi gter du 'gro ba la zhes pa zad par sa yi bsam gtan gyis thang la ji lta ba de bzhin du chu la rgya mtsho'i steng du rnal 'byor pa 'gro'o //
analyzed: chu yi gter du 'gro ba la zhes pa zad par sa yi bsam gtan gyis thang la ji lta ba de bzhin du chu la rgya mtsho'i steng du rnal 'byor pa 'gro'o //
translated: Going into the water-treasure means that, by the earth-totality meditation, the yogi goes on the water like on the ground, on the ocean.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi zad par char pa ni nyams pa'i don to zhes pa ni dpral ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor las sprin gyi steng du rlung gi zad par spros nas bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi zad par char pa ni nyams pa'i don to zhes pa ni dpral ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor las sprin gyi steng du rlung gi zad par spros nas bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, the exhaustion of the wind is the meaning of “rain,” which means that one should meditate on the exhaustion of the wind above the clouds from the wind maṇḍala in the forehead.

original: des sprin @77b dang char rnam par nyams par byed do //
analyzed: des sprin @77b dang char rnam par nyams par byed do //
translated: By that, the clouds and rain are destroyed.

original: gzhan yang khams lnga'i bdag nyid kyi khang pa brtsegs pa bdag nyid kyi steng du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang khams lnga'i bdag nyid kyi khang pa brtsegs pa bdag nyid kyi steng du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should meditate on the mansion of the nature of the five elements above oneself.

original: bsam gtan des ni char 'bab kyang rnal 'byor pa la chus mi reg cing khang pa brtsegs pa'i mtshams kyi mthar thug par sprin gyi char rab tu 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes rtsa ba'i rgyud las rab tu gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan des ni char 'bab kyang rnal 'byor pa la chus mi reg cing khang pa brtsegs pa'i mtshams kyi mthar thug par sprin gyi char rab tu 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes rtsa ba'i rgyud las rab tu gsungs so //
translated: By that meditation, even if it rains, the yogī is not touched by water, and the rain of the clouds does not enter to the end of the boundary of the mansion, as it is said in the Root Tantra.

original: de ltar rlung gi zad par char pa ni nyams pa'i don to zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar rlung gi zad par char pa ni nyams pa'i don to zhes so //
translated: Thus, the exhaustion of the wind is the meaning of “rain.”

original: me yi zad par zhes pa ni 'dir mgrin pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor las me'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa'i 'bar pa rnams sa'i steng du spros nas bsgom par bya ste 'bar ba de rnams kyis sa yi dkyil 'khor gser zhu ba bzhin du zhu bar byed do
analyzed: me yi zad par zhes pa ni 'dir mgrin pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor las me'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa'i 'bar pa rnams sa'i steng du spros nas bsgom par bya ste 'bar ba de rnams kyis sa yi dkyil 'khor gser zhu ba bzhin du zhu bar byed do
translated: The “exhaustion of fire” is meditating on the seed of fire completely transforming into flames that spread out on the ground from the fire maṇḍala in the throat. Those flames melt the earth maṇḍala like molten gold.

original: // de ltar sa zhu bar byed pa'i don du me'i zad par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: // de ltar sa zhu bar byed pa'i don du me'i zad par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the exhaustion of fire in order to melt the earth.

original: de bzhin du me dag kyang nyams pa'i don du chu yi zad par zhes pa ni 'dir lha'i thugs ka'i chu'i dkyil 'khor las chu'i sa bon gyis bskyed pa'i chu'i zad par me'i steng du spros nas bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du me dag kyang nyams pa'i don du chu yi zad par zhes pa ni 'dir lha'i thugs ka'i chu'i dkyil 'khor las chu'i sa bon gyis bskyed pa'i chu'i zad par me'i steng du spros nas bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, in order to extinguish the fire, the “exhaustion of water” is meditating on the exhaustion of water generated from the seed of water on the fire maṇḍala in the heart of the deity.

original: des me bsil bar 'gyur zhing sreg par byed pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: des me bsil bar 'gyur zhing sreg par byed pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: That cools the fire and it loses its ability to burn.

original: stong pa'i zad par mkha' la 'gro dang zhes pa ni gtsug tor gyi nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la nam mkha'i zad par rdzas dang bral ba bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i zad par mkha' la 'gro dang zhes pa ni gtsug tor gyi nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la nam mkha'i zad par rdzas dang bral ba bsgom par bya ste /
translated: “The exhaustion of emptiness in space, and moving in space” means that one should meditate on the exhaustion of space in the maṇḍala of the space of the uṣṇīṣa, free from substance.

original: des nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one will move in space.

original: de bzhin du chom rkun la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba la bsam gtan de nyid kyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chom rkun la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba la bsam gtan de nyid kyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Similarly, with respect to the harm of thieves, and so on, it is certain that one will become invisible by means of that very meditative concentration.

original: da ni dud 'gro'i nye bar 'tshe bzhi pa'i slad du bsam gtan gsungs pa glang po'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni dud 'gro'i nye bar 'tshe bzhi pa'i slad du bsam gtan gsungs pa glang po'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, meditative concentration is taught for the sake of the harm of animals:

original: 'dir gang gi tshe glang po'i bdag pos 'jigs par gyur pa de'i tshe mgrin pa'i me yi sa bon zhes par yig las byung ba'i kha lnga pa bsgom par bya ste glang po'i bdag po'i gzhom pa'i yul la de ni kha lnga pa'i bsam gtan du 'gyur ro
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe glang po'i bdag pos 'jigs par gyur pa de'i tshe mgrin pa'i me yi sa bon zhes par yig las byung ba'i kha lnga pa bsgom par bya ste glang po'i bdag po'i gzhom pa'i yul la de ni kha lnga pa'i bsam gtan du 'gyur ro
translated: Here, when one is frightened by an elephant, at that time one should meditate on the seed of fire in the throat, the letter ra, which is the fifth of the five faces, and that becomes the meditative concentration of the five faces in the object of destruction of the lord of elephants.

original: // de bzhin du klu'i dbang po gzhom pa la ni nam mkha'i lding snying kha'i chu'i dkyil 'khor las chu'i sa bon gyi bdag nyid can te de ni dkar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // de bzhin du klu'i dbang po gzhom pa la ni nam mkha'i lding snying kha'i chu'i dkyil 'khor las chu'i sa bon gyi bdag nyid can te de ni dkar por 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, for the subjugation of the lord of the nagas, one should visualize a garuda, the nature of the water seed syllable, on the water mandala in the heart. It is white.

original: bse'i 'jigs pa dang seng ge'i 'jigs pa la @78a * //🔽rkang brgyad ces pa rkang pa brgyad pa nag po ste /
analyzed: bse'i 'jigs pa dang seng ge'i 'jigs pa la @78a * // rkang brgyad ces pa rkang pa brgyad pa nag po ste /
translated: For the fear of lions and the fear of tigers,

original: dpral ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor las rlung gi sa bon gyi bdag nyid can na //🔽rta'i dgra la zhes pa ma he'i 'jigs pa la bse zhes grags pas yi rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa ser po ste lte ba'i sa'i dkyil 'khor la la yig gi sa bon las so //
analyzed: dpral ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor las rlung gi sa bon gyi bdag nyid can na // rta'i dgra la zhes pa ma he'i 'jigs pa la bse zhes grags pas yi rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa ser po ste lte ba'i sa'i dkyil 'khor la la yig gi sa bon las so //
translated: one should visualize a black scorpion, the nature of the wind seed syllable, on the wind mandala in the forehead.🔽For the fear of horses, one should visualize a yellow buffalo, the nature of the earth seed syllable, on the earth mandala in the navel.

original: lha min gzhom la khro bo skyes gtsug tor gyi stong pa'i dkyil 'khor ljang gu'am /
analyzed: lha min gzhom la khro bo skyes gtsug tor gyi stong pa'i dkyil 'khor ljang gu'am /
translated: For the fear of asuras, one should visualize a green Krodha-Ushnisha, the nature of the space seed syllable, on the space mandala in the crown.

original: gsang ba'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor sngon po las hum yig gi sa bon gyi bdag nyid dam kshum yig gi sa bon gyi bdag nyid khro bo las skyes pa ni lha min la sogs pa rnams gzhom pa'i yul la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bde ba byed
analyzed: gsang ba'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor sngon po las hum yig gi sa bon gyi bdag nyid dam kshum yig gi sa bon gyi bdag nyid khro bo las skyes pa ni lha min la sogs pa rnams gzhom pa'i yul la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bde ba byed
translated: The secret mandala of pristine consciousness, blue in color, is the nature of the seed syllable hūṃ or the nature of the seed syllable kṣuṃ. Born from wrath, it is the bliss of yogins and yoginīs in the realm of the objects to be conquered, such as the demigods, and so on.

original: par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste dud 'gro gzhom pa'i slad du bsam gtan gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste dud 'gro gzhom pa'i slad du bsam gtan gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of concentration for the sake of conquering animals.

original: da ni las bsgrub pa'i slad du dang po'i nges pa gsungs pa khyab bdag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni las bsgrub pa'i slad du dang po'i nges pa gsungs pa khyab bdag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to accomplish activities, the first certainty is stated:

original: 'dir rnal 'byor pas las 'grub pa'i slad du dang por bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pas las 'grub pa'i slad du dang por bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Here, for the sake of accomplishing activities, the yogin should first practice.

original: sngags gzhan 'grub pa'i slad du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg gi cho gas dpal ldan sngags zhes pa ste aom a'a: hum zhes pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags gzhan 'grub pa'i slad du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg gi cho gas dpal ldan sngags zhes pa ste aom a'a: hum zhes pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing other mantras, the glorious mantra, which will be explained by the rite of repetition and fire puja, should be accomplished.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gzhan 'grub pa'i slad du sangs rgyas gzugs zhes pa stong pa nyid kyi gzugs mngon sum du bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gzhan 'grub pa'i slad du sangs rgyas gzugs zhes pa stong pa nyid kyi gzugs mngon sum du bya ste /
translated: Likewise, for the sake of accomplishing the other meditations, one should manifest the form of emptiness, the “Buddha-form” of mantra.

original: de ltar khyab bdag gi ni dpal ldan sngags dang sangs rgyas gzugs kyang rnal 'byor pa yis dang por bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyab bdag gi ni dpal ldan sngags dang sangs rgyas gzugs kyang rnal 'byor pa yis dang por bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogi/nī should first accomplish the glorious mantra and the form of the Buddha, the Lord of all.

original: phyi nas nyi ma'i dbye ba rnams kyis zhes pa dbye ba bcu gnyis kyis gnas pa yon tan dpag tu med pa'i las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nas nyi ma'i dbye ba rnams kyis zhes pa dbye ba bcu gnyis kyis gnas pa yon tan dpag tu med pa'i las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by the twelve divisions, the yogi/nī will accomplish the functions of the immeasurable qualities of the abiding reality.

original: sngags dang gzugs brnyan ma grub par ni srid gsum gnas su ci yang 'grub par 'gyur pa nyid ma yin /
analyzed: sngags dang gzugs brnyan ma grub par ni srid gsum gnas su ci yang 'grub par 'gyur pa nyid ma yin /
translated: Without accomplishing the mantra and the form, nothing at all will be accomplished in the three worlds.

original: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dag las dang por khyab bdag gi sngags dang gzugs ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dag las dang por khyab bdag gi sngags dang gzugs ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, O King, it is certain that one should first accomplish the mantra and the form of the Lord, free from the stains of one’s own mind.

original: da ni ral gri la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi don du lha min dbang po'i sgrub pa gsungs pa dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni ral gri la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi don du lha min dbang po'i sgrub pa gsungs pa dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to attain the powers of the sword and so forth, the rite of the lord of the demigods is taught, beginning with “the hero” and so forth.

original: 'dir g-yul gyi sar @78b dpa' bo zhes pa rgyal po'i bu'am /
analyzed: 'dir g-yul gyi sar @78b dpa' bo zhes pa rgyal po'i bu'am /
translated: Here, on the battlefield, the “hero” is the king’s son,

original: 'thab mo pa gzhan lcags mda' gcig bsnun pas lhung bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'thab mo pa gzhan lcags mda' gcig bsnun pas lhung bar gyur pa'am /
translated: or another warrior who falls by the blow of a single iron arrow.

original: de bzhin du chom rkun nam dpa' bo shing la dpyangs pa ni nag po'i phyogs kyi brgyad dam 'byung po'i mtshan mo zhes pa bcu bzhi la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chom rkun nam dpa' bo shing la dpyangs pa ni nag po'i phyogs kyi brgyad dam 'byung po'i mtshan mo zhes pa bcu bzhi la ste /
translated: Likewise, the thief or hero who is suspended from a tree is on the dark lunar half, the eighth or the fourteenth, the night of the bhūtas.

original: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The “lord of men” is the corpse.

original: ro sreg sar ni zhes pa dur khrod du dbang gi las la gsungs pa'i bum pa brgyad dang rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dag gis kyang ro de bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: ro sreg sar ni zhes pa dur khrod du dbang gi las la gsungs pa'i bum pa brgyad dang rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dag gis kyang ro de bkru bar bya'o //
translated: In the cremation ground, the corpse is washed with the eight vases and the vases of victory and complete victory, which are taught for the rite of power.

original: de nas dri dang spos dang mar me dang ni rnam mang kha zas me tog dmar po rnams kyis rab mchod nas /
analyzed: de nas dri dang spos dang mar me dang ni rnam mang kha zas me tog dmar po rnams kyis rab mchod nas /
translated: Then, having made extensive offerings with perfumes, incense, lamps, various foods, and red flowers,

original: gos dmar po bskon par bya ste /
analyzed: gos dmar po bskon par bya ste /
translated: One should dress him in red garments.🔽One should also place the vajra on the head, heart, crown, navel, and so forth.

original: mgo dang snying kha dang ni spyi bo lte ba la sogs su yang rdo rje dgod pa rab byas te zhes pa ni dpral bar aom /
analyzed: mgo dang snying kha dang ni spyi bo lte ba la sogs su yang rdo rje dgod pa rab byas te zhes pa ni dpral bar aom /
translated: On the forehead, the syllable OṀ.

original: snying khar hum /🔽gtsug tor du ham /🔽lte bar ho:/ mgrin par a'a:/
analyzed: snying khar hum / gtsug tor du ham / lte bar ho:/ mgrin par a'a:/
translated: On the heart, the syllable HŪṀ.🔽On the crown, the syllable HAṀ.🔽On the navel, the syllable HOṀ.🔽On the throat, the syllable AṀ.

original: gsang bar ksha:'o //🔽de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i snying kha dang mgo bo dang gtsug tor dang go cha dang mig dang mtshon cha ste /
analyzed: gsang bar ksha:'o // de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i snying kha dang mgo bo dang gtsug tor dang go cha dang mig dang mtshon cha ste /
translated: On the secret place, the syllable KṢAṀ.

original: yan lag drug dgod pa byas nas ro dang bdag nyid kyi lus kyang lha'i rnal 'byor gyis bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag drug dgod pa byas nas ro dang bdag nyid kyi lus kyang lha'i rnal 'byor gyis bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, having placed the six limbs as previously taught, namely, the heart, head, crown, armor, eyes, and weapons, one should protect the corpse and one's own body with the yoga of the deity.

original: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i thab khung zur gsum du rdul tshon dmar pos snying po'i padma dmar po gang yin pa de ni mtshan mar bcas pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i thab khung zur gsum du rdul tshon dmar pos snying po'i padma dmar po gang yin pa de ni mtshan mar bcas pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Then, in the previously taught triangular hearth, with red powder, the red lotus of the essence is the one with a sign.

original: lte ba la mda'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: lte ba la mda'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The sign in the center is an arrow.

original: yang na las thams cad la rdo rje zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rdo rje dmar po'o //
analyzed: yang na las thams cad la rdo rje zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rdo rje dmar po'o //
translated: Or else, because it is said that the vajra is for all actions, it is a red vajra.

original: 'dab mar rgyal rnams mtshan ma zhes pa ni shar gyi 'dab mar ral gri dang / lhor rin po che dang / byang du padma dang / nub tu 'khor lo ste phyogs su'o //
analyzed: 'dab mar rgyal rnams mtshan ma zhes pa ni shar gyi 'dab mar ral gri dang / lhor rin po che dang / byang du padma dang / nub tu 'khor lo ste phyogs su'o //
translated: On the petals, the signs of the Victors, etc. On the eastern petal, a sword; on the southern, a jewel; on the northern, a lotus; on the western, a wheel.

original: phyogs bral du ni de bzhin lha mo rnams kyi rang mtshan ma zhes pa ni sngar gsungs pa'i ma mo'i skyon la ji lta ba bzhin du mer gri gug dang / bden bral gyi 'dab mar rdo rje lcags kyu dang / rlung du rdo rje zhags pa dang dbang ldan du rtse gsum mo //
analyzed: phyogs bral du ni de bzhin lha mo rnams kyi rang mtshan ma zhes pa ni sngar gsungs pa'i ma mo'i skyon la ji lta ba bzhin du mer gri gug dang / bden bral gyi 'dab mar rdo rje lcags kyu dang / rlung du rdo rje zhags pa dang dbang ldan du rtse gsum mo //
translated: In the intermediate directions, the signs of the goddesses, etc. In the southeast, a flaying knife; in the southwest, a vajra hook; in the northwest, a vajra noose; in the northeast, a trident.

original: phyi rol re kh'a gsum la phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor du ni de bzhin khro bo'i mtshan ma rnams zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol re kh'a gsum la phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor du ni de bzhin khro bo'i mtshan ma rnams zhes pa ni /
translated: On the three outer lines, the signs of the wrathful ones in the mandalas of the ten directions, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs rnams @79a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs rnams @79a * //
translated: In the directions, as the Tathagatas;

original: su'o ; / lha mo rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs bral rnams su'o //
analyzed: su'o ; / lha mo rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs bral rnams su'o //
translated: in the intermediate directions, as the goddesses.

original: steng du gtsug tor gyi rdo rje dang 'og tu gnod mdzes rgyal po'i dgra sta ste ra ba gsum po rnams bsrung ba'i slad du'o //🔽de bzhin du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas mtshan ma rnams bkod cing dur khrod kyi sa gzhi la dkyil 'khor gyi bum pa la sogs pa yang dag par bzhag ste rab tu gnas pa byas la dri la sogs pa rnams kyis 'dod
analyzed: steng du gtsug tor gyi rdo rje dang 'og tu gnod mdzes rgyal po'i dgra sta ste ra ba gsum po rnams bsrung ba'i slad du'o // de bzhin du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas mtshan ma rnams bkod cing dur khrod kyi sa gzhi la dkyil 'khor gyi bum pa la sogs pa yang dag par bzhag ste rab tu gnas pa byas la dri la sogs pa rnams kyis 'dod
translated: Above, the uṣṇīṣa vajra, and below, Sumbha-nīlāmbara-dhara-rāja’s axe—these three fences are for the sake of protection.

original: pa'i lha rnams la mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: pa'i lha rnams la mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Similarly, in the case of a colored-powder maṇḍala, having arranged the signs by the previously described rite, and having placed the maṇḍala vase, etc., on the ground of the charnel ground, one should perform the consecration, and having made offerings to the desired deities with perfume, etc.,🔽one should give sacrificial cakes to the field protectors, etc.

original: zhing skyong la sogs pa rnams la gtor ma sbyin zhing de nas ro ni de yi g-yas min du ste zhes pa thab khung gi byang rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i lhor te /
analyzed: zhing skyong la sogs pa rnams la gtor ma sbyin zhing de nas ro ni de yi g-yas min du ste zhes pa thab khung gi byang rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i lhor te /
translated: Then, “to the right of that corpse” means to the north of the hearth, to the south of the door of the colored-powder maṇḍala.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor dang thab khung dag gi dbus su ro'o //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor dang thab khung dag gi dbus su ro'o //
translated: Thus, the corpse is in the center of the maṇḍala and the hearth.

original: g-yas su rkang pa'o zhes pa ni lhor rkang pa dang byang du mgo bo'o //
analyzed: g-yas su rkang pa'o zhes pa ni lhor rkang pa dang byang du mgo bo'o //
translated: “To the right, the foot” means the foot in the south and the head in the north.

original: lag pad ral gri zhes pa ni lag na ral gri can gan rkyal te ri mo gsum gyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: lag pad ral gri zhes pa ni lag na ral gri can gan rkyal te ri mo gsum gyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The sword in the hand is one lying on his back, surrounded by three lines.

original: de ltar sngar brjod ma mo'i skyon las dkyil 'khor du rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje sngar gsungs pa rnams kyis bdag nyid bsrung ba rab byas nas sngags pas thab kyi g-yas su khrag dang bcas pa'i sha rnams dag gis sbyin sreg nyid ni rab byed pa zhes
analyzed: de ltar sngar brjod ma mo'i skyon las dkyil 'khor du rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje sngar gsungs pa rnams kyis bdag nyid bsrung ba rab byas nas sngags pas thab kyi g-yas su khrag dang bcas pa'i sha rnams dag gis sbyin sreg nyid ni rab byed pa zhes
translated: Thus, having well protected oneself with the previously mentioned mantras of the Lord of Conquerors in the maṇḍala, with the faults of the previously mentioned mother, the mantrin should perform the homa to the right of the hearth with meats together with blood.

original: pa ni 'dir thab khung du rgyal rigs kyi khyim nas blangs pa'i me seng ldeng gi shing gis rab tu sbar te /
analyzed: pa ni 'dir thab khung du rgyal rigs kyi khyim nas blangs pa'i me seng ldeng gi shing gis rab tu sbar te /
translated: Here, having taken fire from a kṣatriya's house, one should kindle it with sticks of palāśa wood.

original: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas me lha spyan drang ba la sogs pa byas nas lha'i rnal 'byor gyis sha chen po khrag dang bcas pa bcu yis bsgyur pa'i brgyar ni zhes pa stong phrag gcig 'di'i sngags kyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas me lha spyan drang ba la sogs pa byas nas lha'i rnal 'byor gyis sha chen po khrag dang bcas pa bcu yis bsgyur pa'i brgyar ni zhes pa stong phrag gcig 'di'i sngags kyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, having invited the fire god and so forth with the previously mentioned ritual, with the yoga of the deity, one should perform the homa with one thousand of the meats together with blood, divided into one hundred parts, with this mantra.🔽 Here, one hundred means one thousand.

original: de yi sngags zhes pa aom hrim phrem h'um phat ces pa 'di ni de'i sngags so //
analyzed: de yi sngags zhes pa aom hrim phrem h'um phat ces pa 'di ni de'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of that is Oṃ hrīṃ phrem hūṃ phaṭ. This is the mantra of that.

original: 'dis de la dgod pa yang bya ste dpral bar aom /
analyzed: 'dis de la dgod pa yang bya ste dpral bar aom /
translated: One should also arrange this: on the forehead, Oṃ;

original: mgrin par hr'im /
analyzed: mgrin par hr'im /
translated: on the throat, hrīṃ;

original: snying khar phrem /
analyzed: snying khar phrem /
