translated: on the heart, phrem;

original: lte bar h'um /
analyzed: lte bar h'um /
translated: on the navel, hūṃ;

original: gsang bar phat ces pa dgod do //
analyzed: gsang bar phat ces pa dgod do //
translated: and on the secret place, phaṭ.

original: rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas 'chi med ri bo bzhin du g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis mtshan mo phyed na thun gcig ji srid par sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas 'chi med ri bo bzhin du g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis mtshan mo phyed na thun gcig ji srid par sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having sat in the vajra posture, one should perform the homa for one watch, until dawn, without moving like Mount Meru.

original: des sbyin sreg stong phrag @79b rdzogs par gyur pa na ro 'dzin ral gri lta bur 'khyug cing 'bar la mche ba rnon po mig gsum pa /
analyzed: des sbyin sreg stong phrag @79b rdzogs par gyur pa na ro 'dzin ral gri lta bur 'khyug cing 'bar la mche ba rnon po mig gsum pa /
translated: When the homa is completed in a thousand, the eater of corpses, like a sword, flickering and blazing, with sharp fangs, three eyes,

original: gang zhig rnam par 'gems pa'i sgra sgrogs sa la rkang pa rdebs shing sgrub pa po ni 'jigs byed pa /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par 'gems pa'i sgra sgrogs sa la rkang pa rdebs shing sgrub pa po ni 'jigs byed pa /
translated: roaring the sound of destruction, stamping with his feet on the ground, terrifying the practitioner,

original: ro yi lus la lha min dbang po zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: ro yi lus la lha min dbang po zhugs pa ste /
translated: the lord of the demigods enters the body of the corpse.

original: de ltar gyur pa thab kyi mtha' ru gnas nas ka ha ka ha rgod par byed cing 'jigs pa'i lus kyis gar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa thab kyi mtha' ru gnas nas ka ha ka ha rgod par byed cing 'jigs pa'i lus kyis gar byed de /
translated: Having become such, he stands on the edge of the cremation ground, neighing, dancing with a terrifying body.

original: de mthong nas ni 'jigs pa'i sngags pa sems nyams skad cig gis ni gshin rje'i grong khyer 'gro bar 'gyur /🔽'di yi rjes la ro bsreg gnas su sngags pas zhes pa la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de mthong nas ni 'jigs pa'i sngags pa sems nyams skad cig gis ni gshin rje'i grong khyer 'gro bar 'gyur / 'di yi rjes la ro bsreg gnas su sngags pas zhes pa la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Seeing him, the terrified mantrin, his mind failing, in an instant goes to the city of the Lord of Death.

original: lha min dbang po bsgrub par bya zhes pa'i mthar thug pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lha min dbang po bsgrub par bya zhes pa'i mthar thug pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum ni go sla'o //
translated: After this, the mantrin, in the cremation ground, beginning with “the first letter of the name of the one to be accomplished,” up to the end of the three verses, “accomplish the lord of the demigods,” is easy to understand.

original: de ltar lha min dbang po bsgrub pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha min dbang po bsgrub pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for accomplishing the lord of the demigods.

original: da ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa ming gi dang po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa ming gi dang po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the definition of the mantra is stated, beginning with “the first letter of the name,” and so on.

original: khams gsum po 'dir brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i chos rnams kyi gang gi ming gang yin pa de'i ming gi dang po'i yi ge ni ming gi dang po'o //
analyzed: khams gsum po 'dir brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i chos rnams kyi gang gi ming gang yin pa de'i ming gi dang po'i yi ge ni ming gi dang po'o //
translated: The first letter of the name of whatever phenomenon, moving or unmoving, in these three realms, is the first letter of the name.

original: de nyid thugs kyi rdo rjer 'gyur te mi yi bdag po lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid thugs kyi rdo rjer 'gyur te mi yi bdag po lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: That is the vajra of mind, of the lords of men, of the gods and goddesses.

original: gsung gi rdo rje ming thams cad de /
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje ming thams cad de /
translated: The vajra of speech is all names.

original: 'dir dper na t'a r'a p'a na da r'a m'a ma k'i lo tsa n'a zhes pa ming de nyid gsung gi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'dir dper na t'a r'a p'a na da r'a m'a ma k'i lo tsa n'a zhes pa ming de nyid gsung gi rdo rje'o //
translated: Here, for example, the name tāre tuttāre ture svāhā is the vajra of speech.

original: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi ming yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi ming yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, all things are also names.🔽Thus, the syllables of all names, and the syllables in excess of those, are the vajra of body.

original: de ltar thams cad kyi ming gi yi ge de las lhag pa dag kyang sku yi rdo rje ste zhes pa ni 'dir dper na aom t'a re tu ta t'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad kyi ming gi yi ge de las lhag pa dag kyang sku yi rdo rje ste zhes pa ni 'dir dper na aom t'a re tu ta t'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
translated: Here, for example, oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā,

original: aom p'a na da ra b'a si ni ba ra de sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom p'a na da ra b'a si ni ba ra de sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ pāṇḍaravāsinī varada-svaha,

original: aom m'a ma k'i ki ri ki ri sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom m'a ma k'i ki ri ki ri sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ māmakī kiri kiri svāhā,

original: aom lo tsa ne ba su de sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom lo tsa ne ba su de sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ locanā vasudhe svāhā,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ming gi yi ge las lhag pa'i yi ge thugs dang gsung gi yi ge dang bcas pa rnams ni sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ming gi yi ge las lhag pa'i yi ge thugs dang gsung gi yi ge dang bcas pa rnams ni sku rdo rje'o //
translated: and so forth, the syllables in excess of the syllables of the names, together with the syllables of the mind and speech, are the vajra of body.

original: sku rdo rje de las gzhan pa phreng ba'i sngags gang yin pa de ni yan lag so so'i sngags zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sku rdo rje de las gzhan pa phreng ba'i sngags gang yin pa de ni yan lag so so'i sngags zhes gsungs te /
translated: The mantra of the rosary, which is different from the mantra of the vajra body, is called the mantra of the individual limbs.

original: ji ltar lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa lus kyi cha shas yin pa de bzhin du ming gi cha shas ni sngags kyi ming gi'o //🔽de yang rnam pa mang por 'gyur zhing bklags @80a * //
analyzed: ji ltar lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa lus kyi cha shas yin pa de bzhin du ming gi cha shas ni sngags kyi ming gi'o // de yang rnam pa mang por 'gyur zhing bklags @80a * //
translated: Just as the hands, feet, and so on are parts of the body, the parts of the name are of the mantra.

original: pas grub pa brgya lam na ste /
analyzed: pas grub pa brgya lam na ste /
translated: Moreover, it becomes many forms, and is accomplished by recitation.🔽Here, just as in the chapter on empowerment, the mantra of the individual limbs is:

original: 'dir ji ltar dbang gi le'u las yan lag so so'i sngags aom a'a:h'um ho:ham ksha: hkshmlwrya k'a la tsa kra dur d'a nta da ma ka dz'a ti dza r'a ma ra n'a na ta ka /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar dbang gi le'u las yan lag so so'i sngags aom a'a:h'um ho:ham ksha: hkshmlwrya k'a la tsa kra dur d'a nta da ma ka dz'a ti dza r'a ma ra n'a na ta ka /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ haṃ kṣaḥ ha kṣa mla vra yakāla cakra durdānta damana jāti jarāmaraṇāntaka

original: tree lo kya bi dza ya /🔽ma h'a b'i re shva ra /
analyzed: tree lo kya bi dza ya / ma h'a b'i re shva ra /
translated: Trailokyavijaya🔽Mahāviryaśvara🔽Vajrabhairava

original: badzra bhee ra ba /🔽badzra k'a ya /
analyzed: badzra bhee ra ba / badzra k'a ya /
translated: Vajrakāya🔽Vajragātra

original: badzra g'a tra /🔽badzra ne tra zhes pa la sogs pa yan lag so so'i sngags te /
analyzed: badzra g'a tra / badzra ne tra zhes pa la sogs pa yan lag so so'i sngags te /
translated: Vajranetra🔽and so on.

original: brgya lam na sngon gyi skye ba la bsgrubs na bklags pas 'grub bo //
analyzed: brgya lam na sngon gyi skye ba la bsgrubs na bklags pas 'grub bo //
translated: If one has previously accomplished the mantra of the individual limbs, it is accomplished by recitation.

original: skye ba 'di la bsgrubs na yang 'grub par 'gyur te de nas las byed do //
analyzed: skye ba 'di la bsgrubs na yang 'grub par 'gyur te de nas las byed do //
translated: If one practices in this life, one will be successful, and then one will perform the rite.

original: 'dir thugs la sogs pa rnams kyi sngags bsgom par bya ba ni ming gi yi ge dang po'o //
analyzed: 'dir thugs la sogs pa rnams kyi sngags bsgom par bya ba ni ming gi yi ge dang po'o //
translated: Here, the mantra of the mind, etc., is the first letter of the name.

original: mchod par bya ba ni ming gi sngags so //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba ni ming gi sngags so //
translated: The one to be worshipped is the mantra of the name.

original: bzlas par bya ba ni ming las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: bzlas par bya ba ni ming las lhag pa'o //
translated: The one to be repeated is the one that is more than the name.

original: rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa bgrang phreng la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnams kyis so //🔽thugs kyi dbye bas bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa bgrang phreng la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnams kyis so // thugs kyi dbye bas bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: By the power of one’s own buddha family, by the divisions of the rosary, etc.

original: gsung gi dbye bas mchod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsung gi dbye bas mchod par bya ba'o //
translated: The one to be worshipped is by the division of speech.

original: sku yi dbye bas bzlas par bya ba'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: sku yi dbye bas bzlas par bya ba'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The one to be repeated is by the division of body.🔽This is the determination.

original: 'dir aom yig ma gtogs pa'i ming gi yi ge dang po lha'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir aom yig ma gtogs pa'i ming gi yi ge dang po lha'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should meditate on the first letter of the name in the form of the deity, except for the letter Oṃ.

original: aom yig dang po'i ming gis thams cad la mchod par bya ste sku rdo rje so //
analyzed: aom yig dang po'i ming gis thams cad la mchod par bya ste sku rdo rje so //
translated: One should worship everything with the name that begins with the letter Oṃ, and one should repeat the body vajra, etc.

original: de bzhin du yan lag so so la dang por sku rdo rje dang mthar thugs rdo rje h'um phat ces pa byin nas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag so so la dang por sku rdo rje dang mthar thugs rdo rje h'um phat ces pa byin nas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should recite the mantra of each limb, first the Body-Vajra, and finally the Mind-Vajra, with the syllable HŪṀ and Phat.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: Likewise, [one should recite the mantra] of all sentient beings, divided into body, speech, and mind.

original: da ni thun mong gi sngags sgrub pa la bzlas pa'i grangs gsungs pa so sor zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni thun mong gi sngags sgrub pa la bzlas pa'i grangs gsungs pa so sor zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in the common mantra practice, the number of recitations is stated, beginning with “individually.”

original: 'dir so sor sku rdo rje'i sngags kyi rigs ni ni bye ba bzlas par 'gyur te rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir so sor sku rdo rje'i sngags kyi rigs ni ni bye ba bzlas par 'gyur te rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: Here, the mantra-type of the individual Body-Vajra is recited ten million times, which is well known.

original: sbyin sreg ni bye ba bzlas pa de las bcu yi cha shas zhes pa gsung rdo rje'i sbyin sreg 'bum phrag bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin sreg ni bye ba bzlas pa de las bcu yi cha shas zhes pa gsung rdo rje'i sbyin sreg 'bum phrag bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: The burnt offering is one-tenth of that ten million recitations, which is one million, stated as “one-tenth of that,” which is the burnt offering of the Speech-Vajra.

original: rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi dbang gis dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams dang / thab dang 'dug stangs la sogs pa'i cho gas grub par 'gyur pa ji srid nyid du'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi dbang gis dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams dang / thab dang 'dug stangs la sogs pa'i cho gas grub par 'gyur pa ji srid nyid du'o //
translated: “By the power of the natural qualities” means that by the power of the qualities of peace and so forth, the substances taught in the chapter on empowerment, and by the rites of the hearth, posture, and so forth, one will be accomplished for as long as one lives.

original: @80b phyi nas zhi ba la sogs rnams la 'bras bu ster bar rab 'gyur rnam pa gzhan du 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: @80b phyi nas zhi ba la sogs rnams la 'bras bu ster bar rab 'gyur rnam pa gzhan du 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: Afterwards, they will surely bestow the fruits of peace and so forth, but not otherwise.

original: de ltar gsungs pa'i bsam gtan dang bcas bzlas dang sbyin sreg brtul zhugs nges ldan rnams kyis sngags kyi skye gnas bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa'i bsam gtan dang bcas bzlas dang sbyin sreg brtul zhugs nges ldan rnams kyis sngags kyi skye gnas bsgrub par bya //
translated: Thus, those who definitely possess the meditative concentration, recitation, burnt offerings, and observances taught here should accomplish the birth of the mantra.

original: 'dir lha gang dag gi dam tshig gang dang gang yin pa'i lha de ni dam tshig dang brtul zhugs dang nges pa des bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir lha gang dag gi dam tshig gang dang gang yin pa'i lha de ni dam tshig dang brtul zhugs dang nges pa des bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, whatever is the commitment of any deity, that deity is to be accomplished by that commitment, observance, and certainty.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it will not be accomplished.

original: de bzhin du bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge gal te sgrub pa po'i ming ge yi ge dang po'i dgrar gyur na de'i tshe sgrub pa po 'chi bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge gal te sgrub pa po'i ming ge yi ge dang po'i dgrar gyur na de'i tshe sgrub pa po 'chi bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Likewise, if the first letter of the name of the object of attainment is an enemy of the first letter of the name of the practitioner, then the practitioner will die.

original: ci ste tha mal par gyur na de'i tshe nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci ste tha mal par gyur na de'i tshe nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
translated: If they are neutral, then he will be afflicted.

original: ci ste grogs por gyur na de'i tshe lha 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste grogs por gyur na de'i tshe lha 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are friends, then the deity will be accomplished.

original: dbyangs dgra yis 'chi ba ste gsal byed dgra yis na ba'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dgra yis 'chi ba ste gsal byed dgra yis na ba'o //
translated: An enemy of a vowel is death, and an enemy of a consonant is sickness.

original: gzhan pa rlung gi yi ge thams cad chu'i yi ge rnams kyi dgra ste dbyangs rnams kyi dbyangs rnams dang gsal byed rnams kyi gsal byed rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan pa rlung gi yi ge thams cad chu'i yi ge rnams kyi dgra ste dbyangs rnams kyi dbyangs rnams dang gsal byed rnams kyi gsal byed rnams so //
translated: All the wind letters are enemies of the water letters, the vowels of the vowels, and the consonants of the consonants.

original: de bzhin du chu'i yi ge rnams me'i yi ge rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i yi ge rnams me'i yi ge rnams kyi'o //
translated: Likewise, the water letters are of the fire letters.

original: me'i yi ge rnams sa'i yi ge rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: me'i yi ge rnams sa'i yi ge rnams kyi'o //
translated: The fire letters are of the earth letters.

original: sa'i yi ge rnams rlung gi yi ge rnams kyi'o ;
analyzed: sa'i yi ge rnams rlung gi yi ge rnams kyi'o ;
translated: The earth letters are of the wind letters.

original: / nam mkha'i yi ge rnams thams cad kyi grogs po ste thams cad kyi yi ge rnams nam mkha'i grogs po'o //
analyzed: / nam mkha'i yi ge rnams thams cad kyi grogs po ste thams cad kyi yi ge rnams nam mkha'i grogs po'o //
translated: All the letters of space are friends of all the letters, and all the letters are friends of the letter of space.

original: de bzhin du sa'i grogs po chu dang me'i grogs po rlung dang rlung gi me dang chu'i sa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i grogs po chu dang me'i grogs po rlung dang rlung gi me dang chu'i sa ste /
translated: In the same way, the friend of earth is water, the friend of fire is wind, and the friend of wind is fire and earth.

original: de ltar na grogs po'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: de ltar na grogs po'i sde tshan no //
translated: Thus is the group of friends.

original: rlung gi tha mal pa ni chu dang me'i tha mal pa ni sa dang chu'i tha mal pa ni me dang sa'i tha mal pa ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: rlung gi tha mal pa ni chu dang me'i tha mal pa ni sa dang chu'i tha mal pa ni me dang sa'i tha mal pa ni rlung ngo //
translated: The neutral of wind is water, the neutral of fire and water is earth, and the neutral of earth and water is fire and wind.

original: de ltar thams cad shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus it should be known for all.

original: de nas sngags kyi lha bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sngags kyi lha bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las nges pa'o //

analyzed: de nas aom t'a re tu ta t'a re tu re sv'a h'a zhes pa sku rdo rje'i bzlas pa bye ba'i mthar thug pa dang 'bum phrag bcu'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Then with Om Tare tuttare ture svaha, the mantra of Kaya-vajra, one should do ten million repetitions and ten hundred thousand burnt offerings.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa rnams la sngags kyi lha mchog ster bar 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa rnams la sngags kyi lha mchog ster bar 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the supreme mantra deity will be granted to the yogis, but not otherwise.

original: thugs dang gsung dang sku'i dbye ba rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba dang mchod par bya ba dang bzlas par bya ba'i sngags so sor 'bum phrag drug dang 'bum phrag drug dang 'bum phrag bcu dang 'bum phrag brgya'o zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das🔽kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: thugs dang gsung dang sku'i dbye ba rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba dang mchod par bya ba dang bzlas par bya ba'i sngags so sor 'bum phrag drug dang 'bum phrag drug dang 'bum phrag bcu dang 'bum phrag brgya'o zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The mantra to be meditated upon, worshipped, and repeated by means of the divisions of mind, speech, and body are, respectively, six hundred thousand, six hundred thousand, ten hundred thousand, and one hundred thousand, as stated in the root tantra of the Bhagavān.

original: da ni ril bu'i sgrub pa gsungs pa grub pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni ril bu'i sgrub pa gsungs pa grub pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the accomplishment of the pill is stated beginning with “accomplishment” and so forth.

original: 'dir dang por ril bu sgrub pa'i sngags sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: 'dir dang por ril bu sgrub pa'i sngags sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas bsgrubs nas /
translated: Here, first, having accomplished the pill-accomplishing mantra by the previously stated ritual,

original: aom k'a la tsakra a'a dzny'a sid dha gu li k'am s'a dha ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom k'a la tsakra a'a dzny'a sid dha gu li k'am s'a dha ya sv'a h'a /
translated: one should repeat the mantra of the pill: Oṃ kālacakra āyurjñāna siddhi gulikāṃ sādhaya svāhā.

original: de nas ril bu bsgrub pa'i slang du lhas rab tu gnang bar 'gyur te de la 'di ni cho ga'o //
analyzed: de nas ril bu bsgrub pa'i slang du lhas rab tu gnang bar 'gyur te de la 'di ni cho ga'o //
translated: Then, the deity will grant permission to accomplish the pill. The ritual for that is as follows.

original: grub pa zhes pa ni dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa mkha' la spyod pa sum cu rtsa drug po rnams lnga dang drug dang bcu dang brgyad dang brgyad ni sde tshan te /
analyzed: grub pa zhes pa ni dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa mkha' la spyod pa sum cu rtsa drug po rnams lnga dang drug dang bcu dang brgyad dang brgyad ni sde tshan te /
translated: The accomplishment is the thirty-six sky-farers mentioned in the chapter on consecration, which are divided into five, six, ten, eight, and eight groups.

original: de rnams las sde tshan gcig gi sha bsgrubs nas grib mal bskams pa bdud rtsi lnga dang lhan cig tu phye mar byas te /
analyzed: de rnams las sde tshan gcig gi sha bsgrubs nas grib mal bskams pa bdud rtsi lnga dang lhan cig tu phye mar byas te /
translated: Having accomplished the flesh of one of these groups, and having dried it in the shade, one should grind it with the five nectars.

original: de nas mi bskyod pas sbrus nas tsa na ka'i tshad kyi ril bu byas te de ltar na grub pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas mi bskyod pas sbrus nas tsa na ka'i tshad kyi ril bu byas te de ltar na grub pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, having mixed it with Akshobhya, one should make a pill the size of a jujube seed. This is called accomplishment.

original: lcags gsum gyis bcings zhes pa ni 'dir sku dang / gsung dang thugs kyi dag pas zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi dbye bas dngul dang zangs dang khab len gyi lcags te /
analyzed: lcags gsum gyis bcings zhes pa ni 'dir sku dang / gsung dang thugs kyi dag pas zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi dbye bas dngul dang zangs dang khab len gyi lcags te /
translated: The bound by the three metals is the division of the moon, sun, and Rahu by the purities of body, speech, and mind, which are silver, copper, and iron.

original: so sor bcings pa ni lcags gsum gyis bcings pa'o //
analyzed: so sor bcings pa ni lcags gsum gyis bcings pa'o //
translated: The bound by the three metals is the individual binding.

original: mkha' la 'gro ba'i sha yi ril bu 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas bsgrubs pa na mkha' la spyod pa nyid ngag ster ro //
analyzed: mkha' la 'gro ba'i sha yi ril bu 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas bsgrubs pa na mkha' la spyod pa nyid ngag ster ro //
translated: The pill of the flesh of one who moves in the sky, accomplished by the process of the previously explained [mantra], bestows the power to move in the sky.

original: de bzhin du khyi dang rta la sogs pa sa la spyod pa dang chu la spyod pa rnams kyi lus kyi sha rnams kyi ril bu @83a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyi dang rta la sogs pa sa la spyod pa dang chu la spyod pa rnams kyi lus kyi sha rnams kyi ril bu @83a * //
translated: Similarly, the pills of the flesh of those who move on the earth, such as dogs and horses, and those who move in the water,

original: grub pa lcags gsum gyis bcings pas lus la bkres skom sogs dang / nad rnams 'phrog par byed do zhes pa ril bu sgrub pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa lcags gsum gyis bcings pas lus la bkres skom sogs dang / nad rnams 'phrog par byed do zhes pa ril bu sgrub pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: bound with the three metals, take away hunger, thirst, and so on, and diseases of the body. This is the rule for accomplishing the pills.

original: da ni mig sman sgrub pa gsungs pa de dag rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni mig sman sgrub pa gsungs pa de dag rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the accomplishment of eye medicine is stated: “of those” and so on.

original: 'dir mig sman sgrub pa'i sngags sngar bzhin bsgrubs nas de nas mig sman bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mig sman sgrub pa'i sngags sngar bzhin bsgrubs nas de nas mig sman bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Here, having accomplished the mantra for accomplishing eye medicine as before, then one should accomplish the eye medicine.

original: aom k'a la tsakra a'a dzny'a sid dh'a nydz'a nam s'a dha ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom k'a la tsakra a'a dzny'a sid dh'a nydz'a nam s'a dha ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ kālacakra ājñā siddhyadhanaṃ sādhaya svāhā.

original: de nas mkha' la 'gro ba rnams kyi mig rnams blangs nas phye ma zhib mor byas te /
analyzed: de nas mkha' la 'gro ba rnams kyi mig rnams blangs nas phye ma zhib mor byas te /
translated: Then, having taken the eyes of those who move in the sky, one should make a fine powder.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis sbru bar bya'o ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis sbru bar bya'o ;
translated: One should smear it with bodhicitta.

original: / mig sman de nyid ni gter bsgrub pa'i slad du sa rab tu 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / mig sman de nyid ni gter bsgrub pa'i slad du sa rab tu 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: That very eye ointment, for the sake of acquiring treasure, will become the division of the earth.

original: mkhris pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mkhris pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
translated: “Bile” means

original: khyi dang rta la sogs pa rnams kyi mkhris pa rnams kyi mig sman byas nas /
analyzed: khyi dang rta la sogs pa rnams kyi mkhris pa rnams kyi mig sman byas nas /
translated: that one should make an eye ointment from the bile of dogs, horses, and so on.

original: bud med kyi me tog gis sbru bar bya'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi me tog gis sbru bar bya'o //
translated: One should smear it with the flower of a woman.

original: mig sman de nyid ni mi snang ba'i yul la mi snang bar byed cing dbang du bya ba'i yul la na chung gi yid 'phrog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig sman de nyid ni mi snang ba'i yul la mi snang bar byed cing dbang du bya ba'i yul la na chung gi yid 'phrog par 'gyur te /
translated: That very eye ointment, in an invisible place, will make one invisible and, in the case of a young woman, will captivate her mind.

original: dpal ldan dur khrod du ni bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan dur khrod du ni bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished in the glorious cemetery.

original: de la 'di ni cho ga ste nag po'i brgyad kyi mtshan mo'am /
analyzed: de la 'di ni cho ga ste nag po'i brgyad kyi mtshan mo'am /
translated: The procedure there is that, on the night of the eighth of the dark fortnight,

original: yang na ma nu'i nyin zhag la zhes pa nag po'i bcu bzhi'i mtshan mo dkyil 'khor bzhengs byas nas /
analyzed: yang na ma nu'i nyin zhag la zhes pa nag po'i bcu bzhi'i mtshan mo dkyil 'khor bzhengs byas nas /
translated: or else, on the day of Mānuṣa, that is, having constructed the maṇḍala on the night of the fourteenth of the dark fortnight,

original: sngar gsungs pa'i lha min dbang po'i sgrub pa las bsrung ba sngar gsungs pa gang yin pa dag kyang kun nas byas te /🔽de nas de'i dbus su dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba la ril bu'am /🔽mig sman thod par gnas pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i lha min dbang po'i sgrub pa las bsrung ba sngar gsungs pa gang yin pa dag kyang kun nas byas te / de nas de'i dbus su dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba la ril bu'am / mig sman thod par gnas pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having made the protection as previously stated,🔽one should place in the center of the maṇḍala, in the middle of the maṇḍala, the pill

original: de ltar de yi dbus su sha yi ril bu rnams sam /
analyzed: de ltar de yi dbus su sha yi ril bu rnams sam /
translated: or the eye medicine in a skull-cup.🔽Having made the pill

original: mig sman ni byas nas shin tu dri bzangs me tog rnams kyis yang dag mchod cing /
analyzed: mig sman ni byas nas shin tu dri bzangs me tog rnams kyis yang dag mchod cing /
translated: or the eye medicine in this way, one should worship it with very fragrant flowers,

original: de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i gtor ma la sogs pa byin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i gtor ma la sogs pa byin la /
translated: and likewise give the previously mentioned bali offering, and so forth.

original: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa cho ga 'dis rab tu bya'o //🔽dus kyi 'khor lo'i bkas ji srid ril bu'am /
analyzed: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa cho ga 'dis rab tu bya'o // dus kyi 'khor lo'i bkas ji srid ril bu'am /
translated: Then one should perform the mantra recitation with the previously mentioned mantra ritual.🔽One should recite the mantra for as long as the pill

original: mig sman rnams 'od zer 'phro ba'i bar de srid du sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mig sman rnams 'od zer 'phro ba'i bar de srid du sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: or the eye medicine emits light, according to the Kālacakra order.

original: de nas te de'i mtshams su blangs la gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas te de'i mtshams su blangs la gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, at that time, one should take it and hold it.

original: @83b gal te 'od zer mi 'phro na de'i tshe yang ji srid lhas rab tu gnas par gyur gyi bar du sngags bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: @83b gal te 'od zer mi 'phro na de'i tshe yang ji srid lhas rab tu gnas par gyur gyi bar du sngags bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: If the light does not shine forth, then at that time, as long as the deity does not consecrate it, one should accomplish the mantra.

original: de nas ril bu bzung ba'i grangs kyi mi rnams ril bu'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas ril bu bzung ba'i grangs kyi mi rnams ril bu'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the people who hold the pill will become a knowledge-holder of the pill.

original: de bzhin du mig sman gyi rig pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig sman gyi rig pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Likewise, one will become a knowledge-holder of eye medicine.

original: ral gris ral gri'i rig pa 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ral gris ral gri'i rig pa 'dzin pa ste /
translated: With the sword, one will become a knowledge-holder of the sword.

original: de bzhin du rin po che la sogs pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin po che la sogs pas kyang ngo //
translated: Likewise, with the jewel and so forth.

original: de la sngags ni /
analyzed: de la sngags ni /
translated: The mantra is:

original: aom k'a la tsakra a'a dzny'a sed dha khat gam s'a dha ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom k'a la tsakra a'a dzny'a sed dha khat gam s'a dha ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ kālacakra ā jñāsaṃkhatakāṃ sādhaya svāhā.

original: de bzhin du rin po che la sogs pa rnams la dang por k'a la tsakra zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin po che la sogs pa rnams la dang por k'a la tsakra zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Likewise, for the jewel and so forth, at the beginning, “kālacakra” is definite.

original: de la lcags kyi ral gri byas nas lha'i nges pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de la lcags kyi ral gri byas nas lha'i nges pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: There, having made an iron sword, one should accomplish it with the deity’s definitive.

original: shel gyi rin po che dang / dngul gyi padma dang / gser gyi 'khor lo dang / lcags thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje dang / de bzhin du dril bu dang / lcags kyi gri gug byas nas so //
analyzed: shel gyi rin po che dang / dngul gyi padma dang / gser gyi 'khor lo dang / lcags thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje dang / de bzhin du dril bu dang / lcags kyi gri gug byas nas so //
translated: The crystal jewel, the silver lotus, the golden wheel, the vajra made of all the iron, and likewise the bell and the iron curved knife are made.

original: mtshan ma bsgrub pa'i nges pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma bsgrub pa'i nges pa ste /
translated: The ascertainment of the accomplishment of the signs.

original: de bzhin du rtse gsum dang dgra sta la sogs pa'i mtshon cha thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtse gsum dang dgra sta la sogs pa'i mtshon cha thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the trident, the battle-axe, and so forth, all the weapons are accomplished.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo'i bkas mtshon cha gang dang gang bsgrubs pa de mtshan ma des de'i rigs kyi rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo'i bkas mtshon cha gang dang gang bsgrubs pa de mtshan ma des de'i rigs kyi rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the order of the Wheel of Time, whatever weapon is accomplished, by that sign one becomes an awareness-holder of that family.

original: ci ste lha'i nges pas grub pa'i bcud bzhin du skye ba bdun du 'khor ba dang phrad na /
analyzed: ci ste lha'i nges pas grub pa'i bcud bzhin du skye ba bdun du 'khor ba dang phrad na /
translated: If, like the elixir of accomplishment by the ascertainment of the deity, one meets with the wheel of life for seven births,

original: sgrub pa med par yang mkha' la spyod pa rnams grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las nges pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa med par yang mkha' la spyod pa rnams grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las nges pa ste /
translated: even without practice, one will become accomplished in the sky-farers. This is the ascertainment from the root tantra.

original: ril bu la sogs pa sgrub pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: ril bu la sogs pa sgrub pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The ritual of the accomplishment of the pill and so forth.

original: de nas tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu lhag pa'i brgya pa nas /
analyzed: de nas tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu lhag pa'i brgya pa nas /
translated: Then, from the one hundred and seventy-seven verses,

original: mkha' lding gi tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi ni go sla ste des na 'dir ma bris so //
analyzed: mkha' lding gi tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi ni go sla ste des na 'dir ma bris so //
translated: the fourteen verses of the garuḍa are easy to understand, so they are not written here.

original: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa la 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa rig byed ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa la 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa rig byed ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala for pacifying, etc., is stated: the mantra, etc.,

original: 'dir dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i n+ya gro dha'i 'dab ma la sogs pa la shr'i khanda la sogs pa dang / tsandan la sogs pa'i smyu gus zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i n+ya gro dha'i 'dab ma la sogs pa la shr'i khanda la sogs pa dang / tsandan la sogs pa'i smyu gus zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: Here, on the nyagrodha leaf, etc., as stated in the chapter on empowerment, one should draw the maṇḍala for pacifying, etc., with a stick of sandalwood, etc., on śrīkhaṇḍa, etc.

original: de la 'di ni rim pa ste dang po'i zlum skor la 'dab ma bzhi dang / gnyis pa la brgyad dang / gsum pa la @84a * //
analyzed: de la 'di ni rim pa ste dang po'i zlum skor la 'dab ma bzhi dang / gnyis pa la brgyad dang / gsum pa la @84a * //
translated: The procedure there is as follows: On the first circle, there are four petals, on the second, eight, on the third,

original: bcu drug dang / bzhi pa la sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / lnga pa la drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / drug pa la sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu drug dang / bzhi pa la sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / lnga pa la drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / drug pa la sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: sixteen, on the fourth, thirty-two, on the fifth, sixty-four, and on the sixth, thirty-two.

original: ji ltar lus la gtsug tor dang / snying kha dang / dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / lte ba dang / gsang ba na 'khor lo drug yod pa de bzhin du 'khrul 'khor bri ba la zlum skor drug go //
analyzed: ji ltar lus la gtsug tor dang / snying kha dang / dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / lte ba dang / gsang ba na 'khor lo drug yod pa de bzhin du 'khrul 'khor bri ba la zlum skor drug go //
translated: Just as there are six cakras in the body, at the crown, heart, forehead, throat, navel, and secret place, so there are six circles in the drawing of the yantra.

original: de la 'dab ma bzhi'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de la 'dab ma bzhi'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming ngo //
translated: In the center of the four-petaled one, there is the name of the person to be benefited.

original: rig byed ces pa 'dab ma bzhi la phyogs su dang por aa aam zung zhes pa ni shar du aa /
analyzed: rig byed ces pa 'dab ma bzhi la phyogs su dang por aa aam zung zhes pa ni shar du aa /
translated: The Vedas are the four petals. First, the pair a and aṁ are in the directions. A is in the east.

original: byang du aam /
analyzed: byang du aam /
translated: Aṁ is in the north.

original: nub tu a'a /
analyzed: nub tu a'a /
translated: Aḥ is in the west.

original: lhor aa: zhes pa ni zlum skor dang po la'o //
analyzed: lhor aa: zhes pa ni zlum skor dang po la'o //
translated: Aḥ is in the south. This is on the first circle.

original: chu skyes 'dab brgyad ces pa ni ai la sogs pa 'dab brgyad la zhes pa ste /
analyzed: chu skyes 'dab brgyad ces pa ni ai la sogs pa 'dab brgyad la zhes pa ste /
translated: The eight-petaled lotus is the eight petals such as i.

original: shar dang mer ai a'i /🔽gshin rje dang bden bral ngu ri r'i /
analyzed: shar dang mer ai a'i / gshin rje dang bden bral ngu ri r'i /
translated: In the east and south are i and ī.🔽In the southwest and west are u and ū.

original: byang dang dbang ldan du au a'u /
analyzed: byang dang dbang ldan du au a'u /
translated: In the north and northeast are ṛ and ṝ.

original: nub dang rlung du li l'i zhes pa ni zlum skor gnyis pa la'o /
analyzed: nub dang rlung du li l'i zhes pa ni zlum skor gnyis pa la'o /
translated: In the northwest and north are ḷ and ḹ. This is on the second circle.

original: de bzhin du mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni zlum skor gsum pa'i 'dab ma bcu drug la ae ya la sogs zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni zlum skor gsum pa'i 'dab ma bcu drug la ae ya la sogs zhes pa ste /
translated: Likewise, “the lord of men” is the sixteen petals of the third circle.

original: shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma bzhi la ae aee y'a'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma bzhi la ae aee y'a'o //
translated: “E ya la sogs” are the four petals beginning with the east.

original: lho'i 'dab ma rnams la ar a'a ra ra r'a'o //
analyzed: lho'i 'dab ma rnams la ar a'a ra ra r'a'o //
translated: “Ar ā ra ra ra” are the petals of the south.

original: byang gi 'dab ma rnams la ao aoo wa w'a'o //
analyzed: byang gi 'dab ma rnams la ao aoo wa w'a'o //
translated: “Ao o va va” are the petals of the north.

original: nub kyi 'dab ma rnams la aa la a'a la la l'a zhes pa ni zlum skor gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: nub kyi 'dab ma rnams la aa la a'a la la l'a zhes pa ni zlum skor gsum pa la'o //
translated: “A la ā la la la” are the petals of the west.

original: so zhes pa 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams la ka sogs gsum gyis bsgyur pa'i bcu zhes pa sum cu dang haksha zhes pa gnyis skyes la'o //
analyzed: so zhes pa 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams la ka sogs gsum gyis bsgyur pa'i bcu zhes pa sum cu dang haksha zhes pa gnyis skyes la'o //
translated: “So” is the thirty-two petals. “Tri” is the three. “Daśa” is the ten. “Kṣa” is the two, ya and ra.

original: de la shar gyi dang po'i 'dab ma lnga po rnams la tsa tsha dza dzha nya dang / lho'i 'dab ma lnga rnams la ta tha da dha na dang / byang gi 'dab ma rnams la pha ba bha ma dang / nub kyi 'dab ma lnga rnams la ta tha da dha na'o //
analyzed: de la shar gyi dang po'i 'dab ma lnga po rnams la tsa tsha dza dzha nya dang / lho'i 'dab ma lnga rnams la ta tha da dha na dang / byang gi 'dab ma rnams la pha ba bha ma dang / nub kyi 'dab ma lnga rnams la ta tha da dha na'o //
translated: On that, the five petals of the first of the east are ca, cha, ja, jha, ña; the five petals of the south are ṭa, ṭha, ḍa, ḍha, ṇa; the five petals of the north are ta, tha, da, dha, na; and the five petals of the west are pa, pha, ba, bha, ma.

original: de bzhin du dbang ldan nas brtsams nas shar du 'dab ma gsum la ma yig nas brtsams te ka kha ga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang ldan nas brtsams nas shar du 'dab ma gsum la ma yig nas brtsams te ka kha ga'o //
translated: Likewise, beginning with the northeast, on the three petals in the east, beginning with the letter ma, are ka, kha, and ga.

original: me nas brtsams nas lhor 'dab ma gsum la nya yig nas brtsams te gha nga ksh'o //
analyzed: me nas brtsams nas lhor 'dab ma gsum la nya yig nas brtsams te gha nga ksh'o //
translated: Beginning with the southeast, on the three petals in the south, beginning with the letter ña, are ṭha, ña, and ḍa.

original: bden bral nas brtsams nas nub tu 'dab ma gsum la na yig nas brtsams te sa wa sha'o //
analyzed: bden bral nas brtsams nas nub tu 'dab ma gsum la na yig nas brtsams te sa wa sha'o //
translated: Beginning with the southwest, on the three petals in the west, beginning with the letter ṇa, are ta, tha, and da.

original: rlung nas brtsams nas byang du 'dab ma gsum la @84b na yig nas brtsams te sha thka  ha'o //
analyzed: rlung nas brtsams nas byang du 'dab ma gsum la @84b na yig nas brtsams te sha thka  ha'o //
translated: Beginning with the northwest, on the three petals in the north, beginning with the letter ṭa, are pa, pha, and ba.

original: de ltar 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams la ste zlum skor bzhi pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams la ste zlum skor bzhi pa la'o //
translated: Thus, on the thirty-two petals, on the fourth circle.

original: chu gter drug ces pa 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi la ste /
analyzed: chu gter drug ces pa 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi la ste /
translated: The “six oceans” are on the sixty-four petals.

original: thun mtshams 'dab ma bzhi po rnams la shar dang / lho dang / byang dang / nub tu bsgrub bya'i ming ste dbus su ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: thun mtshams 'dab ma bzhi po rnams la shar dang / lho dang / byang dang / nub tu bsgrub bya'i ming ste dbus su ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: On the four intermediate petals, in the east, south, north, and west, are the name of the victim, as before, in the center.

original: de ltar gnas lngar bsgrub bya'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gnas lngar bsgrub bya'i ming ngo //
translated: Thus, in five places are the name of the victim.

original: nub tu bsgrub bya'i ming las la l'a li l'i lri lr'i lu l'u lli ll'i lam la:zhes pa 'dab ma bcu gnyis la'o //
analyzed: nub tu bsgrub bya'i ming las la l'a li l'i lri lr'i lu l'u lli ll'i lam la:zhes pa 'dab ma bcu gnyis la'o //
translated: In the west, on the twelve petals, the name of the victim, with la la li li la ri la ri lu lu li li la li la ma la.

original: de nas shar du bsgrub bya'i pha rol gyi 'dab ma la ha'o //
analyzed: de nas shar du bsgrub bya'i pha rol gyi 'dab ma la ha'o //
translated: Then, in the east, on the petal of the enemy, ha.

original: nub tu h'a lhor ha: byang du ham ste /
analyzed: nub tu h'a lhor ha: byang du ham ste /
translated: In the west, ha; in the south, ha; in the north, ham.

original: de bzhin du g-yon skor gyis hi h'i dbang ldan gyi mthar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon skor gyis hi h'i dbang ldan gyi mthar ro //
translated: In the same way, in the counterclockwise order, hi hi in the northeast,

original: hri hr'i me'i mthar ro //🔽hu h'u rlung gi mthar ro //
analyzed: hri hr'i me'i mthar ro // hu h'u rlung gi mthar ro //
translated: hri hri in the southeast,🔽hu hu in the southwest,

original: hli hl'i bden bral gyi mthar ro //
analyzed: hli hl'i bden bral gyi mthar ro //
translated: hli hli in the northwest.

original: bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge dang po ni lte ba la'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge dang po ni lte ba la'o //
translated: The first letter of the name of the victim is in the center.

original: gnyis pa ni shar gyi thun mtshams kyi 'dab ma la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni shar gyi thun mtshams kyi 'dab ma la'o //
translated: The second is on the petal in the east.

original: gsum pa ni lhor dang bzhi pa ni byang du dang lnga pa ni nub tu ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni lhor dang bzhi pa ni byang du dang lnga pa ni nub tu ste /
translated: The third is in the south, the fourth in the north, and the fifth in the west.

original: de rnams h'um a'a: aom ho zhes pa thugs dang gsung dang sku dang ye shes kyi yi ge ming gi yi ge dang po dang bcas pa rnams bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams h'um a'a: aom ho zhes pa thugs dang gsung dang sku dang ye shes kyi yi ge ming gi yi ge dang po dang bcas pa rnams bri bar bya'o //
translated: All of them are written with the letters of the heart, speech, body, and gnosis, namely, hum, a, om, ho, together with the first letter of the name.

original: yang na aa sogs dbyangs ni re re dag gis chu srin bum pa'i dbang las ring po thung ngu dag kyang lnga zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na aa sogs dbyangs ni re re dag gis chu srin bum pa'i dbang las ring po thung ngu dag kyang lnga zhes pa ste /
translated: Or, each of the vowels such as a, from the sign of the water-bearer, the pitcher, are long and short, five each.

original: 'dir chu srin la sogs pa'i dus sbyor rnams kyi lhag pa'i @85a * //
analyzed: 'dir chu srin la sogs pa'i dus sbyor rnams kyi lhag pa'i @85a * //
translated: Here, the extra deities of the lunar mansions such as the water-bearer are k, kh, g, gh, and ṅ.

original: lha ni k'a kh'a g'a gh'a ng'a zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha ni k'a kh'a g'a gh'a ng'a zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The deities of the lunar mansions are k, kh, g, gh, and ṅ.

original: shar du bsgrub bya'i thugs kyi yi ge nas g-yas skor gyis nya la ts'a tsh'a dz'a dzh'a ny'a'o //
analyzed: shar du bsgrub bya'i thugs kyi yi ge nas g-yas skor gyis nya la ts'a tsh'a dz'a dzh'a ny'a'o //
translated: In the east, the heart-letter of the one to be accomplished is clockwise from the right, and the lunar mansions are ṭ, ṭh, ḍ, ḍh, ṇ.

original: de bzhin du lug la nya dzha dza tsha tsa ste de ltar 'dab ma bcu la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lug la nya dzha dza tsha tsa ste de ltar 'dab ma bcu la'o //
translated: In the same way, for Aries, the lunar mansions are ṭ, ḍh, ḍ, ṭh, ṭ, and so on for the ten petals.

original: de bzhin du lhor gsung rdo rje nas t'a la sogs pa bcu dang / byang du sku rdo rje nas p'a la sogs pa bcu dang / nub tu ye shes rdo rje nas t'a la sogs pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhor gsung rdo rje nas t'a la sogs pa bcu dang / byang du sku rdo rje nas p'a la sogs pa bcu dang / nub tu ye shes rdo rje nas t'a la sogs pa bcu'o //
translated: In the same way, in the south, the speech-vajra is from ṭ to ḍh, the ten; in the north, the body-vajra is from ta to ḍha, the ten; and in the west, the gnosis-vajra is from ta to ḍha, the ten.

original: lhag ma'i 'dab ma nyi shu po rnams kyi nub kyi 'dab ma lnga la k'a la sogs pa ring po lnga'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i 'dab ma nyi shu po rnams kyi nub kyi 'dab ma lnga la k'a la sogs pa ring po lnga'o //
translated: On the remaining twenty petals, on the five western petals are the five long vowels such as a.

original: shar du nga la sogs pa thung du lnga dang ; lhor s'a la sogs pa ring po lnga dang / byang du ska la sogs pa thung du lnga ste /
analyzed: shar du nga la sogs pa thung du lnga dang ; lhor s'a la sogs pa ring po lnga dang / byang du ska la sogs pa thung du lnga ste /
translated: In the east, the five short ones beginning with a; in the south, the five long ones beginning with sa; in the north, the five short ones beginning with ka.

original: de ltar yi ge drug cu rnams zlum skor lnga pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar yi ge drug cu rnams zlum skor lnga pa la'o //
translated: Thus, the sixty letters are on the fifth circle.

original: phyi rol 'dab ma sum cu gnyis la zhes pa ni 'dir gsang ba'i padma'i 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pas zlum skor drug pa'i 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams la bdag gi snying po badzra t'i kshna la sogs yi ge rnams zhes
analyzed: phyi rol 'dab ma sum cu gnyis la zhes pa ni 'dir gsang ba'i padma'i 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pas zlum skor drug pa'i 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams la bdag gi snying po badzra t'i kshna la sogs yi ge rnams zhes
translated: On the outer petals, thirty-two, means that here, by the purification of the thirty-two petals of the secret lotus, the thirty-two petals of the sixth circle are the letters of my essence, vajra-tīkṣṇa, and so forth.

original: pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: badzra t'i kshna du:kha tstshe da zhes pa ni dbang ldan nas brtsams nas me'i mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: badzra t'i kshna du:kha tstshe da zhes pa ni dbang ldan nas brtsams nas me'i mthar thug par ro //
translated: Vajra-tīkṣṇa, duḥkha-ccheda, beginning from the northeast and ending in the southeast.

original: de nas lhor pradzny'a dzny'a na m'u rtta ye dzny'a zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: de nas lhor pradzny'a dzny'a na m'u rtta ye dzny'a zhes pa'o ;
translated: Then, in the south, prajñā-jñāna-mūrtaye jñā.

original: / de bzhin du nub tu na k'a ya b'a g'i shva ra aa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du nub tu na k'a ya b'a g'i shva ra aa zhes pa'o //
translated: Likewise, in the west, naya-vāgīśvara-ā.

original: de bzhin du byang du ra pa tsa n'a ya te na ma:zhes pa ste badzra t'i kshna la sogs pa yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang du ra pa tsa n'a ya te na ma:zhes pa ste badzra t'i kshna la sogs pa yi ge rnams so //
translated: Likewise, in the north, ra pa tsa na ya te na ma, that is, the syllables vajra, tikshna, and so on.

original: de ltar 'khor lo drug gi bdag nyid kyi 'khrul 'khor dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas bris nas de dag rnams kyi phyi rol du yang zhi sogs las la wa ya ral dkyil 'khor rnams nyid do zhes pa ni 'khrul 'khor 'dis zhi ba dang rgyas
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo drug gi bdag nyid kyi 'khrul 'khor dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas bris nas de dag rnams kyi phyi rol du yang zhi sogs las la wa ya ral dkyil 'khor rnams nyid do zhes pa ni 'khrul 'khor 'dis zhi ba dang rgyas
translated: Thus, having drawn the machine with the nature of the six wheels by the rite taught in the chapter on the rite of subjugation, outside of them also are the maṇḍalas of the actions such as pacifying and so on, with the letters va, ya, ra, la, and da.🔽This machine is for pacifying, increasing,

original: pa dang rims 'phrog pa dang dug med par byed pa la 'khrul 'khor chu'i dkyil 'khor ram wa yig gis bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang rims 'phrog pa dang dug med par byed pa la 'khrul 'khor chu'i dkyil 'khor ram wa yig gis bskor bar bya'o //
translated: stealing a fever, and rendering poison ineffective.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus sam glang po che'i dbus su gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus sam glang po che'i dbus su gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, in the center of the maṇḍala of the moon or the center of the elephant, one should enter.

original: de bzhin du gsang pa la sogs pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / dbang la sogs pa la me'i dkyil 'khor dang / rengs pa la sogs pa la sa'i dkyil 'khor gyis @85b bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang pa la sogs pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / dbang la sogs pa la me'i dkyil 'khor dang / rengs pa la sogs pa la sa'i dkyil 'khor gyis @85b bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, for the secret and so forth, one should draw the wind maṇḍala; for the power and so forth, the fire maṇḍala; and for the paralysis and so forth, the earth maṇḍala.

original: lhag ma dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa dag bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa dag bya'o //
translated: The rest should be done as taught in the chapter on power.

original: 'dir 'khrul 'khor la snying por yi ge'i yan lag mchog ces pa ni snying por mgo bo bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'khrul 'khor la snying por yi ge'i yan lag mchog ces pa ni snying por mgo bo bri bar bya'o //
translated: Here, in the center of the machine, the supreme limb of the syllable is the head.

original: rtse mo ldan par rkang pa dag ni zhes pa lhun po thams cad kyi byang na gnas pa snying po'i lte ba yin pa'i phyir lhor rkang pa ste dbang dang dgug pa la'o //
analyzed: rtse mo ldan par rkang pa dag ni zhes pa lhun po thams cad kyi byang na gnas pa snying po'i lte ba yin pa'i phyir lhor rkang pa ste dbang dang dgug pa la'o //
translated: The feet are in the north, in the Meru of all, because it is the navel of the center.

original: de bzhin du zhi ba sogs la snying por rkang pa zhes pa ni byang du rkang pa ste lhun po la mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi ba sogs la snying por rkang pa zhes pa ni byang du rkang pa ste lhun po la mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, in the center of the pacification and so forth, the feet are in the north, facing Meru.

original: rtse mo ldan par mgo bo zhes pa ni lhor mgo bo'o //
analyzed: rtse mo ldan par mgo bo zhes pa ni lhor mgo bo'o //
translated: The head is in the south.

original: de bzhin du gsad pa la sogs pa la shar du rkang pa dang nub tu mgo bo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsad pa la sogs pa la shar du rkang pa dang nub tu mgo bo'o //
translated: Likewise, in killing, etc., the feet are in the east and the head in the west.

original: rengs pa la sogs pa la shar du mgo bo dang nub tu rkang pa ste de ltar 'khrul 'khor so so la sngags pas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rengs pa la sogs pa la shar du mgo bo dang nub tu rkang pa ste de ltar 'khrul 'khor so so la sngags pas bri bar bya'o //
translated: In paralyzing, etc., the head is in the east and the feet in the west. Thus the mantrin should draw the individual yantras.

original: zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Pacifying, etc., are easy to understand.

original: 'khor lo drug gi 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug gi 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the yantras of the six cakras.

original: da ni gshin rje mthar byed kyi 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa rtsibs brgyad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gshin rje mthar byed kyi 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa rtsibs brgyad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the yantras of Yamantaka are stated: eight spokes, etc.

original: 'dir n+ya gro dha'i 'dab ma la sogs pa la 'khrul 'khor bri bar bya ste zlum skor dang po ni rtsibs brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir n+ya gro dha'i 'dab ma la sogs pa la 'khrul 'khor bri bar bya ste zlum skor dang po ni rtsibs brgyad pa'o //
translated: Here, the yantras are drawn on a banyan leaf, etc. The first circle has eight spokes.

original: gnyis pa ni rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second has twelve spokes.

original: gsum pa ni rtsibs bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rtsibs bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The third has sixteen spokes.

original: de la rtsibs brgyad po rnams la phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas zhes pa ni phyogs su ya ma la sogs pa'i yi ge gnas pa dang phyogs bral gyi 'dab ma la bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge gnas shing bcu drug rtsibs la yang bar bar gyi 'dab
analyzed: de la rtsibs brgyad po rnams la phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas zhes pa ni phyogs su ya ma la sogs pa'i yi ge gnas pa dang phyogs bral gyi 'dab ma la bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge gnas shing bcu drug rtsibs la yang bar bar gyi 'dab
translated: The letters ya, ma, and so on are located in the cardinal directions, and the letters of the name of the victim are located on the intermediate spokes.

original: ma brgyad po rnams la'o //
analyzed: ma brgyad po rnams la'o //
translated: The eight petals are the sixteen spokes.

original: de ltar zlum skor dang po la bsgrub bya zur rnams su ste /
analyzed: de ltar zlum skor dang po la bsgrub bya zur rnams su ste /
translated: In this way, the victim is in the first circle in the corners.

original: dbus su lte bar rab tu 'gyur pa ya dang shar du ma dang rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i shar du r'a dang / gnyis par dz'a dang / gsum par sa dang 'dab ma bzhi par do'o //
analyzed: dbus su lte bar rab tu 'gyur pa ya dang shar du ma dang rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i shar du r'a dang / gnyis par dz'a dang / gsum par sa dang 'dab ma bzhi par do'o //
translated: In the center, in the hub, is the letter ya. In the east is the letter ma. On the twelve spokes, in the east is the letter ra, in the second position is the letter ja, in the third position is the letter sa, and in the fourth petal is the letter do.

original: dang po'i rtsibs brgyad pa'i lhor me'o //
analyzed: dang po'i rtsibs brgyad pa'i lhor me'o //
translated: In the south of the first eight spokes is the letter me.🔽 Again, on the petals of the twelve spokes, in the fifth position is the letter ru, and in the seventh position is the letter yo.

original: slar yang rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i 'dab ma lnga par ru drug pa na dang bdun par yo'o //
analyzed: slar yang rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i 'dab ma lnga par ru drug pa na dang bdun par yo'o //
translated: Again, in the west of the eight spokes is the letter da.🔽 Again, in the north of the eight spokes is the letter dha.🔽 Again, in the northeast of the eight spokes is the letter na.🔽 Again, in the southeast of the eight spokes is the letter pha.🔽 Again, in the southwest of the eight spokes is the letter ba.🔽 Again, in the northwest of the eight spokes is the letter ya.🔽 Again, in the nadir of the eight spokes is the letter ra.🔽 Again, in the zenith of the eight spokes is the letter la.

original: slar yang rtsibs brgyad pa'i nub kyi 'dab mar da'o //
analyzed: slar yang rtsibs brgyad pa'i nub kyi 'dab mar da'o //
translated: Again, in the center of the eight spokes is the letter va.

original: slar yang rtsibs bcu @86a * //
analyzed: slar yang rtsibs bcu @86a * //
translated: Again, in the center of the twelve spokes is the letter śa.🔽 Again, in the center of the sixteen spokes is the letter ṣa.🔽 Again, in the center of the thirty-two spokes is the letter sa.🔽 Again, in the center of the sixty-four spokes is the letter ha.🔽 Again, in the center of the one hundred and twenty-eight spokes is the letter kṣa.🔽 Again, in the center of the two hundred and fifty-six spokes is the letter a.🔽 Again, in the center of the five hundred and twelve spokes is the letter ā.🔽 Again, in the center of the one thousand and twenty-four spokes is the letter o.🔽 Again,

original: gnyis pa'i brgyad par ni dang dgu par ra dang bcu par ya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i brgyad par ni dang dgu par ra dang bcu par ya'o //
translated: In the eighth [square] of the second [row], there is a da. In the ninth [square], there is a ra. In the tenth [square], there is a ya.

original: slar yang rtsibs brgyad pa'i byang du kshe'o //
analyzed: slar yang rtsibs brgyad pa'i byang du kshe'o //
translated: Again, in the north of the eight-spoked [wheel], there is a kṣe.

original: slar yang rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i bcu gcig par tstsha dang bcu gnyis par ni'o //
analyzed: slar yang rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i bcu gcig par tstsha dang bcu gnyis par ni'o //
translated: Again, in the eleventh [square] of the twelve-spoked [wheel], there is a ca. In the twelfth [square], there is a ni.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa /🔽ya ma r'a dz'a sa do me ya /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa / ya ma r'a dz'a sa do me ya /
translated: Similarly, it is stated in the Root Tantra:🔽Yama rāja sa do me ya,🔽Yama me do ru na yo da ya,

original: ya me do ru na yo da ya /🔽ya da yo ni ra ya kshe ya /
analyzed: ya me do ru na yo da ya / ya da yo ni ra ya kshe ya /
translated: Yama da yo ni ra ya kṣe ya,

original: ya kshe yatstsha ni r'a ma ya zhes so //
analyzed: ya kshe yatstsha ni r'a ma ya zhes so //
translated: Yama kṣe ya ca ni ra ām ya.

original: gcig bdag po yis yi ge bcu drug po rnams 'dab ma bcu drug la'o //
analyzed: gcig bdag po yis yi ge bcu drug po rnams 'dab ma bcu drug la'o //
translated: The lord of the one [square] places the sixteen syllables on the sixteen petals.

original: de ltar dbus su rab 'gyur ya ma r'a dz'a sa do me ru na las yo'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbus su rab 'gyur ya ma r'a dz'a sa do me ru na las yo'o //
translated: Thus, in the center, there is a ya. In the east, there is a ma. In the south, there is a ra. In the west, there is a sa. In the north, there is a do. In the southeast, there is a me. In the southwest, there is a ru. In the northwest, there is a na. In the northeast, there is a ya. In the center, there is a kṣe. In the east, there is a ca. In the south, there is a ni. In the west, there is a ra. In the north, there is an ām.

original: de nas snying po'i rtsibs kyi dbus nas da ni ra ya kshe tstsha de nas mthar ni ni ru 'gyur zhes pa rtsibs brgyad pa dang rtsibs bcu gnyis pa la nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas snying po'i rtsibs kyi dbus nas da ni ra ya kshe tstsha de nas mthar ni ni ru 'gyur zhes pa rtsibs brgyad pa dang rtsibs bcu gnyis pa la nges pa'o //
translated: Then, from the center of the hub-spokes, there is a da. In the north, there is a ni. In the west, there is a ra. In the east, there is a ya. In the southeast, there is a kṣe. In the southwest, there is a ca. In the northwest, there is an ām. In the northeast, there is a ni. Thus, it is ascertained on the eight-spoked and twelve-spoked [wheels].

original: de nas rtsibs bcu drug pa la bsgrub bya'i ming gi bar bar gyi 'dab ma la sngags 'de bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rtsibs bcu drug pa la bsgrub bya'i ming gi bar bar gyi 'dab ma la sngags 'de bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the sixteen spokes, one should write the mantra in the spaces between the names of the victim.

original: aom hr'i sht'i pi kri t'a na na hum h'um phat ces pa'o //🔽de ltar re mig nas ni re mig bar la 'gyur te mi yi bdag po yi bdag po bsgrub bya'i ming dang sngags 'di'o //🔽dbye dang gsad dang dbang la zhes pa ni 'dir dbye ba la dbus su lhag pa'i lha ya dang gsad pa la ma dang dbang la r'a rab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom hr'i sht'i pi kri t'a na na hum h'um phat ces pa'o // de ltar re mig nas ni re mig bar la 'gyur te mi yi bdag po yi bdag po bsgrub bya'i ming dang sngags 'di'o // dbye dang gsad dang dbang la zhes pa ni 'dir dbye ba la dbus su lhag pa'i lha ya dang gsad pa la ma dang dbang la r'a rab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Om hrih shrikri ta ana na hum hum phat.🔽 Thus, from square to square, O lord of men, this is the mantra with the name of the victim.🔽As for dividing, killing, and controlling, here, for dividing, ya of the central deity is used, for killing, ma, and for controlling, ra.

original: de bzhin du kshe da me do sa tstsha sogs zhes pa ni 'dir rengs pa la kshe dang dgug pa la da dang rmongs pa la me dang stobs byed pa la do dang zhi ba la sa dang bskrad pa la tstsha dang rims byed pa la na dang
analyzed: de bzhin du kshe da me do sa tstsha sogs zhes pa ni 'dir rengs pa la kshe dang dgug pa la da dang rmongs pa la me dang stobs byed pa la do dang zhi ba la sa dang bskrad pa la tstsha dang rims byed pa la na dang
translated: Similarly, kṣe, da, me, do, sa, ccha, etc., here, for paralyzing, kṣe, for summoning, da, for deluding, me, for empowering, do, for pacifying, sa, for banishing, ccha, for causing fever, na, for killing, pha, for expelling, tha, for burning, da, for destroying, ya, for paralyzing, ra, for summoning, va, for deluding, la, for empowering, śa, for pacifying, ṣa, for banishing, sa, for causing fever, ha, for killing, kṣa, for expelling, pha, for burning, da, for destroying, ya, for paralyzing, ra, for summoning, va, for deluding, la, for empowering, śa, for pacifying, ṣa, for banishing, sa, for causing fever, ha, for killing, kṣa, for expelling, pha, for burning, da, for destroying, ya, for paralyzing, ra, for summoning, va, for deluding, la, for empowering, śa, for pacifying, ṣa, for banishing, sa, for causing fever, ha, for killing, kṣa, for expelling, pha, for burning, da, for destroying, ya, for paralyzing, ra, for summoning, va, for deluding, la, for empowering, śa, for pacifying, ṣa, for banishing, sa, for causing fever, ha, for killing, kṣa, for expelling, pha, for burning, da, for destroying, ya, for paralyzing, ra, for summoning, va, for deluding, la, for empowering, śa, for pacifying, ṣa, for banishing, sa, for causing fever, ha, for killing, kṣa, for expelling, pha, for burning

original: bskyod pa la ru dang brgyal ba la dz'a dang gdung ba zhi bar byed pa la yo dang dgra bzlog pa la ni'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa la ru dang brgyal ba la dz'a dang gdung ba zhi bar byed pa la yo dang dgra bzlog pa la ni'o //
translated: For shaking, ru; for fainting, ja; for pacifying torment, yo; for warding off enemies, ni.

original: der ni snying po ngag nas ya yig 'gro ste yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni 'dir las kyi rang bzhin gyis yi ge gang zhig snying por bdag por gyur pa de'i gnas su ya yig bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: der ni snying po ngag nas ya yig 'gro ste yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni 'dir las kyi rang bzhin gyis yi ge gang zhig snying por bdag por gyur pa de'i gnas su ya yig bri bar bya'o //
translated: There, the essence is the ya syllable, which goes from the mouth, by the power of the qualities. This means that one should write the ya syllable in the place of any syllable that is the essence, the master, by the nature of the action.

original: phyi rol thams cad snga ma bzhin te gshin rje mthar byed kyi 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol thams cad snga ma bzhin te gshin rje mthar byed kyi 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
translated: All else is as before. This is the rule for the Yāmana Wheel of Yāma.

original: da ni 'jam dpal gyi 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa yi ge rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir yi ge rnams kyi yan lag mchog las zhes pa ni yi ge rnams kyi mgo la thig le'o //
analyzed: da ni 'jam dpal gyi 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa yi ge rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir yi ge rnams kyi yan lag mchog las zhes pa ni yi ge rnams kyi mgo la thig le'o //
translated: Now, the wheel of Mañjuśrī is stated: “The syllables,” etc. Here, “from the supreme limb of the syllables” means that the bindu is on the head of the syllables.

original: yan lag mchog de las mdun du dbyangs kyis 'khrud @86b pa ngag ma ru rab tu 'gyur te rjes su nga ro dbyangs aa yig gis 'khyud pa ni ma ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag mchog de las mdun du dbyangs kyis 'khrud @86b pa ngag ma ru rab tu 'gyur te rjes su nga ro dbyangs aa yig gis 'khyud pa ni ma ru 'gyur ro //
translated: From that supreme limb, in front, the vowel is the cleansing ā, which becomes the ra. The vowel anusvāra embraced by the vowel a is the ra.

original: gzhan yang ka yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis 'khyud pa ni sde mtha' zhes pa nga nya na ma nan rnams su 'gyur te rdo rje rigs kyi dbang gis lnga pa ham dang sam du gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ka yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis 'khyud pa ni sde mtha' zhes pa nga nya na ma nan rnams su 'gyur te rdo rje rigs kyi dbang gis lnga pa ham dang sam du gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, the embrace of the letters such as ka and so on is the final class, which becomes ṅa, ña, ṇa, and ṇa. By the power of the vajra class, the fifth is said to be ha and sa.

original: de'i phyir thig le ni bdag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir thig le ni bdag go //
translated: Therefore, the drop is the self.

original: rnam par bcad pa thig le gnyis kyis dbyangs mchog sbyar ba la ni zhes pa aa yig gnyis kyi dbus su 'di yang bdag gi shes rab yi ge au ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa thig le gnyis kyis dbyangs mchog sbyar ba la ni zhes pa aa yig gnyis kyi dbus su 'di yang bdag gi shes rab yi ge au ru 'gyur ro //
translated: In the union of the supreme melody with the two drops that are cut off, that is, in the middle of the two a letters, this is also my wisdom, the letter u.

original: de ltar ma: zhes pa ni thabs te mu:zhes pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: de ltar ma: zhes pa ni thabs te mu:zhes pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Thus, ma is the method, and mu is wisdom.

original: de bzhin du ham hu:sam su:mam dzu:zhes pa yi ge brgyad po rnams 'dab ma brgyad la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ham hu:sam su:mam dzu:zhes pa yi ge brgyad po rnams 'dab ma brgyad la'o //
translated: Likewise, the eight letters ha ha hu, sa sa su, ma ma ju are on the eight petals.

original: nyi ma'i 'dab ma la zhes pa rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i zlum skor gnyis pa la /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'dab ma la zhes pa rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i zlum skor gnyis pa la /
translated: On the sun petal, that is, on the second circle with twelve spokes,

original: phyi rol du 'dab ma dang po la shr'i dang gnyis pa la ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'dab ma dang po la shr'i dang gnyis pa la ba'o //
translated: on the first petal outside is śrī, and on the second is va.

original: de bzhin du rim pas dzra gho sha sa manta bha tra h'um phat ces pa yi ge bcu gnyis po rnams te lhag ma thams cad sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim pas dzra gho sha sa manta bha tra h'um phat ces pa yi ge bcu gnyis po rnams te lhag ma thams cad sngar bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, in order, the twelve syllables are: jra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra hūṃ phaṭ. All the rest is as before.

original: bsgrub bya 'dir ni lte ba la ste zhes pa ni bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge dang po lte ba la'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya 'dir ni lte ba la ste zhes pa ni bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge dang po lte ba la'o //
translated: Here, the name of the victim is in the center. The first syllable of the name of the victim is in the center.

original: de nas bzlas pa'i dus su dpal ldan zhi ba sogs la bskul zhes pa ni aom shr'i badzra gho sha sa manta bha tra che ge mo'i sh'antim ku ru ku ru na ma:de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs pa la sv'a h'a phat h'um pa sha ta boo
analyzed: de nas bzlas pa'i dus su dpal ldan zhi ba sogs la bskul zhes pa ni aom shr'i badzra gho sha sa manta bha tra che ge mo'i sh'antim ku ru ku ru na ma:de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs pa la sv'a h'a phat h'um pa sha ta boo
translated: Then, at the time of the recitation, one should incite Śrī Heruka and so forth with the words, “Śānti and so forth.” One should add śāntiṃ kuru kuru namaḥ at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s śāntiṃ kuru kuru namaḥ. In the same way, for prosperity and so forth, one should add svāhā phaṭ hūṃ paśa taṃ bhoḥ at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s śāntiṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: sha ta ces pa mthar sbyin par bya ste 'khrul 'khor bri ba la yang mtha'i 'dab ma la'o //
analyzed: sha ta ces pa mthar sbyin par bya ste 'khrul 'khor bri ba la yang mtha'i 'dab ma la'o //
translated: One should add phaṭ at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s māraṇaṃ kuru kuru phaṭ.🔽One should add hūṃ at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s uccaṭaṇaṃ kuru kuru hūṃ.🔽One should add vaśa at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s vaśaṃ kuru kuru vaśa.🔽One should add oṃ at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s ākarṣaṇaṃ kuru kuru oṃ.🔽One should add hūṃ at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s ākarṣaṇaṃ kuru kuru hūṃ.🔽One should add phaṭ at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s māraṇaṃ kuru kuru phaṭ.🔽One should add hūṃ at the end of oṃ śrī vajra ghoṣa sa manta bhatra so and so’s uccaṭaṇaṃ kuru kuru hūṃ.

original: de bzhin sngar brjod 'khor lo rnams dag la yang rtag tu bsgrub bya'i ming ni bri bar bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin sngar brjod 'khor lo rnams dag la yang rtag tu bsgrub bya'i ming ni bri bar bya bar 'gyur /
translated: One should add vaśa at the end of oṃ śrī vajra gho

original: 'di rnams thams cad bdag gi drin las rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis mi rnams kyis ni 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa ste 'khrul 'khor bri ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad bdag gi drin las rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis mi rnams kyis ni 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa ste 'khrul 'khor bri ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual of drawing the machine.

original: de nas tshigs su bcad pa brgyad dgu bcu rtsa gcig pa'i rjes la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu ni go sla ste sgra ni gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa nas pho nya mo rnams dag la zas phud ces pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i mthar thug pa'i
analyzed: de nas tshigs su bcad pa brgyad dgu bcu rtsa gcig pa'i rjes la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu ni go sla ste sgra ni gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa nas pho nya mo rnams dag la zas phud ces pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i mthar thug pa'i
translated: Then, after the eighth, ninth, and eleventh verses, the forty verses are easy to understand, from What is sound? up to the verse The leftovers of food for the messengers.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'ga' zhig ni go sla zhing tshigs su bcad pa 'ga' zhig ni dgos pa'i dbang gis dbang gi le'ur @87a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'ga' zhig ni go sla zhing tshigs su bcad pa 'ga' zhig ni dgos pa'i dbang gis dbang gi le'ur @87a * //
translated: Some verses are easy to understand, and some verses were supplemented in the chapter on empowerment due to the need.

original: kha bskangs te brjod zin to //
analyzed: kha bskangs te brjod zin to //
translated: They have already been explained.

original: da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi slad du lha yi dmigs pa gsungs pa lha yi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lha yi dmigs pa gang yin mngon sum
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi slad du lha yi dmigs pa gsungs pa lha yi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lha yi dmigs pa gang yin mngon sum
translated: Now, in order to attain mundane and supramundane feats, the focus on the deity is stated: “The deity,” and so on.🔽

original: dang ni rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dang ni rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to attain mundane and supramundane powers, the focus on the deity is stated: “The focus on the deity” and so on. Here, due to the power of the thoughts of sentient beings, the focus on the deity of yogins and yoginīs is twofold: direct perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de dag las mngon sum gang yin pa dag ni de nyid sbyor bas mkha' la skar ma bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de dag las mngon sum gang yin pa dag ni de nyid sbyor bas mkha' la skar ma bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Of those, direct perception and inference, those that are direct perception are applied to that, like stars in the sky.

original: skar ma'i tshogs bzhin du du ma longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes pa ni sha la sogs pa'i mig gis gzung bar bya ba srid pa gsum dang dus gsum rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: skar ma'i tshogs bzhin du du ma longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes pa ni sha la sogs pa'i mig gis gzung bar bya ba srid pa gsum dang dus gsum rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The many saṃbhogakāyas, like a multitude of stars, are objects to be apprehended by the eyes of flesh and so on, and are similar to dreams and illusions in the three existences and three times.

original: 'dir dang por las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pas mngon par shes pa med par sha'i mig gis sna tshogs mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dir dang por las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pas mngon par shes pa med par sha'i mig gis sna tshogs mthong ngo //
translated: Here, first, the yogin of the beginner, without superknowledge, sees the various [objects] with the eye of flesh.

original: de nas mngon par shes pa'i mtshams kyi dbang gis lha'i mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas mngon par shes pa'i mtshams kyi dbang gis lha'i mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: Then, by the power of the limit of superknowledge, he sees with the divine eye.

original: de nas chags pa dang bral ba'i mtshams kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
analyzed: de nas chags pa dang bral ba'i mtshams kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
translated: Then, by the power of the limit of freedom from attachment, he sees with the buddha eye.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i mtshams kyi dbang gis shes rab kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i mtshams kyi dbang gis shes rab kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
translated: Then, by the power of the limit of the bodhisattva, he sees with the eye of wisdom.

original: de nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshams kyi thugs kyi dbang gis ye shes kyi spyan gyis gzigs te lhag ma kun las rnam grol zhing zhes so //
analyzed: de nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshams kyi thugs kyi dbang gis ye shes kyi spyan gyis gzigs te lhag ma kun las rnam grol zhing zhes so //
translated: Then, by the power of the mind of perfect buddhahood, he sees with the eye of gnosis, completely liberated from all the rest.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sha la sogs pa'i spyan lnga po rnams ni stong pa nyid gzigs pa'i slad du ste ;
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sha la sogs pa'i spyan lnga po rnams ni stong pa nyid gzigs pa'i slad du ste ;
translated: Thus, the five eyes of the Tathāgata, beginning with the fleshly eye, are for the sake of seeing emptiness.

original: sems can gzhan rnams ni stong pa nyid lta ba'i yul la dmus long ngo //
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams ni stong pa nyid lta ba'i yul la dmus long ngo //
translated: Other sentient beings are blind to the object of the view of emptiness.

original: 'dir nams kyi rgyas pa ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa las brjod par bya ste de kho na nyid bsgom pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir nams kyi rgyas pa ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa las brjod par bya ste de kho na nyid bsgom pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Here, the extensive explanation of the “how” should be stated from the Accomplishment of Supreme Unchanging Wisdom, which is the certainty of meditating on reality.

original: de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i sgrub pa la mngon sum min na rjes su dpag pa shi ba'i lus bzhin de nyid min pa yis ni brtags pa gang /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i sgrub pa la mngon sum min na rjes su dpag pa shi ba'i lus bzhin de nyid min pa yis ni brtags pa gang /
translated: If the accomplishment of what is not reality is not direct perception, then what is imagined by what is not reality, like the body of a dead person, is inferred.

original: de ni ri mo sogs la blta bya zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sku gzugs ri mor byas pa dang lugs ma'am dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bris nas nges pa'i rnam par @87b blta bar bya ste byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa dman
analyzed: de ni ri mo sogs la blta bya zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sku gzugs ri mor byas pa dang lugs ma'am dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bris nas nges pa'i rnam par @87b blta bar bya ste byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa dman
translated: “ That should be seen in paintings, etc.” means that the forms of the buddhas and bodhisattvas should be seen in paintings, statues, or maṇḍala wheels with certainty, for the sake of the meditation of inferior, childish yogins.

original: pa rnams kyi bsgom pa'i don du'o zhes pa rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: pa rnams kyi bsgom pa'i don du'o zhes pa rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of conceptual meditation.

original: da ni rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'i thabs gsungs pa gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi nus pas gzugs zhes pa lha gcig gam dkyil 'khor bris skur bris pa bsgom par bya ste dang por bris
