translated: by that reality of mantra, if the vajra master performs the rite of tracing the maṇḍala, etc. for the sake of the attainment of the great seal, then at that time, enlightenment is difficult to attain for that one who does it. This is the definitive statement of the Tathāgata.

original: rgyu des na zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don dang bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du ste phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du ni ma yin no
analyzed: rgyu des na zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don dang bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du ste phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du ni ma yin no
translated: For that reason, Candraprabha's request is for the sake of accomplishing mundane attainments and the accumulation of merit, but not for the sake of accomplishing the attainment of the great seal and the accumulation of wisdom.

original: // 'dir ye shes bsgrub pa'i slad du gzhan dkyil 'khor gsum bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste //
analyzed: // 'dir ye shes bsgrub pa'i slad du gzhan dkyil 'khor gsum bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste //
translated: Here, in order to accomplish the knowledge, the Blessed One has taught another mandala, which is as follows:

original: lus kyi dbang po bha ga sems //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po bha ga sems //
translated: The body sense-faculty, the bhaga, the mind,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yi //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yi //
translated: and the vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: are the three kinds of mandalas.

original: gzhan pa tshon lnga ldan pa min //
analyzed: gzhan pa tshon lnga ldan pa min //
translated: The other one is not endowed with five colors.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is what it says.

original: de'i phyir bde ba chen po sgrub pa dang mchog gi dbang bskur ba sbyin @89b ba'i don du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba chen po sgrub pa dang mchog gi dbang bskur ba sbyin @89b ba'i don du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to accomplish the great bliss and bestow the supreme consecration, the mandala of colored powders will not be used. This is the request of Sucandra.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig ste gsol ba btab pa'i tshig de nyid gsan nas ni bde bar gshegs pas dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor thams cad rab tu gsungs te thams cad 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas bstan to zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig ste gsol ba btab pa'i tshig de nyid gsan nas ni bde bar gshegs pas dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor thams cad rab tu gsungs te thams cad 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas bstan to zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having heard those very words of request, the speech of Sucandra, the Sugata fully taught all the mandalas of the Wheel of Time, which will be explained in full. This is the meaning.

original: ston po po dang gsol ba 'debs pa po'i tshig bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ston po po dang gsol ba 'debs pa po'i tshig bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of the words of the teacher and the supplicant.

original: da ni bla ma bsten pa'i don du rdo rje slob dpon yongs su brtag pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni bla ma bsten pa'i don du rdo rje slob dpon yongs su brtag pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to rely on the guru, the thorough examination of the vajra master is stated in two verses.

original: 'dir sngags kyi tshul la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub 'dod pa'i slob ma rnams kyis dang por bla ma bsten par bya ste de yang rdo rje slob dpon yongs su brtag pa gsungs pa'i tshogs yang dag par yongs su brtags nas so //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi tshul la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub 'dod pa'i slob ma rnams kyis dang por bla ma bsten par bya ste de yang rdo rje slob dpon yongs su brtag pa gsungs pa'i tshogs yang dag par yongs su brtags nas so //
translated: Here, in the mantra system, disciples who desire mundane and supramundane feats should first rely on the guru, and they should do so after thoroughly examining the assembly of those who teach the thorough examination of the vajra master.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yongs su brtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i bla ma bsten pas slob ma rnams kyi chos phyin ci log tu 'gyur te chos phyin ci log pas dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yongs su brtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i bla ma bsten pas slob ma rnams kyi chos phyin ci log tu 'gyur te chos phyin ci log pas dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if disciples rely on a guru who lacks the characteristics of thorough examination, they will have a distorted Dharma, and due to a distorted Dharma, they will go to hell.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dang por yang dag bsten bya bla ma dag kyang dam tshig ldan zhing zhes pa la 'dir dam tshig rnam pa gnyis ni phyi dang nang gi ste drang pa dang nges pa'i don gyis rtogs par bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dang por yang dag bsten bya bla ma dag kyang dam tshig ldan zhing zhes pa la 'dir dam tshig rnam pa gnyis ni phyi dang nang gi ste drang pa dang nges pa'i don gyis rtogs par bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The teacher who is endowed with the commitments is one who has the two kinds of commitments, the outer and the inner, which are to be understood from the interpretable and the definitive meanings, as will be explained.

original: dam tshig 'di la yod pa'i phyir dam tshig ldan pa'i bla ma'o //
analyzed: dam tshig 'di la yod pa'i phyir dam tshig ldan pa'i bla ma'o //
translated: Because he has these commitments, he is the teacher who is endowed with the commitments.

original: dang por yang dag par bstan par bya ste bu dang chung ma la sogs pas kyang mnyes par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang por yang dag par bstan par bya ste bu dang chung ma la sogs pas kyang mnyes par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: He is to be served first of all, and he is to be pleased with gifts of one's children, wife, and so on.

original: rdo rje theg pa la lhag par gnas zhes pa la 'dir rdo rje theg pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste mu stegs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste thar
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa la lhag par gnas zhes pa la 'dir rdo rje theg pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste mu stegs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste thar
translated: The teacher who is firmly established in the Vajrayana is so called because the Vajrayana is the vehicle of the perfect Buddha, and it is called Vajra because it cannot be split by the vehicles of the heterodox, the Sravakas, and the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: par 'dis 'gro ba'i phyir rdo rje theg pa'o //
analyzed: par 'dis 'gro ba'i phyir rdo rje theg pa'o //
translated: It is called the Vajrayana because one goes to liberation by means of it.

original: de la lhag par gnas pa ni rdo rje theg pa la lhag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhag par gnas pa ni rdo rje theg pa la lhag par gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that is abiding in the Vajrayāna.

original: de nyid bsgoms shing zhes pa la 'dir de nyid ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid sgrub par byed pa rnam pa gnyis te lnga pa ye shes kyi le'u yi mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes
analyzed: de nyid bsgoms shing zhes pa la 'dir de nyid ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid sgrub par byed pa rnam pa gnyis te lnga pa ye shes kyi le'u yi mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes
translated: Meditating on that very thing refers to the two kinds of that very thing that is, the thing that accomplishes mundane feats and the thing that accomplishes perfect buddhahood, which will be explained in the fifth chapter on the gnosis of non-emission.

original: grub pa 'chad par 'gyur pa @90a * //🔽las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: grub pa 'chad par 'gyur pa @90a * // las brjod par bya'o //
translated: The supreme of all, the supreme of all, is the supreme of all things.

original: de nyid de kho na sgom pa ni 'di'i ngang tshul lo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid de kho na sgom pa ni 'di'i ngang tshul lo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Meditating on that very thing is the nature of this.

original: ma chags zhes pa ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa thams cad dang rang gi lus la yang ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags zhes pa ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa thams cad dang rang gi lus la yang ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: Not attached means not caring for anything, such as children, wife, and so on, and also one’s own body.

original: dri ma dag dang rnam par bral zhing zhes pa la dri ma ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang nga rgyal dang phrag dog dang ser sna'i tshogs te de nyid rnam pa mang pos bral ba gang yin pa de ni dri ma dag dang rnam
analyzed: dri ma dag dang rnam par bral zhing zhes pa la dri ma ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang nga rgyal dang phrag dog dang ser sna'i tshogs te de nyid rnam pa mang pos bral ba gang yin pa de ni dri ma dag dang rnam
translated: It is free from all stains means that the stains are the accumulations of desire, anger, ignorance, pride, jealousy, and miserliness.🔽

original: par bral ba'o //
analyzed: par bral ba'o //
translated: Free from all defilements means that he is free from the multitude of defilements, which are desire, hatred, ignorance, pride, envy, and avarice.

original: bzod pa'i ngang tshul zhes pa la bzod pa ni 'di 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i ngang tshul zhes pa la bzod pa ni 'di 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with patience means that he is endowed with patience, which is the nature of the non-retaliation of harm done to him.

original: lam la zhugs zhes pa la lam ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam ste de la zhugs pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: lam la zhugs zhes pa la lam ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam ste de la zhugs pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: He is endowed with the path means that he is endowed with the path, which is the path to perfect enlightenment.

original: bla ma de bsten par 'gyur na slob ma rnams la lam ni sbyin byed dmyal ba'i 'jig pa 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma de bsten par 'gyur na slob ma rnams la lam ni sbyin byed dmyal ba'i 'jig pa 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is attended by such a guru, the disciples are given the path and are freed from the fear of the hells.

original: de nyid las ni tshangs spyod ldan zhes pa gang zhig mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las ni tshangs spyod ldan zhes pa gang zhig mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde pa thob pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with pure conduct means that he is endowed with pure conduct, which is the attainment of supreme, non-transcendent bliss.

original: bdud rnams la zhes pa phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu ste bdud bzhi po rnams la rdo rje dbyug pa dang 'dra ba rdo rje dbyug pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rnams la zhes pa phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu ste bdud bzhi po rnams la rdo rje dbyug pa dang 'dra ba rdo rje dbyug pa'o //
translated: The vajra club is like a vajra club. 🔽 It is well known as Vajrasattva on the basis of the lineage, by the emanation body.

original: de yang lan ma'i gzhi la rdo rje sems dpar rab tu grags pa ste sprul pa'i skus so zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon bsten pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de yang lan ma'i gzhi la rdo rje sems dpar rab tu grags pa ste sprul pa'i skus so zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon bsten pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of relying on the vajra master.

original: da ni gdug pa'i slob dpon gyi skyon yongs su brtag pa'i don du nga rgyal dang ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa nyid kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni gdug pa'i slob dpon gyi skyon yongs su brtag pa'i don du nga rgyal dang ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa nyid kyis gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to fully investigate the faults of a wicked master, the third verse beginning with arrogant is stated.

original: 'dir sngags kyi tshul la bla ma gang zhig nga rgyal la sogs pa'i skyon dang bcas pa'i bla ma de ni bla mar byas kyang dmyal ba bzhin du slob ma mkhas pa ste shes ldan rnams kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyur ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi tshul la bla ma gang zhig nga rgyal la sogs pa'i skyon dang bcas pa'i bla ma de ni bla mar byas kyang dmyal ba bzhin du slob ma mkhas pa ste shes ldan rnams kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyur ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, any guru in the way of mantra who is a guru with faults such as arrogance, even if made a guru, should be abandoned by the wise, that is, by the learned, as a cause of perfect enlightenment, like a hell.

original: nga rgyal 'di la yod pa'i phyir nga rgyal dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal 'di la yod pa'i phyir nga rgyal dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is proud because he has this pride.

original: nga rgyal yang rnam pa du ma ste mkhas pas mngon par khengs pa dang rdzas dang dbang phyug gis mngon par khengs pa dang de nyid bcu yongs su shes pa dang lam dang gzugs la sogs pas mngon par khengs pa ste de gang la yod pa de ni
analyzed: nga rgyal yang rnam pa du ma ste mkhas pas mngon par khengs pa dang rdzas dang dbang phyug gis mngon par khengs pa dang de nyid bcu yongs su shes pa dang lam dang gzugs la sogs pas mngon par khengs pa ste de gang la yod pa de ni
translated: Pride is of many kinds: pride of the learned, pride of wealth and power, pride of the ten powers, pride of the path, pride of form, etc.

original: spang bar bya'o //🔽'og ma 'og ma'i sems can rnams la bltas na nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang gong ma gong ma'i sems can rnams la bltas na nga rgyal dang bral bar 'gyur @90b pa des na yang dag pa'i lam rig pa pos nga rgyal dang ldan zhing snying rje dang
analyzed: spang bar bya'o // 'og ma 'og ma'i sems can rnams la bltas na nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang gong ma gong ma'i sems can rnams la bltas na nga rgyal dang bral bar 'gyur @90b pa des na yang dag pa'i lam rig pa pos nga rgyal dang ldan zhing snying rje dang
translated: He should abandon that pride which is present in him.🔽When he looks at the lower sentient beings, he is proud; when he looks at the higher sentient beings, he is free from pride.

original: bral ba ni spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bral ba ni spang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the one who knows the right path should abandon pride and compassionlessness.

original: de bzhin du khro bas zil gyis mnan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khro bas zil gyis mnan pa'o //
translated: Likewise, he should abandon anger.

original: dam tshig rnam bral zhes pa ni 'jig rten pas smad pa gsang ba'i dam tshig rnams gsal bor spyad pas dam tshig dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam tshig rnam bral zhes pa ni 'jig rten pas smad pa gsang ba'i dam tshig rnams gsal bor spyad pas dam tshig dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are devoid of commitments are those who openly violate the commitments of secrecy despised by the world.

original: de yang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang spang bar bya'o //
translated: They should also be abandoned.

original: rdzas la brkam pa yang ste dge 'dun dang mchod rten gyi rdzas la sogs pa lci ba'i dang bla ma'i rdzas nye bar longs spyod pa ni rdzas la brkam pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas la brkam pa yang ste dge 'dun dang mchod rten gyi rdzas la sogs pa lci ba'i dang bla ma'i rdzas nye bar longs spyod pa ni rdzas la brkam pa'o //
translated: Those who are greedy for wealth are those who enjoy the wealth of the Saṅgha, stūpas, and so on, and the wealth of their gurus.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i longs spyod kyi don du rdzas sogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i longs spyod kyi don du rdzas sogs par byed pa'o //
translated: They are also those who accumulate wealth for the sake of the enjoyments of cyclic existence.

original: thos pa dag kyang med ces pa ni rmongs pa ste dam pa'i lam gyi man ngag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa dag kyang med ces pa ni rmongs pa ste dam pa'i lam gyi man ngag dang bral ba'o //
translated: Those who are ignorant are those who lack learning, who are devoid of the instructions of the path of the holy ones.

original: de bzhin du dam pa'i slob ma rnams ni slu ba don du gnyer zhing zhes pa ni brdzun smra ba po ste spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa'i slob ma rnams ni slu ba don du gnyer zhing zhes pa ni brdzun smra ba po ste spang bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, those who are deceitful are those who seek to deceive the disciples of the holy ones. They are liars and should be abandoned.

original: mchog gi bde ba'i gnas las sems nyams dbang ma bskur zhes pa ni dbang bskur med par rgyud 'chad pa po zhes pa ste spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchog gi bde ba'i gnas las sems nyams dbang ma bskur zhes pa ni dbang bskur med par rgyud 'chad pa po zhes pa ste spang bar bya'o //
translated: “The mind is impaired from the abode of supreme bliss, and the empowerment is not conferred” means that one should avoid the expounder of the tantra without the empowerment.

original: longs spyod dag la kun chags zhes pa ni phyi rol 'khor ba pa'i longs spyod rnams la kun te rnam pa kun nas yang dag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dag la kun chags zhes pa ni phyi rol 'khor ba pa'i longs spyod rnams la kun te rnam pa kun nas yang dag par chags pa'o //
translated: “Completely attached to enjoyments” means completely, in every way, attached to external enjoyments of cyclic existence.

original: bag med ni chang 'thungs pas te mnyam par ma bzhag pa spang bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bag med ni chang 'thungs pas te mnyam par ma bzhag pa spang bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Careless” means one should avoid drinking alcohol and being in an unbalanced state.

original: dbang po'i don du 'dod ldan pa zhes pa ni dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba'i don du 'dod ldan yang spang bar bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i don du 'dod ldan pa zhes pa ni dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba'i don du 'dod ldan yang spang bar bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: “One who is desirous for the sake of the sense faculties” means one should avoid being desirous for the sake of the bliss of the two sense faculties. This is the definitive statement of the Tathāgata.

original: sngags kyi tshul las 'di lta ste //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul las 'di lta ste //
translated: In the system of mantra, it is like this:

original: slob dpon yon tan blang bya ste //
analyzed: slob dpon yon tan blang bya ste //
translated: The master’s good qualities should be taken up,

original: skyon ni nam yang min pa rnyid //
analyzed: skyon ni nam yang min pa rnyid //
translated: but his faults should never be taken up.

original: yon tan blangs pas dngos grub 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan blangs pas dngos grub 'gyur //
translated: By taking up his good qualities, one will attain spiritual powers.

original: skyon brjod pa las dngos grub med ces dang de bzhin du /🔽dbang mchog thob gang rdo rje yi //
analyzed: skyon brjod pa las dngos grub med ces dang de bzhin du / dbang mchog thob gang rdo rje yi //
translated: And,🔽The one who has obtained the supreme initiation

original: slob dpon la ni de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: slob dpon la ni de bzhin gshegs //
translated: is the vajra master.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams bzhugs rnams //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams bzhugs rnams //
translated: The Tathagatas who dwell in the world systems of the ten directions🔽have come in the three times and pay homage.

original: dus gsum byon nas phyag 'tshal lo zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dus gsum byon nas phyag 'tshal lo zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Did not the Tathagata say this?

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi yon tan blang bar bya'o zhes pa la ma nyams pa 'ga' zhig gi tshig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi yon tan blang bar bya'o zhes pa la ma nyams pa 'ga' zhig gi tshig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the words without exception occur in the statement, The qualities of the master are to be accepted.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //🔽'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lam nyams pa'i byi ba'i skye bo rnams kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o // 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lam nyams pa'i byi ba'i skye bo rnams kyis /
translated: Therefore, it will be stated.

original: slob dpon yon tan blang bya ste //
analyzed: slob dpon yon tan blang bya ste //
translated: Here, in the future, the words The qualities of the master are to be accepted,

original: skyon ni nam yang min pa nyid @91a * //
analyzed: skyon ni nam yang min pa nyid @91a * //
translated: but the faults are never to be accepted,🔽will be spoken by those who are mice, who are people who have fallen from the path.

original: ces pa gang brjod par bya ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ces pa gang brjod par bya ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not what is to be stated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir bla ma bsten pa'i slad du slob dpon gyi skyon dang yon tan yongs su brtag pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bla ma bsten pa'i slad du slob dpon gyi skyon dang yon tan yongs su brtag pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Because of the need to rely on the guru, the Tathagata taught the examination of the faults and virtues of the master, as follows:🔽The disciple who has good intellect should not🔽make a guru who is without compassion, angry, and rough,

original: snying rje med cing khro la gdug / khengs shing chags lam bsdams dang // rang bstod bla mar slob ma ni //
analyzed: snying rje med cing khro la gdug / khengs shing chags lam bsdams dang // rang bstod bla mar slob ma ni //
translated: arrogant, attached, and unrestrained,🔽and self-praising.

original: blo bzang ldan pas mi bya'o zhes pa ste gsungs 'di'i phyir bla mar byas kyang bya ba ma yin pa byed ba ni thar pa don du gnyer ba'i slob mas spang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: blo bzang ldan pas mi bya'o zhes pa ste gsungs 'di'i phyir bla mar byas kyang bya ba ma yin pa byed ba ni thar pa don du gnyer ba'i slob mas spang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: Even if he is made a guru, the disciple who seeks liberation should abandon the one who does what should not be done.

original: de bzhin du dang po'i sangs rgyas las /
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po'i sangs rgyas las /

analyzed: de ltar rnam pa du mas slob dpon yongs su brtag pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bla ma slob ma rnams kyis bsten par bya ste sngar gsungs pa'i nges pa ni skyon dang ldan pa spang ba'i slad du'o //
translated: Thus, by examining the master in many ways, one should rely on the guru as taught by the Blessed One. The previously stated qualifications are for the purpose of avoiding faults.

analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan las kyang gsungs pa 'di lta ste ; brtan zhing dul la blo gros ldan //
translated: Similarly, it is also taught from the perspective of qualities, as follows:🔽Steadfast, disciplined, and intelligent,

original: bzod ldan drang la g-yo sgyu med //
analyzed: bzod ldan drang la g-yo sgyu med //
translated: patient, honest, and without deceit,

original: sngags dang rgyud kyi sbyor ba shes //
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud kyi sbyor ba shes //

original: snying brtser ldan zhing bstan bcos mkhas //
analyzed: snying brtser ldan zhing bstan bcos mkhas //
translated: compassionate, and skilled in treatises,

original: de nyid bcu ni yongs su shes //
analyzed: de nyid bcu ni yongs su shes //
translated: fully understanding the ten principles,

original: dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i las la mkhas //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i las la mkhas //
translated: skilled in the activities of drawing mandalas,

original: gsang sngags 'chad byed @91b slob dpon de //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'chad byed @91b slob dpon de //

analyzed: 'on kyang tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis gsungs pa'i tshig ci ste rnam par mi dpyod ce na /
translated: But why not analyze the words stated in another verse?

original: dbang mchog thob gang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni mkhas pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i bden pa dang 'jig rten pa'i bden pa ste nges pa'i don dang drang ba'i don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang mchog thob gang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni mkhas pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i bden pa dang 'jig rten pa'i bden pa ste nges pa'i don dang drang ba'i don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The words “who has obtained the supreme empowerment” and so forth are to be understood by the wise as the ultimate truth and the mundane truth, the definitive meaning and the interpretable meaning.

original: de la re zhig nges pa'i don brjod par bya ste 'dir bum pa dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba rnams kyi mchog phyag rgya chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi 'gyur pa'i bden ba chen po'i skad cig ma
analyzed: de la re zhig nges pa'i don brjod par bya ste 'dir bum pa dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba rnams kyi mchog phyag rgya chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi 'gyur pa'i bden ba chen po'i skad cig ma
translated: Here, the supreme among the empowerments conferred with the vase, the secret, and the wisdom-knowledge are the great seal, the perfection of wisdom, the great truth of immutability,

original: rnams kyi mtha' ma mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'i mtshan nyid mi chod pa ste de bcom ldan 'das gang gis byang chub kyi shing drung du thob pa de ni dbang mchog thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi mtha' ma mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'i mtshan nyid mi chod pa ste de bcom ldan 'das gang gis byang chub kyi shing drung du thob pa de ni dbang mchog thob pa'o //
translated: the final moment of the nature of manifest complete enlightenment, which is unbroken. The Bhagavān who obtained that under the Bodhi tree is “who has obtained the supreme empowerment.”

original: gang ni gang gi phyir te sku dang gsung dang thugs mi phyed pa de'i phyir rdo rje slob dpon te de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: gang ni gang gi phyir te sku dang gsung dang thugs mi phyed pa de'i phyir rdo rje slob dpon te de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: Who is for what reason? The vajra master is for the reason of the indivisibility of body, speech, and mind, that is, the Tathagata Shakyamuni.

original: khams gsum po 'dir sems can gyi don du gang gis sku dang gsung dang thugs mi phyed pa rdo rje bzhin du spyod pa de ni rdo rje slob dpon kun du gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: khams gsum po 'dir sems can gyi don du gang gis sku dang gsung dang thugs mi phyed pa rdo rje bzhin du spyod pa de ni rdo rje slob dpon kun du gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: In this three-realm world, he who acts for the sake of sentient beings with an indivisibility of body, speech, and mind like a vajra is the vajra master, the omniscient one who has gone everywhere.

original: de la yang de bzhin gshegs /
analyzed: de la yang de bzhin gshegs /
translated: And to him also the Tathagatas

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams bzhugs pa rnams zhes pa la 'dir phyogs bcu rnams na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag yod pa de rnams kyi cod pan rin po che bdun gyi rang bzhin ni nges pa'i don gyis 'jig rten gyi khams zhes brjod de cod pan de
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams bzhugs pa rnams zhes pa la 'dir phyogs bcu rnams na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag yod pa de rnams kyi cod pan rin po che bdun gyi rang bzhin ni nges pa'i don gyis 'jig rten gyi khams zhes brjod de cod pan de
translated: who dwell in the world systems of the ten directions, here the bodhisattvas who exist in the ten directions, their crowns which are of the nature of the seven jewels are said to be the world systems in the definitive meaning. That crown

original: dag la de bzhin gshegs pa gang dag rigs kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyis bzhugs pa de dag ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams bzhugs rnams so //
analyzed: dag la de bzhin gshegs pa gang dag rigs kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyis bzhugs pa de dag ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams bzhugs rnams so //
translated: The tathāgatas who reside in the nature of the family seals are those who reside in the world systems of the ten directions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang dus gsum du byon nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang dus gsum du byon nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bar byed de /
translated: Those bodhisattvas also come from the three times and pay homage to the blessed buddhas.

original: de dag phyag 'tshal bar byed pas cod pan la gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang phung po rnams kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag phyag 'tshal bar byed pas cod pan la gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang phung po rnams kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'i don to //
translated: Since they pay homage, the tathāgatas who reside in the crown and the aggregates also pay homage to the tathāgatas. This is the definitive meaning of the Bhagavān.

original: de bzhin du nye bar brtags nas drang ba'i don brjod par bya ste 'dir phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du lus la sna tshogs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sgras phyogs bcu @92a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du nye bar brtags nas drang ba'i don brjod par bya ste 'dir phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du lus la sna tshogs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sgras phyogs bcu @92a * //
translated: Similarly, having analyzed, the provisional meaning should be stated. Here, since it is said that the body is diverse like the external world, the term world system refers to the ten directions and the three times.

original: na gnas pa'i slob ma rnams kyi lus brjod de 'og ni sa'i khang pa la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: na gnas pa'i slob ma rnams kyi lus brjod de 'og ni sa'i khang pa la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The lower part is those who live in the house of earth.

original: steng ni khang bzangs sum rtseg la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: steng ni khang bzangs sum rtseg la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The upper part is those who live in a three-storied mansion, and so on.

original: de rnams la phung po lnga gnas ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de rnams la phung po lnga gnas ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod de /
translated: The five aggregates that abide in them are described as the Tathāgata.

original: de ltar 'jig rten khams bzhugs rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten khams bzhugs rnams so //
translated: Thus, they abide in the world systems.

original: slob ma de rnams kyang thun mtshams gsum du 'ongs nas bla ma la phyag 'tshal bar byed de de rnams phyag 'tshal bar byed pas phung po lnga rnams kyis kyang bla ma la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: slob ma de rnams kyang thun mtshams gsum du 'ongs nas bla ma la phyag 'tshal bar byed de de rnams phyag 'tshal bar byed pas phung po lnga rnams kyis kyang bla ma la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: Those disciples also come in the three periods of the day and pay homage to the guru. Since they pay homage, the five aggregates also pay homage to the guru. This is the provisional meaning.

original: 'dir dur smrig 'dzin pa'i dge slong rnams kyis dus gsum du rdo rje slob dpon la phyag 'tshal bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dur smrig 'dzin pa'i dge slong rnams kyis dus gsum du rdo rje slob dpon la phyag 'tshal bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the bhikṣus who hold the saffron robes should pay homage to the vajra master three times a day.

original: khyim pa dang gsar bu rnams la ni dam pa'i chos 'chad pa ma gtogs par ma yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa dang gsar bu rnams la ni dam pa'i chos 'chad pa ma gtogs par ma yin no //
translated: They should not do so for householders and novices, except to explain the true Dharma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: 'jig rten smod pa spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig rten smod pa spang ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to avoid the censure of the world,

original: dam chos la sogs mdun bdar te //
analyzed: dam chos la sogs mdun bdar te //
translated: one should go forward with the holy Dharma, etc.

original: khyim pa'am ni gsar bu la //
analyzed: khyim pa'am ni gsar bu la //
translated: , in front of the householder or the novice.

original: brtul zhugs 'dzin pas blos phyag bya //
analyzed: brtul zhugs 'dzin pas blos phyag bya //
translated: The one who maintains the observances should bow with his mind.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise,

original: mchog min las dang phyag spangs nas //
analyzed: mchog min las dang phyag spangs nas //
translated: having abandoned the inferior actions and the five-limbed prostration,🔽the one who maintains the observances should do all of these:

original: stan bstab ba dang ldang ba dang // don bya la sogs bsnyen bkur 'dir //
analyzed: stan bstab ba dang ldang ba dang // don bya la sogs bsnyen bkur 'dir //
translated: offering a seat, rising, and honoring with service, etc.

original: thams cad brtul zhugs can gyis bya zhes pa 'dir gal te khyim pa'am gsar bu dag kyang dge slong gi rdo rje slob dpon du mtshungs par gyur na de'i tshe ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad brtul zhugs can gyis bya zhes pa 'dir gal te khyim pa'am gsar bu dag kyang dge slong gi rdo rje slob dpon du mtshungs par gyur na de'i tshe ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Here, if the householder or the novice are the same as the vajra master monk, then what?

original: mchog min gyi las rkang pa bkru ba la sogs pa dang yan lag lnga'i phyag spangs nas rang gi gnas su bla ma byon pa la nor la sogs pa'i bkur sti bya'o //
analyzed: mchog min gyi las rkang pa bkru ba la sogs pa dang yan lag lnga'i phyag spangs nas rang gi gnas su bla ma byon pa la nor la sogs pa'i bkur sti bya'o //
translated: Having abandoned the inferior actions such as washing the feet, etc. and the five-limbed prostration, one should honor the guru who has come to one's abode with wealth, etc.

original: 'chad pa'i dus su 'jig rten smod pa spang ba'i phyir dam pa'i chos la sogs pa mdun du bdar nas phyag 'tshal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa'i dus su 'jig rten smod pa spang ba'i phyir dam pa'i chos la sogs pa mdun du bdar nas phyag 'tshal bar bya'o //
translated: At the time of teaching, in order to avoid the censure of the world, one should bow with the holy Dharma, etc. in front.

original: 'dir 'jig rten smod pa ni khyim pa'am dge tshul gang yin pa de dag le lo nyid kyi gong ma'i rtags mi 'dzin pas so sor thar pa thos pa dang yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten smod pa ni khyim pa'am dge tshul gang yin pa de dag le lo nyid kyi gong ma'i rtags mi 'dzin pas so sor thar pa thos pa dang yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the world criticizes those who are householders or novices because they do not take up the signs of the higher training out of laziness, and so they do not know or understand the pratimoksha.

original: gal te le lo dang nga rgyal med pa de lta na sngar dge slong gi sdom pa shes nas phyis theg pa chen po shes par bya ba ste kye'i rdo rje la sogs par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba ci'i don du mi byed /
analyzed: gal te le lo dang nga rgyal med pa de lta na sngar dge slong gi sdom pa shes nas phyis theg pa chen po shes par bya ba ste kye'i rdo rje la sogs par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba ci'i don du mi byed /
translated: If one is without laziness and pride, then why not do what the Bhagavat taught in the Hevajra Tantra and so forth, namely, to know the Mahayana after first knowing the vows of a bhikshu?

original: de'i phyir dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa yod na khyim na gnas pa'i slob dpon ni dge slong rnams kyis @92b bsten par mi bya ste rgyal pos kyang rnam pa thams cad du bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa yod na khyim na gnas pa'i slob dpon ni dge slong rnams kyis @92b bsten par mi bya ste rgyal pos kyang rnam pa thams cad du bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if there is a bhikshu vajra holder, the master who lives in a house should not be relied upon by the bhikshus, and the king should not rely upon him in any way.

original: de bzhin du slob dpon yongs su brtag pa las /🔽slong mo dang ni gos dmar gyis //
analyzed: de bzhin du slob dpon yongs su brtag pa las / slong mo dang ni gos dmar gyis //
translated: Similarly, the Examination of the Master says:🔽The one who begs and wears red

original: ngan pa'i bdag gang ngo tsha nas //
analyzed: ngan pa'i bdag gang ngo tsha nas //
translated: clothes is a bad master who is ashamed.

original: g-yem bcas phyag dang mchod byed pas //
analyzed: g-yem bcas phyag dang mchod byed pas //
translated: By bowing down and worshipping those who are Buddhists,

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams la ma nyams par ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams la ma nyams par ;
translated: even though they have broken their vows,

original: 'gyur ro zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes 'brel lo //
translated: one will not be harmed.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise:

original: gang tshe gos dmar mthong gyur nas //
analyzed: gang tshe gos dmar mthong gyur nas //
translated: When the wicked see red garments,

original: sdig can rnams ni zhe sdang 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig can rnams ni zhe sdang 'gyur //
translated: they become angry.

original: kla klo'i chos dga' sangs rgyas pa //
analyzed: kla klo'i chos dga' sangs rgyas pa //
translated: Those who delight in the religion of the barbarians

original: de tshe dkar po'i gos la mos //
analyzed: de tshe dkar po'i gos la mos //
translated: at that time desire white garments.

original: zhes so // 'dir sangs rgyas pa'i bstan pa ni dus thams cad du gos dkar po ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir sangs rgyas pa'i bstan pa ni dus thams cad du gos dkar po ma yin te /
translated: Here, the Buddhist doctrine is not always white garments.

original: de ltar yang 'jam dpal gyi yul gyi gtsug lag khang du dge slong dang / dge tshul pham par gyur pa de'i tshe gos dkar po byin zhing dur smrig blangs te gtsug lag khang nas nges par 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'jam dpal gyi yul gyi gtsug lag khang du dge slong dang / dge tshul pham par gyur pa de'i tshe gos dkar po byin zhing dur smrig blangs te gtsug lag khang nas nges par 'byin par byed do //
translated: Thus, when the monks and novices in the Mañjuśrī temple became defeated, they gave away their white garments, took on the saffron robes, and were expelled from the temple.

original: rdo rje slob dpon yang sngags pa'i gtsug lag khang nas rgyal po'i nges pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon yang sngags pa'i gtsug lag khang nas rgyal po'i nges pas so //
translated: The vajra master was also expelled from the temple of the mantra practitioners by royal decree.

original: 'phags pa'i yul 'dir yang khyim na gnas pa gos dkar po 'dzin pa ni dur smrig 'dzin pa rnams kyi bla ma dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa rab tu gnas pa byed pa po ci ltar yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yul 'dir yang khyim na gnas pa gos dkar po 'dzin pa ni dur smrig 'dzin pa rnams kyi bla ma dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa rab tu gnas pa byed pa po ci ltar yin /
translated: In this holy land of India, householders who wear white robes are the gurus of those who wear saffron robes, and they are the ones who establish the monasteries and so forth.

original: gang zhig dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa yod kyang gnod pa'i gnas skabs thob pa dag sten par byed na 'di ni dge 'dun la brnyas pa chen po ste nges par 'di ni bde bar gshegs pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnam par nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa yod kyang gnod pa'i gnas skabs thob pa dag sten par byed na 'di ni dge 'dun la brnyas pa chen po ste nges par 'di ni bde bar gshegs pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnam par nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: If someone serves those who have attained a state of harmfulness even though there are fully ordained vajra holders, this is a great insult to the Sangha.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa kun du yongs su brtags nas skyon dang bral ba'i bla ma bsten par bya zhing skyon dang ldan pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa kun du yongs su brtags nas skyon dang bral ba'i bla ma bsten par bya zhing skyon dang ldan pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should rely on a guru who is free of faults after thoroughly investigating in all ways, and one should abandon those who have faults.

original: slob dpon yongs su brtag pa gsungs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon yongs su brtag pa gsungs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the conclusion of the chapter on examining the master.

original: da ni zab cing zhes pa la sogs pas shes rab ye shes la sogs pa'i dbang gi don du slob ma dam pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zab cing zhes pa la sogs pas shes rab ye shes la sogs pa'i dbang gi don du slob ma dam pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “deep,” he teaches the characteristics of the disciple who is fit for the wisdom-intuition initiation, etc.

original: 'dir sngags kyi tshul la slob ma rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub pa don du gnyer ba dang gnyis pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi tshul la slob ma rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub pa don du gnyer ba dang gnyis pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: Here, in the Mantra system there are two kinds of disciples: one who is intent on achieving the Great Seal spiritual power, and one who is intent on achieving mundane spiritual powers.

original: gang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub pa don du gnyer ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi lam bsgom pa'i don du bum pa dang gsang ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o //🔽gang @93a * //
analyzed: gang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub pa don du gnyer ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi lam bsgom pa'i don du bum pa dang gsang ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o //🔽gang @93a * //
translated: The one who is intent on achieving the Great Seal spiritual power should be gathered in the vase, secret, etc., initiations in order to cultivate the path of emptiness.🔽The one who is intent on achieving mundane spiritual powers should be gathered in the action and performance initiations in order to cultivate the path of method.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa don du gnyer ba de ni sngags dang phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i don du dbang bdun gyis yang dag par bsdu bar bya ste 'bring bo bsod nams dag gi rgyur zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa don du gnyer ba de ni sngags dang phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i don du dbang bdun gyis yang dag par bsdu bar bya ste 'bring bo bsod nams dag gi rgyur zhes so //
translated: He who is intent on the attainment of mundane powers should be properly initiated by means of the seven initiations for the sake of the meditation on the mantra, the seal, and the wheel of the mandala.

original: tha ma ni dbang gis yang dag par bsdu bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tha ma ni dbang gis yang dag par bsdu bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The lowest is not to be properly initiated,

original: dge bsnyen gyi bslab pas yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi bslab pas yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: but is to be properly initiated by the precepts of the upasaka.

original: 'dir zab cing rgya che ba'i chos stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid la gang zhig sems pa de ni zab cing rgya che la sems zhes pa ste slob ma mchog go //
analyzed: 'dir zab cing rgya che ba'i chos stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid la gang zhig sems pa de ni zab cing rgya che la sems zhes pa ste slob ma mchog go //
translated: Here, he who reflects on the Dharma of the profound and the vast, which is the nature of emptiness and compassion, is called the profound and vast-minded, and is the best disciple.

original: bla ma'i nges pa la dga' zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu bzhi dang bral zhing dge ba bcu'i chos la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i nges pa la dga' zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu bzhi dang bral zhing dge ba bcu'i chos la dga' ba'o //
translated: He who delights in the certainty of the guru is free from the fourteen transgressions and delights in the Dharma of the ten virtues.

original: gtong ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan zhes pa ni 'du 'dzi thams cad rnam par spangs shing /
analyzed: gtong ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan zhes pa ni 'du 'dzi thams cad rnam par spangs shing /
translated: The phrase endowed with a generous nature means that he has abandoned all distractions.

original: rdzas la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: He is not concerned with material things and so forth.

original: yon tan shes zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la dad pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan shes zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la dad pa'o //
translated: The phrase who knows the qualities means that he has faith in the Three Jewels.

original: thar ba don gnyer zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub la ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thar ba don gnyer zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase who seeks liberation means that he is not concerned with mundane accomplishments.

original: rgyud la gus shing zhes pa ni rgyud las gsungs pa'i sdom pa srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud la gus shing zhes pa ni rgyud las gsungs pa'i sdom pa srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase who is devoted to the tantras means that he keeps the vows taught in the tantras.

original: g-yo ba min pa'i sems ldan zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam rnams kyis gang gi sems mi g-yo ba de ni g-yo ba med pa'i sems ldan no //
analyzed: g-yo ba min pa'i sems ldan zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam rnams kyis gang gi sems mi g-yo ba de ni g-yo ba med pa'i sems ldan no //
translated: The phrase whose mind is unmoved means that his mind is not moved by mundane paths.

original: de nyid thob pa shin tu sbed ces pa ni de kho na nyid thob pa na ji srid rang gis nyams su myong bar gyur pa de srid du sbed pa ni shin tu sbed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid thob pa shin tu sbed ces pa ni de kho na nyid thob pa na ji srid rang gis nyams su myong bar gyur pa de srid du sbed pa ni shin tu sbed pa'o //
translated: The phrase who is very secretive about attaining reality means that he is very secretive about the experience of reality as long as he has not attained it.

original: gdug pa rnams kyi grogs nyams zhes pa ni 'dir gang dag nor don du gnyer ba'i khyim pa'i slob dpon rnams dang de bzhin du dka' thub pa rnams kyang ste gang zag gcig gis bsti gnas dang gtsug lag khang nye bar longs spyod pa de rnams ni gdug
analyzed: gdug pa rnams kyi grogs nyams zhes pa ni 'dir gang dag nor don du gnyer ba'i khyim pa'i slob dpon rnams dang de bzhin du dka' thub pa rnams kyang ste gang zag gcig gis bsti gnas dang gtsug lag khang nye bar longs spyod pa de rnams ni gdug
translated: The deterioration of the friends of the wicked are the householder teachers who seek wealth, and likewise the ascetics, who are wicked because they enjoy the use of the hermitage and temple.

original: pa'o // de rnams kyi grogs ni mi dge ba bcu'i lam ste de gang la nyams pa de ni gdug pa rnams kyi grogs nyams pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // de rnams kyi grogs ni mi dge ba bcu'i lam ste de gang la nyams pa de ni gdug pa rnams kyi grogs nyams pa'o //
translated: Their friends are the paths of the ten nonvirtues. The deterioration of the friends of the wicked is the deterioration of those.

original: de ltar gyur pa ni slob ma chen po ste bla ma shin tu mkhas pa de nyid rig pa rnams kyis shes rab ye shes kyi dbang la sogs pa'i rgyur bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ni slob ma chen po ste bla ma shin tu mkhas pa de nyid rig pa rnams kyis shes rab ye shes kyi dbang la sogs pa'i rgyur bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Such a person is a great student, who is to be understood by the very wise guru as the cause of the initiation of wisdom knowledge, and so forth.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dbang bzhi pa'i rgyur yang de nyid do //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dbang bzhi pa'i rgyur yang de nyid do //
translated: The word and so forth indicates that he is also the cause of the fourth initiation.

original: gzhan 'bring po ni slar yang bsod nams dag gi rgyur te yon tan 'bring po dang ldan pa @93b ni dbang bdun gyi rgyur yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'bring po ni slar yang bsod nams dag gi rgyur te yon tan 'bring po dang ldan pa @93b ni dbang bdun gyi rgyur yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The middling one is again the cause of merit, and the middling one endowed with qualities is the cause of the seven empowerments.

original: tha ma yang gal te bla ma sten par byed cing smod par mi byed na bslab pa'i gnas lnga'i rgyur yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa ste slob ma yongs su brtag pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma yang gal te bla ma sten par byed cing smod par mi byed na bslab pa'i gnas lnga'i rgyur yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa ste slob ma yongs su brtag pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The inferior one, if he serves the guru and does not disparage him, is the cause of the five precepts. This is the rule of the Bhagavān, the rule of the disciple.

original: da ni rdo rje slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa dang / dbang sbyin pa dang rgyud bstan pa'i don du rnal 'byor ma rnams la mchod pa byed pa'i slad du nag pa'i mthar zhes pa la sogs pas dkar po'i tshigs nges ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa rnam par rgyas par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa dang / dbang sbyin pa dang rgyud bstan pa'i don du rnal 'byor ma rnams la mchod pa byed pa'i slad du nag pa'i mthar zhes pa la sogs pas dkar po'i tshigs nges ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa rnam par rgyas par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to worship the yoginīs for the sake of the vajra master erecting the maṇḍala, bestowing empowerment, and teaching the tantra, the Bhagavān extensively teaches the rule of the bright fortnight with “the end of the dark fortnight,” and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i yul 'dir dkar po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa cha bcva lnga'i mthar nag po'i tshes gcig 'jug pa sa ga'i nya'i skya rengs 'char ba'i tshe bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te de nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing theg
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yul 'dir dkar po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa cha bcva lnga'i mthar nag po'i tshes gcig 'jug pa sa ga'i nya'i skya rengs 'char ba'i tshe bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te de nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing theg
translated: In this noble land, on the fifteenth day of the bright fortnight, at the break of dawn on the full moon of the month of Jyaistha, the Bhagavat Sakyamuni attained perfect buddhahood.🔽

original: pa gsum bstan pa mdzad nas zla ba bcu gnyis pa nag pa'i nya la shr'i dh'a n+ya ka ta ka ra chos kyi dbyings gsung gi dbang phyug gi dkyil 'khor cha bcu drug gi rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid can dang / de'i steng du dpal ldan rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor cha bcu drug gi rnam par dbye ba can dang po'i sangs rgyas rnam par spros so //
analyzed: pa gsum bstan pa mdzad nas zla ba bcu gnyis pa nag pa'i nya la shr'i dh'a n+ya ka ta ka ra chos kyi dbyings gsung gi dbang phyug gi dkyil 'khor cha bcu drug gi rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid can dang / de'i steng du dpal ldan rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor cha bcu drug gi rnam par dbye ba can dang po'i sangs rgyas rnam par spros so //
translated: In this noble land, on the fifteenth day of the bright fortnight, at the time of the dawn of the full moon of the month of Jyeṣṭha, the Bhagavat Śākyamuni was perfectly enlightened. Then, he turned the wheel of the Dharma, taught the three vehicles, and on the full moon of the month of Āṣāḍha, the twelfth month, in the Dharma realm of Śrī Dhānyakataka, he emanated the maṇḍala of Vāgīśvara, which has the characteristic of being divided into sixteen parts, and above that, the maṇḍala of the glorious lunar asterisms, which is divided into sixteen parts, as the primordial buddha.

original: 'dir rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor zhes ci ltar shes par bya zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor zhes ci ltar shes par bya zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, how should one understand the maṇḍala of the lunar asterisms? It should be stated.

original: 'dir mchod rten gyi phyi rol du rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad rnam par dag pas ka ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad de phyogs bzhi rnams su thur ma bdun gyi dbye bas shar du khyab 'jug gis khyer nas 'ongs pa dang lhor k'a rti kas dang nub tu
analyzed: 'dir mchod rten gyi phyi rol du rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad rnam par dag pas ka ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad de phyogs bzhi rnams su thur ma bdun gyi dbye bas shar du khyab 'jug gis khyer nas 'ongs pa dang lhor k'a rti kas dang nub tu
translated: Here, since the twenty-eight constellations are pure externally on the cairn, there are twenty-eight pillars. Since there are seven divisions in each of the four directions, in the east Viṣṇu carried them, in the south Kartikeya,

original: tshangs pas dang byang du bde byed kyis khyer nas 'ongs pa rnams btsugs pa gang yin pa des na mchod rten gyi phyi rol rgyu skar gyi rnam par dbye bas mchod rten gyi nang gi dkyil 'khor ni dpal ldan rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: tshangs pas dang byang du bde byed kyis khyer nas 'ongs pa rnams btsugs pa gang yin pa des na mchod rten gyi phyi rol rgyu skar gyi rnam par dbye bas mchod rten gyi nang gi dkyil 'khor ni dpal ldan rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: in the west Brahmā, and in the north Śiva carried them. Since they were erected, since the external cairn is divided into the twenty-eight constellations, the maṇḍala inside the cairn is the maṇḍala of the glorious constellations.

original: de bzhin du sgo logs nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni phyogs kyi cha'i dbye bas so ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sgo logs nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni phyogs kyi cha'i dbye bas so ;
translated: Similarly, the twenty-four door panels are divided into the directions.

original: / gzhan 'og gi dkyil 'khor sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid cha bcu drug dang ldan pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje bcu drug rnam par dag pas so zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi gnas nges pa'o //🔽gnas der nyin zhag de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pas sangs @94a * //
analyzed: / gzhan 'og gi dkyil 'khor sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid cha bcu drug dang ldan pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje bcu drug rnam par dag pas so zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi gnas nges pa'o // gnas der nyin zhag de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pas sangs @94a * //
translated: The other mandala below, which is the mandala of body, speech, and mind, is endowed with sixteen parts, which are the sixteen purities of emptiness and compassion. This is the ascertainment of the site of the mandala.

original: rgyas kyi dbang byin nas lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du lung bstan te /
analyzed: rgyas kyi dbang byin nas lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du lung bstan te /
translated: In that place, on that very day, the Tathagata conferred the empowerment of Buddhahood and prophesied the attainment of Buddhahood by the gods, titans, and so forth.

original: des na ma 'ongs pa'i dus su nya 'di ni dus kyi 'khor lo las rdo rje slob dpon rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges par gyur to //
analyzed: des na ma 'ongs pa'i dus su nya 'di ni dus kyi 'khor lo las rdo rje slob dpon rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, in the future, this fish will be the Vajra Master in the Kalachakra Tantra, and will definitely become a Tathagata.

original: nag pa'i mthar ni dkar po'i tshigs la gzhan la phan pa'i bla mas dkyil 'khor dag ni bzhengs byas nas //
analyzed: nag pa'i mthar ni dkar po'i tshigs la gzhan la phan pa'i bla mas dkyil 'khor dag ni bzhengs byas nas //
translated: At the end of the dark half, in the white half, the teacher who benefits others will construct the mandala.

original: sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bdun rnams ni bsod nams don du bu rnams dag la sbyin par bya zhes pa la /
analyzed: sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bdun rnams ni bsod nams don du bu rnams dag la sbyin par bya zhes pa la /
translated: The seven empowerments that steal the stains of sin are to be given to the sons for the sake of merit.

original: 'dir dang por dbang bdun sbyin pa ni gzhug pa'i don dang sngags bzlas pa dang dkyil 'khor sgom pa'i don du ste des bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dir dang por dbang bdun sbyin pa ni gzhug pa'i don dang sngags bzlas pa dang dkyil 'khor sgom pa'i don du ste des bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Here, the giving of the seven empowerments is for the sake of introducing, for the sake of mantra repetition, and for the sake of mandala meditation.

original: de'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyur dbang bdun sbyin par bya zhing mi 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs nyi shu rtsa lnga sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyur dbang bdun sbyin par bya zhing mi 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs nyi shu rtsa lnga sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of the accumulation of merit, the seven empowerments are to be given, and the twenty-five disciplines of nonviolence, and so on, are to be given.

original: de nas ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du dbang gong ma gsum sbyin pa ni rang gi sha la sogs pa dang shin tu 'dod pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i don dang rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid sgom pa'i don dang byang🔽chub kyi sems mi 'gyur pa'i don te des ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du dbang gong ma gsum sbyin pa ni rang gi sha la sogs pa dang shin tu 'dod pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i don dang rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid sgom pa'i don dang byang🔽chub kyi sems mi 'gyur pa'i don te des ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: Then, for the sake of the accumulation of wisdom, the three higher empowerments are to be given, for the sake of giving one’s own flesh, and so on, and for the sake of giving what is extremely desired, and so on, and for the sake of meditating on emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, and for the sake of unchanging bodhicitta.

original: de'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyur dbang gong ma rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyur dbang gong ma rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the higher initiations should be given as the cause of the accumulation of intuition.

original: de dag kyang dbang bzhi pa dang bcas pa ste bzhi pa ni man ngag gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang dbang bzhi pa dang bcas pa ste bzhi pa ni man ngag gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: And those are together with the fourth initiation, which is to be expressed by means of instruction.

original: zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang gi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the Lord's definition of initiation.

original: de ltar nag pa'i nya gtso bor byas nas nya bcu gnyis po rnams la rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang sbyin par bya zhing sku gzugs la sogs pa rnams rab tu gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nag pa'i nya gtso bor byas nas nya bcu gnyis po rnams la rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang sbyin par bya zhing sku gzugs la sogs pa rnams rab tu gnas par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having made the new moon foremost, the Vajra Master should give the twelve initiations on the twelve days of the new moon, and should consecrate the images, etc.

original: de bzhin du rgyu skar dang sbyor ba dge ba dang bcas pa'i nyin zhag gzhan la yang bya'o zhes pa ni dbang la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu skar dang sbyor ba dge ba dang bcas pa'i nyin zhag gzhan la yang bya'o zhes pa ni dbang la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: And likewise, it should be done on other days with the conjunction of a lunar mansion and a virtuous star. This is the definition of initiation, etc.

original: da ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyud bstan pa'i don du rnal 'byor ma rnams mchod pa'i nges pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyud bstan pa'i don du rnal 'byor ma rnams mchod pa'i nges pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the Kalachakra Tantra, he states the rule for worshipping the yoginis:

original: nag pa'i nya la dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas sam yang na dkyil 'khor bris pa med par mtha' dag yon tan gter gyur rgyud kyi rgyal po bstan pa'i slad du rnal 'byor ma rnams dag la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pas mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: nag pa'i nya la dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas sam yang na dkyil 'khor bris pa med par mtha' dag yon tan gter gyur rgyud kyi rgyal po bstan pa'i slad du rnal 'byor ma rnams dag la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pas mchod pa bya'o //
translated: On the new moon day, having set up the mandala, or else without drawing the mandala, one should worship the yoginīs with food, drink, and so forth, in order to teach the king of tantras, which is a treasure of good qualities.

original: ci ste ma tshogs pa'i dbang gis nag pa'i nya la mchod pa med par gyur @94b na de'i tshe lo gcig tu ni rgyud kyi rgyal po dag ni bla ma rdo rje slob dpon gyis bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste ma tshogs pa'i dbang gis nag pa'i nya la mchod pa med par gyur @94b na de'i tshe lo gcig tu ni rgyud kyi rgyal po dag ni bla ma rdo rje slob dpon gyis bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: But if, due to lack of resources, there is no worship on the new moon day, then for one year the king of tantras should not be taught by the guru vajra master.

original: ci ste mchod pa med par gyur pa la 'os pa'i slob ma 'ga' zhig thos pa don du gnyer na de'i tshe des nya bcu gnyis po rnams la rnal 'byor ma rnams la mchod pa byas nas mnyan par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste mchod pa med par gyur pa la 'os pa'i slob ma 'ga' zhig thos pa don du gnyer na de'i tshe des nya bcu gnyis po rnams la rnal 'byor ma rnams la mchod pa byas nas mnyan par bya ste /
translated: But if there is a suitable disciple who seeks to hear it, even in the absence of worship, then he should listen to it after worshipping the yoginīs on the twelve new moon days.

original: de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis gzhan rnams kyis kyang mnyan no //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis gzhan rnams kyis kyang mnyan no //
translated: By his accumulation of merit, others will also hear it.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor ma rnams la mchod pa ni phyi'i bgegs nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du ste rtag tu brgyad dang bcu bzhi la ji ltar 'byor pa bya ba dang 'byung po la sogs pa rnams la nyin zhag so sor gtor ma sbyin par bya ba
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor ma rnams la mchod pa ni phyi'i bgegs nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du ste rtag tu brgyad dang bcu bzhi la ji ltar 'byor pa bya ba dang 'byung po la sogs pa rnams la nyin zhag so sor gtor ma sbyin par bya ba
translated: Here, the worship of the yoginis is for the sake of pacifying external obstacles, and one should always do it on the eighth and fourteenth days of the lunar month, according to one's means, and one should give sacrificial cake to the bhutas and so forth every day.

original: dang / sangs rgyas mchod pa mandala la sogs pa bya ba ni khyim na gnas pa nor dang ldan pa rnams kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: dang / sangs rgyas mchod pa mandala la sogs pa bya ba ni khyim na gnas pa nor dang ldan pa rnams kyi nges pa'o //
translated: And the worship of the Buddha, such as by making mandalas, is obligatory for householders who have wealth.

original: kun spangs kyi slob ma rnams la ni mchod pa des pa med cing de rnams la bstan pa'i don du bla ma rnams kyis kyang nges pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: kun spangs kyi slob ma rnams la ni mchod pa des pa med cing de rnams la bstan pa'i don du bla ma rnams kyis kyang nges pa mi bya'o //
translated: But for disciples who have renounced everything, there is no such fixed rule of worship, and the gurus should not make it obligatory for them, in order to teach them.

original: gang gis phyir sangs rgyas dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang bsam pa 'dzin par byed pa ste mchod pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyir sangs rgyas dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang bsam pa 'dzin par byed pa ste mchod pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Buddhas and Vajrayoginis do not take into account the things of worship, such as sacrificial cakes, because they do not take them into account.

original: rgyud bstan pa'i mchod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud bstan pa'i mchod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule of worship taught in the Tantra.

original: da ni dbang gi don du sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dbang gi don du sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: Now, the characteristics of earth and so on are taught for the purpose of initiation.🔽In this verse, whatever is mentioned of earth and so on should be described in the explanation to come.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dir sa la sogs pa gang smos pa de mtha' dag 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon gyis so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dir sa la sogs pa gang smos pa de mtha' dag 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon gyis so //
translated: For the sake of the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, one should perform pacification and so on. This is for the vajra master.

original: slob ma rnams ni bsdu ba dag dang gang yang dkyil 'khor bri ba dag shes nas bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma rnams ni bsdu ba dag dang gang yang dkyil 'khor bri ba dag shes nas bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The disciples should be gathered, and having understood the drawing of the maṇḍala, one should act. This is the certainty.

original: gdug pa'i slob dpon pha rol slu ba po rdzas la chags pas yongs su shes pa med par byed na dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni slob dpon la rjes su bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gdug pa'i slob dpon pha rol slu ba po rdzas la chags pas yongs su shes pa med par byed na dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni slob dpon la rjes su bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: If the evil master, the deceiver of others, acts without complete knowledge due to attachment to wealth, he will go to hell. This is the verse of instruction to the master.

original: dbang gi don dus ni yongs brtag ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dbang gi don dus ni yongs brtag ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: For the purpose of initiation, the time is thoroughly examined, and so on. This is easy to understand.

original: da ni sa yi zhes pa la sogs pas sa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis dngos po rnams kyi rigs rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: da ni sa yi zhes pa la sogs pas sa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis dngos po rnams kyi rigs rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Now, the characteristics of the earth are stated beginning with “Now, the earth” and so on. Here, by worldly convention, the classes of things are of four kinds.

original: de yang kha dog bzhis rig par bya ste dmangs rigs la sogs pa rnams kha dog nag po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de yang kha dog bzhis rig par bya ste dmangs rigs la sogs pa rnams kha dog nag po la sogs pas so //
translated: Moreover, they should be known by four colors, such as the black color of the śūdra class and so on.

original: 'dir 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis kha dog nag po'i sa ni dmangs rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis kha dog nag po'i sa ni dmangs rigs so //
translated: Here, by worldly convention, the black color earth is the śūdra class.

original: ser po ni @95a * //
analyzed: ser po ni @95a * //
translated: The yellow is the

original: rje'u rigs dang dmar po ni rgyal rigs dang dkar po ni bram ze'i rigs so //
analyzed: rje'u rigs dang dmar po ni rgyal rigs dang dkar po ni bram ze'i rigs so //
translated: kṣatriya class, the red is the vaiśya class, and the white is the brahmin class.

original: de bzhin du dri las te rmag gi dri ni dmangs rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dri las te rmag gi dri ni dmangs rigs so //
translated: Similarly, from smell, the smell of a corpse is the śūdra class.

original: lan tshva'i dri ni rje'u rigs dang padma'i dri ni rgyal rigs dang mchog gi dri ni bram ze'i rigs te rim pas so //
analyzed: lan tshva'i dri ni rje'u rigs dang padma'i dri ni rgyal rigs dang mchog gi dri ni bram ze'i rigs te rim pas so //
translated: The smell of salt is the kṣatriya class, the smell of a lotus is the vaiśya class, and the smell of the supreme is the brahmin class, in order.

original: de bzhin du ro las te sgyur pa dang lan tshva'i ro ni dmangs rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ro las te sgyur pa dang lan tshva'i ro ni dmangs rigs so //
translated: Similarly, from taste, the taste of sour and salt is the śūdra class.

original: mngar dang tshab zhes pa la mngar ba'i ro ni rje'u rigs dang tsha ba'i ro ni mi bdag gi rigs te rgyal rigs dang gzhan pa'i ro kha ba dang bska ba dag ni gnyis skyes kyi rigs so zhes pa ste ro las rigs nges pa'o //
analyzed: mngar dang tshab zhes pa la mngar ba'i ro ni rje'u rigs dang tsha ba'i ro ni mi bdag gi rigs te rgyal rigs dang gzhan pa'i ro kha ba dang bska ba dag ni gnyis skyes kyi rigs so zhes pa ste ro las rigs nges pa'o //
translated: The sweet and sour tastes are the caste of the Vaisyas, and the sour taste is the caste of the Kshatriyas, and the other tastes, the bitter and astringent, are the caste of the Sudras. Thus, the caste is determined by the taste.

original: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i don dus gsungs pa dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa las dkar po dang bsad pa dang bskrad pa la kha dog nag po dang dbang dang dgug pa la dmar po dang rengs pa dang🔽rmongs pa la ser por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i don dus gsungs pa dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa las dkar po dang bsad pa dang bskrad pa la kha dog nag po dang dbang dang dgug pa la dmar po dang rengs pa dang rmongs pa la ser por 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the colors for the purposes of pacification, etc., are stated by white, etc. Here, for pacification and enrichment, the color is white; for killing and banishing, it is black; for subjugation and attraction, it is red; for paralyzing and confusing, it is yellow.

original: yang yig las dug gzhil ba la sogs pa la yang rim pa ji lta bas te des pa'o //
analyzed: yang yig las dug gzhil ba la sogs pa la yang rim pa ji lta bas te des pa'o //
translated: And by the also [in the root text], in the case of counteracting poison, etc., it is also as stated, in due order.

original: 'dir las kyi cha ni thams cad pa las ljang gu las thams cad byed par 'gyur te lnga pa dang ni mtha' ma dag gi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir las kyi cha ni thams cad pa las ljang gu las thams cad byed par 'gyur te lnga pa dang ni mtha' ma dag gi rigs so //
translated: Here, the color for all the rites is green, and the fifth and last are the colors for all the rites.

original: ro dang dri rnams thams cad dang ldan mtha' dag yon tan gter de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mtshan nyid du rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ste sa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: ro dang dri rnams thams cad dang ldan mtha' dag yon tan gter de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mtshan nyid du rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ste sa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The yogi should know that the entire treasure of qualities, endowed with all tastes and smells, is the characteristic of the space element. This is the ascertainment of the characteristic of earth.

original: 'dir gal te 'di 'dra ba'i sa'i mtshan nyid nges pa zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du yin na de'i tshe nags dang grong khyer la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi cha thams cad du mtshan nyid 'di rnams dang ldan pa'i sar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gal te 'di 'dra ba'i sa'i mtshan nyid nges pa zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du yin na de'i tshe nags dang grong khyer la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi cha thams cad du mtshan nyid 'di rnams dang ldan pa'i sar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if the ascertainment of the characteristic of earth like this is for the sake of peace, etc., then in all places such as forests and cities, it would not be earth endowed with these characteristics.

original: de nas rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān said in the Root Tantra:

original: 'dir gang du dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i las bya ba der gal te las dang rjes su mthun pa'i sa med par gyur na de'i tshe khung bu brkos nas te chu'i mtha' ma rdo ba'i mthar brko bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang du dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i las bya ba der gal te las dang rjes su mthun pa'i sa med par gyur na de'i tshe khung bu brkos nas te chu'i mtha' ma rdo ba'i mthar brko bar bya'o //
translated: Here, if in the place where the rites such as the maṇḍala are to be performed there is no earth suitable for the rite, then having dug a pit, that is, having dug up to the water level or the rock level,

original: de nas las dang rjes su mthun pa'i sa gzhan gyis khung bu dgang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas las dang rjes su mthun pa'i sa gzhan gyis khung bu dgang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should fill the hole with another kind of earth that is suitable for the rite.

original: 'dir sa'i dri'i don du sa dkar po ni tsandan gyi chus bran par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sa'i dri'i don du sa dkar po ni tsandan gyi chus bran par bya'o //
translated: Here, for the sake of the smell of the earth, white earth should be moistened with sandalwood water.

original: sa dmar po ni padma'i chu dang tsandan dmar po'i chus bran par bya'o //
analyzed: sa dmar po ni padma'i chu dang tsandan dmar po'i chus bran par bya'o //
translated: Red earth should be moistened with lotus water and red sandalwood water.

original: sa ser po ni bong bu dang rta dang mi'i gci bas bran par bya'o //
analyzed: sa ser po ni bong bu dang rta dang mi'i gci bas bran par bya'o //
translated: Yellow earth should be moistened with the urine of a donkey, a horse, and a human.

original: sa nag po ni sha rul pa'i chus bran par bya'o //
analyzed: sa nag po ni sha rul pa'i chus bran par bya'o //
translated: Black earth should be moistened with the water of rotten meat.

original: ro @95b bro ba'i don du nag po la lan tshva dang skyur ba bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: ro @95b bro ba'i don du nag po la lan tshva dang skyur ba bsre bar bya'o //
translated: For the sake of taste, black [earth] should be mixed with salt and sour [substances].

original: ser po la bu ram dang dmar po la tsha ba gsum dang dkar po la kha ba dang bska ba'o //
analyzed: ser po la bu ram dang dmar po la tsha ba gsum dang dkar po la kha ba dang bska ba'o //
translated: Yellow [earth] should be mixed with molasses, red [earth] with the three sweets, and white [earth] with salt and astringent [substances].

original: ljang gu ni las thams cad pa nyid kyi phyir ci yang bsre bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ljang gu ni las thams cad pa nyid kyi phyir ci yang bsre bar mi bya'o //
translated: Green [earth] should not be mixed with anything, because it is for all activities.

original: de bzhin du sa'i nang du gter gzhug par bya ste nag po la ni bsad pa la mi rus dang bskrad pa la bya rog gi mjug sgro dang sdang ba la bong bu'i rus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i nang du gter gzhug par bya ste nag po la ni bsad pa la mi rus dang bskrad pa la bya rog gi mjug sgro dang sdang ba la bong bu'i rus pa'o //
translated: In the same way, one should bury treasure in the ground: for black [magic], in killing, [one should use] human bone; in driving out, the tail of a crow; in causing hatred, the bone of a donkey.

original: ser po la ni phur bus gdab pa la lug gi rva dang rengs pa la ba bla dang rmongs pa la sbrul lo //
analyzed: ser po la ni phur bus gdab pa la lug gi rva dang rengs pa la ba bla dang rmongs pa la sbrul lo //
translated: For yellow [magic], in nailing down, [one should use] a sheep's horn; in paralyzing, barley flour; in causing confusion, a snake.

original: dmar po la ni dbang la gi wang dang dgug pa la mtshal dang bskyod pa la ldong ros so //
analyzed: dmar po la ni dbang la gi wang dang dgug pa la mtshal dang bskyod pa la ldong ros so //
translated: For red [magic], in enthralling, gopīcandana; in summoning, vermilion; in shaking, realgar.

original: dkar po la ni zhi ba la shel dang rgyas pa la dung dang rims 'phrog pa dang bsreg pa la mu tig go //
analyzed: dkar po la ni zhi ba la shel dang rgyas pa la dung dang rims 'phrog pa dang bsreg pa la mu tig go //
translated: For white [magic], in pacifying, crystal; in prospering, a conch; in stealing fever, a pearl.

original: ljang gu la ni cung zad kyang gzhug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ljang gu la ni cung zad kyang gzhug par mi bya'o //
translated: For green [magic], one should not bury anything at all.

original: ci ste ljang gu la thun mong gi las thams cad pa bya ba yin na de'i tshe sa'i snying por rin po che lnga gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste ljang gu la thun mong gi las thams cad pa bya ba yin na de'i tshe sa'i snying por rin po che lnga gzhug par bya'o //
translated: But if one is performing all the common rites for green [magic], then one should bury the five precious things in the heart of the earth.

original: dkar po dang dmar po la yang ste las thams cad pa la drag po'i rdzas rnams spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po dang dmar po la yang ste las thams cad pa la drag po'i rdzas rnams spang bar bya'o //
translated: Also for white and red, one should avoid the fierce substances for all activities.

original: las thams cad pa'i sgras ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang dbang la sogs pa'i las drug ste bsad pa la sogs pa dang phur bus gdab pa la sogs pa drug ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i sgras ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang dbang la sogs pa'i las drug ste bsad pa la sogs pa dang phur bus gdab pa la sogs pa drug ni ma yin no //
translated: By the term all activities are meant the six activities such as pacifying, and so on, and the six such as controlling, and so on, and not the six such as killing, and so on, and the six such as stabbing with a dagger, and so on.

original: sa yongs su brtag pa'i nges pa'o ;
