analyzed: sa yongs su brtag pa'i nges pa'o ;
translated: This is the determination of the earth examination.

original: / da ni dbang ldan pa la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du phyogs kyi cha gsungs te 'dir spyi'i grong las grong gi phyi rol dbang ldan dang byang du yang zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag bya'o //
analyzed: / da ni dbang ldan pa la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du phyogs kyi cha gsungs te 'dir spyi'i grong las grong gi phyi rol dbang ldan dang byang du yang zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag bya'o //
translated: Now, beginning with the northeast, he states the directional parts for the purposes of pacifying, and so on. Here, in general, outside the town, in the northeast, one should perform pacifying and enriching.

original: rgyal po chen po'i gnas las ni phyogs brgyad na ro sreg pa la sogs pa'i dur khrod brgyad de /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po'i gnas las ni phyogs brgyad na ro sreg pa la sogs pa'i dur khrod brgyad de /
translated: In the eight directions from the abode of the great king, there are the eight charnel grounds such as the Burning Ground, and so on.

original: des na zhi ba dang rgyas pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na zhi ba dang rgyas pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, pacifying and enriching will not be accomplished.

original: de'i phyir rgyal po'i khab kyi dbang ldan dang byang du zhi ba dang rgyas pa bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyal po'i khab kyi dbang ldan dang byang du zhi ba dang rgyas pa bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the royal palace, one should perform pacifying and enriching in the east.🔽The remaining rites are like those in the village, outside the royal palace.

original: las lhag ma rnam ni grong gi bzhin du rgyal po'i gnas las phyi rol du'o zhes pa zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i las nges pa'o //
analyzed: las lhag ma rnam ni grong gi bzhin du rgyal po'i gnas las phyi rol du'o zhes pa zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i las nges pa'o //
translated: Thus is the determination of the rites of pacifying and enriching.

original: de bzhin du mer bsad pa dang shar du rnam par dbye ba dang bskrad pa dang bden bral du dbang du bya ba dang lhor dgug pa dang rlung du rmongs pa dang nub tu rengs pa dang phur bus gdab pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mer bsad pa dang shar du rnam par dbye ba dang bskrad pa dang bden bral du dbang du bya ba dang lhor dgug pa dang rlung du rmongs pa dang nub tu rengs pa dang phur bus gdab pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one should kill in the fire, divide and expel in the east, enthrall in the south, summon in the west, stupefy in the north, and paralyze and nail down in the northwest.

original: grong gi dbus su las thams cad pa'i dkyil 'khor dang thab dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa sngags pas bya'o zhes pa ni phyogs kyi @96a * //
analyzed: grong gi dbus su las thams cad pa'i dkyil 'khor dang thab dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa sngags pas bya'o zhes pa ni phyogs kyi @96a * //
translated: In the center of the village, the mantrin should perform all rites, such as the maṇḍala, the hearth, and the homa.

original: char las byed pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: char las byed pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the rites in the directions.

original: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i thab gsungs te thab khung grong gi phyogs brgyad dbang ldan la sogs pa rnams su rim pa ji lta bas te zhi ba la thab khung zlum po'o //
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i thab gsungs te thab khung grong gi phyogs brgyad dbang ldan la sogs pa rnams su rim pa ji lta bas te zhi ba la thab khung zlum po'o //
translated: Now, the hearths for pacifying and so forth are taught. The hearths are in the eight directions of the village, beginning with Isana, in due order: for pacifying, the hearth is round;

original: rgyas pa la gru bzhi dang bsad pa la gzhu'i rnam pa dang dbye ba la zur lnga pa dang dbang la zur gsum pa dang dgug pa la zur bdun pa dang rmongs pa la zur drug pa dang rengs pa la zur brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la gru bzhi dang bsad pa la gzhu'i rnam pa dang dbye ba la zur lnga pa dang dbang la zur gsum pa dang dgug pa la zur bdun pa dang rmongs pa la zur drug pa dang rengs pa la zur brgyad pa'o //
translated: for enriching, square; for killing, the shape of a bow; for dividing, five-sided; for controlling, three-sided; for summoning, seven-sided; for confusing, six-sided; and for paralyzing, eight-sided.

original: 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga las rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga las rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of these will be described in detail in the ritual of the fire sacrifice that will be explained.

original: da ni thab khung gi mtshan ma gsungs te 'dir thab khung zlum po'i padma'i lte ba la mtshan ma ni padma'o //
analyzed: da ni thab khung gi mtshan ma gsungs te 'dir thab khung zlum po'i padma'i lte ba la mtshan ma ni padma'o //
translated: Now, the signs of the hearths are taught. Here, in the center of the lotus of the round hearth, the sign is a lotus.

original: gru bzhi pa la 'khor lo dang gzhu'i rnam pa la gri gug dang zur lnga pa la ral gri dang zur gsum pa la mda' dang zur bdun pa la rdo rje lcags kyu dang zur drug pa la rmongs pa la sbrul dang zur brgyad pa la lcags sgrog
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la 'khor lo dang gzhu'i rnam pa la gri gug dang zur lnga pa la ral gri dang zur gsum pa la mda' dang zur bdun pa la rdo rje lcags kyu dang zur drug pa la rmongs pa la sbrul dang zur brgyad pa la lcags sgrog
translated: In the square one, there is a knife in the form of a wheel and a bow, in the five-cornered one, a sword, in the three-cornered one, an arrow, in the seven-cornered one, a vajra hook, in the six-cornered one, a snake for delusion, and in the eight-cornered one, an iron chain.

original: go // 'dir thab khung gnyis kyi mtshan ma bzlog pa ni sde ba sbyor gyi dbang gis te mtshan ma'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: go // 'dir thab khung gnyis kyi mtshan ma bzlog pa ni sde ba sbyor gyi dbang gis te mtshan ma'i nges pa'o //
translated: Here, the reversal of the signs of the two hearths is due to the power of the combination of the classes, and that is the rule of the signs.

original: 'di rnams kyi tshad gsungs pa gcig ces pa la sogs pa ste zlum po ni khru gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi tshad gsungs pa gcig ces pa la sogs pa ste zlum po ni khru gcig pa'o //
translated: The measure of these is stated by one and so forth. The round one is one cubit.

original: gru bzhi pa ni khru gnyis pa dang gzhu'i rnam pa ni khru phyed pa dang zur lnga pa ni zlum po'i tshad dang zur gsum pa ni sor nyi shu dang zur bdun pa ni sor bzhi bcu dang zur drug pa ni sor sum cu dang zur brgyad pa
analyzed: gru bzhi pa ni khru gnyis pa dang gzhu'i rnam pa ni khru phyed pa dang zur lnga pa ni zlum po'i tshad dang zur gsum pa ni sor nyi shu dang zur bdun pa ni sor bzhi bcu dang zur drug pa ni sor sum cu dang zur brgyad pa
translated: The square one is two cubits, the one in the form of a bow is half a cubit, the five-cornered one is the measure of the round one, the three-cornered one is twenty finger-widths, the seven-cornered one is forty finger-widths, the six-cornered one is thirty finger-widths, and the eight-cornered one

original: ni sor drug cu'o //
analyzed: ni sor drug cu'o //
translated: is sixty finger-widths.

original: thab khung gi phyed kyi tshad ni zabs so //
analyzed: thab khung gi phyed kyi tshad ni zabs so //
translated: The measure of half the hearth is the depth.

original: thab khung gi drug gi cha shas ni kha khyer ro //
analyzed: thab khung gi drug gi cha shas ni kha khyer ro //
translated: One-sixth of the hearth is the lip.

original: thab khung gi bcu gnyis kyi cha shas ni mchu'o //
analyzed: thab khung gi bcu gnyis kyi cha shas ni mchu'o //
translated: One-twelfth of the hearth is the rim.

original: mtshan ma'i phring  ba yang kha khyer la kun nas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i phring  ba yang kha khyer la kun nas so //
translated: The line of the sign is all around the lip.

original: phyi rol du chu skyes 'dab ma rnams ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du chu skyes 'dab ma rnams ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la'o //
translated: The petals of the lotus are outside for pacifying and increasing.

original: lhag ma'i las rnams la ni rtsig pa'i phyi rol du gzhan dang gzhan 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma'i las rnams la ni rtsig pa'i phyi rol du gzhan dang gzhan 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: For the remaining rites, others are explained outside the wall.

original: yang na las thams cad la thab khung gi dbus su rdo rje mtshan mar shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na las thams cad la thab khung gi dbus su rdo rje mtshan mar shes bar bya'o //
translated: Or, for all rites, one should know the vajra sign in the middle of the hearth.

original: da ni sa la phur bu gdab ba'i don du phur bu gsungs te 'dir phyogs bcur phur bu gdab pa'i don du zhi ba la n+ya gro dha'i phur bu'o //
analyzed: da ni sa la phur bu gdab ba'i don du phur bu gsungs te 'dir phyogs bcur phur bu gdab pa'i don du zhi ba la n+ya gro dha'i phur bu'o //
translated: Now, for the purpose of driving in the stakes in the ground, the stakes are mentioned. Here, for the purpose of driving in the stakes in the ten directions, for pacifying, it is the banyan stake.

original: rgyas pa la aa shva da tha dad bsad pa la rus pa'i bdag nyid dang bskrad pa la lcags dang dbang la seng ldeng las skyes pa dang dgug pa la ts'u ta las skyes pa @96b dang rmongs pa la aa rka las skyes pa dang rengs pa la
analyzed: rgyas pa la aa shva da tha dad bsad pa la rus pa'i bdag nyid dang bskrad pa la lcags dang dbang la seng ldeng las skyes pa dang dgug pa la ts'u ta las skyes pa @96b dang rmongs pa la aa rka las skyes pa dang rengs pa la
translated: For the extensive [rite], it is an ashvakarna tree. For killing, it is bone. For banishing, it is iron. For controlling, it is born from a teak tree. For summoning, it is born from a chuta tree. For confusing, it is born from an arka tree. For paralyzing, it is born from a bilva tree.

original: bil ba las skyes pa'o zhes pa ni phur bu'i nges pa ste las thams cad pa la au dum a'a ra las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bil ba las skyes pa'o zhes pa ni phur bu'i nges pa ste las thams cad pa la au dum a'a ra las skyes pa'o //
translated: These are the certainties of the kīla. For all activities, it is born from an udumbara tree.

original: da ni bum pa gsungs te zhi ba la shel gyi bum pa'o //
analyzed: da ni bum pa gsungs te zhi ba la shel gyi bum pa'o //
translated: Now, the vases are described. For pacifying, it is a crystal vase.

original: rgyas pa la dngul gyi'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la dngul gyi'o //
translated: For enriching, it is a silver one.

original: bsad pa la mi'i thod pa'o //
analyzed: bsad pa la mi'i thod pa'o //
translated: For killing, it is a human skull.

original: bskrad pa dang dbye ba la lcags kyi'o //🔽dbang la gser gyi'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa dang dbye ba la lcags kyi'o // dbang la gser gyi'o //
translated: For banishing and separating, it is an iron one.🔽For controlling, it is a golden one.

original: dgug pa la zangs kyi'o //
analyzed: dgug pa la zangs kyi'o //
translated: For summoning, it is a copper one.

original: rengs pa la sa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rengs pa la sa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: For paralyzing, it is earthen.🔽For confusing, it is a wooden vase.

original: rmongs pa la shing las skyes pa'i bum pa bcu'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa la shing las skyes pa'i bum pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten vases.

original: de nas zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i don du bum pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te 'dir bum pa'i lto ba zlum po ni brgyad gnyis sor du brjod de sor bcu drug tu brjod do //
analyzed: de nas zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i don du bum pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te 'dir bum pa'i lto ba zlum po ni brgyad gnyis sor du brjod de sor bcu drug tu brjod do //
translated: Then, for the sake of peace and increase, the characteristics of the vase are taught. Here, the round belly of the vase is said to be eight fingerbreadths, which is sixteen fingerwidths.

original: gnyis kyis bsgyur pa'i bcu yis dpangs zhes pa ni bum pa'i lto ba'i 'og nas kha dang mchu'i mthar sor nyi shu ni dpangs so //
analyzed: gnyis kyis bsgyur pa'i bcu yis dpangs zhes pa ni bum pa'i lto ba'i 'og nas kha dang mchu'i mthar sor nyi shu ni dpangs so //
translated: The height is ten fingerbreadths multiplied by two, meaning that from the bottom of the vase belly to the edge of the mouth and lips is twenty fingerbreadths.

original: sor gnyis dag gi mchu zhes pa ni gang dag gi mchu sor gnyis 'phyang ba de dag ni sor gnyis dag gi mchu'o //
analyzed: sor gnyis dag gi mchu zhes pa ni gang dag gi mchu sor gnyis 'phyang ba de dag ni sor gnyis dag gi mchu'o //
translated: The lips are two fingerbreadths means that those with two fingerbreadths of hanging lips are two fingerbreadths.

original: kha'i mtshams nas sor drug gi mgrin pa'o //
analyzed: kha'i mtshams nas sor drug gi mgrin pa'o //
translated: The neck is six fingerbreadths from the edge of the mouth.

original: sor brgyad kha ste zhes pa ni mchu'i mtha' nas mchu'i mthar kha sor mo brgyad de /
analyzed: sor brgyad kha ste zhes pa ni mchu'i mtha' nas mchu'i mthar kha sor mo brgyad de /
translated: The mouth is eight fingerbreadths means that from the edge of the lips to the edge of the lips is eight fingerbreadths.

original: sor brgyad cha gsum du byas nas cha gnyis kyis mgrin pa'i bug pa'o //
analyzed: sor brgyad cha gsum du byas nas cha gnyis kyis mgrin pa'i bug pa'o //
translated: Having divided eight fingerbreadths into three parts, the hole of the neck is two parts.

original: cha gcig gis mchu gnyis kyi zheng ngo //
analyzed: cha gcig gis mchu gnyis kyi zheng ngo //
translated: One part is the width of the two lips.

original: de yang ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar ba'i bum pa ni zhi rgyas dag la ste gzhan la ni 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar ba'i bum pa ni zhi rgyas dag la ste gzhan la ni 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, a pot that is white like a rabbit's fur is for pacifying and increasing, but not for the others.

original: shel dang dngul gyi bum pa rnams med na sa'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa nag po dang rtsa ba med pa rnams s'a li btags pa'am tsandan gyis byugs te dkar por bya'o //
analyzed: shel dang dngul gyi bum pa rnams med na sa'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa nag po dang rtsa ba med pa rnams s'a li btags pa'am tsandan gyis byugs te dkar por bya'o //
translated: If there are no crystal or silver pots, a black pot made of earth, without a base, should be made white by being smeared with salt or sandalwood.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: Similarly, the Lord also taught in the Root Tantra:

original: bsad pa la mi'i thod pa dur khrod kyi sol ba'i phye ma dang mi'i zhag gis byugs te nag por bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: bsad pa la mi'i thod pa dur khrod kyi sol ba'i phye ma dang mi'i zhag gis byugs te nag por bya'o zhes so //
translated: For killing, a human skull should be smeared with charnel ground ash and human fat and made black.

original: bskrad pa dang dbye ba la mgrin pa ring po sor brgyad pa 'khyog po lus phra ba zlum po sor bcu gnyis ba srid du sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa mchu sor gcig pa /
analyzed: bskrad pa dang dbye ba la mgrin pa ring po sor brgyad pa 'khyog po lus phra ba zlum po sor bcu gnyis ba srid du sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa mchu sor gcig pa /
translated: For banishing and separating, a long, crooked neck eight fingerbreadths long, a slender, round body twelve fingerbreadths long, twenty-four fingerbreadths in height, one fingerbreadth for the beak,

original: kha sor drug pa'o //
analyzed: kha sor drug pa'o //
translated: and six fingerbreadths for the mouth.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis bzo bos ji ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis bzo bos ji ltar byas pa'o //
translated: For controlling and summoning, it should be made by an artisan according to worldly conventions.

original: rengs pa la sbom thung ste zlum po dang dpangs mtshungs par sor bcu drug pa mgrin pa sor bzhi pa /🔽kha sor drug pa mchu mthug @97a * //
analyzed: rengs pa la sbom thung ste zlum po dang dpangs mtshungs par sor bcu drug pa mgrin pa sor bzhi pa / kha sor drug pa mchu mthug @97a * //
translated: For immobilization, the vase is thick and short, that is, round and sixteen fingerbreadths in height, with a neck four fingerbreadths high,

original: po sor gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: po sor gnyis pa'o //
translated: a mouth six fingerbreadths across, and lips two fingerbreadths thick.

original: bum pa'i nges pa ste las thams cad pa la zhi ba la sogs pa dang dbang la sogs pa'i las la gsungs pa rnams gzung bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa'i nges pa ste las thams cad pa la zhi ba la sogs pa dang dbang la sogs pa'i las la gsungs pa rnams gzung bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the vase, which should be understood as stated for all actions, such as pacifying and so forth, and for the actions of power and so forth.

original: da ni snga dro zhes pa la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i dus gsungs te 'dir nyin zhag so so la snga dro nas thun brgyad ni thun tshod rnams te de rnams las dang po'i thun la zhi ba dang gnyis pa la rgyas pa dang gsum pa
analyzed: da ni snga dro zhes pa la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i dus gsungs te 'dir nyin zhag so so la snga dro nas thun brgyad ni thun tshod rnams te de rnams las dang po'i thun la zhi ba dang gnyis pa la rgyas pa dang gsum pa
translated: Now, the time for pacifying and so forth is stated by “in the morning” and so forth. Here, the eight periods from morning to the end of the day are the periods.

original: la bsad pa dang bzhi pa la bskrad pa dang lnga pa la dbang dang drug pa la dgug pa dang bdun pa la rmongs pa dang / brgyad pa la rengs pa bya'o zhes ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa la thun mtshams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la bsad pa dang bzhi pa la bskrad pa dang lnga pa la dbang dang drug pa la dgug pa dang bdun pa la rmongs pa dang / brgyad pa la rengs pa bya'o zhes ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa la thun mtshams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the fourth, one should drive out; in the fifth, enthrall; in the sixth, summon; in the seventh, stupefy; and in the eighth, paralyze. This is the division of the periods for pacifying, and so forth.

original: de bzhin de yi thun phyed dag la zhes pa ni snga dro'i thun phyed la zhi ba dang phyed phyi ma la rgyas pa ste thams cad du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin de yi thun phyed dag la zhes pa ni snga dro'i thun phyed la zhi ba dang phyed phyi ma la rgyas pa ste thams cad du yang de bzhin no //
translated: And in its half-periods means that in the first half of the morning period one should perform the pacifying rite, and in the second half, the enriching rite. And so on for all.

original: de bzhin du mtshan mo'i thun phyed snga ma la zhi ba dang phyed phyi ma la rgyas pa'i las rnams kyang sngags pas bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan mo'i thun phyed snga ma la zhi ba dang phyed phyi ma la rgyas pa'i las rnams kyang sngags pas bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the mantrin should perform the pacifying rite in the first half of the night period and the enriching rite in the second half.

original: gal te 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'dug stangs bcings nas thun tshod gcig tu sbyin sreg byed par mi nus na de'i tshe thun phyed gcig sbyin sreg byas nas bsgrub par bya ste gnyig gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'dug stangs bcings nas thun tshod gcig tu sbyin sreg byed par mi nus na de'i tshe thun phyed gcig sbyin sreg byas nas bsgrub par bya ste gnyig gsungs so //
translated: If one is unable to perform the homa for one period, binding the posture that will be described, then one should perform the rite in one half-period, for it is said, both.

original: dus kyi bye brag gis lha mchod pa dang sgrub pa'i nges pa gzhan ni le'u lnga par 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi bye brag gis lha mchod pa dang sgrub pa'i nges pa gzhan ni le'u lnga par 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other certainties of worship and practice of the deity by the particular time will be described in Chapter Five.

original: da ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la gdug pa'i dus dang dus sbyor dgag pa gsungs te 'dir nyin zhag so sor nyi ma gung dang nam phyed dag ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i las la yang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: da ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la gdug pa'i dus dang dus sbyor dgag pa gsungs te 'dir nyin zhag so sor nyi ma gung dang nam phyed dag ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i las la yang spang bar bya'o //
translated: Now, the prohibition of the evil time and conjunctions for pacification and enrichment is stated. Here, noon and midnight on each day should be avoided for the rites of pacification and enrichment.

original: de bzhin du 'char ba'i dus sbyor gdug pa'i gza' rnams gnas pa ste bkra shis dang sben pa dang dus me'i gza' dang bcas pa ni spang ste gang gi phyir 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'char ba'i dus sbyor gdug pa'i gza' rnams gnas pa ste bkra shis dang sben pa dang dus me'i gza' dang bcas pa ni spang ste gang gi phyir 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed do //
translated: Similarly, the evil conjunctions of the rising [of the sun] are the abodes of the evil planets, along with the auspicious, the Pleiades, and the planet of time, which should be avoided, because they are the bringers of the fear of death.

original: des na bsad pa dang bskrad pa la ni de nyid sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: des na bsad pa dang bskrad pa la ni de nyid sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, for killing and expelling, one should apply just that. This is the rule.

original: da ni'o ma dang bcas zhes pa la sogs pas zhing la sogs pa rnams la sbyin sreg gi yam shing gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni'o ma dang bcas zhes pa la sogs pas zhing la sogs pa rnams la sbyin sreg gi yam shing gsungs te /
translated: Now, with “along with the cow,” etc., the fuel for the homa in the fields, etc. is stated.

original: 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa la 'o ma dang bcas yam shing mda' brgya zhes pa ni lnga brgya'i grangs so //
analyzed: 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa la 'o ma dang bcas yam shing mda' brgya zhes pa ni lnga brgya'i grangs so //
translated: Here, for pacifying and enriching, the one hundred sacrificial sticks with milk are five hundred in number.

original: 'o ma'i shing rnams zhes pa ni au dum b'a ra dang aa shvad tha dang n+ya gro dh'a dang brk'a t'i dang ma dhu bri ksha rnams so //
analyzed: 'o ma'i shing rnams zhes pa ni au dum b'a ra dang aa shvad tha dang n+ya gro dh'a dang brk'a t'i dang ma dhu bri ksha rnams so //
translated: The milky trees are udumbara, ashvattha, nyagrodha, banyan, and madhuvṛkṣa.

original: bsad @97b pa la mi rus mthe chung gi sor mo'i dbyibs su byas pa lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: bsad @97b pa la mi rus mthe chung gi sor mo'i dbyibs su byas pa lnga brgya'o //
translated: For killing, there are five hundred human bone pieces shaped like little fingers.

original: de bzhin du dbye ba dang bskrad pa la bya rog gi mjug ma lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbye ba dang bskrad pa la bya rog gi mjug ma lnga brgya'o //
translated: Similarly, for dividing and expelling, there are five hundred crow tails.

original: de bzhin du dbang la seng ldeng las skyes ba dang dgug pa la ba l'a sha las skyes pa dang rmongs pa la smyo byed las skyes pa dang rengs pa la bil ba las skyes pa ste thams cad du khru phyed ni sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang la seng ldeng las skyes ba dang dgug pa la ba l'a sha las skyes pa dang rmongs pa la smyo byed las skyes pa dang rengs pa la bil ba las skyes pa ste thams cad du khru phyed ni sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, for controlling, it is from khadira wood; for summoning, from lāśa wood; for confusing, from madana wood; and for paralyzing, from bilva wood. In all cases, one cubit is twelve finger breadths.

original: mthe chung gi sor mo'i tshad nas mthe bo'i bar du ste de'i steng du chad pa'am lhag pa ni gzung bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni yam shing gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: mthe chung gi sor mo'i tshad nas mthe bo'i bar du ste de'i steng du chad pa'am lhag pa ni gzung bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni yam shing gi nges pa'o //
translated: From the measure of the little finger up to the thumb, one should not take what is above or below that. This is the rule for the sacrificial sticks.

original: da ni sbyin sreg gi rdzas rnams gsungs pa'o ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zhi ba la ba'i 'o ma dang d'u ra bas sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: da ni sbyin sreg gi rdzas rnams gsungs pa'o ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zhi ba la ba'i 'o ma dang d'u ra bas sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Now, the substances for the homa are stated: mam and so forth. Here, for pacification, one should perform the homa with cow's milk and barley.

original: rgyas pa la mar dang 'bru lngas so //
analyzed: rgyas pa la mar dang 'bru lngas so //
translated: For prosperity, with ghee and the five grains.

original: bsad pa la khrag gis te sha dang dug dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: bsad pa la khrag gis te sha dang dug dang lhan cig go //
translated: For killing, with blood, together with flesh and poison.

original: bskrad pa dang dbye ba la mi'i zhag gis te skye tshe dang lan tshva dag dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: bskrad pa dang dbye ba la mi'i zhag gis te skye tshe dang lan tshva dag dang lhan cig go //
translated: For banishing and separating, with human fat, together with asafoetida and salt.

original: dbang la rngul gyis te ka ra b'i ra'i me tog dmar po la sogs pa dang lhan cig go //🔽dgug pa la gci bas te bil ba'i 'dab ma'am /
analyzed: dbang la rngul gyis te ka ra b'i ra'i me tog dmar po la sogs pa dang lhan cig go // dgug pa la gci bas te bil ba'i 'dab ma'am /
translated: For enthralling, with sweat, together with red karavīra flowers and so forth.🔽For summoning, with urine, together with bilva leaves

original: de'i 'bras bu'i 'bru dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i 'bru dang lhan cig go //
translated: or with the grain of its fruit.

original: rengs pa la mchil mas te me tog rnyings pa'i phreng ba dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: rengs pa la mchil mas te me tog rnyings pa'i phreng ba dang lhan cig go //
translated: For paralysis, with saliva, and together with a garland of withered flowers.🔽For confusion, with beer, and together with dhattura flowers.

original: rmongs pa la chang gis te dha du ra'i me tog dang lhan cig go zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa la sbyin sreg gi rdzas nges pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa la chang gis te dha du ra'i me tog dang lhan cig go zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa la sbyin sreg gi rdzas nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the substances for the homa in pacification and so forth.

original: da ni slob dpon gyi gdan gyi phyogs kyi cha gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyi gdan gyi phyogs kyi cha gsungs te /
translated: Now, the master's seat is taught:

original: 'dir zhi ba la gshin rjer 'chad par 'gyur pa'i gdan bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhi ba la gshin rjer 'chad par 'gyur pa'i gdan bya'o //
translated: Here, for pacification, the seat is in the south, as will be explained.

original: rgyas pa la bden bral gyi zur du'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la bden bral gyi zur du'o //
translated: For increase, in the corner of the west.

original: bsad pa la chu ru'o //🔽bskrad pa dang dbye ba la rlung du'o //
analyzed: bsad pa la chu ru'o // bskrad pa dang dbye ba la rlung du'o //
translated: For killing, in the north.🔽For banishing and separating, in the east.

original: dbang la gnod sbyin du'o //🔽dgug pa la dbang ldan du'o //
analyzed: dbang la gnod sbyin du'o // dgug pa la dbang ldan du'o //
translated: For enthrallment, in the northeast.🔽For attraction, in the southeast.🔽For confusion, in the south.

original: rmongs pa la shar du'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa la shar du'o //
translated: For paralysis, in the southwest.

original: rengs pa la me'i zur du'o zhes pa ni zhi ba'i las la sogs pa la sbyin sreg gi thab kyi gdan gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: rengs pa la me'i zur du'o zhes pa ni zhi ba'i las la sogs pa la sbyin sreg gi thab kyi gdan gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the seat of the homa hearth in the rites of pacification and so forth.

original: da ni rdul tshon gyi cho ga gsungs te 'dir zhi ba la sogs pa'i las gnyis gnyis la thab khung rnams dang dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rngul tshon gdab bar 'gyur te zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la rdul tshon dkar po'o //
analyzed: da ni rdul tshon gyi cho ga gsungs te 'dir zhi ba la sogs pa'i las gnyis gnyis la thab khung rnams dang dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rngul tshon gdab bar 'gyur te zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la rdul tshon dkar po'o //
translated: Now the rite of colored powders is taught. Here, in the case of the two actions of pacification and so forth, the colored powders are applied in the hearth and in the center of the mandala. For pacification and increase, the colored powder is white.

original: bsad pa dang bskrad pa dag la rdul tshon nag po dang dbang dang dgug pa dag la dmar po dang rmongs pa dang rengs pa dag la ser po dang las thams cad pa la ljang gu @98a * //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad pa dag la rdul tshon nag po dang dbang dang dgug pa dag la dmar po dang rmongs pa dang rengs pa dag la ser po dang las thams cad pa la ljang gu @98a * //
translated: For killing and expelling, the colored powder is black; for power and summoning, it is red; for stupefying and paralyzing, it is yellow; and for all actions, it is green.

original: ste dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po dang ser po dang ljang gu dang bcas pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: ste dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po dang ser po dang ljang gu dang bcas pa'o zhes so //
translated: Thus, it is white, black, red, yellow, and green.

original: de bzhin du thab khung rnams dang dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi sa la sangs rgyas kyi dbye ba'am bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi dbye bas rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas rdul tshon gdab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du thab khung rnams dang dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi sa la sangs rgyas kyi dbye ba'am bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi dbye bas rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas rdul tshon gdab bo //
translated: Similarly, in the hearths and outside the mandala in the east, south, west, and north, one should apply the colored powders according to the procedure taught in the tantra, with the divisions of the Buddha or the divisions of the face of the Blessed One.

original: rdul tshon gdab ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rdul tshon gdab ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for the colored powders.

original: de bzhin du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas slob dpon gyis dgod pa sogs dang bsang gtor la sogs pa dang rang gi snying ga'i rdo rje dag las lha rnams spro bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas slob dpon gyis dgod pa sogs dang bsang gtor la sogs pa dang rang gi snying ga'i rdo rje dag las lha rnams spro bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: In the same way, by the procedure to be described, the master should emit the deities from the vajra in his heart, beginning with the layout, and so on, and the sprinkling of water, and so on. This is the rule.

original: da ni mchod yon gyi snod kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te 'dir zhi ba la ni mchod yon sbyin pa'i don du shel gyi snod kham bor gyi rnam pa ste ka tso la'i rnam pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: da ni mchod yon gyi snod kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te 'dir zhi ba la ni mchod yon sbyin pa'i don du shel gyi snod kham bor gyi rnam pa ste ka tso la'i rnam pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Now he states the characteristics of the vessel for the libation. Here, for the peaceful rite, a crystal vessel in the shape of a cup or a kachola is for the purpose of giving the libation.

original: thams cad cad sor bcu gnyis pa lte ba dang bcas pa 'dab ma brgyad pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad cad sor bcu gnyis pa lte ba dang bcas pa 'dab ma brgyad pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: All are twelve finger-breadths, with a navel and an eight-petaled [lotus].

original: de ltar na shel la sogs pa'i mchod yon snod la padma nor gyi 'dab ma mthe bo dag ni bcu gnyis kyang zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar na shel la sogs pa'i mchod yon snod la padma nor gyi 'dab ma mthe bo dag ni bcu gnyis kyang zhes so //
translated: Thus, in the libation vessel of crystal and so on, the lotus has twelve finger-breadths, the petals are four finger-breadths, and the navel is four finger-breadths.

original: 'dir lte ba sor bzhi dang 'dab ma rnams sor bzhi ste de ltar sor bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dir lte ba sor bzhi dang 'dab ma rnams sor bzhi ste de ltar sor bcu gnyis so //
translated: Here, the navel is four finger-breadths, and the petals are four finger-breadths, thus twelve finger-breadths.

original: de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs pa la dngul dang thod pa dang lcags dang gser dang zangs dang shing dang sa'i rang bzhin gyi snod rnams la sgrub po //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs pa la dngul dang thod pa dang lcags dang gser dang zangs dang shing dang sa'i rang bzhin gyi snod rnams la sgrub po //
translated: Similarly, for the sake of prosperity, etc., one should perform the rite in vessels made of silver, skull, iron, gold, copper, wood, or earth.

original: de bzhin du sreg blugs kyi sbyin sreg gi don du dgang gzar dang blugs gzar gsungs te 'dir yu ba'i rtse mor te khru gang tsam gyi yu ba'i rtse mor snyim pa'i rnam pa'i snod gru bzhi pa ste sor mo gcig gi dpangs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sreg blugs kyi sbyin sreg gi don du dgang gzar dang blugs gzar gsungs te 'dir yu ba'i rtse mor te khru gang tsam gyi yu ba'i rtse mor snyim pa'i rnam pa'i snod gru bzhi pa ste sor mo gcig gi dpangs so //
translated: Similarly, for the sake of the homa rite, the ladle and spoon are prescribed. Here, the ladle is a vessel shaped like a cupped hand at the end of a handle one cubit long, and one fingerbreadth high.

original: mnyam pa'i gzhil padma ste padma'i 'dab ma'i rtse mo 'di ni mchu'i nang gi ngos so //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i gzhil padma ste padma'i 'dab ma'i rtse mo 'di ni mchu'i nang gi ngos so //
translated: The base is even, like a lotus. This is the edge of the rim.

original: phyi rol du rdo rje rtse lnga pa ste dbu ma'i rtse mo la gci ba dang khu ba'i rgyun 'byung ba bzhin du mar gyi rgyun 'byung ba'i don du bug pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du rdo rje rtse lnga pa ste dbu ma'i rtse mo la gci ba dang khu ba'i rgyun 'byung ba bzhin du mar gyi rgyun 'byung ba'i don du bug pa'o //
translated: Outside, there is a five-pronged vajra. Like the tip of the central channel, there is a hole for the stream of ghee to flow out, like the flow of semen and urine.

original: sreg blugs kyi bya ba la sreg blugs kyi dgang gzar ro //
analyzed: sreg blugs kyi bya ba la sreg blugs kyi dgang gzar ro //
translated: For the sake of the homa rite, there is the homa ladle.

original: khru gang tsam gyi yu ba las zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las snying ga'i padma nas rdo rje'i mthar thug pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: khru gang tsam gyi yu ba las zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las snying ga'i padma nas rdo rje'i mthar thug pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The statement the handle is one cubit in length is a specification that it extends from the lotus of the heart to the end of the vajra, as stated in the root tantra.

original: de bzhin du yu ba'i rtse mor sbyin sreg gi bya ba la khyor bar 'gyur te mdzod spu'i gnas nas snying ga'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yu ba'i rtse mor sbyin sreg gi bya ba la khyor bar 'gyur te mdzod spu'i gnas nas snying ga'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, the tip of the handle is the ladle for the rite of homa, extending from the place of the tuft to the heart.

original: kha'i rgya'i cha de nyid lag mthil gyi tshad kyis padma sor drug pa'o //
analyzed: kha'i rgya'i cha de nyid lag mthil gyi tshad kyis padma sor drug pa'o //
translated: The size of the mouth of the ladle is the size of the palm of the hand, and the lotus is six finger-widths.

original: rdzas @98b kyi sbyin sreg gi blugs gzar gyi yu ba'i rgyab la rdo rjes mtshan pa ste sbyin sreg gi snod kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas @98b kyi sbyin sreg gi blugs gzar gyi yu ba'i rgyab la rdo rjes mtshan pa ste sbyin sreg gi snod kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The handle of the ladle for the homa of substances is marked with a vajra at the back, and this is the specification for the homa vessel.

original: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa la lha'i sku gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa la lha'i sku gsungs te /
translated: Now, the deity's body is stated for pacification and so forth.

original: 'dir thab khung gi me lha dang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la zhi ba kha dog dkar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir thab khung gi me lha dang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la zhi ba kha dog dkar por 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the fire god of the hearth and the principal deity of the mandala are white for pacification and increase.

original: bsad pa dang bskrad pa la sogs pa la drag po kha dog nag po'o //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad pa la sogs pa la drag po kha dog nag po'o //
translated: For killing, expelling, and so on, they are wrathful and black.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la chags pa dang bcas pa kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la chags pa dang bcas pa kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: For attraction and summoning, the color is red, along with passion.

original: rmongs pa dang rengs pa la sogs pa la khengs pa kha dog ser po'o zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa la lha'i kha dog go //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang rengs pa la sogs pa la khengs pa kha dog ser po'o zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa la lha'i kha dog go //
translated: For stupefaction, paralysis, and so on, the color is yellow, along with haughtiness. This is the color of the deity in pacification and so on.

original: las thams cad pa la ljang gu cung zad bzhad cing chags pa'i sku ste lha'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: las thams cad pa la ljang gu cung zad bzhad cing chags pa'i sku ste lha'i nges pa'o //
translated: For all actions, the color is green, with a slightly smiling and passionate body. This is the deity's determination.

original: da na rdul tshon gyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa rnam pa lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rgyal ba'i dbang po rdo rje sems dpa' rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: da na rdul tshon gyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa rnam pa lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rgyal ba'i dbang po rdo rje sems dpa' rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Now, the purity of the colored powders is stated: Five aspects and so on. Here, the lords of the victors are the five Vajrasattvas.

original: gang phyir te gang gi phyir ye shes kyi 'od zer rnam pa lnga spro ba'i phyir te srid pa gsum la gnas pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched sgrib pa med pa'i dbye ba yis so //
analyzed: gang phyir te gang gi phyir ye shes kyi 'od zer rnam pa lnga spro ba'i phyir te srid pa gsum la gnas pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched sgrib pa med pa'i dbye ba yis so //
translated: Because means that since the five aspects of the light rays of gnosis are emitted, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that abide in the three existences are without obscurations.

original: de las kyang ni lha rnams dkyil 'khor dag la rdul tshon rnam pa lnga ru 'gyur te rdul tshon gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de las kyang ni lha rnams dkyil 'khor dag la rdul tshon rnam pa lnga ru 'gyur te rdul tshon gyi nges pa'o //
translated: From that, the deities become the five aspects of the colored powders in the maṇḍala. This is the determination of the colored powders.

original: da ni thig skud khru ni brgyad ces pa la sogs pas thig skud kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te //
analyzed: da ni thig skud khru ni brgyad ces pa la sogs pas thig skud kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te //
translated: Now, beginning with the line, “The thread should be eight cubits long,” the characteristics of the thread are taught.

original: 'dir gzhon nu mas bkal pa'i srad bu du ma sum bsgril gyi bdag nyid du bya ste de nas rdo rje slob dpon gyi mthe bo'i nas kyi tshad kyis sum bsgril du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhon nu mas bkal pa'i srad bu du ma sum bsgril gyi bdag nyid du bya ste de nas rdo rje slob dpon gyi mthe bo'i nas kyi tshad kyis sum bsgril du bya'o //
translated: Here, many threads spun by a young girl should be made into a triple strand. Then, with the cubit of the vajra master, it should be made into a triple strand.

original: de nyid ni khru brgyad pa ces pa dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur ram pa bzhi 'gyur khru bcu drug gi bar du slob dpon gyi khru yis thig skud gcig bya ste dkyil 'khor la mtshan nyid gzhan ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni khru brgyad pa ces pa dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur ram pa bzhi 'gyur khru bcu drug gi bar du slob dpon gyi khru yis thig skud gcig bya ste dkyil 'khor la mtshan nyid gzhan ba ma yin no //
translated: That itself is called “eight cubits long,” which is double the maṇḍala, or quadruple, up to sixteen cubits. With the cubit of the master, one should make the thread. It is not of another characteristic in the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor ni rtag tu rang gi bdag nyid kyi chas khru gcig nas brtsams te khru stong ji srid pa de srid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni rtag tu rang gi bdag nyid kyi chas khru gcig nas brtsams te khru stong ji srid pa de srid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The maṇḍala always has its own measure, from one cubit up to one thousand cubits.

original: des na gang du thig skud kyi nges pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa slob dpon gyi khru yis yin pa der thig skud ni dkyil 'khor las nyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gang du thig skud kyi nges pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa slob dpon gyi khru yis yin pa der thig skud ni dkyil 'khor las nyis 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, where the certainty of the thread and the certainty of the mandala are in terms of the teacher's cubit, the thread is twice the size of the mandala.

original: de la dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni khru bcu gnyis pa rab tu bya'o zhes pa'i nges pas thig skud khru nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni khru bcu gnyis pa rab tu bya'o zhes pa'i nges pas thig skud khru nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: There, the first Buddha's mind mandala should be made twelve cubits, so the thread is twenty-four cubits.🔽Similarly, the speech mandala is sixteen cubits and the body mandala is twenty cubits.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi dkyil 'khor khru bcu drug pa dang sku'i dkyil 'khor khru nyi shu pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa ste thig skud ni de dag gi nyis 'gyur ro //🔽khru @99a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi dkyil 'khor khru bcu drug pa dang sku'i dkyil 'khor khru nyi shu pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa ste thig skud ni de dag gi nyis 'gyur ro // khru @99a * //
translated: The thread is twice those.

original: stong gi dkyil 'khor ni khru nyis stong gi thig skud kyis thig gdab bar mngon par brjod pa med de shin tu rmad du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong gi dkyil 'khor ni khru nyis stong gi thig skud kyis thig gdab bar mngon par brjod pa med de shin tu rmad du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A mandala of one thousand cubits is not to be measured with a thread of two thousand cubits, because it is extremely marvelous.

original: rgyud gzhan las thig skud sgoms su sgo'i nyi shu cha dang ring ba dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan las thig skud sgoms su sgo'i nyi shu cha dang ring ba dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur ma yin nam /
translated: In other tantras, the thread is one-twentieth the size of the door and the length is twice the mandala, is it not?

original: ci ltar na sboms su nas tsam dang / ring ba khru brgyad pa yin zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi tshig 'byung bar 'gyur te de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar na sboms su nas tsam dang / ring ba khru brgyad pa yin zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi tshig 'byung bar 'gyur te de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Some texts say, How is it that the width is the size of a barley seed and the length is eight cubits? Therefore, it should be explained.

original: 'dir gal te dkyil 'khor thams cad la thig skud sboms su sgo'i nyi shu cha yin na de'i tshe khru stong gi dkyil 'khor la 'khor lo'i brgyad cha'i sgo ni nyu shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i khru brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gal te dkyil 'khor thams cad la thig skud sboms su sgo'i nyi shu cha yin na de'i tshe khru stong gi dkyil 'khor la 'khor lo'i brgyad cha'i sgo ni nyu shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i khru brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if the width of the thread for all maṇḍalas is one-twentieth of the door, then in a maṇḍala of one thousand cubits, the door, which is one-eighth of the maṇḍala, will be five hundred and twenty-five cubits.

original: de'i nyi shu cha sor drug lhag pa'i khru drug ni thig skud kyi sboms su 'gyur te thig skud khru stong phrag gnyis pa des slob dpon su zhig dkyil 'khor gyi sa la thig gdab ba byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i nyi shu cha sor drug lhag pa'i khru drug ni thig skud kyi sboms su 'gyur te thig skud khru stong phrag gnyis pa des slob dpon su zhig dkyil 'khor gyi sa la thig gdab ba byed par 'gyur /
translated: One-twentieth of that, six finger-widths plus six cubits, will be the width of the thread. With that thread of two thousand cubits, what master will draw the lines on the maṇḍala ground?

original: de'i phyir tshig 'di ni dkyil 'khor khru gang tsam la sogs pa la ste de'i steng du spyi'i thig skud kyi sboms nges pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig 'di ni dkyil 'khor khru gang tsam la sogs pa la ste de'i steng du spyi'i thig skud kyi sboms nges pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement is for maṇḍalas of one cubit and so on. The definite width of the general thread is not of the Blessed One.

original: mi rnams kyi lus ni thun mong gis khru bzhi ste nges na lus las nyis 'gyur ni khru brgyad do //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lus ni thun mong gis khru bzhi ste nges na lus las nyis 'gyur ni khru brgyad do //
translated: The bodies of men are generally four cubits, and double that is eight cubits.

original: rnam pa gsum gyi lam la gnas pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rtsal gnas pa gcig du 'dres par gyur pa'i thig skud do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyi lam la gnas pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rtsal gnas pa gcig du 'dres par gyur pa'i thig skud do //
translated: The thread of the warp is the single mixed state of the power of body, speech, and mind, which is the state of abiding in the three aspects of the path.

original: des khru stong gi mthar thug pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab bar bya ste snying po'i 'khor lo'i rtsibs rnams las yang dang yang du thig gi gnas su thig gdab pas so zhes pa ni thig skud kyi cho ga'i ngas pa'o //🔽da ni zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las sgrub pa'i don du 'dug stangs rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: des khru stong gi mthar thug pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab bar bya ste snying po'i 'khor lo'i rtsibs rnams las yang dang yang du thig gi gnas su thig gdab pas so zhes pa ni thig skud kyi cho ga'i ngas pa'o // da ni zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las sgrub pa'i don du 'dug stangs rnams gsungs te /
translated: With that, one should lay out the mandala up to a thousand cubits, by repeatedly laying out the thread at the place of the thread, from the spokes of the wheel of the essence. This is the section on the procedure of the warp thread.🔽Now, beginning with “peaceful,” he teaches the postures for the sake of accomplishing the actions of pacification and so forth.

original: 'dir zhi ba la sogs pa la rim pas 'dug stangs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhi ba la sogs pa la rim pas 'dug stangs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the postures are for pacification and so forth, respectively.

original: de yang zhi ba la skyil krung zhes pa ste pus mo g-yon pa'i steng du rkang ba g-yas pa gan rkyal du gnas pa ni skyil krung ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhi ba la skyil krung zhes pa ste pus mo g-yon pa'i steng du rkang ba g-yas pa gan rkyal du gnas pa ni skyil krung ngo //
translated: For pacifying, the posture is called “cross-legged,” that is, the right foot lies flat on the left thigh and the left foot on the right thigh.

original: rgyas pa la rdo rje'i 'dug stangs ni rkang ba g-yas pa brla g-yon pa'i steng dang g-yon pa yang brla g-yas pa'i steng du ste thad kar gan rgyal gyis so zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dug stangs so //
analyzed: rgyas pa la rdo rje'i 'dug stangs ni rkang ba g-yas pa brla g-yon pa'i steng dang g-yon pa yang brla g-yas pa'i steng du ste thad kar gan rgyal gyis so zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dug stangs so //
translated: For increasing, the posture is the “vajra posture,” that is, the right foot lies flat on the left thigh and the left foot on the right thigh.

original: lha min zhes pa ni lha min gyi 'dug stangs te bsad pa la 'thab mo byed pa'i rus sbal gyi stabs bzhin no @99b zhes pa ni lha min gyi 'dug stangs so //
analyzed: lha min zhes pa ni lha min gyi 'dug stangs te bsad pa la 'thab mo byed pa'i rus sbal gyi stabs bzhin no @99b zhes pa ni lha min gyi 'dug stangs so //
translated: For the rite of killing, the posture is the “asura posture,” that is, the right foot lies flat on the left thigh and the left foot on the right thigh, but with the feet turned up.

original: tsog bu zhes pa ni bskrad pa dang dbye ba la tsog bur 'gyur te rkang ba gnyis mnyam pa lo dbu 'phong tshos kyi rtsa ba la reg pa dag ste byin pa gnyis dang brla gnyis steng du son pa ni tsog bu'o //
analyzed: tsog bu zhes pa ni bskrad pa dang dbye ba la tsog bur 'gyur te rkang ba gnyis mnyam pa lo dbu 'phong tshos kyi rtsa ba la reg pa dag ste byin pa gnyis dang brla gnyis steng du son pa ni tsog bu'o //
translated: For the rites of expelling and separating, the posture is the “squatting posture,” that is, the two feet are together and the knees touch the ground, and the two shins and two thighs are raised up.

original: skyil krung phyed pa dbye ba rnam pa gnyis zhes pa ni 'dir dbang la rkang ba g-yon pa skyil krung bzhin dang g-yas ba tsog bu bzhin te g-yas su cung zad du dpa'o //🔽dgug pa la dbye ba gnyis pa ste g-yas pa skyil krung bzhin dang g-yon ba tsog pu bzhin te g-yon du cung zad dud pa'o zhes pa ni skyil krung phyed pa dbye ba gnyis so //
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pa dbye ba rnam pa gnyis zhes pa ni 'dir dbang la rkang ba g-yon pa skyil krung bzhin dang g-yas ba tsog bu bzhin te g-yas su cung zad du dpa'o // dgug pa la dbye ba gnyis pa ste g-yas pa skyil krung bzhin dang g-yon ba tsog pu bzhin te g-yon du cung zad dud pa'o zhes pa ni skyil krung phyed pa dbye ba gnyis so //
translated: The two kinds of half-cross-legged posture are as follows: For the rite of subjugation, the left foot is like the cross-legged posture and the right foot is like the squatting posture, with the right foot slightly bent.🔽For the rite of summoning, the right foot is like the cross-legged posture and the left foot is like the squatting posture, with the left foot slightly bent.

original: bshad lam rkang bar gnas pa dag ces pa ni 'dir rmongs pa la rkang pa g-yon par bshad lam gnas pa ste rkang pa g-yon pa'i steng du bshad lam bzhag cing g-yas pa tsog bu bzhin no //
analyzed: bshad lam rkang bar gnas pa dag ces pa ni 'dir rmongs pa la rkang pa g-yon par bshad lam gnas pa ste rkang pa g-yon pa'i steng du bshad lam bzhag cing g-yas pa tsog bu bzhin no //
translated: The two kinds of half-cross-legged posture are as follows: For the rite of stupefying, the left foot is in the posture of the path of explanation, with the path of explanation placed on top of the left foot and the right foot like the squatting posture.

original: rengs pa la g-yas par bshad lam gnas pa ste rkang pa'i steng du bshad lam bzhag cing g-yon btsog pu bzhin no //
analyzed: rengs pa la g-yas par bshad lam gnas pa ste rkang pa'i steng du bshad lam bzhag cing g-yon btsog pu bzhin no //
translated: For the rite of paralyzing, the right foot is in the posture of the path of explanation, with the path of explanation placed on top of the right foot and the left foot like the squatting posture.

original: 'dug stangs kyi dbye ba rnam ba brgyad kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug stangs kyi dbye ba rnam ba brgyad kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the eight kinds of sitting postures.

original: da ni shel dang zhes pa la sogs pas sngags bzlas pa'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa'i bgrang phreng gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni shel dang zhes pa la sogs pas sngags bzlas pa'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa'i bgrang phreng gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “crystal” and so forth, he teaches the rosaries for the peaceful and so forth for the purpose of mantra recitation.

original: 'dir zhi ba la shel gyi bgrang phreng ngo //
analyzed: 'dir zhi ba la shel gyi bgrang phreng ngo //
translated: Here, for the peaceful, a crystal rosary.

original: rgyas pa la mu tig gi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la mu tig gi 'bras bu'o //
translated: For the increasing, a rosary of pearl seeds.

original: bsad pa la mi'i so las byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsad pa la mi'i so las byas pa'o //
translated: For the killing, a rosary made of human teeth.

original: bskrad pa la bod bu'i so las byas pa'am rus pa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa la bod bu'i so las byas pa'am rus pa las byas pa'o //
translated: For the expelling, a rosary made of goat’s teeth or bone.

original: dbang la bo de tse'i bgrang phreng ngo /
analyzed: dbang la bo de tse'i bgrang phreng ngo /
translated: For the controlling, a rosary of bodices.

original: dgug pa la padma 'am tsandan dmar po'i sa bon gyi bgrad phreng ngo //
analyzed: dgug pa la padma 'am tsandan dmar po'i sa bon gyi bgrad phreng ngo //
translated: For the summoning, a rosary of lotus or red sandalwood seeds.

original: rmongs pa la lung tang gi bgrang phreng ngo //
analyzed: rmongs pa la lung tang gi bgrang phreng ngo //
translated: For the confusing, a rosary of mustard seeds.

original: rengs pa la dbang po'i mig ces pa ru rag sha'i bgrang phreng ngo zhes pa ni bgrang phreng gi nges pa ste bde gshegs rigs kyi dbang gis zhes ba ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rengs pa la dbang po'i mig ces pa ru rag sha'i bgrang phreng ngo zhes pa ni bgrang phreng gi nges pa ste bde gshegs rigs kyi dbang gis zhes ba ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: For the paralyzing, a rosary of peacock feathers. This is the ascertainment of the rosary. “By the power of the sugata family” will be explained in the following.

original: da ni dri zhim zhes pa la sogs pas mchod pa'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa la me tog rnams gsungs te 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa la dri zhim po'i me tog dkar po rnams kyis lha la sogs pa rnams mchod do //
analyzed: da ni dri zhim zhes pa la sogs pas mchod pa'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa la me tog rnams gsungs te 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa la dri zhim po'i me tog dkar po rnams kyis lha la sogs pa rnams mchod do //
translated: Now, with “fragrant” and so forth, he teaches the flowers for pacification and so forth for the purpose of worship. Here, for pacification and enrichment, one worships the gods and so forth with fragrant white flowers.

original: bsad pa dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba la tsha ba dang bcas pa'i nag po tsher ma can rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba la tsha ba dang bcas pa'i nag po tsher ma can rnams kyis so //
translated: For killing, expelling, and separating, one uses hot black thorny flowers.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la dmar pos so //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la dmar pos so //
translated: For enthralling and summoning, one uses red flowers.

original: rmongs pa dang rengs pa @100a * //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang rengs pa @100a * //
translated: For stupefying and paralyzing,

original: la ser pos te mchod pa'i me tog gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: la ser pos te mchod pa'i me tog gi nges pa'o //
translated: one uses yellow flowers. This is the rule for worship flowers.

original: da ni bsil dang zhes pa la sogs pas spos gsungs te zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la bsil ba'i sbos te bsil ba ni aa ga ru dang shi la ka dang ga bur rnams kyi spos sbrang rtsi dang sha ka ra la sogs pa dang bcas ba
analyzed: da ni bsil dang zhes pa la sogs pas spos gsungs te zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la bsil ba'i sbos te bsil ba ni aa ga ru dang shi la ka dang ga bur rnams kyi spos sbrang rtsi dang sha ka ra la sogs pa dang bcas ba
translated: Now, with “cool” and so forth, he teaches incense. For pacification and enrichment, one uses cool incense, cool being the incense of agarwood, śilā, and camphor, together with honey, sugar, and so forth.

original: ni bsil pa'i sbos zhes brjod de bsil ba'i rdzas rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ni bsil pa'i sbos zhes brjod de bsil ba'i rdzas rnams kyis so //
translated: This is called “cool incense,” with cool substances.

original: de bzhin du bsad pa dang bskrad pa la bshad pa dang sha yi spos khrag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsad pa dang bskrad pa la bshad pa dang sha yi spos khrag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Likewise, for killing and expelling, the incense is explained as being made of meat and blood.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la drag po'i sbos zhes pa ste gu gul dang rgya skyegs dang spos dkar dang kun du ru dang thang chu rnams bu ram gyis sbyar ba ni drag po'i sbos so //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la drag po'i sbos zhes pa ste gu gul dang rgya skyegs dang spos dkar dang kun du ru dang thang chu rnams bu ram gyis sbyar ba ni drag po'i sbos so //
translated: For enthralling and summoning, the incense is called “fierce” — namely, gugul, lac, white incense, costus, and myrobalan mixed with molasses.

original: de bzhin du rmongs pa dang rengs pa la bska ba'i sbos ni aa ru ra'i phye ma bur ma dang bcas pa bska ba'i sbos te sbos kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rmongs pa dang rengs pa la bska ba'i sbos ni aa ru ra'i phye ma bur ma dang bcas pa bska ba'i sbos te sbos kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Likewise, for stupefying and paralyzing, the incense is “bitter” — namely, a powder of yellow myrobalan mixed with molasses. This is the rule for incense.

original: de bzhin du zhal zas ni zhi ba la 'o ma dang zan no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhal zas ni zhi ba la 'o ma dang zan no //
translated: Likewise, for food, for pacifying, it is milk and rice;

original: rgyas pa la zho dang zan no //
analyzed: rgyas pa la zho dang zan no //
translated: for enriching, yogurt and rice;

original: bsad pa la mchin pa'o //
analyzed: bsad pa la mchin pa'o //
translated: for killing, liver;

original: bskrad pa la sha'o //🔽dbang la mar dang zan no //
analyzed: bskrad pa la sha'o // dbang la mar dang zan no //
translated: for expelling, meat;🔽for enthralling, butter and rice;

original: dgug pa la til gyi 'bru mar dang zan no //🔽rmongs pa la sran chung mung+ga dang bsres pa'i zan no //
analyzed: dgug pa la til gyi 'bru mar dang zan no // rmongs pa la sran chung mung+ga dang bsres pa'i zan no //
translated: for summoning, sesame oil and rice;🔽for stupefying, rice mixed with mung beans;

original: rengs pa la tsan ka dang nya dang zan no //
analyzed: rengs pa la tsan ka dang nya dang zan no //
translated: and for paralyzing, rice mixed with fish and mustard.

original: de bzhin du zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la tsandan gyi byug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la tsandan gyi byug pa'o //
translated: Likewise, for pacification and increase, it is sandalwood unguent.

original: bsad pa dang bskrad pa la khrag dang sol bas so //🔽dpad  dang dgug pa la gur gum dang gi wang dam tsandan dmar pos so //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad pa la khrag dang sol bas so // dpad  dang dgug pa la gur gum dang gi wang dam tsandan dmar pos so //
translated: For killing and expelling, it is blood and charcoal.🔽For bewitching and summoning, it is saffron, realgar, or red sandalwood.

original: rmongs pa dang rengs pa la yud ba dang ba blas te dri'i des pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang rengs pa la yud ba dang ba blas te dri'i des pa'o //
translated: For stupefying and paralyzing, it is urine and cow dung.

original: de bzhin du mar me ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la mar gyi mar me'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mar me ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la mar gyi mar me'o //
translated: Likewise, for pacification and increase, the lamp is a butter lamp.

original: bsad pa dang bskrad pa dag la mi'i zhag gis so //🔽dbang dang dgug pa dag la til gyi 'bru mar gyis so //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad pa dag la mi'i zhag gis so // dbang dang dgug pa dag la til gyi 'bru mar gyis so //
translated: For killing and expelling, it is a human's fat.🔽For enthralling and summoning, it is sesame oil.🔽For stupefying and paralyzing, it is mustard oil and acacia oil.

original: rmongs pa dang rengs pa la zar ma'i 'bru mar dang bse shing gi 'bru mar gyis so zhes pa la sogs pa mar me'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang rengs pa la zar ma'i 'bru mar dang bse shing gi 'bru mar gyis so zhes pa la sogs pa mar me'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the section on lamps.

original: de bzhin du zhi ba dang rgyas pa la 'bras s'a lu ma chag ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi ba dang rgyas pa la 'bras s'a lu ma chag ba'o //
translated: Likewise, for pacification and increase, the food is unhusked rice.

original: bsad pa dang bskrad ba la skye tshe dang dbang dang dgug pa la yungs kar dang rengs pa dang rmongs pa la sran chung ngam 'bru gzhan no //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad ba la skye tshe dang dbang dang dgug pa la yungs kar dang rengs pa dang rmongs pa la sran chung ngam 'bru gzhan no //
translated: For killing and banishing, mustard seed; for power, summoning, and enthralling, kidney beans or other grains.

original: de bzhin du gos la sogs pa ste zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la mchod pa'i rdzas thams cad dkar po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gos la sogs pa ste zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la mchod pa'i rdzas thams cad dkar po'o //
translated: Similarly, for pacifying and enriching, all the offering substances are white;

original: bsad pa dang bskrad pa dag la nag po dang dbang dang dgug pa la @100b dmar po dang / rengs pa dang rmongs pa dag la ser po'i las thams cad pa la ljang gu ste mchod pa'i cho ga nges pa'o //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad pa dag la nag po dang dbang dang dgug pa la @100b dmar po dang / rengs pa dang rmongs pa dag la ser po'i las thams cad pa la ljang gu ste mchod pa'i cho ga nges pa'o //
translated: for killing and banishing, black; for power, summoning, and enthralling, red; for paralyzing and confusing, yellow; and for all activities, green. This is the rule for the offerings.

original: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'khrul 'khor bri ba'i chog gsungs te 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'khrul 'khor ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dpal n+ya gro dh'a'i 'dab ma sar pa la shr'i khanda dang s'a btags pa'i chus d'ur pa'i
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'khrul 'khor bri ba'i chog gsungs te 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'khrul 'khor ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dpal n+ya gro dh'a'i 'dab ma sar pa la shr'i khanda dang s'a btags pa'i chus d'ur pa'i
translated: Now, with regard to the activities of pacifying and so forth, the procedure for drawing the described yantras is taught. Here, the described yantras are for pacifying and enriching, on fresh nyagrodha leaves, with water mixed with śrīkhaṇḍa and flour, and for killing and banishing, on the ground with the powder of burnt corpses.

original: smyu gur gri par bya ste rgyas pa la ni bsil pa'i smyu gus so //
analyzed: smyu gur gri par bya ste rgyas pa la ni bsil pa'i smyu gus so //
translated: For a sword, one should use a bamboo stick. For prosperity, one should use a cooling stick.

original: de bzhin du bsad pa dang bskrad pa la yang dur khrod kyi ras la dug dang khrag dang sol bas mi'i rus pa'i smyu gus te bskrad pa la ni bya rog gi mjug ma'i smyu gus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsad pa dang bskrad pa la yang dur khrod kyi ras la dug dang khrag dang sol bas mi'i rus pa'i smyu gus te bskrad pa la ni bya rog gi mjug ma'i smyu gus so //
translated: Similarly, for killing and expelling, one should use a human bone stick on a charnel ground cloth with poison, blood, and soot. For expelling, one should use a crow tail stick.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la ni gro ga'i 'dab ma la gur gum dang gi wang gis gser gyi smyu gus te dgug pa la ni sed ldeng gi smyu gus tsandan dmar po btags pas so //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la ni gro ga'i 'dab ma la gur gum dang gi wang gis gser gyi smyu gus te dgug pa la ni sed ldeng gi smyu gus tsandan dmar po btags pas so //
translated: For enthralling and summoning, one should use a golden stick on a birch bark leaf with saffron and bezoar. For summoning, one should use a sandalwood stick mixed with red sandalwood.

original: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la ni aa rka'i 'dab ma yongs su smin pa kha dog ser po la 'bras bu gsum gyi khu ba dang bcas pa'i ba bla dang yung bas bil ba'i smyu gus te rmongs pa la aa rka'i smyu gus so zhes pa ni nges
analyzed: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la ni aa rka'i 'dab ma yongs su smin pa kha dog ser po la 'bras bu gsum gyi khu ba dang bcas pa'i ba bla dang yung bas bil ba'i smyu gus te rmongs pa la aa rka'i smyu gus so zhes pa ni nges
translated: For paralyzing and confusing, one should use a bilva stick on a fully ripened yellow arjaka leaf with babula and turmeric mixed with the three fruit juices. For confusing, one should use an arjaka stick. This is the definite number.

original: pa'o // de ni 'khrul 'khor rab tu gzhag pa'i cho ga gsungs te 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la 'khrul 'khor bris pa'i 'dab ma la sogs pa ni ji srid 'khrul 'khor mi mthong gi bar du slad bu dkar pos dkri bar bya ste /
analyzed: pa'o // de ni 'khrul 'khor rab tu gzhag pa'i cho ga gsungs te 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la 'khrul 'khor bris pa'i 'dab ma la sogs pa ni ji srid 'khrul 'khor mi mthong gi bar du slad bu dkar pos dkri bar bya ste /
translated: The procedure for setting up the machine is stated: Here, for pacifying and increasing, the machine is drawn on a leaf, etc., and wrapped with white thread until the machine is seen.

original: de bzhin du las kyi dbye bas srad bu nag po dang srad bu dmar po dang srad bu ser bos dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi dbye bas srad bu nag po dang srad bu dmar po dang srad bu ser bos dkri bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, by the division of the rite, it is wrapped with black thread, red thread, and yellow thread.

original: de nas zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la kham phong kha sbyar du mngar gsum ste sbang rtsi dang mar dang 'o ma yang dag par bsres pa la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la kham phong kha sbyar du mngar gsum ste sbang rtsi dang mar dang 'o ma yang dag par bsres pa la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, for pacifying and increasing, it is placed in a joined pair of bowls with the three sweet things, i.e., honey, butter, and milk, mixed together.

original: bsad pa dang bskrad pa la thod pa khrag gis gang bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad pa la thod pa khrag gis gang bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: For killing and expelling, it is placed in a skull filled with blood.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la mes gdungs pa'i gyo mo kha sbyar du sbra tshil gyis dkris nas so //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la mes gdungs pa'i gyo mo kha sbyar du sbra tshil gyis dkris nas so //
translated: For enthralling and summoning, it is placed in a joined pair of bowls heated by fire, wrapped in beeswax.

original: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la ba bla'i chus gang ba'i so phag gi dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la ba bla'i chus gang ba'i so phag gi dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: For paralyzing and confusing, it should be placed in the center of a brick filled with the water of the vase.

original: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la rlan dang bcas pa'i gnas ni gtsang ma dag tu mandala gyi steng du gzhag par bya'o //🔽bsad pa dang bskrad pa la ro bsregs pa'i sa brkos pa'i 'og tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dag la rlan dang bcas pa'i gnas ni gtsang ma dag tu mandala gyi steng du gzhag par bya'o // bsad pa dang bskrad pa la ro bsregs pa'i sa brkos pa'i 'og tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: For pacifying and enriching, the moist place is a clean spot, where it should be placed on top of a maṇḍala.🔽For killing and expelling, it should be placed under a pit dug in a cremation ground.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la thab kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la thab kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: For enthralling and summoning, it should be placed under the hearth.

original: rengs pa dang rmongs pa las skam po la @101a * //
analyzed: rengs pa dang rmongs pa las skam po la @101a * //
translated: For paralyzing and confusing, it should be placed on dry ground.

original: gzhug par bya ste dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las la 'bras bu sngags pa yis ni rig par bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzhug par bya ste dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las la 'bras bu sngags pa yis ni rig par bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The result of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions should be understood by the mantra practitioner. This is the conclusion.

original: da ni bris pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i phyi rol gyi nges pa gsungs te 'dir zhi ba la 'khor lo'i phyi rol du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis bskor par bya ste zlum po'i ri mos so //
analyzed: da ni bris pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i phyi rol gyi nges pa gsungs te 'dir zhi ba la 'khor lo'i phyi rol du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis bskor par bya ste zlum po'i ri mos so //
translated: Now, the external certainty of the drawn maṇḍala wheel is stated. Here, for pacifying, the outer circle of the wheel should be surrounded by a lunar maṇḍala, with a circular line.

original: rgyas pa la glang po ches bskor bar bya ste ji ltar glang po che'i lus la 'khor lor 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la glang po ches bskor bar bya ste ji ltar glang po che'i lus la 'khor lor 'gyur pa'o //
translated: For the extensive [rite], one should draw a wheel on the body of an elephant.

original: bsad pa la yi dags kyi lus la'o //🔽bskrad pa la rnga mo'i lus la'o //🔽dbang la ri dags kyi lus la'o //
analyzed: bsad pa la yi dags kyi lus la'o // bskrad pa la rnga mo'i lus la'o // dbang la ri dags kyi lus la'o //
translated: For killing, on the body of a preta.🔽For banishing, on the body of a camel.🔽For enthralling, on the body of a deer.

original: dgug pa la rta'i lus la'o //
analyzed: dgug pa la rta'i lus la'o //
translated: For summoning, on the body of a horse.

original: rmongs pa la ra'i lus sam lug gi lus la'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa la ra'i lus sam lug gi lus la'o //
translated: For stupefying, on the body of a ram or a sheep.

original: rengs pa la rus sbal gyi lus la ste ji ltar 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lor 'gyur pa de bzhin du phyi rol du gzugs bya'o //
analyzed: rengs pa la rus sbal gyi lus la ste ji ltar 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lor 'gyur pa de bzhin du phyi rol du gzugs bya'o //
translated: For paralyzing, on the body of a tortoise. Just as a machine wheel would turn, so one should draw the external form.

original: de nas sngon du gsungs pa'i srad bus dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngon du gsungs pa'i srad bus dkri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should wrap it with the previously mentioned thread.

original: de bzhin du rig pa yang nges pa ste zhi ba dang rgyas pa la dngul gyi sbu gu rig pa'i dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig pa yang nges pa ste zhi ba dang rgyas pa la dngul gyi sbu gu rig pa'i dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge [implement] is also determined: for pacifying and enriching, one should place a silver tube in the center of the knowledge [implement].

original: bsad pa la mi'i rus pa'i spu gu dang bskrad pa la bya rog gi rus pa'i sbu gu dang dbang la gser gyi sbu gu dang dgug pa la zangs kyi sbu gu dang rmongs pa la lcags kyi sbu gu dang rengs pa lar gan gyi sbu gu'o zhes
analyzed: bsad pa la mi'i rus pa'i spu gu dang bskrad pa la bya rog gi rus pa'i sbu gu dang dbang la gser gyi sbu gu dang dgug pa la zangs kyi sbu gu dang rmongs pa la lcags kyi sbu gu dang rengs pa lar gan gyi sbu gu'o zhes
translated: For killing, a human bone tube; for banishing, a crow bone tube; for controlling, a gold tube; for summoning, a copper tube; for confusing, an iron tube; and for paralyzing, a lead tube.

original: pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty.

original: 'dir gang gis bskrad par 'gyur ba'i chog de nyid kyis dbye ba'i bya ba bya'o //🔽gang gis rengs par 'gyur pa de nyid kyis phur bus gdab pa bya ste 'on kyang dgra'i dri ma dril ba bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pas gzugs brnyan byas nas 'khor lo drug dang lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs rnams la myos byed kyi tsher ma rnams kyis
analyzed: 'dir gang gis bskrad par 'gyur ba'i chog de nyid kyis dbye ba'i bya ba bya'o // gang gis rengs par 'gyur pa de nyid kyis phur bus gdab pa bya ste 'on kyang dgra'i dri ma dril ba bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pas gzugs brnyan byas nas 'khor lo drug dang lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs rnams la myos byed kyi tsher ma rnams kyis
translated: Here, the activity of dividing should be done by just that rite by which one banishes.🔽By just that by which one paralyzes, one should drive in the dagger. However, having made an effigy with the smells of the enemy together with the five elixirs, one should drive in the dagger with the thorns of madana

original: phur bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: phur bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: at the six wheels and the joints of the arms and legs.

original: lha min rengs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lha min rengs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the paralysis of the demigods, and so on.

original: gang gis dgug par 'gyur pa de nyid kyis rims skyed pa ste 'on kyang skye tshe dang lan tshvas gzugs brnyan la byugs nas mes rab gdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis dgug par 'gyur pa de nyid kyis rims skyed pa ste 'on kyang skye tshe dang lan tshvas gzugs brnyan la byugs nas mes rab gdung bar bya'o //
translated: The same one who summons should also cause fever, but with mustard seed and salt, anointing the effigy and heating it with fire.

original: gang gis zhi bar 'gyur pa de nyid kyis gdug pa'i lta ba dang dug gzhil ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis zhi bar 'gyur pa de nyid kyis gdug pa'i lta ba dang dug gzhil ba ste /
translated: The same one who pacifies should also cure poison and the gaze of the malevolent, but with milk and sugar, anointing the patient and cooling him with water.

original: slob dpon gyis las bcu gnyis kyi cho ga shes nas gal te gzhan la phan pa'i slad du byed na de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pas gdon mi za bar de'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis las bcu gnyis kyi cho ga shes nas gal te gzhan la phan pa'i slad du byed na de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pas gdon mi za bar de'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: If the master, knowing the rite of the twelve acts, performs them for the sake of helping others, then by the word of the Lord, the result will certainly come to pass for him,

original: rang @101b gi don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang @101b gi don du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for his own sake.

original: gang zhig byed na yang 'dir de'i cung zad kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur te gdug pa'i slob dpon rnams yongs su ngal ba nyon mongs pa tsam 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: gang zhig byed na yang 'dir de'i cung zad kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur te gdug pa'i slob dpon rnams yongs su ngal ba nyon mongs pa tsam 'ba' zhig go //
translated: And if he performs them for himself, nothing will be accomplished, and it will be only a vexation for the malevolent master.

analyzed: do // mgrin par nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dmar po la a'a: yig dgod do //

original: snying gar sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor nag po la h'um yig dgod do //🔽lte bar dus kyi me'i dkyil 'khor kha dog ser po la ho: yig dgod do //

translated: In the heart, on the black Rāhu maṇḍala, one should place the syllable hūṃ.🔽In the navel, on the yellow Kālacakra maṇḍala, one should place the syllable hoḥ.

original: gtsug tor dang gsang bar grangs bzhin du nam mkha' dang ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ljang gu dang sngon po la hom dang ksha: yig dag dgod do //
analyzed: gtsug tor dang gsang bar grangs bzhin du nam mkha' dang ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ljang gu dang sngon po la hom dang ksha: yig dag dgod do //
translated: In the uṣṇīṣa and the secret place, on the green space and the blue gnosis maṇḍalas, one should place the syllables hūṃ and kṣaḥ, respectively.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor drug bsgoms te dkyil 'khor de rnams la rim pa ji lta bas sa bon 'di rnams yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje rnams bsgom par bya ste rtse mo bcu bdun pa dang / rtse mo sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / rtse mo dgu pa dang /

translated: Having meditated on the six maṇḍalas in that way, on those maṇḍalas, one should meditate on the vajras that are the complete transformations of those seeds, in order: a seventeen-tined vajra, a thirty-three-tined vajra, a nine-tined vajra,

original: rtse mo drug cu rtsa lnga pa dang / rtse mo lnga pa dang / rtse mo sum cu rtsa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo drug cu rtsa lnga pa dang / rtse mo lnga pa dang / rtse mo sum cu rtsa gsum pa'o //
translated: a sixty-five-tined vajra, a five-tined vajra, and a thirty-three-tined vajra.

analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol du g-yon pa'i phrag pa dang dpung pa'i tshigs la ka sde'i bdag nyid rtse mo sum cu rtsa gcig pa'o //

translated: Similarly, on the right, there are the long consonants.🔽Similarly, on the left elbow joint, there are the short vowels, and on the right, the long vowels.

analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i phrag pa dang dpung pa'i tshigs la ta sde thung ngu'i bdag nyid de g-yas pa la ring po'i bdag nyid do // g-yon pa'i brla'i tshigs la pa sde thung du'i bdag nyid de g-yas pa la ring po'i bdag nyid do //

analyzed: g-yon pa'i pus mo'i tshigs la ta sde thung ngu'i bdag nyid de g-yas pa la ring po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: On the left knee joint, there are the short gutturals, and on the right, the long gutturals.

original: rkang pa g-yon pa'i tshigs la sa sde thung ngu'i bdag nyid de g-yas pa la ring po'i bdag nyid do zhes pa ni tshigs la rdo rje dgod pa'o //

translated: On the joints of the left foot, the short vowels, and on the right foot, the long vowels. This is the placement of the vajras on the joints.

original: de bzhin du sor mo'i tshigs drug cu po rnams la so sor rdo rje rtse mo bdun pa bsgom par bya ste nang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams kyis so //

translated: Thus, on the sixty joints of the fingers and toes, one should meditate on the seven-pointed vajras with the seed syllables taught in the Inner Chapter.

analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dag la aa a'a dag gis rdo rje rtse mo gsum pa bsgom par bya'o //

original: sna'i bug pa dag @102b la ae aee dag gis so //
analyzed: sna'i bug pa dag @102b la ae aee dag gis so //

analyzed: mig dag la aar a'ar dag gis so //

analyzed: lce dang lce chud dag la ao aoo dag gis so //

analyzed: rdo rje dang gsang ba dag la aa la a'a la dag gis so //

analyzed: yid dang khu ba'i rtsa la aom a'a: dag gis so //
translated: On the mind and semen channel, with oṃ and āḥ.

analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug tor dang mgo bo dag la ha h'a dag gis rtse mo lnga pa'o //
translated: Likewise, on the uṣṇīṣa and head, with ha and ha, the five-pointed [vajra].

analyzed: de nas mchu lce dang rkan dag la ya y'a dag gis rtse mo lnga pa'o //
translated: Then, on the lips, tongue, and palate, with ya ra la wa, the five points.
