analyzed: lag pa'i mthil dag la ra r'a dag gis so // de bzhin du rkang pa'i mthil dag la wa w'a dag gis so //
translated: On the palms of the hands, with ra ra la la,🔽and likewise on the soles of the feet, with wa wa ya ya.

analyzed: de bzhin du bshang lam gyi g-yon dang g-yas su la l'a dag gis so //
translated: Likewise, on the left and right of the anus, with la la va va.

analyzed: de ltar rdo rje'i skur bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus one should meditate on oneself as the vajra body.🔽Then, from those vajras, blazing vajras radiate and definitely burn up all the hosts of māras in the ten directions who harm sentient beings.

original: de nas rdo rje de rnams las 'phros pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba rnams kyis phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i mtha' dag bdud kyi tshogs sems can la rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa rnams nges par bsreg par bya ste steng du ljang gu 'bar ba rnams dang 'og tu
analyzed: de nas rdo rje de rnams las 'phros pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba rnams kyis phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i mtha' dag bdud kyi tshogs sems can la rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa rnams nges par bsreg par bya ste steng du ljang gu 'bar ba rnams dang 'og tu
translated: Above, with green flames, and below, with

original: sngon po 'bar ba rnams dang shar dang mer nag po 'bar ba rnams dang lho dang bden bral du dmar po 'bar ba rnams dang byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po 'bar ba rnams dang nub dang rlung du ser po 'bar ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sngon po 'bar ba rnams dang shar dang mer nag po 'bar ba rnams dang lho dang bden bral du dmar po 'bar ba rnams dang byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po 'bar ba rnams dang nub dang rlung du ser po 'bar ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The blazing blue ones are in the east and southeast, the blazing black ones are in the south and southwest, the blazing red ones are in the west and northwest, the blazing white ones are in the north and northeast, and the blazing yellow ones are in the nadir and zenith.

original: bdud kyi tshogs bsregs pa de'i 'og tu phyi nas 'khor lo'i rtsibs bcu rnams la /
analyzed: bdud kyi tshogs bsregs pa de'i 'og tu phyi nas 'khor lo'i rtsibs bcu rnams la /
translated: After the demons' hordes have been burned, then the wrathful hosts should be visualized on the ten spokes of the wheel in the directions and quarters.

original: phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas khro bo'i tshogs ni bsgom par bya zhes pa ni 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas bdud dang bgegs dang log 'dren rnams phur bus gdab pa'i don dang gnas bsrung ba'i don du sngags pas bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas khro bo'i tshogs ni bsgom par bya zhes pa ni 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas bdud dang bgegs dang log 'dren rnams phur bus gdab pa'i don dang gnas bsrung ba'i don du sngags pas bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse: The magician should visualize the protection wheel for the purpose of nailing the demons, obstructors, and misleaders with the dagger and for the purpose of protecting the site, according to the procedure to be explained.

original: 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las nges pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las nges pa gsungs pa /
translated: The certainty is stated in the verse to be explained:

original: sa'i phyogs rnams su 'dir dang por rdo rje gsum gyis zhing skyong rnams la gtor ma sbyin bya ste /
analyzed: sa'i phyogs rnams su 'dir dang por rdo rje gsum gyis zhing skyong rnams la gtor ma sbyin bya ste /
translated: Here, first of all, in the directions, one should give sacrificial cake to the field-protectors with the three vajra-words.🔽Then, with the four vajra-words, one should definitely burn the host of obstructors abiding in the directions and quarters.

original: phyi nas rdo rje brjod ba bzhi yis phyogs dang phyogs bral la gnas pa dud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg par bya zhes pa ste 'dir bzhi yis zhes pa ni gtso bo nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas rdo rje brjod ba bzhi yis phyogs dang phyogs bral la gnas pa dud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg par bya zhes pa ste 'dir bzhi yis zhes pa ni gtso bo nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa'o //
translated: Here, the word “four” is stated because of the principal one.

original: rgyas par ni rdo rje thams cad kyis nges par bsreg par bya'o zhes pa nges pa ste yan lag thams cad la sngags dgod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni rdo rje thams cad kyis nges par bsreg par bya'o zhes pa nges pa ste yan lag thams cad la sngags dgod par rig par bya'o //
translated: In detail, one should definitely burn with all vajras, that is, one should know the placement of the mantra on all the limbs.

original: de'i phyir dang por sal zhing skyong gang zhig de'i grong gi ming gis mnyam pa dang mi @103a * //🔽mnyam pa'i yi ge ste de'i gtor ma'i sngags ni aom a'a: h'um che ger mos par ri w'a r'a ya /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por sal zhing skyong gang zhig de'i grong gi ming gis mnyam pa dang mi @103a * // mnyam pa'i yi ge ste de'i gtor ma'i sngags ni aom a'a: h'um che ger mos par ri w'a r'a ya /
translated: Therefore, first of all, one should give sacrificial cake to the field-protectors, whose names are equal or unequal to the name of that city.

original: ai dam ba lim ga na dham pushpam dh'u pam pra d'i p'a ksha tam da d'a ma he /
analyzed: ai dam ba lim ga na dham pushpam dh'u pam pra d'i p'a ksha tam da d'a ma he /
translated: The mantra of that sacrificial cake is: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ, so-and-so, I offer this bali to the assembly of gods, with food, drink, perfume, flowers, incense, lamps, and music.

original: sa pa ri w'ar: sh'i ghram a'a gatstsha tu /
analyzed: sa pa ri w'ar: sh'i ghram a'a gatstsha tu /
translated: To the place, to the assembly, to the flesh-eating one, I pay homage!

original: dza: h'um bam ho: ai dam ba lim grihn'a tu kh'a da tu bi ba tu /
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: ai dam ba lim grihn'a tu kh'a da tu bi ba tu /
translated: Jham! Hum! Bam! Ho! I offer this sacrificial cake, accept it, enjoy it!

original: sa pa ri w'a ra ka:sarba sa tv'a n'am sh'a na tim pushtim raksh'a wa ra na gu pa tim ka ro tu /
analyzed: sa pa ri w'a ra ka:sarba sa tv'a n'am sh'a na tim pushtim raksh'a wa ra na gu pa tim ka ro tu /
translated: To the assembly, to all beings, grant peace, increase, protection, and well-being!

original: ai dam sth'a nom tya ka tr'a b'a hye mandala bh'u myam tishtha tu h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: ai dam sth'a nom tya ka tr'a b'a hye mandala bh'u myam tishtha tu h'um h'um phat /
translated: I give you this place, so depart! I will not be frightened! I stand on the mandala ground! Hum! Hum! Phat!

original: badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
translated: The vajra-holder will not be destroyed! Svâhâ!

original: de ltar gtor ma byin nas gnas kyi bdag po gshegs te de nas sngar gsungs pa'i chogs bdud kyi tshogs bsregs nas bsrung ba'i 'khor lo rnam par bsam mo //
analyzed: de ltar gtor ma byin nas gnas kyi bdag po gshegs te de nas sngar gsungs pa'i chogs bdud kyi tshogs bsregs nas bsrung ba'i 'khor lo rnam par bsam mo //
translated: Having thus offered the sacrificial cake, the lord of the place departs. Then, by the previously mentioned rite, having burned the host of demons, one should imagine the protection circle.

original: de la dang por yom yig yongs su gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor te steng dang 'og tu h'um yig las rdo rje kha sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang por yom yig yongs su gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor te steng dang 'og tu h'um yig las rdo rje kha sbyar ba'o //
translated: There, first, from the transformation of the syllable yom, the wind mandala, above and below, is the vajra-kiss from the syllable hum.

original: de bzhin du ram yig gi bdag nyid me'i dkyil 'khor dang / wam yig gi bdag nyid chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / lom yig gi bdag nyid sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ram yig gi bdag nyid me'i dkyil 'khor dang / wam yig gi bdag nyid chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / lom yig gi bdag nyid sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Likewise, the fire mandala, which is the nature of the syllable RAM, the water mandala, which is the nature of the syllable VAM, and the earth mandala, which is the nature of the syllable LOM.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor bzhi po rnams gcig tu byas te tho rangs grib ma yi ni mtha' ru zhes pa mtshams kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor bzhi po rnams gcig tu byas te tho rangs grib ma yi ni mtha' ru zhes pa mtshams kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: Then, having made the four mandalas into one, at the end of the twilight of dawn, at the end of the boundary.

original: de nas yang khang pa brtsegs pa khru brgya phrag gnyis pa bsgom par bya ste phyi rol du ring du mthong ba'i mtha' ru ste /
analyzed: de nas yang khang pa brtsegs pa khru brgya phrag gnyis pa bsgom par bya ste phyi rol du ring du mthong ba'i mtha' ru ste /
translated: Then, one should meditate on the two hundred cubits of the tower, at the end of the far-reaching external.

original: gang du nam mkha' dang sa 'byar ba zlum po'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par snang ba der dkyil 'khor bzhi cig tu gyur pa de nyid las rab gsum mo //
analyzed: gang du nam mkha' dang sa 'byar ba zlum po'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par snang ba der dkyil 'khor bzhi cig tu gyur pa de nyid las rab gsum mo //
translated: Where the sky and earth are joined, appearing in the form of a round mandala, there the four mandalas become one, and from that very [mandala] the three lights.

original: de nas yul 'khor bsrung ba'i don du yul 'khor gyi mtshams su ra ba lnga bsgom par bya ste thams cad du 'og du mdung rnams dang steng du mda'i dra ba rnon po'o //
analyzed: de nas yul 'khor bsrung ba'i don du yul 'khor gyi mtshams su ra ba lnga bsgom par bya ste thams cad du 'og du mdung rnams dang steng du mda'i dra ba rnon po'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of protecting the country, one should meditate on the five walls at the boundary of the country, with spears below everywhere and a net of sharp arrows above.

original: dbus su rdo rje'i sa gzhi yul 'khor gyi mtshams kyi mthar thug pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje'i sa gzhi yul 'khor gyi mtshams kyi mthar thug pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the middle, one should meditate on the vajra ground, extending to the boundaries of the realm.

original: de nas khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbus su chu skyes sam 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa khru bcu gnyis pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbus su chu skyes sam 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa khru bcu gnyis pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, in the middle of the palace, one should meditate on a lotus or an eight-spoked wheel, twelve cubits in size.

original: de'i lte ba'am mu khyud gdan dang bcas pa ste nyi ma'i gdan dang bcas pa dag kyang khru bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i lte ba'am mu khyud gdan dang bcas pa ste nyi ma'i gdan dang bcas pa dag kyang khru bzhi'o //
translated: Its center or circumference, together with the seat, and also the sun seat, are four cubits.

original: nyi ma de'i steng du bdag nyid 'chad par 'gyur pa'i khro bo rdo rje shugs kyi sku phyag nyi shu rtsa drug dang zhal bzhi pa nyes pa dag dang rnam par bral ba ste /
analyzed: nyi ma de'i steng du bdag nyid 'chad par 'gyur pa'i khro bo rdo rje shugs kyi sku phyag nyi shu rtsa drug dang zhal bzhi pa nyes pa dag dang rnam par bral ba ste /
translated: On that sun, one should meditate on oneself as the wrathful Vajravega, with twenty-six arms and four faces, free from faults.

original: 'di ltar 'khor lo'i dbus su gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag dang dus @103b kyi zhal ldan khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs zhes pa ste sgrub thabs kyi le'u las 'chad par 'gyur pa sngags pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor lo'i dbus su gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag dang dus @103b kyi zhal ldan khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs zhes pa ste sgrub thabs kyi le'u las 'chad par 'gyur pa sngags pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the center of the wheel, with two more arms of the Victorious One and four faces, the lord of wrath is called Vajravega. The mantrin should meditate on him as will be explained in the Sadhana chapter. This is the determination.

original: de nas te khro bo'i rgyal po de bsgoms nas bla ma'i nges pa dang ldan zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang ldan pa gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa sgrub pa po yis bsgrub par bya zhes pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi sa dang slob ma la sogs pa
analyzed: de nas te khro bo'i rgyal po de bsgoms nas bla ma'i nges pa dang ldan zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang ldan pa gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa sgrub pa po yis bsgrub par bya zhes pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi sa dang slob ma la sogs pa
translated: Then, having meditated on that King of Wrathful Ones, one who is endowed with the certainty of the guru, that is, who is endowed with the speech of the Buddha, the adept should accomplish a little bit of what is desired, that is, the protection wheel for the sake of protecting the maṇḍala site, the disciples, and so on.

original: rnams bsrung ba'i don du bsrung ba'i 'khor lo la khro bo la sogs pa'i lha'i tshogs spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnams bsrung ba'i don du bsrung ba'i 'khor lo la khro bo la sogs pa'i lha'i tshogs spro bar bya'o //
translated: The assembly of deities such as the wrathful ones should be emanated.

original: 'dir ting nge 'dzin ni dang por bdag nyid rdo rje shugs su bsgoms te /
analyzed: 'dir ting nge 'dzin ni dang por bdag nyid rdo rje shugs su bsgoms te /
translated: Here, first one should meditate on oneself as Vajrasena.

original: de nas snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ha ya ra wa la rnams brtsegs pa'i rang bzhin bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ha ya ra wa la rnams brtsegs pa'i rang bzhin bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should meditate on the nature of the stacked syllables hā, ra, wa, la on the sun maṇḍala at the heart.

original: de dag gi nang nas ha yig las grub pa kha dog ljang gu 'chad par 'gyur pa'i phyag dang mtshon cha dang zhal dang ldan pa zhal gyi gtso bo'i rna ba g-yon pa'i sgo nas phyung ste steng du brtsegs pa'i nang du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ram nyi
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas ha yig las grub pa kha dog ljang gu 'chad par 'gyur pa'i phyag dang mtshon cha dang zhal dang ldan pa zhal gyi gtso bo'i rna ba g-yon pa'i sgo nas phyung ste steng du brtsegs pa'i nang du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ram nyi
translated: From among those, the green syllable ha arises, endowed with the hands, weapons, and faces that will be explained, and emerges from the left ear door of the principal face.🔽

original: ma'i dkyil 'khor la gtsug tor can g-yas brkyang du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ma'i dkyil 'khor la gtsug tor can g-yas brkyang du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: From among those, the one produced from the syllable ha, green in color, having the hands, weapons, and faces that will be explained, emerges from the left ear door of the principal face, and is placed on the moon maṇḍala or sun maṇḍala in the interior of the upper tier, with the uṣṇīṣa in the extended-right-leg posture.

original: 'dir nyi ma'i rkang pa'i bye bas khro bo rnam dgod pa ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dir nyi ma'i rkang pa'i bye bas khro bo rnam dgod pa ni rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Here, the wrathful deities are arranged by the power of the sun’s digits in five ways.

original: 'dir ro dang das dang ri bong can zhes pa'i nges pa las nyi ma'i rkang pa ni bcu gcig go //
analyzed: 'dir ro dang das dang ri bong can zhes pa'i nges pa las nyi ma'i rkang pa ni bcu gcig go //
translated: Here, the certainty of “corpse, da, and rabbit” is that the power of the sun’s digits is eleven.

original: de la ri bong can gyis rdo rje shugs kyi'o //
analyzed: de la ri bong can gyis rdo rje shugs kyi'o //
translated: There, the rabbit is the power of Vajratuṇḍa.

original: dus kyis gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa bzhi yi'o //
analyzed: dus kyis gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa bzhi yi'o //
translated: The da is the power of the four, such as Yamarī.

original: ro yis gtsug tor la sogs pa drug gi'o //
analyzed: ro yis gtsug tor la sogs pa drug gi'o //
translated: The corpse is the power of the six, such as Uṣṇīṣa.

original: de'i phyir nyi ma'i bu lon dang nor gyi dbye bas thams cad nyi ma la gnas pa'am de bzhin du tshes kyi nor dang bu lon gyi dbye bas thams cad zla ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyi ma'i bu lon dang nor gyi dbye bas thams cad nyi ma la gnas pa'am de bzhin du tshes kyi nor dang bu lon gyi dbye bas thams cad zla ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, by the division of the moon's debt and wealth, everything is located in the moon.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi dbye bas phyogs rnams su zla ba la gnas pa dang phyogs bral rnams su nyi ma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi dbye bas phyogs rnams su zla ba la gnas pa dang phyogs bral rnams su nyi ma la gnas pa'o //
translated: In the same way, by the division of the body, the moon is located in the directions and the sun is located in the intermediate directions.

original: de bzhin du bsam pa'i dbye bas phyogs bral rnams su zla ba la gnas pa dang phyogs rnams su nyi ma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam pa'i dbye bas phyogs bral rnams su zla ba la gnas pa dang phyogs rnams su nyi ma la gnas pa'o //
translated: In the same way, by the division of the mind, the moon is located in the intermediate directions and the sun is located in the directions.🔽In the same way, the sun is located on the seat of the sun in the west and south, and the moon is located on the seat of the moon in the north and east.

original: de bzhin du nub dang lhor nyi ma'i gdan la gnas pa dang / byang dang shar du zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa ni nyi ma'i rkang pa'i dbye bas nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub dang lhor nyi ma'i gdan la gnas pa dang / byang dang shar du zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa ni nyi ma'i rkang pa'i dbye bas nges pa'o //
translated: This is ascertained by the division of the sun's feet.

original: des na sngags pas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin khro bo'i cho gas gzhag par bya'o zhes @104a * //
analyzed: des na sngags pas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin khro bo'i cho gas gzhag par bya'o zhes @104a * //
translated: Therefore, the mantrin should be placed according to one's desire by the rite of wrath.

original: pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment.

original: de bzhin du h'a yig ring po las grub pa'i gnod mdzes rgyal po kha dog sngon po ni rna ba g-yas pa'i sgo nas phyung ste rdo rje'i sa gzhir nyi ma la gzhag par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du yi yig las grub pa bgegs mthar byed kha dog nag po ni sna g-yon pa'i sgo nas phyung ste shar gyi rtsibs su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ram nyi ma la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du h'a yig ring po las grub pa'i gnod mdzes rgyal po kha dog sngon po ni rna ba g-yas pa'i sgo nas phyung ste rdo rje'i sa gzhir nyi ma la gzhag par bya'o // de bzhin du yi yig las grub pa bgegs mthar byed kha dog nag po ni sna g-yon pa'i sgo nas phyung ste shar gyi rtsibs su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ram nyi ma la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the blue Nīladaṇḍa, who is produced from the long HĀ syllable, emerges from the right ear-gate and should be placed on the sun in the vajra ground.🔽Similarly, the black Vighnāntaka, who is produced from the YĀ syllable, emerges from the left nostril-gate and should be placed on the moon maṇḍala or sun in the eastern petal.

original: de bzhin du y'i yig las grub pa dbyug pa sngon po nag po ni sna g-yas pa'i sgo nas phyung ste me'i rtsibs su nyi ma'am zla ba la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du y'i yig las grub pa dbyug pa sngon po nag po ni sna g-yas pa'i sgo nas phyung ste me'i rtsibs su nyi ma'am zla ba la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the black Nīladaṇḍa, who is produced from the YĀ syllable, emerges from the right nostril-gate and should be placed on the sun or moon in the southern petal.

original: rri yig las grub pa shes rab mthar byed dmar po ni mig g-yon pa'i sgo nas phyung ste lho'i rtsibs su zla ba'am nyi ma'i gdan la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rri yig las grub pa shes rab mthar byed dmar po ni mig g-yon pa'i sgo nas phyung ste lho'i rtsibs su zla ba'am nyi ma'i gdan la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The red Prajñāntaka, who is produced from the Ṛ syllable, emerges from the left eye-gate and should be placed on the moon or sun seat in the southern petal.

original: de bzhin du rr'i yig las grub pa 'dod pa'i rgyal po dmar po ni mig g-yas pa'i sgo nas phyung ste bden bral gyi rtsibs su nyi ma'am zla ba'i gdan la gzhag par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du wu yig las grub pa padma mthar byed dkar po ni lce'i sgo nas phyung ste byang gi rtsibs su zla ba'am nyi ma la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rr'i yig las grub pa 'dod pa'i rgyal po dmar po ni mig g-yas pa'i sgo nas phyung ste bden bral gyi rtsibs su nyi ma'am zla ba'i gdan la gzhag par bya'o // de bzhin du wu yig las grub pa padma mthar byed dkar po ni lce'i sgo nas phyung ste byang gi rtsibs su zla ba'am nyi ma la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the red King of Passion, accomplished from the syllable ra, is emitted from the right eye and should be placed on the spoke of southwest, on a seat of sun or moon.🔽Similarly, the white Padmanarteshvara, accomplished from the syllable vu, is emitted from the mouth and should be placed on the spoke of north, on a seat of moon or sun.

original: de bzhin du w'u yig las grub pa mi g-yo ba dkar po ni gci ba'i sgo nas phyung ste dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su nyi ma'am zla ba la gzhag par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du lli yig las grub pa gshin rje mthar byed ser po ni bshang lam gyis go nas phyung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du w'u yig las grub pa mi g-yo ba dkar po ni gci ba'i sgo nas phyung ste dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su nyi ma'am zla ba la gzhag par bya'o // de bzhin du lli yig las grub pa gshin rje mthar byed ser po ni bshang lam gyis go nas phyung ste /
translated: Similarly, the white Acala, accomplished from the syllable vau, is emitted from the anus and should be placed on the spoke of northeast, on a seat of sun or moon.

original: nub kyi rtsibs su zla ba'am nyi ma la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nub kyi rtsibs su zla ba'am nyi ma la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the yellow Yamantakrt, accomplished from the syllable li, is emitted from the path of excretion and should be placed on the spoke of west, on a seat of moon or sun.

original: de bzhin du ll'i yig las grub pa stobs po che ser po ni rdo rje gtsug tor gyi sgo nas phyung ste rlung gi rtsibs su nyi ma'am zla ba la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ll'i yig las grub pa stobs po che ser po ni rdo rje gtsug tor gyi sgo nas phyung ste rlung gi rtsibs su nyi ma'am zla ba la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the yellow Mahābala, consisting of the syllable LA, should be emitted through the Vajroṣṇīṣa door and placed on the sun or moon in the wind petal.

original: yang na bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sngags pas thams cad nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sngags pas thams cad nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Or, following the Condensed Tantra, the mantrin should place all [deities] on sun maṇḍalas.

original: de ltar na snying po'i 'khor lo dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na snying po'i 'khor lo dgod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the wheel of the essence is arranged.

original: de nas brtsegs pa'i phyi rol du tshangs ris la sogs pa'i zad par sa la sogs pa rnams spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas brtsegs pa'i phyi rol du tshangs ris la sogs pa'i zad par sa la sogs pa rnams spro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, outside the stacked [walls], one should emanate the all-encompassing earth and so forth, such as the Brahmakāyika and so forth.

original: 'dir so sor bsdu ba'i tshig gis ha ya ra wa la zhes brjod nas nga nya na ma nan gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir so sor bsdu ba'i tshig gis ha ya ra wa la zhes brjod nas nga nya na ma nan gsungs te /
translated: Here, using the words of the individual collections, one should recite HAYA RAVA LA, and then A NA MA NA MA NA.

original: de bzhin du 'dir snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la nga nya na ma nan brtsegs pa'i rang bzhin bsgoms nas de dag lang ng'a'i yi ge dag las grub pa zad par nam mkha' dag ni sngar brjod pa'i sgo @104b dag nas phyung ste brtsegs pa'i steng dang🔽gnod mdzes kyi 'og tu stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du nyi ny'i las grub pa'i zad par rlung dag ni shar dang me dag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la nga nya na ma nan brtsegs pa'i rang bzhin bsgoms nas de dag lang ng'a'i yi ge dag las grub pa zad par nam mkha' dag ni sngar brjod pa'i sgo @104b dag nas phyung ste brtsegs pa'i steng dang gnod mdzes kyi 'og tu stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o // de bzhin du nyi ny'i las grub pa'i zad par rlung dag ni shar dang me dag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, here one should meditate on the nature of the stacked up letters of the mantra in the heart on a sun maṇḍala, and having emanated the complete exterminations of the letters of the mantra through the previously mentioned doors, one should meditate on them abiding in the maṇḍala of emptiness above the stacked up letters and below Sumbha.🔽Similarly, one should meditate on the complete exterminations of wind, which are accomplished from the letters ya and ra, on the wind maṇḍala in the east and in Agni.

original: de bzhin du nri nr'i las grub pa zad par me dag ni lho dang bden bral dag tu me'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nri nr'i las grub pa zad par me dag ni lho dang bden bral dag tu me'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should meditate on the complete exterminations of fire, which are accomplished from the letters ṇi and ṇe, on the fire maṇḍala in the south and in Nirṛti.

original: de bzhin du mu m'u las grub pa zad par chu dag ni byang dang dbang ldan dag tu chu'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mu m'u las grub pa zad par chu dag ni byang dang dbang ldan dag tu chu'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should meditate on the complete exterminations of water, which are accomplished from the letters mu and ma, on the water maṇḍala in the north and in Indra.

original: de bzhin du nli nl'i dag las grub pa zad par sa dag ni nub dang rlung dag tu sa'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nli nl'i dag las grub pa zad par sa dag ni nub dang rlung dag tu sa'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should meditate on the earth mandala in the west and wind in the north, which are established from the na and ña, as the earth.

original: de nas gha dzha dha bha dha dha brtsegs pa'i rnam pa bsgom par bya zhing de dag las kyang phyogs skyong pa bcu spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas gha dzha dha bha dha dha brtsegs pa'i rnam pa bsgom par bya zhing de dag las kyang phyogs skyong pa bcu spro bar bya ste /
translated: Then one should meditate on the form of the stacked gha, jha, dha, bha, and dha, and emanate the ten direction protectors from them.

original: gha gh'a las grub pa tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug ljang gu dang sngon po dag ni ra ba'i khyon gyi tshad kyis steng du tshangs pa dang 'og tu khyab 'jug ste /
analyzed: gha gh'a las grub pa tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug ljang gu dang sngon po dag ni ra ba'i khyon gyi tshad kyis steng du tshangs pa dang 'og tu khyab 'jug ste /
translated: Brahma and Vishnu, who are established from the gha and gha, are green and blue, respectively, and are the size of the enclosure. Brahma is above and Vishnu is below.

original: ngang pa dang mkha' lding la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ngang pa dang mkha' lding la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on them as being on a goose and garuḍa, respectively.

original: de bzhin du dzhi dzh'i las grub pa bden bral dang rlung lha kha dog nag po dag ni shar dang me dag tu yi dags dang / ri dags kyi gdan la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dzhi dzh'i las grub pa bden bral dang rlung lha kha dog nag po dag ni shar dang me dag tu yi dags dang / ri dags kyi gdan la gnas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, Nairṛtī and Vāyavī, who are established from the jha and jha, are black and are in the east and fire, respectively. They are on the seats of a ghost and a deer.

original: de bzhin du lho dang bden bral du dhri dhr'i las grub pa gshin rje dang me lha dag ni ma he dang lug la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang bden bral du dhri dhr'i las grub pa gshin rje dang me lha dag ni ma he dang lug la gnas pa'o //
translated: Likewise, in the south and in the south-west, Yama and Agni, accomplished from dhri dhri, are on a buffalo and a ram.

original: byang dang dbang ldan du bhu bh'u las grub pa rgya mtsho dang bde byed dag ni chu srin dang khyu mchog la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byang dang dbang ldan du bhu bh'u las grub pa rgya mtsho dang bde byed dag ni chu srin dang khyu mchog la gnas pa'o //
translated: In the north and in the north-east, Varuna and Kubera, accomplished from bhu bhu, are on a crocodile and a bull.

original: nub dang rlung du dhli dhl'i las grub pa dbang po dang gnod sbyin dag ni glang po dang 'khor lo'i khang brtsegs la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nub dang rlung du dhli dhl'i las grub pa dbang po dang gnod sbyin dag ni glang po dang 'khor lo'i khang brtsegs la gnas pa ste /
translated: In the west and in the south-west, Indra and Yaksha, accomplished from dhrī dhrī, are on an elephant and a chariot.

original: de ltar phyogs skyong rnams ra ba'i nang la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs skyong rnams ra ba'i nang la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should visualize the world guardians inside the enclosure.

original: de nas rab bsrung ba'i don du gz'a'i 'khor lo spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rab bsrung ba'i don du gz'a'i 'khor lo spro bar bya ste /
translated: Then, in order to protect, one should emanate the planets.

original: sngar brjod pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ga dza da ba da da bsgoms te /
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ga dza da ba da da bsgoms te /
translated: On the sun mandala mentioned before, one should visualize gaja, vaja, vada, and dada.

original: de dag las ga g'a las grub pa sgra gcan dang dus kyi me dag ni ra ba gsum po rnams kyi khyon gyi tshad kyis steng dang 'og tu stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las ga g'a las grub pa sgra gcan dang dus kyi me dag ni ra ba gsum po rnams kyi khyon gyi tshad kyis steng dang 'og tu stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From the syllables ga and ga, Rāhu and Kālāgni are formed. They are imagined to be located above and below, in the middle of the empty maṇḍala, with the measure of the three enclosures.

original: de bzhin du dzi dz'i las grub pa zla ba dang / nyi ma dag ni shar dang me dag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dzi dz'i las grub pa zla ba dang / nyi ma dag ni shar dang me dag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, from the syllables ji and ji, the moon and sun are formed. They are located in the east and south, in the wind maṇḍala.

original: dri dr'i las grub @105a * //
analyzed: dri dr'i las grub @105a * //
translated: From the syllables dri and dri,

original: pa gza' lag dang / bkra shis dag ni lho dang bden bral du me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pa gza' lag dang / bkra shis dag ni lho dang bden bral du me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: the planets Mercury and Venus are formed. They are located in the south and southwest, in the fire maṇḍala.

original: bu b'u las grub pa pa sangs dang phur bu dag ni byang dang dbang ldan du chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bu b'u las grub pa pa sangs dang phur bu dag ni byang dang dbang ldan du chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: From the syllables bu and bu, the planets Jupiter and Mars are formed. They are located in the north and northeast, in the water maṇḍala.

original: dli dl'i las grub pa mjug rings dang ; spen pa dag ni nub dang rlung dag tu sa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dli dl'i las grub pa mjug rings dang ; spen pa dag ni nub dang rlung dag tu sa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: From the syllables dli and dli, the planets Saturn and Ketu are formed. They are located in the west and northwest, in the earth maṇḍala.

original: 'di ni ra ba'i phyi rol du srung zhing skyong ba'i gza' rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni ra ba'i phyi rol du srung zhing skyong ba'i gza' rnams so //
translated: These are the planets that protect and guard outside the enclosures.

original: de nas ra ba lnga bsrung ba'i don du klu'i rgyal po rnams spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas ra ba lnga bsrung ba'i don du klu'i rgyal po rnams spro bar bya ste /
translated: Then, in order to protect the five walls, the naga kings are emanated.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de la kha tsha tha pha tha tha bsgoms nas de dag las kha kh'a las grub pa rgyal ba dang / rnam par rgyal ba dag ni ra ba lnga'i nang gi khyon gyi tshad kyis steng dang 'og tu stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du tshi tsh'i las grub pa stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma dag ni shar dang me dag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de la kha tsha tha pha tha tha bsgoms nas de dag las kha kh'a las grub pa rgyal ba dang / rnam par rgyal ba dag ni ra ba lnga'i nang gi khyon gyi tshad kyis steng dang 'og tu stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o // de bzhin du tshi tsh'i las grub pa stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma dag ni shar dang me dag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: Having contemplated the syllables kha tsa tha pa tha in the center of the sun maṇḍala, from those, Jina and Vijaya, formed from kha kha, are contemplated as abiding in the maṇḍala of space above and below, the measure of the area of the five walls.🔽Similarly, Balabhadra and Padma, formed from tsi tsi, are contemplated as abiding in the maṇḍala of air in the east and southeast.

original: de bzhin du shthi thr'i las grub pa nor rgyas kyi bu dang / dung skyong dag ni lho dang bden bral dag tu me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shthi thr'i las grub pa nor rgyas kyi bu dang / dung skyong dag ni lho dang bden bral dag tu me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, Vāsuki and Śaṅkhapāla, formed from sthiti, are contemplated as abiding in the maṇḍala of fire in the south and southwest.

original: de bzhin du phu ph'u las grub pa mtha' yas dang / rigs ldan dag ni byang dang dbang ldan dag tu chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phu ph'u las grub pa mtha' yas dang / rigs ldan dag ni byang dang dbang ldan dag tu chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: In the same way, one should meditate on the two accomplished ones, Ananta and Kulika, on the circle of water in the north and northeast, respectively.

original: thli thl'i las grub pa padma chen po dang / 'jog po dag ni nub dang rlung du sa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thli thl'i las grub pa padma chen po dang / 'jog po dag ni nub dang rlung du sa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the two accomplished ones, Mahāpadma and Takṣaka, on the circle of earth in the west and southwest, respectively.

original: de nas ra ba lnga'i phyi rol du /
analyzed: de nas ra ba lnga'i phyi rol du /
translated: Then, outside the five enclosures,

original: bsrung ba'i don du 'byung po dang lha ma yin rnams bsgom par bya ste ;
analyzed: bsrung ba'i don du 'byung po dang lha ma yin rnams bsgom par bya ste ;
translated: one should meditate on the spirits and titans for the sake of protection.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de la ka tsa ta pa ta ta brtsegs pa bsgoms nas /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de la ka tsa ta pa ta ta brtsegs pa bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the sun-disk with the stacked syllables ka ca ṭa ta pa ya śa,

original: de dag las phyi rol du ra ba'i khyon gyi tshad kyis steng du ro langs dang 'og tu grul bum ste /
analyzed: de dag las phyi rol du ra ba'i khyon gyi tshad kyis steng du ro langs dang 'og tu grul bum ste /
translated: outside of them, one should meditate on the zombies above and the kumbhāṇḍas below, with the measure of the area of the enclosure.

original: 'di dag ni ka k'a las grub pa stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ka k'a las grub pa stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: These are accomplished from the syllable ka, and one should meditate on them abiding in the circle of emptiness.

original: shar du tsi las grub pa mi'am ci khyi'i gdong can dang / mer ts'i las grub pa skyes bu'am ci bya rog gi gdong can de rlung la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shar du tsi las grub pa mi'am ci khyi'i gdong can dang / mer ts'i las grub pa skyes bu'am ci bya rog gi gdong can de rlung la gnas pa'o //
translated: In the east, the kinnara with the face of a dog, born from ci, and the kumbhāṇḍa with the face of a crow, born from tsai, are in the wind.

original: de bzhin du tri tr'i las grub pa dag ni dri za phag gi gdong can dang / 'byung po bya rgod kyi gdong can te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tri tr'i las grub pa dag ni dri za phag gi gdong can dang / 'byung po bya rgod kyi gdong can te /
translated: In the same way, the gandharva with the face of a pig, born from tri, and the bhūta with the face of a vulture, born from trī,

original: lho dang bden bral du me la @105b gnas pa'o //🔽pu p'u las grub pa srin po stag gi gdong can dang / yi dags 'ug pa'i gdong can ni byang dang dbang ldan du chu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lho dang bden bral du me la @105b gnas pa'o // pu p'u las grub pa srin po stag gi gdong can dang / yi dags 'ug pa'i gdong can ni byang dang dbang ldan du chu la gnas pa'o //
translated: are in the south and in the southwest, in the fire.🔽The rākṣasa with the face of a tiger, born from pu, and the preta with the face of an owl, born from pū, are in the north and in the northeast, in the water.

original: tli tl'i las grub pa brjed byed ce sbyang gi gdong can dang / mkha' lding ni mkha' lding nyid de nub dang rlung dus la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: tli tl'i las grub pa brjed byed ce sbyang gi gdong can dang / mkha' lding ni mkha' lding nyid de nub dang rlung dus la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The piśāca with the face of a hyena, born from ta, and the garuḍa with the face of a garuḍa, are in the west and in the northwest, in the air. This is the protection wheel.

original: sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi chos rnam par dag pa khang pa brtsegs pa dang / ra ba gsum dang / ra ba lnga rnams ni ye shes dang / nam mkha' dang / rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / sa'i khams drug las skyes pa khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dang /
analyzed: sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi chos rnam par dag pa khang pa brtsegs pa dang / ra ba gsum dang / ra ba lnga rnams ni ye shes dang / nam mkha' dang / rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / sa'i khams drug las skyes pa khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dang /
translated: The pure phenomena of body, speech, and mind are the stacked palaces, the three walls, and the five walls, which are born from the six elements of gnosis, space, wind, fire, water, and earth.

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / phyogs skyong bcu dang / gza' dang / klu dang / 'byung po ste sde pa drug gi bdag nyid srung zhing skyong ba rnams ni nang dang phyi rol nas yang dag par sbyar ba'i sbyor bas dgod par bya'o ;
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / phyogs skyong bcu dang / gza' dang / klu dang / 'byung po ste sde pa drug gi bdag nyid srung zhing skyong ba rnams ni nang dang phyi rol nas yang dag par sbyar ba'i sbyor bas dgod par bya'o ;
translated: The wrathful kings and the protectors and guardians of the six classes of beings—form, formless, the ten directions, planets, nāgas, and bhūtas—are to be arranged by the application of the inner and outer unions.

original: / sa dang chu las byung ba rnams ni lus kyi khams srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: / sa dang chu las byung ba rnams ni lus kyi khams srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Those born from earth and water protect the body element.

original: me dang rlung gi khams la byung ba rnams ni ngag gi khams srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: me dang rlung gi khams la byung ba rnams ni ngag gi khams srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Those born from the fire and wind elements protect the speech element.

original: stong pa dag ye shes kyi khams las byung ba rnams ni thams cad du sems kyi khams srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa dag ye shes kyi khams las byung ba rnams ni thams cad du sems kyi khams srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The empty ones, arisen from the element of gnosis, protect the mind element in every way.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the ascertainment of the Blessed One.

original: de nas bla ma'i nges pa dang ldan gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa sgrub pa po yis bsgrub par bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bla ma'i nges pa dang ldan gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa sgrub pa po yis bsgrub par bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Then, which one possessing ascertainment should the adept who desires a little accomplish? This is the ascertainment.

original: da ni khro bo la sogs pa 'di rnams so so'i gtor ma'i sngags kyi tshig rnams su 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: da ni khro bo la sogs pa 'di rnams so so'i gtor ma'i sngags kyi tshig rnams su 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Now, the words of the mantras of the individual bali offerings of these wrathful ones and so forth are as follows:

original: aom a'a:h'um ho //🔽au shn'i sha /
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um ho // au shn'i sha /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ🔽Uṣṇīṣa

original: sumbha ni sumbha /
analyzed: sumbha ni sumbha /
translated: Sum-bhani sum-bhani

original: bighn'a na ta ka /
analyzed: bighn'a na ta ka /
translated: Vigha-na-taka
